name: Cured Kwama Leggings
description: Hand-cured in the Kwama Mines of Senie, these leggings are extremely rugged.

name: Apprentice's Leggings
description: These leggings are often issued to the newest members of the Mages Guild.

name: Scampstamper Sabatons
description: The soles of these sabotons were magically hardened.

name: Sommelier's Gloves
description: The intricate weave used in these gloves imbues the wearer with magical potency.

name: Lion Guard Sabatons of the Wyrd Tree
description: These heavy boots were awarded by Dame Clarique of the Lion Guard for assisting with the rescue of Eagle's Brook.

name: Bloodthorn Bastion of the Dragon
description: This shield was awarded for discovering Faolchu's weakness by visiting the past.

name: Swine-Herder Britches
description: These light leggings were awarded for saving the prized pig Glutton in Daggerfall.

name: Rough Oak
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make sanded oak.

name: Sanded Oak
description: An ingredient for crafting wooden weapons and shields.

name: Gabrielle's Staff of Healing
description: For purging the Midnight Talisman and restoring its power, mage Gabrielle Benele awarded this healing staff.

name: Rawhide Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make rawhide.

name: Rawhide
description: An ingredient for crafting clothing.

name: Superb Hide Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make superb hide.

name: Rough Maple
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make sanded maple.

name: Sanded Maple
description: An ingredient for crafting wooden weapons and shields.

name: Iron Ore
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make iron ingots.

name: Jade
description: Can be used to enhance weapons.

name: Jute
description: An ingredient for crafting clothing.

name: Raw Jute
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make jute.

name: Turquoise
description: Can be used to enhance weapons.

name: Rough Birch
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make sanded birch.

name: Wyrd Branch of the Wyrd Tree
description: For destroying the Corruption of the Tree and restoring the Wyrd Tree, Wyress Gwen bestowed this powerful staff.

name: Natural Water
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 3 potions

name: Lion Guard Gauntlets
description: These heavy gloves were awarded for rescuing the Lion Guard scouts from Dominion forces at Farwatch Tower.

name: Werewolf Hide Red Rook Ailettes
description: This medium armor was awarded for defeating the Red Rook Bandits' leader, Sternis Gelves, at Crosswych.

name: Bloodthorn Captain Rosalind's Blade
description: For helping the spirits of Westtry, the sword of Captain of the Guard Rosalind Milielle was awarded.

name: Lion Guard Poleyns
description: These heavy leggings were awarded for helping the Lion Guard repel a Dominion attack at Farwatch Tower.

name: Dusant's Antique Dagger
description: The ghost of Richard Dusant awarded this ancient blade for discovering the treasure of Dresan Keep.

name: LeBlanc's Walking Shoes
description: Guy LeBlanc awarded this light footwear for saving his sister and the other women from the Bloodthorn cultists in Hag Fen.

name: Noellaume Family Heirloom
description: Lady Eloise awarded this pendant for recovering her lockbox from the Red Rook Bandits.

name: Werewolf Hide Werewolf Slayer
description: Gloria Fausta bestowed this weapon for helping her deal with Duke Sebastien and the werewolves of Aldcroft.

name: Mother Murk's Corrupted Sprig of the Wyrd Tree
description: For defeating the Hagraven Mother Murk in the Hag Fens, this gnarled staff was awarded.

name: Odei's Stylish Epaulieres
description: This fashionable light armor was awarded for reuniting Odei with Dame Veronica at Cambray Pass

name: Gallant Chain
description: Captain Kaleen gave you a cut of her profits, including this armor, upon reaching Betnikh.

name: Lion Guard Girdle
description: This heavy belt was awarded for rescuing Lion Guard soldiers from the labyrinthine catacombs of Cath Bedraud.

name: Dencent Family Heirloom
description: Alexia Dencent bestowed this ring for aiding her outside Aldcroft.

name: Daggerfall Guard Waist Band
description: This medium belt was bestowed for bringing the Red Rook Bandits' plans to the Daggerfall Guard near Noellaume Manor.

name: Guifford's Mining Helmet
description: This medium headgear was awarded for returning a journal found in the Mines of Khuras to Odette Vinielle in Glenumbra Moors.

name: Lion Guard Battle Staff
description: For bringing proof of the Red Rook Bandits collaborating with the Bloodthorn cultists, you were given this battle staff.

name: Lion Guard Great Helm
description: You received this helmet from General Gautier of the Lion Guard for assisting with the first push to retake Camlorn.

name: Werewolf Hide King Deleyn's Longbow
description: This antique weapon was bestowed for aid given to the ancient lords and ladies entombed within the Burial Mounds.

name: Bloodthorn Stibbons's Dapper Chapeau
description: For aiding Lady Laurent and Stibbons at the Tomb of Lost Kings, this stylish headgear was awarded.

name: Bloodthorn Guardian's Hammer
description: This weapon was awarded for setting the elemental guardians free from Angof's imprisoning spell.

name: King's Justice of the Wyrd Tree
description: A distinctive weapon awarded by King Casimir for stopping the Bloodthorn assassins in Daggerfall.

name: Lion Guard's Pride
description: This weapon was awarded for finding Recruit Gorak and helping him complete his mission in the swamps outside Aldcroft.

name: Werewolf Hide Daggerfall Guard Tabard
description: Captain Farlivere awarded this medium armor for rescuing the noble hostages from the Red Rook Bandits.

name: King Deleyn's Silk Gloves
description: These antique hand coverings were bestowed by the spirit of King Deleyn for returning the stolen regalia to the Burial Mounds.

name: Crosswych Mining Maul
description: For rescuing the captive miners in Crosswych, Tamien Sellan awarded this two-handed mace.

name: Guardian's Gauntlets
description: These medium hand coverings were awarded for summoning the elemental guardians for the Wyresses of the Beldama Wyrd.

name: Clear Water
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 10 potions

name: Sigil of House Dres
description: This amulet hums with restrained power.

name: Queensguard Chestplate
description: Metalsmiths from across the Summerset Isles collaborated to forge this chestpiece, a token of esteem directly from the Queen.

name: Telvanni Spellhood
description: This hood was woven with the finest silks of Vvardenfell.

name: Telacar's Sustaining Helm
description: This helm glows with a pale yellow light. It was long ago worn by the powerful necromancer Telacar.

name: Cheliceral Hook
description: The hollow reservoir within this dagger seems patterned after some kind of fang. It only stops dripping when sheathed.

name: Hollow Moon Cowl
description: This cowl is difficult to see in poor light. It does not impede the wearer's field of view.

name: Kwama Goad
description: This strange hammer has a peculiar, earthy scent. When wielded below ground, its bearer constantly salivates.

name: Orthelos' Torchstaff
description: This staff smolders brightly in the darkness. If kept alight for too long, the bearer begins to crave roasted acorns.

name: Rajhin's Diminished Mantle
description: This is all that remains of Rajhin's Mantle. Its curse-and much of its power-was burned away by the Orrery.

name: Ear of the Queen
description: There is a tiny etching of an ear on the back of this amulet. In dim light, the etching glows faintly.

name: Ukaezai's Scalpel
description: This sword emanates dark energy. When released, the hilt blackens the bearer's palms with greasy soot.

name: Vinedusk Pauldrons
description: These pauldrons change color in the light. The iridescent gleam is reminiscent of a magical portal.

name: Murdered Mason's Boots
description: These boots are caked in layers of ancient mud. They are all that remains of a slave who upset his Ayleid master.

name: Clumsy Alchemist's Vambraces
description: These heavy gloves have a distinct alchemical smell. Dozens of acid spatters cover the metal.

name: Barkbite Greaves
description: This plate armor was made by Wood Orc smiths. It is thick, heavy, and well-constructed.

name: Whispering Gloves
description: When clapped together, the sound made by these gloves is no louder than a whisper.

name: Jackdaw's Galoshes
description: These fine boots are much lighter than they appear. They keep the wearer's feet completely dry.

name: Bloodshark's Cutlass
description: Brauti Bloodshark's cutlass is razor sharp. Several splotchy stains mar the blade itself.

name: Brackenleaf's Bough
description: This bow is as light as it is deadly. It was made from wood freely given by Brackenleaf himself.

name: Barrowbough's Cage
description: The small bones sewn into this armor strengthen it greatly. This does not restrict the movement of the wearer's arms.

name: Sheogorath's Choice
description: This peculiar crown looks too small to fit comfortably. When worn, the faint urge to dance is unrelenting.

name: Redfur Trading Gloves
description: These gloves are well maintained, despite years of use. An advertisement for Redfur Trading Post is stitched within.

name: Quartermaster's Secret
description: This belt is warm to the touch. A secret compartment within appears large enough to hold three small vials.

name: Scented Leathers
description: This distinctive but not unpleasant odor permeating this armor is said to repel fleshflies.

name: Reliquarian's Robes
description: These robes are remarkably thin. They seem to be made from some strange kind of silk.

name: Cathartic Band
description: This ring is simple in its design. The wearer feels a distinct sense of calm and acceptance.

name: Alyxe's Rancid Pants
description: Whatever is caked into the material will require powerful magic to remove.

name: Stibbons's Misplaced Sash
description: A small note within this worn belt reads: "To Stibbons, for five years of entirely adequate service. —Laurent"

name: Nereid's Slippers
description: These slippers vibrate softly when near sources of running water.

name: Belt of the Bad Performance
description: This belt twitches slightly when objects are thrown at its wearer.

name: Abaede Pauldrons
description: These immaculate pauldrons are of Ayleid design. Eminaire traded them to me for the fragments I brought her.

name: Barkbite Breastplate
description: This heavy breastplate is incredibly sturdy. Its simple construction shows the great skill of Barkbite smiths.

name: Mother Lightning's Spur
description: This hammer is only heavy when sheathed. It crackles and seems to lose half its weight in the bearer's hand.

name: Jade General's Helm
description: This helm once belonged to General Endare. It bears the markings of a decorated Dominion general.

name: Honor's Guardian
description: This armor honors the one who brought Duchess Lakana's murderer to justice.

name: The High King's War Axe
description: Presented by High King Emeric to you for service to the Daggerfall Covenant.

name: Dark Elf Scouting Boots
description: These boots were awarded for helping Scout Vartis discover the secret of the Orcs of Malak's Maw.

name: Redoran Cuisses
description: These cuisses were awarded for returning a fallen Redoran soldier's medallion to his retainer at Tal'Deic Fortress.

name: Midnight Union Disguise
description: Use this disguise to appear as a Midnight Union thief. This disguise may not fool everyone.

name: Empty Wine Bottle
description: This empty wine bottle bears the seal of the Balmora Blue vineyards.

name: Queen's Eye Leathers
description: This carefully tooled leather chestpiece was made specially for the Eyes of the Queen, Ayrenn's hand-picked agents.

name: Redoran Bludgeoner
description: A weapon awarded for rescuing the soldier Saryvn from the ruins beneath Tal'Deic Fortress.

name: Merchant Guardian's Pauldrons
description: These pauldrons were a gift from caravan guard Kotholl for helping him recover goods at the Obsidian Gorge.

name: Betina's Fashionable Gloves
description: You received these gloves for helping resolve the situation between the Argonians and Betina Volek in Mournhold.

name: Ring of Remembrance
description: This ring was given to you for returning Risa's amulet to her mother.

name: Cold-Blooded Vengeance
description: This weapon was awarded for avenging the village of Silent Mire against the Renrijra pirates.

name: Snakeskin Belt
description: This belt was awarded for deciding the fate of the Mabrigash in the Vale of the Ghost Snake.

name: Blood Groove
description: This axe has dozens of tiny notches along the haft. A pair of fangs are fastened tightly to the grip.

name: Dres Dirk
description: This dagger was a gift given to you for aiding the House Hlaalu caravan against Dres raiders at the ruins of Mzithumz.

name: Rigurt's Cultural Coif
description: Rigurt the Brash gave you this coif for assisting the Nord Cultural Exchange in Mournhold.

name: Ashlander's Honor of Mother's Sorrow
description: For defeating the Vereansu leader, Ginasa, and saving the village of Muth Gnaar, Dolril Belvayn gave you this staff.

name: Hlaalu's Protection
description: For uncovering evidence linking disappearances to the Llodos plague in Narsis, Councilor Ralden rewarded you with this mace.

name: Ashlander's Rebuke
description: After avenging the Andalen brothers' father and setting fire to the Vereansu supply stores, Tennus Andalen gave you this axe.

name: Ordinator Breastplate
description: Almalexia gave you this breastplate for defeating Magistrix Vox at Eidolon's Hollow.

name: Quarantine Staff
description: This staff of healing was awarded for helping the alchemist Nilyne create a plague suppressant at Quarantine Serk.

name: Naryu's Sniper's Bow
description: Naryu Virian bestowed this weapon upon you for helping her investigate Maulborn activity in Mournhold.

name: Selforan Temple Sash
description: This light armor was awarded for defeating the Echo of Vox and freeing the town of Selfora.

name: Redoran General's Gauntlets
description: These gauntlets were your reward for exposing the truth of a Maulborn plot to disrupt Tal'Deic Fortress.

name: Gruznak's Chestplate
description: You earned this chestpiece by defeating Gruznak the Impatient at Malak's Maw.

name: Redoran Great Sword
description: Awarded for showing the Redoran Sentinels that bad behavior will not be tolerated at Tal'Deic Fortress.

name: Argonian Muck Minder of Mother's Sorrow
description: This staff was awarded for defeating Seeks-the-Night and aiding the Argonians of Silent Mire.

name: Plague Mask
description: Aerona Berendas gave you this light headpiece for helping combat the Llodos plague in Quarantine Serk.

name: Ordinator Boots
description: In gratitude for service to the Tribunal and the city of Mournhold, this piece of Ordinator armor has been bestowed.

name: Rough Ash
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make sanded ash.

name: Emerald
description: Can be used to enhance armor.

name: Hide
description: An ingredient for crafting clothing.

name: Hide Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make hide.

name: Quartz
description: Can be used to enhance armor.

name: Flax
description: An ingredient for crafting clothing.

name: Raw Flax
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make flax.

name: Shadowhide Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make shadowhide.

name: Calcinium Ore
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make calcinium ingots.

name: Ruby
description: Can be used to enhance weapons.

name: Steel Ingot
description: An ingredient for crafting metal weapons.

name: Pristine Water
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 20 potions

name: Dungeon-Delving Slippers
description: This heavy footwear awarded for helping Kireth and Raynor Vanos solve the mystery of the Bthanual ruins.

name: Propylon Index ZTestContent
description: Index for activating propylon obelisks

name: Daedric Rune ZTestContent
description: This rune radiates with Daedric magic

name: Planed Maple
description: Use for Crafting Armor and Weapons

name: Thin Rawhide
description: Use for Crafting Armor and Weapons

name: Iron Ingot
description: An ingredient for crafting metal weapons.

name: High Iron Ore
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make steel ingots.

name: Dwarven Ingot
description: An ingredient for crafting metal weapons.

name: Ebony Ingot
description: An ingredient for crafting metal weapons.

name: Thick Leather Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make thick leather.

name: Chef's Apron
description: Mamma Aralosi gave you this heavy cooking belt for reporting her son's fate in Lady Llarel's Shelter.

name: Garth's Gages
description: Gloves given for saving Garth from the spider cave.

name: Magister's Staff
description: For returning the Tear of Anurraame to the Mages Guild in Shornhelm, the magister awarded this staff.

name: Troll Friend
description: Grulaz's troll-taming staff, awarded for returning her journal to Gothurg in Shornhelm.

name: Klaandor's Pauldrons
description: Shoulder protection awarded for bringing news of Klaandor's fate to his true love.

name: Ravenwatch Gloves
description: Adusa-daro awarded these House Ravenwatch hand coverings for dispatching Arcorion Two-Blades.

name: Ravenwatch Rerebraces
description: Adusa-daro awarded these House Ravenwatch shoulder pads for obtaining the assassin's list of targets.

name: Heloise's Staff of Necropotence
description: Healer Heloise's staff, awarded for aiding the soldiers at Hinault Farm.

name: Gennove's Blade
description: For aiding the Hinault family, Jowan awarded his father's sword.

name: Dathieu's Traitorous Axe of the Vampire's Cloak
description: For listening to his tale and ending Ranser's curse, General Dathieu awarded the axe that killed the mad king.

name: Darkstride Ravenwatch Cuirass
description: Verandis awarded this House Ravenwatch armor for unraveling the mysteries of his memories in Ravenwatch Castle.

name: Darkstride Reezal-Jul's Dagger
description: For slaying Reezal-Jul, Countess Tamrith presented the necromancer's dagger.

name: High King's Signet
description: For saving Rivenspire and helping choose a ruler, High King Emeric awarded this signet ring.

name: Reezal-Jul's Necrotic Robes of Necropotence
description: For granting the spirits of Crestshade peace, the Mayor presented Reezal-Jul's discarded robes.

name: Darkstride Ravenwatch Girdle
description: Adusa-daro awarded this House Ravenwatch adornment for aid provided at Moira's Hope.

name: Darkstride Silverhoof Loop
description: A ring received for saving the villagers of Silverhoof Vale.

name: Shornhelm Guard Sollerets of the Vampire's Cloak
description: Boots given for recruiting soldiers at Hoarfrost Downs.

name: Edrald's Wedding Veil of Necropotence
description: Arlie Edrald bestowed this elegant head piece for saving her and her family.

name: Adusa's Hunting Bow
description: Adusa-daro awarded her personal hunting bow for helping her bring down Rohlbert Montclair.

name: Ravenwatch Mask
description: Adusa-daro awarded this House Ravenwatch head covering for exposing the spy in Shornhelm.

name: Eternal Tree Spliter
description: Merethrin's spirit bestowed this weapon for freeing him from the eternal tree.

name: Nedras' Leather Pants
description: Leggings presented for bringing news of Nedras' fate to his sister Gendinora.

name: Darkstride Ravenwatch Boots
description: For tearing Lleraya's veil in the Lorkrata Ruins, Verandis awarded this House Ravenwatch footwear.

name: Barrow Hammer of Necropotence
description: Weapon received after dealing with the war criminal Althen at Sanguine Barrows.

name: Fell's Run Hero Necklace of the Vampire's Cloak
description: A pendant bestowed by Constable Aguza for aiding the people of Fell's Run.

name: Stibbons's Fancy Epaulettes of Necropotence
description: Shoulder protection awarded for helping Lady Laurent and Stibbons recover the Emerald Chalice at Breagha-Fin.

name: House Dorell Greaves
description: Awarded for service to Northpoint above and beyond the call of duty, these leggings bear the crest of House Dorell.

name: House Dorell Cuirass of the Vampire's Cloak
description: Awarded for service to Northpoint above and beyond the call of duty, this armor bears the crest of House Dorell.

name: Ravenwatch Staff of the Vampire's Cloak
description: Gwendis wanted you to have Verandis' staff for standing with him at the Doomcrag.

name: Ayleid Greatsword
description: For solving the puzzle of the Shrouded Pass, Verandis awarded this Ayleid blade.

name: Shornhelm Guard Baldric
description: A belt given for recruiting soldiers at Hoarfrost Downs.

name: Arkay's Vambraces
description: Alvaren awarded these Knight of Arkay gloves for recovering holy relics from across Rivenspire.

name: Ignobert's Sash
description: A belt given for locating the missing Ignobert for his worried wife.

name: Lothson's Smasher
description: Lothson bestowed this weapon for locating Marien's stolen necklace from Orc's Finger ruins.

name: Ordinator Rerebrace
description: You received this rerebrace for stopping the shipments of Llodos Plague from leaving the Obsidian Gorge.

name: Shad Astula Academy Robes
description: These robes were a gift given to you for stopping the Maulborn from converting the students at the Shad Astula Academy.

name: Ordinator Chausses
description: You received these chausses for defeating Merdyndril, the creator of the Llodos plague, at the Obsidian Gorge.

name: Hlaalu Pauldrons
description: For investigating Maulborn activities in Narsis, Varon Davel gave you these pauldrons.

name: Khralek's Anguish
description: You received this staff after defeating Khralek gro-Vortag and aiding the Dark Elf spirits at Malak's Maw.

name: Naryu's Spare Blade
description: This blade was your reward for defeating Giron and disrupting the Maulborn plot at Narsis.

name: Caravan Master's Ring
description: For recovering House Hlaalu's cargo and manifest, Caravan Master Girano rewarded you with this ring.

name: Shornhelm Guard Armet
description: A helm given for recruiting soldiers at Hoarfrost Downs.

name: Kwama Mining Gloves
description: For helping the miner of Deepcrag Den, Boril Drelas gave you these gloves.

name: Dreamless Staff
description: This staff is styled after one used by ancient court mages throughout High Rock.

name: Gloo's Primer
description: This small band still smells of potentially flammable reagents.

name: Scourer's Scale
description: Daedric script lines the inside of the shield. The acrid smell reminds you of the prison bars in Coldharbour.

name: Werewolf Hide Kip's Roguish Leathers
description: For disrupting the Red Rook and Bloodthorn meeting at the Dwynnarth Ruins, these medium leggings were awarded.

name: Bonesplinter
description: This hammer was frost-forged for extra strength..

name: Kwama Cuttle Shield
description: Someone spent a great deal of time gathering and fashioning all this Kwama Cuttle into the shape of a shield.

name: Ancient Warden's Greaves
description: These greaves are as old as the Dunmer race, but they're as strong as the day they were forged.

name: Bala's Engagement Chain
description: This necklace imbues its wearer with better health and a more positive mental outlook.

name: Dagon Morag
description: Also known as 'The Unbound Blade,' this sword was forged using a bonespur from the great Brother of Strife, Balreth.

name: House Cousin's Cowl
description: A cowl that shields the wearer from the elements and from fatigue.

name: Rebellion Mace
description: This mace was soaked in the blood of countless oppressors.

name: House Cousin's Helm
description: This helm makes the wearer want to stand straight and proud.

name: Alexandra's Froststaff
description: This staff was once displayed proudly in the Daggerfall Mages Guild.

name: Gauntlets of the Akaviri War
description: These gauntlets were designed to choke the scaled throats of the Akaviri invaders.

name: Telvanni Warsash
description: It's said that a traitor within House Telvanni was choked by this sash.

name: Darj's Shield
description: Darj gave you this shield for returning the dead at Skyshroud Barrow to their rest.

name: Hlaalu Trader's Belt
description: This belt includes several inner pockets for holding coins and lockpicks.

name: Ashlander's Girdle
description: This girdle was rough-forged from metals common to the Ashlands.

name: Temple Keeper's Spaulders
description: These spaulder were once worn by acolytes tending the deep vaults below Heimlyn Keep.

name: Great Axe of Obedience
description: This great axe was forged for a powerful and dominating ruler.

name: Ahknara's Silent Slippers
description: These slippers are made from flexible Duneripper hide gathered in the Alik'r Desert.

name: Redoran Archmage's Robes
description: House Redoran invested a great deal of gold to weave these fine robes.

name: Boltstaff of Koal Canton
description: Up close, the staff smells of crushed muckspunge pulp and netch tentacles.

name: Falkwind's Shadewrap
description: This chestpiece was hand-made by the finest leatherworkers of Sentinel.

name: Guarblood Ring
description: This ring pulsates with animal energy.

name: Pauldrons of the Holdfast
description: A great thane once wore these into battle. His name is long-forgotten, but the pauldrons are as good as new.

name: Mota Fang
description: This dagger was made from the actual fang of a great Shadowfen serpent.

name: Murkreed Mantle
description: The cloth used in this mantle still smells faintly of alchemical reagents and swamp water.

name: Harpy Feather Shirt
description: Harpy down is spun with fine wool to make the shirt's sturdy fabric.

name: Throne Keeper Coif
description: Several thin copper medallions are inset into the coif.

name: Yokudan Epaulets
description: A repetitive motif of stylized waves is woven into the epaulets.

name: Ashwalker's Boots
description: One could walk all the way across Tamriel in these boots without ever being fatigued.

name: Master's Sharpsword
description: Generations of Masters at Leki's Blade have wielded swords like this, though it's rare for one to be seen outside the school.

name: Sailor's Hatchet
description: Initials on the handle hint at ports visited by this blade's former owner.

name: Serpent-Rider Spaulders of the Twin Sisters
description: Bearing the maker's mark of a Sea Elf leatherworker, this shoulder armor displays the scars of the fight for Greenwater Cove.

name: Loop of Devotion
description: This fine necklace, engraved symbols to Auri-El, was blessed in one of his temples.

name: First Mate's Leathers
description: The fine etching on these leggings is typical of Maormer crafting techniques.

name: Traitor's Flame
description: This utilitarian staff is like the ones used by the warmages of the First Auridon Marines.

name: Despot's Shoulderplates
description: Forged at the height of Highlord Rilis the XII's reign, the sigil of that house is subtly worked into these shoulderplates.

name: Micro-Etched Ring
description: The runes etched into this simple loop are almost too small to see. The steadiest of hands enchanted this item.

name: Heritance Gauntlets
description: Symbols of the Veiled Heritance, bitter opponents to Queen Ayrenn's rule, are hidden on the gauntlets' inner lining.

name: Spellforged Buckle
description: Signs of magical craftsmanship are evident on this weighty belt.

name: Keeneye Belt
description: The Eyes of the Queen use highly specialized gear. This belt, for example, has a small pouch secreted behind the buckle.

name: Divine-Touched Aegis
description: Small sigils representing each of the Eight Divines, invisible to the naked eye, run along the inside face of this shield.

name: Queensguard Greaves
description: These greaves are well appointed, with gold accents and inlaid runes.

name: Collector's Coinblade
description: A mysteriously collectible and sought-after piece, despite being worth next to nothing.

name: War-Mage's Cowl
description: This cloth was hand-dyed in the far-off land of Glenumbra, and issued to a loyal member of the Covenant armed forces.

name: Patriot's Mace
description: This exquisite weapon is only given for exceptional service to the Aldmeri Dominion.

name: Kilt of the Fractured Mind
description: Faintly, as if from a far distance, you can hear the strained laughter of a delusional mind.

name: Relic-Tender Sash
description: Simple runes are sewn into the sash, revering the Eight Divines in their myriad forms.

name: Mourner's Ring
description: This simple loop is worn from where it was repeatedly twisted around tired, grieving fingers.

name: Executioner's Gloves
description: Though carefully cleaned, an odor of death still permeates these gloves.

name: Binder's Robe
description: Sewn into the hem of this robe are numerous runes meant to ward and bind spirits and Daedra.

name: Scampcrusher
description: This hammer saw heavy use in the fight for Dawnbreak.

name: Thalmor Helm
description: Standard issue to the Dominion soldiers who guard Thalmor diplomats, these helms are crafted to be as comfortable as possible.

name: Estre's Dreadstaff
description: Something about this staff exudes a terrible chill that settles deep into the bones.

name: Blood Mask
description: This protective head covering was bestowed for aiding the vampires of Wittestadr.

name: Skald-King's War Plackart
description: For helping Jorunn the Skald-King's council of war take place at Jorunn's Stand, this heavy armor was bestowed.

name: Voljar Meadery Seal
description: This ring was awarded for being a friend to Haraldar and the mead makers of Voljar's Meadery in their time of troubles.

name: Dungeon-Delving Brigandine
description: This brigandine was given to you for helping Raynor Vanos locate his sister Kireth in the Mzulft ruins.

name: Skald-King's Favor
description: Prince Irnskar awarded this heavy helm for aiding Jorunn the Skald-King's war council at Fort Amol.

name: Rigurt's Robust Ring
description: Rigurt the Brash, Master of Ceremonies for the Konunleikar, bestowed this ring for aiding with the party planning in Windhelm.

name: Frostwind Axe
description: This weapon was awarded for aiding the survivors of the giant attack on Lower Yorgrim.

name: Aleeto's Alchemy Gloves
description: For assisting Aleeto with her alchemy experiment at Fort Amol, this light hand protection was bestowed.

name: Skald-King's Pauldrons
description: For helping the soldiers of Fort Morvunskar repel the Stormfist invaders, this heavy armor was awarded.

name: Wolf-Sister Sandals
description: Thane Oda Wolf-Sister gave you these sandals for acquiring the vampire blood and aid of a Dreamwalker.

name: Dungeon-Delving Harness
description: A heavy-weight belt awarded for helping Kireth and Raynor Vanos solve the mystery of the Mzulft ruins.

name: Hefty Bonestrewn Gauntlets
description: For aid and assistance provided to the foresters working the Bonestrewn Crest, Selgaard awarded you with these heavy gloves.

name: Giant-Friend
description: The mysterious Aspera gave you this bow for helping the giants drive Lob the Cleaver and the Stormfists out of Cradlecrush.

name: Thane Watch
description: Thane Mera awarded this shield for saving Jorunn the Skald-King and foiling Fildgor's Stormfist assassins in Windhelm.

name: Voljar Meadery Trousers
description: Yraldar Snowpeak gave you these light leggings for helping him defeat Kazok the Orc at Voljar's Meadery.

name: Sonya's Bridal Veil
description: Hadmal gave you his most prized possession, his beloved wife's bridal veil, for putting his daughters' troubled spirits to rest.

name: Skald-King's Greaves
description: Jorunn the Skald-King gave you these greaves for entering his dreams and saving him from the Daedric poison at Mistwatch.

name: Kyne's Honor
description: You received this amulet for helping Captain Alhana and her soldiers at Kynesgrove.

name: Riekling Skull-Cleaver
description: For helping the Royal Road Works of Cragwallow and stopping the Riekling menace, this axe was awarded.

name: Wolf Pelt Mantle
description: This mantle was bestowed by Hanmaer Furmender for helping the villagers of Lower Yorgrim with their wolf problem.

name: Burial Shawl of the Brief Queen
description: The spirit of Queen Nurnhilde bestowed this light shoulder protection for sowing chaos in the Stormfist camp at Skuldafn.

name: Forester Leggings
description: Medium-weight armor awarded for helping Thulvald's logging camp settle a land dispute with a spriggan matron.

name: Darkwater Hand Warmers
description: The Dreamwalker Stormy-Eyes gave you these protective gloves for aid provided to the Argonians of Darkwater Crossing.

name: Shell Slicer
description: This dagger was awarded by Captain Ula-Reen for assisting with security concerns at Jorunn's Stand.

name: Skald-King's Sabatons
description: For defeating Fildgor Orcthane and helping to seal the Ebonheart Pact, Prince Irnskar gave you these sabatons.

name: Lost Knife Mining Boots
description: Jomund awarded these medium foot coverings for helping to free the Lost Knife Cave Mine from Stormfist control.

name: Sweetbreeches
description: These traveling breeches seem cool to the touch.

name: Great Axe of the Crescent Moon
description: Found in the wake of the Colovian occupation. Kazirra believes it may have been looted from a Khajiiti tomb.

name: Pactbreaker
description: This axe's blade never dulls. Karthdar's citizens provided it to symbolically purge their town of items that offend the Green.

name: Culanwe's Will
description: This staff is quite ancient. While holding it, you can hear incredibly faint but indescribably beautiful singing.

name: Dreamwalker Staff
description: The Ternion High Priest awarded this staff for walking the Dreamstride at Mistwatch.

name: Ordinator Helm
description: Almalexia herself gave you this helm for defeating Vanus Sathram and saving the Tribunal Temple.

name: Defender of the Valenheart
description: This massive axe was awarded after defeating the Shade of Prince Naemon and helping Indaenir heal the Valenheart.

name: Everfull Girdle
description: Nelhilda gave you this medium-weight belt for helping to break the curse hanging over the Everfull Flagon.

name: Earth-Shaker Staff
description: Wood from trees on Silatar was used in creating this staff.

name: Ashenblade
description: Veiled Heritance Champion Andur once used this weapon during the fight to protect the Court of the Wilderking.

name: Sargasso's Curse
description: This sword, forged long ago for a Maormer Warlord, now celebrates Vicereeve Pelidil's death near Seaside Sanctuary.

name: Gauntlets of the Claw
description: These master-forged grips are treasures by several Khajiiti monastic orders.

name: Ehtayah's Tear
description: The unadorned circle was found on a Do'Krin offering altar.

name: Senche Hide Girdle
description: The senche-tiger, one of the most dangerous creatures on Tamriel, has hide which make excellent armor.

name: Queensguard Ring
description: This ring is only given to loyal agents of Queen Ayrenn for service and sacrifice.

name: Khaj Rawlith Crescent of the Smuggler
description: Found in the ruins beneath Fort Grimwatch, this is a relic of ancient times.

name: Blade of the Eye
description: This was left behind by the Queen's Eye, Razum-dar, at the Senalana forward camp.

name: Artificer's Vestments
description: Telenger himself inlaid enchantments on this garment, ensuring only the most powerful of spells can harm it.

name: Arbordawn Breastplate
description: Not so much forged as grown, this carapace will withstand almost any blow.

name: Leathers of the Emancipator
description: Tooled by one of the finest craftswomen in Arenthia, these leggings were finished just before the Colovians invaded.

name: Chain of the Hallowed
description: Each link is like forged moonlight, lustrous in light, dim and shadowed elsewise.

name: Faithful Greaves
description: Worn by the most faithful of the lunar clergy, blessed by the light of Jone and Jode.

name: Veteran's Warhammer
description: Battered from long use in the border wars between the Wood Elves and the Khajiit, there is fight in this weapon.

name: Emancipator's Gloves
description: Left behind in the slave quarters of Hadran's Caravan, this was marked as property of a former 'guest.'

name: Pircalmo's Rimestaff
description: Despite the questionable skill of its enchanter, the spellwork on this staff is competently done.

name: Gavel of the Hallowed
description: A relic of the early structure at the Mount of the Moons, this hammer sings with the light of Jone and Jode.

name: Desecration Treads
description: Forged in the days of Rid-Thar, these boots show a level of skill rarely seen in Tamriel today.

name: Trollslayer's Girdle
description: The hardiness of this belt is made to withstand the sharpness of troll claws.

name: Traitor's Treads
description: Though the former Eye hasn't seen much action in recent years, Krin Ren-dro wore only the best gear.

name: Naked Nord's Pants
description: You received these leggings after helping Norgred find his missing items.

name: Wormcrusher's Axe
description: The sturdy axe was obtained during the battles with the Graveborn.

name: Fascinating Ring
description: The ring's opalescent surface appears to change with your every movement.

name: Wormwood Staff
description: Tiny holes made by beetle larvae once ran throughout the staff, but are now sealed with a hardened layer of resin.

name: Aetherian
description: The staff's name and lineage had once been etched upon the staff. Now, the barest trace of its name is all that remains.

name: Bonebane
description: This legendary weapon once belonged to Unnvald, Fullhelm's thane.

name: Axe of the Houndslayer
description: The edge is so finely honed, it can cut through paper along its width.

name: Sapmagic Ring
description: Though Bosmer in origin, this ring also incorporates Wood Orc motifs.

name: The Hound's Helm
description: While not shaped like an actual hound's head, this helm would provide excellent protection against one.

name: Dagger of the Green Sister
description: Several collectible items related to the Green Lady, such as this dagger, are made in Deepwoods.

name: Greatshield of Bangkorai
description: Etched along all its edges are the coats of arms for both King Eamond and Queen Arzhela of Evermore.

name: The Negotiator
description: This ceremonial blade is an exquisite marriage of form and function.

name: Shore's Edge
description: It is said the edge of this blade was honed on a type of whetstone found only in the Far Shores.

name: Staff of Secundus
description: Grandeya Nuwarrah of Hallin's Stand gave you this staff for defeating the city's Imperial occupiers.

name: Hist Bark Hide
description: The Argonians of Haj Uxith gave you this chestpiece for helping decide the fate of their embattled Hist tree.

name: Black Forge Blade
description: You were given this blade for exploring the Black Forge and restoring the great mage, Vanus Galerion.

name: Galerion's Spare Staff
description: The great mage, Vanus Galerion, gave you this staff for helping him destroy the Great Shackle and weaken the Planemeld.

name: Privateer Clogs
description: Captain One-Eye gave you these clogs for defeating the Admiral and determining the fate of the Crown of Bones.

name: Stibbon's Dress Trousers of the Prisoner
Molag Grunda's Girdle
description: You earned this girdle by defeating Molag Grunda at the Gatehouse in Coldharbour

name: The Observer's Battle Helm
description: This Daedric helmet was awarded for beating the Observer at the Cliffs of Failure.

name: Arbiter's Vambraces
description: You were given these gauntlets for saving the Mages Guild members and defeating Judge Xiven at the Court of Contempt.

name: Ayleid's Wrath
description: King Dynar gave you this greatsword as a remembrance of companions who fell to the Planemeld.

name: Old Bone's Shivering Timber
description: For reassembling the living skeleton called Bosun Bones of the Lost Fleet, this weapon was awarded.

name: Fighters Guild Visor
description: You received this visor after traversing the Moonless Walk and locating Sergeant Kamu of the Fighters Guild.

name: The Observer's Battle Boots
description: This Daedric footwear was awarded for joining the Observer's game and choosing a side at the Cliffs of Failure.

name: Dungeon-Delving Staff
description: Kireth Vanos bestowed this staff for destroying the Daedric lenses and releasing her from the gallery at the Library of Dusk.

name: Ahirunz's Beloved Sash
description: Ahirunz awarded this light-weight belt for recovering his beloved Ernabi's pendant from the Cave of Trophies.

name: Battle Minstrel's Mantle
description: Minstrel Idria bestowed this light shoulder armor for recovering her lute, F'lah, from the Grotto of Depravity.

name: Battle Bracers
description: Awarded by Grundskar for providing news about the fate of his cousin in Mal Sorra's Tomb.

name: Morrowind Vambraces
description: Dralnas awarded these medium-weight hand protectors for destroying the Anguish Gem and restoring his soul.

name: Ravenwatch Tassets
description: Adusa-daro awarded these House Ravenwatch leggings for helping her stop the assassins at Ravenwatch Castle.

name: Ayleid's Hope
description: King Dynar gave you this amulet for gathering the forces of the Mages Guild and the Fighters Guild in the Hollow City.

name: Dungeon-Delving Mantle
description: You earned this mantle by helping Kireth and Raynor Vanos, Lady Laurent, and Telenger escape from the Library of Dusk.

name: Ayleids' Coat of Memories
description: King Dynar gave you this armor as a reward for freeing him from the binding darkness of the Lightless Oubliette.

name: Stibbon's Dress Shirt of the Prisoner
Bow of Penumbra
description: A Shadow Walker weapon awarded for traversing the Moonless Walk and finding a way into the Lightless Oubliette.

name: Blood-Red Brogans
description: You received these boots after resolving the vampire dilemma at the Orchard beyond the Chasm.

name: Bulwark of the Citadel
description: Awarded for helping the Fighters Guild and Mages Guild find safe passage through the Citadel of the Reavers.

name: Skordo's Stalwart
description: Skordo the Knife awarded this shield for releasing the Fighters Guild prisoners from the Tower of Lies.

name: Soul-Meld Staff
description: This staff was your reward for helping restore the Soul-Meld Mage at the Vile Laboratory.

name: Saint Veloth's Shield
description: Saint Veloth himself bestowed this blessed shield for repairing the reliquary and restoring the Shrine of Saint Veloth.

name: Small Wrapped Gift
description: Prepared specially by the merchant in Silvenar.

name: Pickled Fish and Mushrooms
description: What started off as a rank odor from this serving of food is beginning to grow on you. That would be the fungus.

name: Citrine
description: Can be used to enhance weapons.

name: Crafting Motif 1: High Elf Style
description: Use to learn the High Elf crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 5: Breton Style
description: Use to learn the Breton crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 8: Orc Style
description: Use to learn the Orc crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

description: Use to learn the Redguard crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 3: Wood Elf Style
description: Use to learn the Wood Elf crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Stolen Goods
description: This large bag is filled with pilfered items.

name: Egg-Tender's Guard
description: Vicecanon Servyna gave you these gloves for saving the eggs at the Hatching Pools in Shadowfen.

name: Wrap of My Enemy's Skin
description: Grisly as it may be, these leggings are made from several different types of skin stitched together.

name: Chain of Hist's Power
description: This necklace oozes with the primordial power of the Hist.

name: Leather Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make leather.

name: Fell Hide Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make fell hide.

description: An ingredient for crafting clothing.

description: An ingredient for crafting clothing.

name: Staff of Nature's Accord
description: This staff was bestowed for helping to restore Nature's Accord and keep the sigil out of Stormfist hands.

name: Rearguard's Insignia
description: This insignia was dropped by a member of the expeditionary force sent against Doomcrag.

name: Barefoot Breton's Shoes
description: Footwear received after helping Parquier find his missing items.

name: Stoneskin Gloves
description: The gloves are lined with tufts of goat hair, softening their touch on the wearer's skin.

name: Staff of Withering
description: This staff was made from a tree which once grew in Motalion Necropolis.

name: Darkstride High King's Shield
description: High King Emeric bestowed this shield for defeating Montclair's forces in Shornhelm.

name: Frost Mirriam
description: An ingredient for crafting food.

name: Garlic
description: An ingredient for crafting food.

name: Dominion Firepot Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose fireball causes burn damage to structures and foes.

name: Siege Repair Kit
description: Repairs a Siege weapon for 20000 HP.

name: Pact Firepot Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose fireball causes burn damage to structures and foes.

name: Covenant Firepot Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose fireball causes burn damage to structures and foes.

name: Dominion Battering Ram
description: Creates a battering ram which can be used to destroy doors.

name: Keep Wall Masonry Repair Kit
description: Repairs 5,000 points of damage to a keep wall.

name: King Camoran's Boon
description: This garment is slippery to the touch. It appears to be a Khajiiti gift of state re-gifted to you by King Camoran Aeradan.

name: Pathwalker's Shield
description: The light of Jone and Jode seems to flow from every scar on this shield's surface..

name: Crafting Motif 4: Nord Style
description: Use to learn the Nord crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 2: Dark Elf Style
description: Use to learn the Dark Elf crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 9: Argonian Style
description: Use to learn the Argonian crafting style. Requires Rank 1 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Prophet's Recollection
description: A signet ring the Prophet has carried with him since his days in the Moth Priest's library.

name: Titanborn Family Signet
description: Lyris kept this with her for years, as she trained relentlessly with the members of her mercenary company.

name: Aldmion's Amulet
description: Imbued with some of the animal cruelty that comes from a life as a vampire and cultist.

name: Signet of the Worm
description: Worn by the upper ranks of Mannimarco's followers, this simple ring is stained with necromantic fluids.

name: Tharn Family Ring
description: Emblazoned with the symbol of the ancient Tharn family, and most likely hundreds of years old.

name: Jewel of the Duchess
description: This simple band allowed the Daedra working for the Duchess to withstand the agony of her mere presence.

name: Sword Saint's Choker
description: A relic interred within the Ancestral Crypt. Disturbed by the dark magics of Mannimarco and once worn by a Sword Saint of old.

name: Flash Powder
description: A granular powder known for causing a small explosions when put in fire

name: Covenant Battering Ram
description: Creates a battering ram which can be used to destroy doors.

name: Varnag's Head
description: This is the severed head of the vicious nix hound known as Varnag. There might be a reward for killing him.

name: Bleiger's Tentacle
description: This is the severed tentacle of the vicious netch, Bleiger. There might be a reward for killing him.

name: Gurlisk's Head
description: This is the severed head of the savage clannfear known as Gurlisk. There might be a reward for killing it.

name: Pact Battering Ram
description: Creates a battering ram which can be used to destroy doors.

name: Religious Fetish Statue
description: This curious obsidian figurine is of uncertain origin and purpose.

name: Keep Door Woodwork Repair Kit
description: Repairs 5,000 points of damage to a door.

name: Dominion Meatbag Catapult
description: Creates a catapult siege weapon that fires a bag of diseased meat at its targets.

name: Pact Meatbag Catapult
description: Creates a catapult siege weapon that fires a bag of diseased meat at its targets.

name: Covenant Meatbag Catapult
description: Creates a catapult siege weapon that fires a bag of diseased meat at its targets.

name: Dominion Oil Catapult
description: Creates a catapult siege weapon that fires a jar of oil at its targets, ensnaring them and draining their Stamina.

name: Pact Oil Catapult
description: Creates a catapult siege weapon that fires a jar of oil at its targets, ensnaring them and draining their Stamina.

name: Covenant Oil Catapult
description: Creates a catapult siege weapon that fires a jar of oil at its targets, ensnaring them and draining their Stamina.

name: Dominion Fire Ballista
description: Creates a ballista siege weapon whose bolt causes flame damage to structures and also damages foes over time.

description: Creates a ballista siege weapon whose bolt causes flame damage to structures and also damages foes over time.

name: Covenant Fire Ballista

description: Creates a ballista siege weapon whose electrically charged bolt ensnares enemies and drains their Magicka.

name: Blackfeather Court Whistle
description: This is an obsolete item. It no longer has any in-game value and is safe to destroy.

name: Glimmering Book
description: This ancient text seems to glow with an inner light.

description: Availble from Vendors for brewing ales and meads

description: Availble from Vendors for distilling liquiors

description: This note is from the leader of the Frostedge Pillagers.

description: A mysterious letter sealed with red wax

name: Dominion Forward Camp
description: Creates a site at which 20 soldiers of your alliance can respawn. Alliance Rank 6 or higher to purchase.

name: Pact Forward Camp
description: Creates a site at which 20 soldiers of your alliance can respawn. Alliance Rank 6 or higher to purchase.

name: Covenant Forward Camp
description: Creates a site at which 20 soldiers of your alliance can respawn. Alliance Rank 6 or higher to purchase.

name: Eaglebanner Longbow
description: Queen Ayrenn herself has tuned and tightened the bowstring on this weapon, ensuring every arrow flies straight and true.

name: Bathrobe of Vigor
description: This robe was your reward for helping the bathers taking advantage of the hot springs south of Wittestadr.

name: Pact Amulet
description: There is a faint engraving on the back of the amulet.

name: Indoril Pyrostaff
description: Legend says this staff was once used to smite an Akaviri Warlord.

name: Trader's Signet
description: This ring was allegedly worn by a merchant who was sponsored by Sotha Sil.

name: Rhorlak's War Axe
description: The haft of this axe was hewn from the finest Skyrim lumber.

name: Spiritmender's Staff
description: This staff is imbued with the strength of scores of restful spirits.

name: Bloodthorn Wyress Mantle
description: This light armor was awarded for helping the Wyresses save the villagers at Deleyn's Mill.

name: Bloodthorn Baelborne Signet
description: This signet ring was awarded for resolving the curse of Baelborne Rock.

name: Werewolf Hide Dagger's Combat Stompers
description: Distinctive heavy footwear awarded for assisting the Daggers against the harpies of the Shrieking Scar.

name: Wyress Sash
description: This light belt was awarded for helping the Wyresses save the villagers at Deleyn's Mill.

name: Lion Guard Pauldrons of the Wyrd Tree
description: For defeating Faolchu in Camlorn, this heavy shoulder armor was awarded.

name: Daggerfall Champion's Breastplate of the Wyrd Tree
description: A bounty of heavy armor awarded for defeating Angof Gravesinger in Cath Bedraud.

name: Monastic Slippers
description: These simple slippers are worn by priests tending the ancient Aldmeri site of Tanzelwil.

name: The Laughing Blade
description: Dunmer daggers in this style purportedly contain secret compartments for poison, though no one has ever located any.

name: Riverwalker Boots
description: These boots were fashioned from the hide of a kagouti, a creature from far-off Shadowfen.

name: Plaguetender's Staff
description: This simple staff is stained from numerous alchemical substances.

name: Artificer's Bolt

name: Nolagha's Scale Leggings of Meridia
description: Heavy leggings awarded for defeating the daedroth trio led by the fearsome Nolagha.

name: Brolsgerbwd's Bone Staff of Meridia
description: A weapon awarded for defeating the Dremora necromancer, Brolsgerbwd.

name: Prisoner Cynhamouth's Undulating Band
description: A ring awarded for defeating the harvester champion, Cynhamoth.

name: Elegant Deathcaller's Cowl
description: Smelling vaguely of embalming fluid and cremation ash, this hood was a dear treasure on Soulfire Plateau.

name: Sea-Raider's Hood of the Twin Sisters
description: Opportunistic bandits, such as the ones at Seaside Scapr, have taken the Three Banners War as a call to arms.

name: The Captain's Helm of the Veiled Heritance
description: Once worn by Captain Blanchete himself, this helm has seen every shore in southern Tamriel.

name: Snapjaw's Tooth of the Veiled Heritance
description: In truth, only the core of this blade is made up of clannfear tooth, but it's more than enough to give the sword a vile taint.

name: Elegant Serpent's Flame
description: The legends of fire-breathing snakes are just that, legends. Or so they say.

name: Loyalist's Longbow of the Veiled Heritance
description: The Veiled Heritance soldiers training on  the shores of Auridon have imbued this longbow with icy, slow-flowing malice.

name: Shagura's Staff of the Ranger
description: This staff is warm to the touch.

name: Nindaeril's Tooth of the Green Pact
description: This tooth still has sinews attached to it and can fit around your neck.

name: Unfortunate Wanderer's Boots of Syrabane
description: These boots smell of mildew and death.

name: Poacher's Cuirass of the Ranger
description: This breastplate is cool to the touch.

name: Thugrub's Bane of Syrabane
description: Flames lick the blade of this massive sword.

name: Valanir's Lost Hope of the Green Pact
description: This staff emanates despair.

name: Maheelius' Hunting Vest of the Wilderqueen
Croc Hunter's Axe of the Shadow Dancer
Rootwater Robes of the Shadow Dancer
Spinner's Sea Tamer's Torc
description: The torc feels warm against one's skin, no matter the weather.

name: Spinner's Fractured Femur
description: This large leg bone crackles with energy.

name: Waterlogged Chestpiece of Salvation
description: This piece of armor is creaky with rust, yet surprisingly functional.

name: Belt of the Waylaid Traveler of Salvation
description: This belt is gilded with stolen silver.

name: Commander's Signet of Salvation
description: This ring bears the mark of one of high military rank.

name: Spinner's Skullbreaker
description: This hammer weighs more than a guar.

name: Niramo's Gravegloves of the Senche
description: Taken from the Necromancer at Reaper's Henge. Best not to think about where the leather for these gloves came from.

name: Big Ozur's Ogre Grips of Soulshine
description: Big Ozur the Ogre didn't give up these gauntlets willingly. They're impressive pieces of crafting, if you can stand the smell.

name: Smuggler's Gloves of Three Mercies
description: These finely crafted, waterproof gloves were made for the Queen of Three Mercies.

name: Crocmother Fang of the Senche
description: Torn from the mouth of the Crocmother herself, this fang still exudes the toxic venom that made her a walking nightmare.

name: Smuggler's Devouring Earth Greatstaff
description: When Nirn itself rises up against the races of Tamriel, it's a sure sign that corruption has rooted itself deep.

name: The Overlord's Sun Shield of Soulshine
description: The vampires of Ushmal's Rest laid in enchantments to protect themselves from the sun. This massive shield is no different.

name: Strifeswarm Legplates of the Shalk
description: Still reeks of the kwama tunnel where it was formed.

name: Ancestor's Kilt of the Sun
description: Blessed by the tribe's wise woman in the Cave of Memories.

name: Dreugh-Hide Leggings of the Red Mountain
description: Smells faintly of the tides around Matron's Clutch.

name: Crabclaw Axe of the Shalk
description: Made from the actual claw of Shellcracker, the cannibal crab.

name: Netch-Hunter's Bow of the Red Mountain
description: Taken up by a fallen hunter in the Brahma's Grove.

name: Madcaller's Blade of the Red Mountain
description: Stained with the blood of a dozen sacrifices at the Shivering Shrine.

name: Kagouti Slayer Medallion of Mother's Sorrow

Folium Discognitum
description: The pages of this book bear near incomprehensible scrawls. When you look closer, the words move on the page to avoid your gaze.

name: Acanthia's Arm of Cyrodiil's Light
description: This unique bow is made from an unknown hardwood and requires great strength to wield.

name: Ironlash's Vine of Cyrodiil's Light
description: Ironlash's tentacles serve as a unique belt.

name: Razorback's Hide of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: Razorback's carapace grants its wielder lightweight but sturdy protection.

name: The Black Dagger of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: The Black Dagger's unusually sharp edge easily slices through most armor.

name: Longfang of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: Longfang's poison sacs have imbued this sword's blade with a toxic coating.

name: Volcatia's Shroud of Cyrodiil's Light
description: This headgear is warm to the touch, though the source of its heat is uncertain.

name: Barasatii's Chain of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: This intricately woven chain feels slimy upon the neck.

name: The Harrower of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: Volgo's favored weapon feels light and perfectly weighted.

name: Serrin Vol's Advantage of Cyrodiil's Light
description: This ring feels slick upon one's finger, as if always about to slip off.

name: Vethisa's Grips of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: Power emanates from these gloves, made from animal hide reinforced with metallic thread.

name: Blighttooth's Embrace of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: The simplicity of this wrapping is belied by the feeling of power that issues from it.

name: Bruuke's Hide of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: This crudely made chestpiece seems very sturdy, able to stand up to any attack.

name: Matriarch Boots of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: The pads on these boots grant improved traction on almost any surface.

name: Claudette's Fingers of Cyrodiil's Light
description: A faint shimmer on the surface of these gloves hints at their magical enhancements.

name: Sargos' Vestments of Cyrodiil's Light
description: The intricate patterns woven into this material suggest master craftmanship.

name: Ashham's Breastplate of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: Heavily ornamented and immensely strong, this breastplate imbues its wearer with a sense of immortality.

name: Marbita's Helm of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: This helmet's interlocking metal plates provide excellent protection for the wearer's head.

name: Endare's Vision of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: Lightweight and intricately designed, this helm protects its wearer well.

name: Zandur's Speed of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: Lightweight and strong, this armor fits the legs snugly, enabling rapid movement.

name: Lucienne's Remnants of Cyrodiil's Light
description: These shoulder ornaments fill their wearer with the desire to see the world.

name: Roreles' Ring of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: This ring is well-worn, but a feeling of power still issues from it.

name: Serniel's Belt of Cyrodiil's Light
description: The craftsmanship that went into this sash makes it a delight to behold.

name: Virane's Boots of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: These boots served General Virane in life, though not well enough to prevent his death.

name: Ashham's Crook of Cyrodiil's Light
description: This staff glows with an evil-looking inner light.

name: Emelin's Clasp of Cyrodiil's Light
description: This translucent necklace always feels damp to the touch.

name: Meb's Chopper of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: This massive ax is extremely well-balanced and a joy to wield.

name: Regsrot's Shoulders of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: This shoulder protection seems unusually well-made.

name: Traug's Arrow Flinger of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: A mighty bow whose smooth lines bespeak great accuracy.

name: Cynaceae's Branch of Cyrodiil's Light
description: The solidity of this thick staff confers confidence to those who wield it.

name: Ogre Biter's Shell of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: Insect carapaces reinforce the metal-and-leather structure of this unique shield.

name: Kerks' Pauldrons of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: These heavy shoulder pieces project an aura of strength and endurance.

name: Gravel Tooth's Tooth of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: The edges of this wickedly sharp dagger appear coated with an unknown substance.

name: Rock Wing Skin Belt of Cyrodiil's Ward
description: Metal and hide strands interweave to give this belt unusual strength and flexibility.

name: Athal's Robe of Cyrodiil's Light
description: Eerie shimmers pulse along the threads of this extraordinary robe.

name: Ingested Hammer of Cyrodiil's Light
description: Crafted in Oblivion, this weapon's surface glistens with an evil sheen.

name: Faceless Staff
description: Faint whispers, heard only by the wielder, are said to emanate from this ill-omened weapon.

name: Ritual Shard
description: A stone plate covered in ritual scrawl.

name: Hilt of Rahni'Za
description: A broken blade meant to represent spirit of Rahni'Za.

name: Kollopi Essence
description: Use the Kollopi essence to cloak in a haze of forest moths and enter the Wood Orcs' camp disguised. (Will not work in Cyrodiil, the Imperial City, or its sewers.)

name: The Trial of Air
description: Use to read.

name: The Trial of the True Path
description: Use to read.

name: The Hidden Trials
description: Use to read.

description: A broken blade meant to represent the spirit of Rahni'Za

description: A broken blade meant to represent the spirit of Rahni'Za.

name: Gem of Rahni'Za
description: A broken blade meant to represent the spirit of Rahni'Za.

name: Dreadfang's Bite of Cyrodiil's Crest
description: This blade reeks of foulness.

name: Webmistress' Silk of Cyrodiil's Light
description: A belt spun of spider silk. The patterns seem divinely influenced.

name: Murky Crystal
description: A dulled crystal that looks like it can reflect light in short distances.

name: Bright Crystal
description: A bright crystal that looks like it can reflect light in long distances.

name: Covenant Treasure Maps
description: Contains seven Treasure Maps that lead to treasure in Covenant areas. Unlike other treasure maps, these troves will only contain gear based on your character's preferred weapon and armor skills. (Once a map is removed, it cannot be returned to the box!)

name: Dominion Treasure Maps
description: Contains seven Treasure Maps that lead to treasure in Dominion areas. Unlike other treasure maps, these troves will only contain gear based on your character's preferred weapon and armor skills. (Once a map is removed, it cannot be returned to the box!)

name: Pact Treasure Maps
description: Contains seven Treasure Maps that lead to treasure in Pact areas. Unlike other treasure maps, these troves will only contain gear based on your character's preferred weapon and armor skills. (Once a map is removed, it cannot be returned to the box!)

name: Coldharbour Treasure Map
description: Contains one Treasure Map that leads to treasure in Coldharbour. Unlike other treasure maps, these troves will only contain gear based on your character's preferred weapon and armor skills. (Once a map is removed, it cannot be returned to the box!)

name: Dwarven Oil

name: Grain Solvent

name: Magnificent Bat Pelt
description: Though too small to make anything larger than a pillow from it, the pelt of this bat is silky soft and well-groomed.

name: Shimmering Alit Bezoar
description: This stone was pulled from the gullet of a slain alit.

name: Gnarled Bear Claw
description: The paw of this bear is tipped with brutal, jagged claws that could tear the face off a grown man.

name: Wolf's Tooth Necklace
description: The large canine of a wolf makes an excellent, easily made souvenir with but a simple leather string.

name: Cat's Claw
description: This hooked, retractable talon is a token of victory over a savage big cat.

name: Inert Egg
description: The giant snake swallowed a huge, mottled egg. The egg is still warm, but shows no signs of hatching.

name: Malformed Kagouti Tusk
description: This tooth curls in on itself like a seashell and is highly polished by saliva and other digestive fluids.

name: Huge Mammoth's Tooth
description: While a mammoth's tusks are impressive, the creature's eye teeth truly show its age and size.

name: Buzzing Spine
description: This spine from a wamasu's ridge hums faintly and causes unprotected flesh to tingle unpleasantly.

name: Bile Gilt
description: This netch organ typically produces paralzying venom, but this one has hardened into a pearl-like stone.

name: Cruel Collar
description: This barbed collar was around the neck of a slain jackal. Clearly someone tried to make it a pet.

name: Hand of Glory
description: The practice of cutting off the hands of hanged murderers appears to be alive and well in Tamriel.

name: Chattering Skull
description: Even after its body was destroyed, this skeleton's jaw keeps moving, seemingly of its own accord.

name: Wraith Shackle
description: This ghostly chain did not dissipate upon destruction of the wraith that bore it.

name: Crypt Jar
description: The embalmed dead from many cultures in Tamriel often have their organs stored in separate containers.

name: Twitching Draugr Hand
description: The Nord dead can rise to protect their tombs and even dismemberment does not always stop this drive.

name: Ectoplasmic Discharge
description: This variety of the common residue isn't useful, but glows softly within its vial and casts an eerie greenish light.

name: Petrified Spider Egg
description: A tiny spider is forever frozen within the calcified confines of this egg.

name: Calcified Cuttle
description: The cuttle from the beak of the kwama sometimes hardens and crystallizes, appearing much like quartz.

name: Razor-Edged Mandible
description: Though the chitin is dried and the edges are brittle, the blade-like jaws of the giant beetle are still impressive.

name: Luminous Blood Sac
description: The blood sac of this hoarvor is filled with glowing blood. Whatever it feasted upon was unnatural indeed.

name: Polished Shell Shard
description: Water flowing over the shell of the mudcrab has polished it to a pearly sheen.

name: Prized Barb
description: While useless as a weapon now that its owner is dead, the mottled coloration and fearsome nature of the object is impressive.

name: Multifaceted Eye
description: A thousand reflections of yourself can be seen when this eye is held up for inspection.

name: Gossamer Winglet
description: The second row of wings on a wasp's back are of a paper-like consistency and refract light in a pleasing way.

name: Perfectly Balanced Gyro
description: Even when set down on its sides or tossed gently across the floor, this component rights itself and continues to spin.

name: Whirring Dynamo
description: This dynamo taken from a mechanical spider continues to buzz and hum despite its owner being little more than scrap.

name: Primal Sproutling
description: Found lodged in the side of the spriggan's corpse is a cutting, an innocent bloom fallen away from the nature spirit.

name: Lashing Tentacle
description: Despite being severed from its fleshy trunk, the tentacle of the strangler plant continues to writhe and ooze without tiring.

name: Brass Anklets
description: Claimed from a slain nereid, these shining brass anklets should have corroded away long ago, but they remain intact.

name: Imp's Effigy
description: Why the imp was carrying a small wicker caricature is unknown, but the effigy is unnerving to stare at for long.

name: Icebound Vertebra
description: The frozen spine of the Ice Wraith shattered when it died, but one of its smaller vertebrae survived.

name: Knotted Heart
description: Pulled from the torso of a slain lurcher, this fist-sized acorn beats like a heart.

name: Glowing Remnant
description: When held up to the ear, a soft sound like that of a distant sob can be heard.

name: Werewolf's Cameo
description: The image on the profile is that of a young woman, but when held up to moonlight, it changes to that of a wolf.

name: Nose Shackle
description: This trophy from a slain ogrim is etched with jagged runes, signifying its obeisance to a Daedric master.

name: Troll Skull
description: Troll skulls are macabre, sought-after collectibles across Tamriel.

name: Ogre Toe Ring
description: Not known for wearing jewelry, it's surprising that this Ogre wore a massive toe-ring on its right foot.

name: Stony Heart
description: Striated with multi-hued crystal, the head-sized core of the slain gargoyle stretches the definition of the word "heart".

name: Second Skin
description: The fine, translucent sheaf of epidermis acts like a prism when held up to the light, refracting colors in all directions.

name: Flawless Tail Feather
description: Harpy plumage is generally beautiful, but this feather stands out above all others.

name: Smoldering Ember Heart
description: For whatever reason, the heart of this flame atronach has refused to cool entirely and is very warm to the touch.

name: Fleshy Symbiont
description: Though the rest of the atronach has become inert, the lashing, slavering tongue of your kill continues to twitch and undulate.

name: Everfrost
description: Though most of a frost atronach's remains will melt and sublimate eventually, this shard of its body persists.

name: Crackling Lodestone
description: This lodestone was pulled from the remains of a storm atronach and has yet to cease sparking.

name: Banekin Horn
description: Despite the discorporation process that follows the destruction of Daedra, the gnarled and tumorous horn of the banekin endures.

name: Daedric Dewclaw
description: Clannfear claws are made for hooking their prey and pinning them while they are consumed alive.

name: Burning Daedroth Eye
description: Even after its host was slain, this hateful eye stares malevolently back at you, its humors failing to calcify or drain away.

name: Blighted Iron Collar
description: This scamp's iron collar is etched with runes ascribing it as the property of one of the innumerable Dremora Kynreeves.

name: Spider's Crown
description: The exoskeletal ridge affixed to the Daedra's brow broke away when she died, appearing much like a chitinous crown.

name: Scaly Durzog Hide
description: The durzog is to the Goblin what the dog is to Man and Mer, save that dogs lack the rough crocodilian skin of the former.

name: Summoner's Shoulderpads
description: The sigil of Thizzrini is the mark of a true champion.

name: Sorceror's Mantle
description: The sigil of Thizzrini, mark of a true champion, is woven into the inner neckline of this garment.

name: Swordmaster's Shoulderplates
description: The sigil of Thizzrini, a mark of a true champion, is used as a maker's mark in the neck of this armor.

name: Great Blade of Thizzrini
description: This sword bears the sigil of Thizzrini Arena, cleverly worked into it as a maker's mark.

name: Mara's Breath
description: Reverent prayers to the wife of Akatosh imbue this staff with an air of cheerful grace.

name: Sphinxblade Hatchet
description: A holdover from the days when Sphinxmoth was a true garrison, the bite on this axe is as sharp as the day it was forged.

name: Desert's Jewel Cowl
description: This comfortable hood was only tooled days before the attack on the city.

name: Helm of Khali's Strength
description: Formed from planar dream-stuff, this handsome helm was awarded to you by the Lunar Champion.

name: Fire of Shazah's Wisdom
description: Formed from planar dream-stuff, this staff embodies the wisdom and intelligence of the Champion Shazah.

name: Epic Bard's Cowl
description: Passed down through Valencia's family, this simple garment retains the glamor of its association to that legendary bard.

name: Stinkfish
description: A rare fish found only in Stonefalls.

name: Steel Shrike Uniform
description: This loose uniform worn by the Steel Shrikes reeks of stale sweat, spilled drinks, and pungent spices.

name: Foul Hide
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Carapace
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Daedra Husk
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Ectoplasm
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Elemental Essence
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Dwarven Gear
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Membrane
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Supple Root
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Meridia's Charm of the Dawn
description: Meridia created this token from the first light of dawn at the height of summer.

name: Meridia's Emblem of Searing Light
description: Though the task Meridia set before you is complete, you sense that she still watches you through this pendant.

name: Unidentified the Skillmaxer 4000
description: Unlocks Undaunted, Soulmagic, Fighter's and Mage's Guilds, Legerdemain, and AVA lines and a bunch of skill points

name: The Werewolf Pact
description: Unlocks the perks and pitfalls of being a Werewolf.

name: The Vampire Secret
description: Unlocks the perks and pitfalls of being a vampire.

name: Rotmeth Sandals
description: These leather sandals were boiled in rotmeth. The tingling sensation they provide keeps the wearer alert.

name: Gold Coast Gauntlets
description: These gauntlets were once fashionable amongst Colovian knights. A mild enchantment quickly clots the blood for minor wounds.

name: The Spinner's Weave
description: This elegant cowl smells faintly of lilacs. The pleasant scent helps the wearer concentrate amidst chaotic surroundings.

name: Garnikh's Bite

Box of Impromptu Yokudan Destiny
description: This box is heavy with unearned power.

name: Ashes of Remorse
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Charcoal of Remorse, which is used to make Xivkyn equipment.

Inferno Staff of the Noble's Conquest
Ice Staff of the Noble's Conquest

Cirion's Last Stand of the Tormentor
description: The leg guards worn by Keeper Cirion before he sacrificed himself to stop High Kinlord Rilis.

name: Kargand's Barkskin Helmet
description: A gift from Bakkhara on behalf of her brother.

name: Ancient Netch-Robes
description: Ancient attire, discarded long ago and sealed away for centuries beneath Darkshade Caverns.

name: Pellingare War Plate of the Sergeant
description: The finest armor to be found in Wayrest, above the city or below.

name: Necromancer's Lich-Heart
description: This amulet is cold to the touch.

name: Crown Repair Kit
description: When used, this repair kit restores all your damaged equipment to its original condition.

name: Crown Soul Gem
description: These soul gems can be used to revive players of any level, and to fully charge weapons of any level.

name: Leveled Soul Gem (Empty)
description: Used to capture souls of any Level.

name: Collar of Bones
description: This strand was taken from the neck of the Child of Bones. It's surprisingly cold.

name: Bloody Fist Armband
description: A blood-red armband worn by Headman Bhosek's most trusted warriors.

name: Reinforced Ankle-Wraps
description: Often worn by dancers to prevent injuries, these ankle-wraps have thin iron strips woven into the fabric.

name: Imitation Elf Ears
description: These imitation High Elf ears would sell well as part of a disguise.

name: Queen Maraya's Scarf
description: This colorful adornment was sewn from the finest silks sold in Sentinel.

name: Genuine Psijic Stole
description: This simple attire may have belonged to a member of the Psijic Order, secretive monks devoted to the esoteric study of the Elder Way.

name: Whispering Scarf
description: This scarf is made of thin gauze and used to cover one's mouth to ensure spies cannot glean information by lip reading.

name: Prince Adrien's Silken Scarf
description: When her son came of age and joined in the war, the queen made him wear flashy scarves so the king could protect him in battle.

name: Head Scarf
description: A light and breathable cotton scarf. Great protection against both sun and sandstorm.

name: Royal Scarf of Daggerfall
description: Stylish neck wrapping featuring the crescent moon pattern of King Casimir, sold exclusively by clothier Kareem Winvale.

name: Royal Scarf of Shornhelm
description: Stylish neck wrapping featuring the heraldry of King Ranser. Quite popular—prior to the losing effort of Ranser's War.

name: Battle Scarf of the Rift
description: Stylish neck wrapping sold exclusively by Tolfari the Tailor as a military accessory, though most say it just gets in the way.

name: Brightly Colored Scarf
description: A striped, multicolored, knitted winter scarf that seems absurdly long.

name: Sentinel Guard Captain's Badge
description: A badge carried by high-ranking officers of the Sentinel Guard.

name: Burnished Judgment Badge
description: A badge worn by the famed Justices of Bergama. A fence might be able to ransom this back to its original owner.

name: Badge of the Ra Gada
description: This ancient military badge was given to the warlords of the Ra Gada when they first arrived on Tamriel's shores.

name: Murcien's Badge of Courage
description: Sir Etienne of Murcien's Hamlet recognized his officers with these badges if they displayed bravery in the field.

name: Dragonstar Enforcer Badge
description: Thuggish Dragonstar caravan enforcers all wear this badge. It's become a symbol of the harsher side of commerce.

name: Common Buckle
description: There is nothing flashy about this buckle. Its previous owner was likely of modest or practical temperament.

name: Nord Clan Neckerchief
description: A triangular piece of cloth, decorated with the markings of a Nord clan, usually worn about the leader's neck.

name: Summerset Silk Neckerchief
description: A colorful cloth made of the finest Summerset silk and worn around the neck, it can be pulled up to protect from sea spray.

name: Monocular Loupe
