description: Perfect for the appraiser of fine art and jewelry. Lacking a chain, it is not recommended for the easily shocked.

name: Fine Silken Ascot Neckerchief
description: Red and green silk neckerchief with elaborate cursive praises of the Tribunal, and a tag, "Steamfont Laundry."

name: Vicecanon's Cloth-Of-Gold Armband
description: Symbol of office for a Vicecanon of Stormhold and "All Surrounding Domains Appertaining Thereto," says the label.

name: House Ravenwatch Sash
description: A decorative sash bearing the colors and crest of House Ravenwatch of Rivenspire.

name: Covenant Blue Sash
description: A silken sash, dyed a deep ocean blue.

name: High Priest's Sash
description: A gold-embroidered sash, modeled after the one worn by the High Priest of Satakalaam.

name: Seventh Legion Sash
description: This elegant sash is handed out to Imperial agents so that when the legion arrives, they can prove their loyalty.

name: Silver Sash
description: A shining sash made from a finespun, fragile material and studded with rubies on its ends.

name: Saint Pelin's Prayer Shawl
description: Sisters who pledge themselves to the Order of Saint Pelin often wear these prayer shawls.

name: Tribunal Mourning Stole
description: A brightly colored stole worn to honor the dead, as per the traditions set forth by the Tribunal.

name: Wood Elf Dance Shawl
description: Traditional attire for engaging in Wood Elf ritual dances, the frolicker usually wears this diaphanous cloth—and nothing more.

name: Feathery Finery Shawl
description: Wood Elves consider this shawl made of blue-bunting feathers to be stylish, while most everyone else think it looks ridiculous.

name: Arkay Mourning Shawl
description: A dark-colored shawl worn to honor the dead, as per the traditions set forth in the "Cycles of Arkay."

name: Gaudy Baandari Budi Shawl
description: Linen shawl with a bright floral print, typical of Baandari Pedlars, and labeled "Serious Stitchery, Redfur Trading Post."

name: Parrot-Feather Shawl
description: Light chamois shawl decorated with hundreds of parrot feathers woven in a floral design.

name: House Tamrith Prayer Shawl
description: Countess Tamrith's devotion to the Light inspired women throughout Rivenspire to acquire these Arkay prayer shawls.

name: Dark Elf Rain Shawl
description: Dark Elves who spend any time in Skyrim's colder climes utilize water-proof rain shawls to stay more or less comfy and dry.

name: Yokudan Prayer Shawl
description: An ancient shawl that bears the image of sword-wielding figures. Collectors and academics would pay handsomely for it.

name: Mephala Spidersilk Prayer Shawl
description: Spun from expensive spidersilk, this prayer shawl is used in rituals honoring the Spider God, Mephala.

name: Bejeweled Eye-Patch Scraper
description: A fancy, specialized tool to keep one's eye-patch clean. Perfect for the fashionable privateer on the go.

name: Red Rook Neckerchief
description: A colorful cloth, worn around the neck, it can be pulled up to hide the features of a notorious Red Rook bandit.

name: Black Lace Kerchief
description: This kerchief has the faint smell of wood smoke, as if from a pyre.

name: High King's Nose Warmer
description: A fur-rimmed nose cozy famously modeled after one favored by High King Emeric, it's all the rage among High Rock's elite.

name: Collection of Colorful Ribbons
description: A collection of ribbons of various widths and colors, used to decorate a Dark Elf's hair or clothing.

name: Trader's Levy Tassel
description: A tassel hung from clothing to denote a merchant's good standing with the Queen's Collector of Taxes and Tariffs.

name: Merchant's Levy Tassel
description: A tassel hung from clothing to denote a merchant's good standing with the Royal Tax-Collector of Daggerfall.

name: Vizier's Golden Tassel
description: A golden tassel traditionally attached to the robes of the king's viziers.

name: Golden Braid Band
description: A band of pure gold, designed to secure and decorate the hair braids or beard braids of stylish Nords.

name: Copper Horn Caps
description: While the "capping" fad has largely passed, there's still a market for horn adornments in Black Marsh.

name: Jeweled Elven Ear Cuffs
description: Long ear cuffs of silver wire with small topaz accents.

name: Banner of the Na-Totambu
description: This is an archaic flag, carried by servants of the Na-Totambu when they first arrived on ships from old Yokuda.

name: Tattered Flag
description: A folded linen flag bearing the golden crest of the Aldmeri Dominion. This was likely taken from an alliance command vessel.

name: Royal Banner of Evermore
description: After King Eamond's death, these valuable banners were taken down and replaced with black mourning banners.

name: Camoran Coronation Banner
description: Carefully-folded royal banner with silversilk embroidered fringe, from Aeradan Camoran's coronation.

name: "Unforeseen Queen" Homecoming Banner
description: Bright silk banner displaying the Altmeri eagle, prepared for Ayrenn's return to Summerset by way of Firsthold.

name: Dragonstar Caravan Banner
description: A banner emblazoned with the Dragonstar Caravan emblem. It would be quite useful to a smuggler.

name: Camoran Banner
description: A tall and tattered banner that's obviously seen battle. It still stands proudly, and could be useful to smugglers.

name: Aldmeri Dominion Banner
description: A silk banner bearing the symbol of the Aldmeri Dominion. The gold embroidery indicates its owner's prominence.

name: Lion Guard Banner
description: A neatly folded banner bearing the symbol of the Lion Guard and signed by a Lion Guard officer.

name: Hand-Stitched Flag
description: A heavy woolen flag. A giant serpent with the head of an Orc is skillfully embroidered onto the cloth.

name: Antique Hallin's Stand Flag
description: This flag flew over Hallin's Stand centuries ago when the city was part of the kingdom of Sentinel.

name: House Redoran Victory Flag
description: A flag bearing the symbol of House Redoran, commemorating one of the many victories they claim credit for achieving.

name: King Ranser Victory Flag
description: A flag bearing the symbol of King Ranser, made to commemorate the victory of Wayrest but perhaps distributed too soon.

name: Orcthane's Victory Flag
description: Some Stormfist Brigade supporter jumped the pig and created a limited number of flags proclaiming Fildgor's victory over Jorunn.

name: Flayed Flag of Camlorn
description: A fragment of the flag of Camlorn, said to have been carried into war during the Battle of Granden Tor.

name: Royal Hussar's Wing Sashimono
description: Feathered back-banner shaped like a great eagle's wing, worn by the Royal Altmeri Hussars.

name: Beachcomber's Basket
description: A tightly woven basket filled with polished shells and seaglass, collected from the coast.

name: Dragonstar Picnic Basket
description: Burzgrag in Dragonstar packs and sells these picnic baskets for miners and others who work outdoors for long hours at a time.

name: Konunleikar Festival Basket
description: Fertab in Windhelm packs and sells these festival baskets, full of everything necessary for a long day of celebrating.

name: Gray Mire Angler's Creel
description: Argonian-made croc-hide creel for stowing caught fish; includes stiffened safety-pocket for extra hook storage.

name: Lizard-Leather Fishing Creel
description: Bag of waxed lizard-leather with shoulder strap for holding fresh-caught fish.

name: Intricate Fishing Basket
description: An expertly coiled basket made from river cane and red wasso—popular with Argonian fishwives.

name: Arkay Meditation Beads
description: These meditation beads are often used by Priests of Arkay when consecrating the dead.

name: Hall of Heroes Prayer Beads
description: These ivory prayer beads came from the necropolis in Southern Bangkorai. The centerpiece is a crude likeness of Makela Leki.

name: Arzhela's Ivory Prayer Beads
description: The queen has made a habit of handing out these valuable prayer beads to mourning mothers and wives in Evermore.

name: Mother Morrowind Meditation Beads
description: Meditation beads used to contemplate the mysteries of the Tribunal, especially the blessings of Almalexia.

name: Precious Kynesgrove Prayer Beads
description: Rare mother-of-pearl prayer beads, dedicated to Kyne and crafted by the keepers of Kynesgrove for wealthy patrons.

name: Zenithar Negotiation Beads
description: Prayer beads used by followers of Zenithar to call forth good luck and success in all types of negotiations.

name: Do'Krin Prayer Beads
description: Prayer beads carved at Do'Krin Temple. They are valued for their pleasant musk scent.

name: Hunding Prayer Beads
description: The centerpiece of these prayer beads is a small crystal sword. The beads were crafted to pay homage to Divad Hunding.

name: Tava's Prayer Beads
description: A string of pink pearls, accented by an olive-wood medallion carved to resemble a bird.

name: Silver Bell
description: A small bell with a light and cheerful jingle.

name: Jone and Jode Bell
description: A silver bell engraved with an image of the big moon and the little moon. Khajiit ring it to ward off night spirits.

name: Dark Moon Temple Bell
description: Ancient bronze bell stolen from the Temple of the Dark Moon. It probably lacks the traditional theft-curse placed on such items.

name: Golden Cow Bell
description: A cow bell of solid gold. One of several created by Tuvor the Goldsmith for the finest of Lord Hannudra's prized cattle.

name: Fox-Bone Chime
description: These hollow bone chimes sing a soothing song when blown by the wind.

name: Wind Chimes
description: The light wooden rods of these chimes have been hollowed out to produce deep tones when blown by the wind.

name: Seashell Wind Chimes
description: When Iron-In-Blood takes a break from crafting weapons, he makes these delicate chimes from local seashells.

name: Bleakrock Docks Wind Chimes
description: These wind chimes once hung at the Bleakrock docks, but the workers demanded they be removed because of the annoying noise.

name: Bronze Crosswych Alarm Gong
description: A bronze gong and hammer, small enough to fit on a bedside table, makes a noise loud enough to wake the soundest sleeper.

name: Brown Bear Sleeping Furs
description: Bear-fur sleeping blanket, lined with flannel in a floral print. A label reads "Snip and Stitch Outfitters, Skywatch."

name: Imported Khenarthi's Wool Blanket
description: Soft ivory-colored blanket of wool from Khenarthi's Roost. The label reads "Imported by The Handy Haversack."

name: Dhalmora Leather Snuggle
description: Dhalmora Argonians find the feel of these thick, leather blankets oddly comforting on cold, lonely nights.

name: Miner's Blanket
description: A thin, light blanket is perfect for covering rocks or hard ground. It provides miners a clean place to sit.

name: Mammoth-Hide Blanket
description: Only the children of jarls, thanes, and wealthy merchants could afford an ostentatious blanket made from the hide of a mammoth.

name: Woolen Blanket
description: A warm blanket, valuable to adventurers and travelers.

name: Mammoth-Ear Suede Coverlet
description: A suede blanket made from the finest chamois timber-mammoth ear. Embroidered script reads "Silver Moons Honeymoon."

name: Wolfskin Blanket
description: A well-tanned wolfskin, complete with fur and lined with linen. It can serve as a blanket or a makeshift mantle.

name: Plaid Cashmere Blanket
description: A warm blanket of plaid cashmere from the goatherds of Hoarfrost Downs.

name: Silverhoof Horse Blanket
description: An exquisitely crafted horse blanket from Silverhoof Vale, decorated with a pastural scene of frolicking horses.

name: Gerent's Quilted Sponge-Blanket
description: Quilted sponge-blanket displaying the sigil of the vicecanons. It is best used for staying moist while sleeping.

name: Lamb's Wool Blanket
description: A high quality blanket made of lamb's wool.

name: Woven Blanket
description: This blanket is perfectly soft and not at all itchy.

name: Ash'abah Blanket
description: This coarse, but finely woven blanket was crafted by the Ash'abah to keep them warm on cold nights in the desert.

name: Woven Baandari Blanket
description: This Baandari-style blanket has a colorful and exotic look.

name: Bearskin Blanket
description: This large, thick bearskin was earned by a trophy hunter who ventured into Fallen Grotto.

name: Dark Elf Prayer Blanket
description: A finely-woven prayer blanket featuring depictions of the "Living Gods" of the Tribunal.

name: Lost Hope Quilt
description: A Breton quilt of "lost hope" is crafted, usually by a mother and daughter, to work through past regrets and sorrows.

name: High Rock Quilt
description: This Breton quilt features an embroidered map of High Rock. Southern Bangkorai is included in Evermore's domain.

name: Lovelorn Comforter
description: A comforter quilted by the We Who Pine for Darien Gautier Quilting Circle. A number of chapters exist throughout Rivenspire.

name: Lovelorn Quilt
description: A quilt by the We Who Have Loved and Lost Darien Gautier Sewing Circle. A number of chapters exist throughout Glenumbra.

name: Love-Lost Comforter
description: A comforter quilted by We Who Lost Battle Maidens in the most-recent wars. Such sewing circles exist throughout Skyrim.

name: Fine Woolen Bedroll
description: A plush woolen bundle, dyed a deep blue.

name: Wolf Pelt Sleeping Bag
description: Lined with fur on the inside, this sleeping bag is both soft and warm. Water resistant lacquer has been painted on the outside.

name: Velvet Bedroll
description: A fine velvet bedroll lined with soft sheep's wool, suitable for camping in high style on chilly nights.

name: Orcish Ledger of Significant Grudges
description: A record of all of the grievances and insults an Orc family has suffered, with dates, specifics, and planned responses.

name: Blank Leatherbound Journal
description: The pages of this well-bound book are stiff and empty.

name: Cheaply Bound Journal
description: This journal contains private thoughts and personal details. A fence may be able to resell it to a blackmailer.

name: Firebrand Prayer Book
description: A small book of prayers collected by the Knights of the Flame and gifted to the head of their order.

name: Ruby-Studded Book Cover
description: This fancy book cover was among several King Fahara'jad gifted to the scholars who supported his claim to the throne.

name: Visual Guide To Auridon Flora
description: A handy guide to Auridon plants. Of interest to poisoners is the chapter "A Publication of Malefic Aldmer Essences, 2E 561."

name: Guide To Approved Methods of Procreation
description: Illustrated folio from the Thalmor depicting methods of coition "that properly reflect our Altmeri heritage."

name: High Elf Songbook
description: The songs are written in Old Aldmeris, and would be of great value to historians.

name: Book of Erotic Stories
description: A collection of erotic fiction, featuring pairings of prominent Aldmeri Dominion figures, including Queen Ayrenn and Urcelmo.

name: Argonian Desk Reference
description: This text contains highly inaccurate translations of Nord and Dark Elf phrases into simple Argonian words.

name: Handmaiden's Sketch Book
description: The handmaiden to a prominent noble in Evermore filled this book with beautiful sketches before becoming a famous artist.

name: Bizarre Daedric Text
description: Attempts to read this book leave the reader nauseous and disoriented. The runes constantly shift and change.

name: Yorran's Yarns of Cyrodiil, Illustrated Edition
description: Amusing and often bawdy anecdotes detailing a Nord's adventures in the Imperial City, complete with explicit illustrations.

name: Saint Veloth Prayer Book
description: A small book of prayers gifted to the visitors to Saint Veloth's Shrine in exchange for voluntary contributions.

name: First Edition Fjokki
description: A rare copy of the first edition of "The Art of Love and Swordplay" by Fjokki the Bard.

name: Cambray Hills Academy of Art Sketchbook
description: A sketchbook bearing the mark of the famed art school in central Glenumbra, partially filled with nature drawings.

name: Untranslated Ayleid Book
description: Rare book from the Reliquary of Stars, bound in mysterious leather, and written in untranslated Ayleidoon.

name: Signed "Trees of Brackenleaf" Folio
description: Signed folio of engravings depicting the leading trees of Brackenleaf, with their names and brief histories.

name: Camoran Throne-Tattoo Codex
description: Gilt-edged hand-drawn folio depicting the Wood Elf tattoo patterns that may only be worn by members of House Camoran.

name: Baandari Ledger
description: This ledger contains evidence of illegal trading by the Baandari. It could be quite valuable to a rival.

name: "Lusty Argonian Maid" Art Folio
description: A well-worn book of stimulating images illustrating the popular tale of "The Lusty Argonian Maid."

name: Nord-To-Dark Elf Concordance
description: A list of common Nord words and sayings, translated into phrases more palatable to Dark Elf sensibilities.

name: Nam-Li's Immodest Fables
description: Amusing (and often bawdy) anecdotes and tall tales detailing an Argonian's adventures in Morrowind.

name: "Sketches From Lukiul Uxith" Folio
description: Folio by the popular artist Andrano Andraneth of his drawings of the "exotic" Argonian town; signed and numbered.

name: Indecipherable Metallic Book
description: Book of strange, indecipherable runes printed on thin foil pages of an unknown metal, labeled "Found in Gandranen."

name: Deluxe Dark Elf Pantomime Joke Book
description: Leather-bound joke book of wordless cartoons all mocking Dark Elves, their customs and personal habits; "Stormhold, 2E 578."

name: Erotic Argonian Etchings
description: A set of limited-edition etchings of Argonian erotica. It is impossible to discern the gender of the participants.

name: Three-Temples Picture Book
description: "Khenarthi's Roost: Isle of Three Temples," a folio of engravings depicting ancient sacred sites.

name: Blackcaster Mage's Spellbook
description: A book with no markings identifying its owner. It contains component lists for spells, and is wrapped in Elinhiran leather.

name: Constellation Guide
description: A handsome reference book about the constellations. The Star-Gazers issue these to senior members.

name: Common Wood Elf Insults
description: It would be better not to repeat the insults contained in this book. The inside cover claims it is of a very rare edition.

name: Erotic Green Pact Drawings
description: A collection of plant life drawings that are strangely suggestive.

name: The Wilderflowers of Elsweyr
description: An illustrated guide to the various species of wildflowers found throughout Elsweyr, hand-painted by the artist Guta-dar.

name: First Era Illuminated Manuscript
description: A gorgeous illuminated manuscript from the First Era, decorated with gold and silver leaf, containing prayers to the Divines.

name: Thulie's Five Card Wisp Master System
description: This foolproof system for beating the Five Card Wisp dealers at Hadran's Caravan is enciphered. Code book sold separately!

name: Drinks-Not Bookmark
description: Drinks-Not-Investments, the bank in Dhalmora, distributed these stylish leather bookmarks to promote business.

name: Ja'khajiit Picture Book
description: A simple picture book with ten images of mischievous kittens. Each picture is composed of a single unbroken line.

name: Courtesan's Client List
description: This small book belongs to one of Wayrest's courtesans. A blackmailer would pay well for this list of wealthy clients.

name: Veiled Heritance Codebook
description: A codebook used by the Veiled Heritance to communicate in secret.

name: Courtesan's Appointment Book
description: This little book lists the clients of a popular courtesan in Hallin's Stand, making it almost priceless to a blackmailer.

name: "Netch, Kwama, Netch" Game
description: A travel-sized version of the Dark Elf drinking game played in corner-clubs throughout Morrowind.

name: Courtesan's Notebook
description: This small book belongs to one of Mournhold's courtesans. A blackmailer would pay well for this list of wealthy clients.

name: Personal Record of Honor
description: An ongoing chronicle of a prominent Nord's personal legend, including significant successes and failures.

name: Leather-Bound Sketchbook
description: A small, tightly bound sketchbook. It is full of charming charcoal drawings of common woodland animals.

name: Magnificent Leatherbound Blank Oghma
description: Blank life-journal of gilt-edged, bleached vellum pages. The hand-tooled gargoyle leather binding is from "Remarkable Leathers."

name: Nocturnal Musings
description: Other than a boldly written title within the front cover, the pages of this journal are empty.

name: Little Black Journal
description: A book filled with the names and addresses of both men and women. There is a 1 to 5 star rating system.

name: Ayleid Alphabet Pocket Translations
description: Although it touts itself as a guide, this small pamphlet only translates Ayleid letters into the common alphabet.

name: Dog Training Pamphlet
description: Excessive barking? Running away? Chasing the cat? This pocket-sized pamphlet will help you train your problem dog!

name: Lady A's Amorous Articles
description: Romantic pamphlets secreted away for a noble's lonely nights, written by the anonymous Lady "A."

name: Llirala's Amorous Articles
description: Romantic pamphlets secreted away for a Dark Elf noble's lonely nights.

name: Pamphlet of Erotic Engravings
description: Khajiiti pamphlet showing various forms of erotic dalliance, illustrated by stylized drawings of astoundingly lithe cat-people.

name: Illustrated "Vade Mecum of Love" Brochure
description: "The Vade Mecum of Love," a wordless brochure on gilt-edged vellum illustrated with inspiring and instructive engravings.

name: Granite Wash Basin
description: The cut and polish of this stone is impeccable ... but that doesn't make it any less heavy.

name: Alabaster Scrying Basin With Bug-Parade Brim
description: Scrying basin carved from alabaster, brim carved with a line of marching caterpillars, engraved "KA" for Karthdar Artisans.

name: Fine Washbasin With Sload Soap
description: Gilt-edged redware washbasin with bar of sload soap, unused and inscribed "Dhalmora Fine Goods, Davon's Watch."

name: Porcelain Bowl
description: This porcelain bowl has a lovely irridescent color.

name: Royal Pudding Bowl
description: This is one of a dozen ebony-inlaid pudding bowls that once graced the feasting hall in Wayrest.

name: Cherrywood Morsel Bowl
description: A small, wooden bowl, usually filled with tiny nibbles and set beside the bed for late-night snacking.

name: Festival of Blades Bowl
description: This porcelain bowl depicts the events celebrated by the Festival of Blades: a Redguard fights against a race of giant Goblins.

name: Fancy Porridge Bowl
description: An extravagant and finely decorated bowl that seems almost too fancy for serving simple porridge.

name: Mosaic Glass Bowl
description: The tiny stones that make up this colorful bowl take the shape of a redwort flower.

name: Crystal Punch Bowl
description: Complete with ladle, this crystal punch bowl can hold a lot of liquid.

name: Steel Sugar Bowl
description: This elegant sugar bowl comes complete with a matching spoon.

name: Chitin Soup Bowl
description: This finely crafted, large bowl holds enough soup to be shared between three to four people.

name: Olive Stoneware Bowl
description: This dish was distributed to all the clan-wives to commemorate the marriage of Hearth-Wife Sholg to Chief Tazgol.

name: Nix Hound Food Bowl
description: A bowl crafted to hold food for a nix hound, most likely a beloved pet of a Dark Elf living in Bal Foyen.

name: Gilded Soup Bowl
description: A kingly bowl, perfect for expensive soups served at extravagant parties.

name: Herma-Mora Incense Burner
description: The Primeval Seekers offered these Daedric bowls to scholars in Evermore who helped them find Halcyon Lake.

name: Moonstone Washbowl
description: A polished basin, filled with fresh-smelling rosewater.

name: Fancy Redoran Porridge Bowl
description: This is one of a dozen silver-inlaid porridge bowls that once graced the Redoran feasting halls throughout Morrowind.

name: Porcelain Stew Bowl
description: A fine porcelain stew bowl, used to serve venison or rabbit stew.

name: Gaudy Konunleikar Serving Bowl
description: This is one of two dozen silver-plated serving bowls used at the Skald-King's banquets during the Konunleikar celebration.

name: Small Aquarium
description: This simple glass bowl would make a good home for a pet fish—or tomorrow's dinner.

name: Queen Donella Dinnerware
description: A set of plates and bowls bearing the traditional pattern of Queen Donella of the middle Second Era.

name: Casimir Porcelain Dessert Bowl
description: A bowl specifically crafted for serving and consuming the elaborate cakes and confections that King Casimir loves.

name: Giblets' Particular Food Bowl
description: An ornate bowl with the name "Giblets" stenciled on one side. Rumors claim that many such bowls are hidden around Daggerfall.

name: Set of Four Guar-Egg-Poaching Ramekins
description: Four star-shaped enameled ceramic ramekins for poaching bantam guar eggs, from the Southpoint Inn.

name: Baandari Stoneware Bowl Calendar
description: Baandari serving bowl and calendar, with two banded rim-rings where stones are placed representing Jone and Jode.

name: Fine Ceramic Wash Bowl
description: Heirloom personal wash bowl painted with scenes from "The Naming Story of Y'ffre" around the rim.

name: Bedside Fertility Censer
description: Silver bowl decorated with symbols of Mother Mara, for burning incense said to encourage conception.

name: Argonian Fruit Bowl
description: A wooden bowl crafted by and popular with Argonians, some Dark Elves have begun to use these distinctive bowls to store fruit.

name: Gobbet Bowl With Hackwing Picks
description: Coral-rimmed bowl with bird-bone fang-picks. After meals, diners pick uneaten food from their fangs and place it in the bowl.

name: Haj Mota Serving Bowl
description: This large bowl was fashioned from the shell of a baby haj mota.

name: Marble Font of the White Kagouti
description: Marble washbasin surmounted by a sculpture of the Legendary White Kagouti, rampant.

name: Scorpion Claw Bowl
description: A bowl made out of a repurposed claw—one that once belonged to a massive scorpion.

name: Gilded Terrarium
description: A glass bowl with a shining, golden rim that could serve as a home for tiny animals or insects.

name: Gold Plated Bowl
description: A bowl that looks like the noontime sun under full lighting. It's difficult to stare at until one fills it with food.

name: Orcish Stoneware
description: A set of stone bowls, made in the Orcish tradition, imported from Wrothgar.

name: Children's Wooden Bowls
description: These small glass bowls are adorned with cute little monkeys playing in the trees.

name: Pinewood Nibble Bowl
description: No prominent Nord household is complete without a set of pinewood nibble bowls—perfect for all-day snacking.

name: Kragenmoor Stew Bowls
description: A set of distinctive square-shaped bowls, used to serve stews and soups, originally made popular at the Hissing Guar Inn.

name: Hallin's Stand Spittoon
description: A grandee from Hallin's Stand had dozens of these golden spittoons made for his friends.

name: Nord Helmet Serving Bowl
description: This Nord helmet has been refashioned into a serving bowl, with the horns trimmed and shaved so the bowl sits level on a table.

name: Cloisonne Thunderbug-Head Spittoon
description: Enameled head-carapace of a thunderbug, with mandibular spout and leather anti-skid feet, labeled "Phynaster's Stride, Haven."

name: Ivory Mixing Bowl
description: A polished mixing bowl carved from a young mammoth's tusk.

name: Reliquary With Ancient Prophet's Finger
description: Holy reliquary, a small glass-covered box containing one of the fingerbones of the Prophet Ciroloth of Ancient Quendeluun.

name: Sterling Silver Croc-In-The-Box
description: The toy of a noble's child. When cranked, this box of sterling silver plays a simple melody until a stuffed crocodile pops out.

name: Mother-Of-Pearl Incense Box
description: Box of carved mother-of-pearl containing a selection of incenses: myrrh, sandalwood, and frankincense.

name: "Lay of Firsthold" Music Box
description: Clockwork music box of brass and tin that plays the "Lay of Firsthold" while tiny swan ships sail in a circle.

name: "Summer Sun" Music Box
description: Wind up this mechanical contraption and it plays "The Summer Sun Sets on Summerset."

name: "King Camoran" Music Box
description: A small wind-up device that plays the propaganda tavern song "King Camoran, It's You I'm Adorin'."

name: Box of Calligrapher's Pen Nibs
description: Ivory box containing copper pen nibs of assorted widths, labeled "Property of the Altmeri Embassy Clerks' Office."

name: Desktop Nine-Holes Game
description: Desktop nine-holes set, base made of thunderbug carapace, with finely-carved bone pieces.

name: Chitin Box With Toothpick Collection
description: Box of thunderbug chitin containing a collection of 341 toothpicks: ivory, bugshell, bone, imported wood, and even flint.

name: Box of Y'ffre's Sacred Incense
description: Meerschaum box containing twelve sticks (a year's supply) of the Verdant Incense of Y'ffre, one for each month's firstday.

name: Magnificent Grahtwood Beetle Collection
description: Glass-covered box containing a collection of over a hundred mounted beetles, arranged in prismatic order from red to violet.

name: Cache of Forbidden Fruits
description: Jade box labeled "Jathsogur Smoking Powder" containing an assortment of taboo sweets: candied plums, cherries, and apricots.

name: "Ancestors" Music Box
description: An Altmeri-styled music box that, when wound, plays a tinkly "Ancestors' Waltz."

name: Carved Bone Sand-Shaker
description: A small bone box with pierced lid for sanding finished documents, carved with images of Imga.

name: Soapstone Snuff Box
description: Enameled box carved from soapstone, containing a quantity of aromatic powdered-insect snuff.

name: Assortment of Cosmetic Horns
description: Cuir-bouilli box containing various prosthetic forehead-horns, with beetle-glue to affix them.

name: Jeweled Dice Box
description: This splendid gem-encrusted box is inscribed "Administrative Decision Makers" and contains two golden, gem-pipped dice.

name: Dancing Mammoth Music Box
description: Music box that, when wound, plays "Threnody for King Eplear" as three clockwork mammoths dance around Treehenge.

name: Concealed Alabaster Skooma Pipe
description: An imported marlwood box labeled "Spatula Set (Extra)" holds an elaborately hand-carved alabaster skooma pipe.

name: Snuffbox With Montclair Crest
description: Small rosewood box containing piquant, aromatic snuff. The box top is inlaid with the crest of House Montclair.

name: Coffin-Shaped Plume Box
description: Coffin-shaped coralwood box containing writing plumes, inscribed "Memento Mori: Othrenis."

name: Portable Tribunal Shrine
description: Diorama box that opens into a triptych for worship of the Tribunal; engraved "Personally Blessed by Disciple Sildras."

name: Elegant Pearl "Veloth's Conundrum" Puzzle
description: Exquisite traditional Dunmeri puzzle game, with an ebony board and pieces of Dwarven metal and nacreous pearl.

name: Tribal Elder's Shellback-Gammon Box
description: Wood-and-shell box, folds open to become a board for the game of shellback-gammon, with deluxe kwama-carapace tiles.

name: Morrowind Spice Box
description: A container for holding spices, crafted and sold by a friendly Dark Elf trader in the Rift's Ragged Hills.

name: Canebrake Market Bamboo Fruit Box
description: An empty bamboo box labeled "Canebrake Market," with partitions intended to hold candied pieces of fruit.

name: Twelve Moons Sweet-Box
description: This lacquered wooden box contains twelve separate partitions for different varieties of moon-sugar.

name: Coffer of Light From the Dawn Era
description: Sealed jade box, said to be lined with mirrors and containing an eternally-reflected gleam of light from the Dawn Era.

name: Ban Daar Puzzle Box
description: An intricately-fashioned box, thought by the Khajiit to bestow good fortune upon anyone who can remove the luck charm inside.

name: Royal Guard Boot Shine Kit
description: Brushes, sponges, buffers, and tins of polish in an elegant mahogany box with a footrest, bearing the symbol of the Royal Guard.

name: Silver Hoarvor Pipeworm Canister
description: Noble's silver canister in the likeness of an engorged hoarvor, and filled with the finest Strid-Bottom Pipeworm.

name: Tinderbox
description: The battered box appears mostly full. The flint, firesteel, and straw are all supplied.

name: Set of Mineral-Based Paints of Rare Colors
description: Sectioned shellmold box containing eight bottles of bright mineral-based paints in rare colors, quite valuable.

name: Master Painter's Set
description: An ornate wooden box inlaid with ivory, containing a set of oil paints, fine brushes, a painting knife and a palette.

name: Mammoth Tusk Jewelry Box
description: An intricately-carved jewelry box crafted from an enormous mammoth tusk.

name: Aldmeri Snuff Box
description: Made specially for Aldmeri officers of high-breeding, this snuff box is lined with gold and covered in Dominion motifs.

name: Iron Lizard Crate
description: An iron cage designed to hold pet lizards and train them to empty their bladder outside.

name: Delicate Brass Birdcage
description: Fanciful birdcage of brass wire, with a chain and eyelet for hanging, labeled "Sabir's General Goods" underneath.

name: Corimont Mouth-Plover Cage
description: Sturdy birdcage for a Corimont Mouth-Plover, which high-status Argonians use to clean their fangs after dining.

name: Amber Bedside Grub-Cage
description: Carved amber grub-cage with chrysoberyl stopper for containing live snack-larvae.

name: Notched Candle
description: The notches carved into the side of this candle indicate how much time has passed.

name: Scented Candle
description: When lit, the candle exudes the faintest scent of cardamom. A fence could resell it for certain necromantic rituals.

name: Malevolent Cultist Candle
description: A thick, dark candle, nestled atop a bone tray and engraved with Daedric runes. A fence will pay well to attain this.

name: Candles of Mara
description: Used to celebrate the passing of another year of marriage, these candles are a symbol of love and devotion.

name: Orcish Longevity Candle
description: No one has ever confirmed it, but this massive red candle is said to be large enough to burn for an Orc's entire lifespan.

name: Dark Elf Life Candle
description: These large, ornate candles are lit when a Dark Elf is born. As long as it burns, the Dark Elf will be blessed with a long life.

name: Nord's Night Candle
description: A traditional night candle, rumored to repel draugr. Also provides a sense of security for Nords who are afraid of the dark.

name: "Xarxes' Memory" Worship Candle
description: Leg-sized tallow candle, the kind used in the annual "Rites of Xarxes' Memory" at Southpoint Cathedral.

name: Ill-Gotten Daedric Candle
description: A thick, red candle, nestled atop a bone tray. Covered with embossed Daedric runes and symbols of bats.

name: Proscribed Daedric Candle
description: A thin, black candle, fastened onto a bone tray. Engraved with Daedric runes and symbols of dragons.

name: Dreugh Wax Crescent Candles
description: Pair of disc-shaped candles, one pink, one blue; when burned they melt away to a crescent shape.

name: Everburning Spice Candle
description: A candle enchanted to release the pleasant aroma of spices while burning "forever," according to the tiny label.

name: Lion's Mane Candelabrum
description: A weighty iron candle holder, bearing the shape of a lion's head.

name: Brass Candlestick Holder
description: Shiny and functional, these candlestick holders are extremely versatile, able to hold both candles and candle-shaped things.

name: Crystal Candlestick Holder
description: The crystal of these candlestick holders casts a brilliant pattern of light and shadow when the candles are lit.

name: Dreugh-Claw Candle Holder
description: This exquisite candle holder comes from a set that was gifted to Lord Farangel of Menevia.

name: Daedric Candlestick
description: This candlestick, decorated with dancing scamps and banekin frolicking in a Daedric circle, might be a novelty—or cult fetish.

name: Brass Candle Snuffer
description: Although a little sooty inside, this polished candle snuffer is the perfect size for putting out small desk candles.

name: Brass Candelabra
description: This candelabra stands empty, its three branches devoid of candles or any leftover wax residue.

name: Silver Crown Candelabra
description: Each of the eight candle holders in this candelabra are molded into a likeness of one of the Crowns' gods.

name: Yldunz Candleholder
description: Fashioned from a Dwemer gear and other trinkets, this decorative candleholder is a popular gift in Sentinel.

name: Silaseli Crystal Candelabra
description: An ancient candelabra retrieved from the ruins of Silaseli. Quite fashionable to Evermore nobles.

name: Haunted Wood Candlestick
description: This candlestick, decorated with dancing spriggans frolicking in the Haunted Wood, was purchased at the Tree's Bounty.

name: Sterling Silver Orc-Forged Candlestick
description: Portable silver candlestick, with finger-ring and tallow candle, etched underneath "Shakul, Barkbite Forge."

name: Golden Candle Holder
description: A family heirloom, no doubt. It is both light and well-polished.

name: Crystal Candleholder
description: These candleholders are perfect for an elegant table setting.

name: Castle Rilis Brass Candelabra
description: Antique three-armed brass candelabra, in the "Sinuous Serpent" style, recovered from the ruins of Castle Rilis.

name: King Donel Candle Tree
description: A multi-stick candle holder from the time of King Donel, noted for having three sticks instead of the five of later eras.

name: Imperial-Style Brass Candlestick
description: Brass candlestick for holding a medium-sized candle, in the Nibenese style, possibly from Fort Zantonius

name: Mudcrab Shell Powder Case
description: The women of the Alik'r desert often powder their noses before social engagements. They store their powder in mudcrab shells.

name: Precious-Color Eye Shadow Maquillage Case
description: Bright frogskin makeup case containing shiny "precious-color" eye shadow of crushed pearls and gold dust.

name: His and Hers Makeup Case
description: Hand-tooled leather makeup case containing matching maquillage tools for him and her.

name: Case of Fine Shaving Articles
description: Leather shaving kit containing a boarbristle brush and a straight razor from The Fighting Edge in Shornhelm.

name: Nix-Hound Treat Cannister
description: A decorated container that hold treats for a Dark Elf's beloved pet nix-hound.

name: Antique Sewing Kit With Adamantium Needles
description: Imported netch-leather case containing splendid antique sewing kit, with adamantium leather-needles.

name: Desktop Concentration Censer
description: Bronze desktop censer for burning sandalwood incense, said to help sharpen concentration, in a package labeled Starfall Arcana.

name: Silver Censer
description: This silver vessel is etched with maritime motifs and filled with rich Alik'ri incense.

name: Silver Boar Censer
description: A silver, boar-shaped censer used to burn animal fat in various Green Pact rituals.

name: Ebonheart Temple Priest's Thurible
description: Electrum-clad censer for wafting ancestral ash incense during ceremonies in honor of the Tribunal.

name: Fish Ephemera Counter-Censer
description: Nautilus-shaped silver incense burner, used on fishing parties by Thalmor Canonreeves to mitigate piscine odors.

name: Gold Censer
description: A censer that gleams with a polished surface. It's fit for religious use or as an expensive paperweight.

name: Bolt of Red Fabric
description: Soft to the touch, only a small square has been cut from the corner of this bright red fabric.

name: Silken Tablecloth
description: A fine silk cloth with lace trim, lovingly maintained.

name: Silk Sheets
description: These sheets have been woven from the secretions of insects who make their cocoons on the mulberry tree.

name: Fancy Royal Tablecloth
description: Most households don't usually fuss with such things, but when they use a tablecloth, one depicting favored royalty is preferred.

name: Tamriel Festival Ribbons
description: Traditional Tamrielic ribbons for participating in festivals, balls, and other formal celebrations.

name: Pristine Mummy-Wrap Handkerchiefs
description: Only the most exclusive shops sell these elegant handkerchiefs crafted from genuine mummy wrappings.

name: Unspoiled Butterfly-Wing Napkins
description: Fancy and delicate, almost every wealthy household owns a set—but it's rare to find a set that hasn't been used.

name: High Priest's Ephod Keepsake
description: A gold-embroidered cloth triangle from an ephod once worn by the High Priest of Satakalaam.

name: Swan-Satin Bathing Thong
description: Sleek and sensuous singing-swan style satin string sporting silver sequins, from Snip & Stitch, Skywatch.

name: Linen Tablecloth
description: A simple tablecloth, excellent for picnicking.

name: Bangkorai Garrison Towels
description: These thick, warm towels were taken from the baths at Bangkorai Garrison.

name: Magus-General's Tablecloth
description: This gold-embroidered tablecloth was designated for the dining table of Imperial Magus-General Septima Tharn.

name: Lady Laurent's Silk Kerchief
description: The renowned voyager employs these kerchiefs to keep her hands clean in old tombs. Stibbons has lost hundreds of them.

name: Faux Fennec Flesh Handkerchief
description: Yahiri the Tailor in Belkarth makes and sells these simulated Fennec hide kerchiefs—far less expensive than the real thing.

name: Kwama Miner Neckerchief
description: A colorful cloth, worn around the neck, it can be pulled up to protect the nose and mouth of workers in kwama mines.

name: Pristine Netch-Hide Handkerchiefs
description: Iirila Maleran of Mournhold produces these elegant handkerchiefs for the upper echelon of House Hlaalu and House Telvanni.

name: Fancy Skald-King Tablecloth
description: Nords don't usually bother with such things, but when they decide to use a tablecloth, one depicting King Jorunn is a favorite.

name: Fancy Windhelm Pommel Cozy
description: No one who's anyone walks the streets of Windhelm without a cozy to keep their weapon pommel warm and comfy.

name: Gold-Trimmed Dust Cloth
description: The Merry Maids of Daggerfall use these distinctive dust cloths when cleaning the homes of wealthy nobles in the city.

name: Lord Diel's Spidersilk Bib
description: Fancy and delicate, Lord Diel popularized the use of these expensive bibs at extravagant dinner parties in Daggerfall.

name: Royal Monogramed Towels
description: A set of royal towels from the castle in Daggerfall, monogramed with the initials of King Casimir.

name: Bolt of Iridescent Spidersilk
description: Bolt of iridescent spidersilk from the Scuttle Pit. It seems to be every color at once, or no color at all.

name: Red Sateen Vestments of Z'en
description: Red vestments of a Priest of Z'en, worn when declaring a Wood Elf Mourning War begun or ended.

name: Otter-Skin Cheese Strainer
description: This finely stitched sling has seen a lot of use in the making of rodent cheeses.

name: Treethane's Splinted Thunderbug Sash
description: Treethane's crimson sash of enameled thunderbug splints, traditionally worn for Y'ffre's Naming Day.

name: Silk Sugar Dauber
description: A square of folded silk used to daub moon-sugar onto Khajiiti tongues. Called a "hairball hankie" by ignorant foreigners.

name: Royal Monogramed Bed Sheets
description: A set of royal bed sheets from Shornhelm, monogramed with the initials of the former ruler, King Ranser.

name: Hoarfrost Downs Sash of Office
description: Only the mayor and town officials of Hoarfrost Downs can purchase and wear these stylish, pleated sashes.

name: Experimental Magma-Suit, Damaged
description: Silvery coveralls of an unknown material, partially burned through, labeled "Valdam Andoren, Davon's Watch Guildhall."

name: Cache of Dunmeri Women's Lingerie
description: Assortment of Dark Elven lingerie of plush, camlet, and sarsanet, all labeled "Klaandi's Back Room."

name: Set of Chamois Hand-Cloths
description: A set of four soft deer-chamois hand-cloths, stamped on the corners, "Riverside Inn, Nimalten."

name: Rabbit-Fur Ear Warmers
description: A set of rabbit-fur muffs designed to protect the ears from the harsh and biting cold of the Rift.

name: Jarl's Manor Monogramed Bed Sheets
description: A set of luxurious bed sheets from Riften, monogramed with the initials of one of the local jarls.

name: Embroidered Pot Holder
description: A quilted pot holder with an intricate embroidered floral pattern.

name: Spidersilk Handkerchief
description: A forest green handkerchief of fine spidersilk.

name: Dancing Day Silk Veils
description: Long veils of crimson, scarlet, and lemon yellow, for doing the sprightly Mistral Tarantella on Dancing Day.

name: Bolt of Royal Cloth-Of-Gold
description: Bolt of glimmering cloth-of-gold, with a repeating embroidered pattern of the Seal of House Rilis.

name: Silk Handkerchief
description: Thankfully, this handkerchief does not appear to have been used.

name: Faux Fox Fur Handkerchief
description: Josee Maviniele, the tailor in Windhelm, sells these simulated fox fur handkerchiefs—far less expensive than the real thing.

name: Burgundy Kerchief
description: This fashionable pocket cloth is extremely soft and dyed a rich burgundy.

name: Canonreeve's Silken Handkerchiefs
description: Pair of off-white silken handkerchiefs, trimmed with lace and embroidered with the arms of the Dawnbreak Canonreeve.

name: Ulath Ashlander Ceremonial Body Wrap
description: Long gray fungus-linen wrap-shroud, draped many times around a wise-woman's torso during Holy Meditation.

name: Raw Silk Linens
description: Rough-spun linens gathered from an Argonian caterpillar farm.

name: Unspoiled Spidersilk Napkins
description: Fancy and delicate, almost every wealthy Nord household owns a set—but, being Nords, they never use them.

name: Thalmor Authenticated Silk Sheets
description: These sheets are fit for Queen Ayrenn herself to lie on.

name: Bolt of Silk Sarsenet
description: Bolt of fine fabric, apricot-colored silk sarsenet, bound in a broad ribbon labeled "Northpoint Imports."

name: Silverweave Small Clothes
description: These silverweave small clothes appear quite comfortable. What they lack in style, they make up in volume.

name: Mournhold Ambassador's Doily
description: A doily with the Tribunal heraldry, distributed during a rare public banquet held by the Dark Elf ambassador to Riften.

name: Velvet Curtains
description: These velvet curtains are so soft.

name: Leather Laces
description: These laces are just wide enough to see the Ayleid letters burnt into them.

name: Embroidered Hand Towel
description: Embroidered with an image of the Crimson Ship, this hand towel is a reminder to those in Hammerfell of the Day of Shame.

name: Silken Dueling Towel
description: When Alik'r nobles engage in a duel, it is customary to bring a dueling towel to wipe sweat from one's brow.

name: Duke's Edition Plush Towels
description: Bits & Pieces in Aldcroft sells these luxurious bath towels featuring the Duke of Camlorn's crest woven into the design.

name: Set of Chamois Hand-Towels
description: A set of four fine deer-chamois handtowels, stamped on the corners "Trader's Rest, Velyn Harbor."

name: High King's Celebratory Token
description: A large coin engraved with the image of High King Emeric, issued to commemorate his coronation and rise to the throne.

name: Hammerdeath Arena Token
description: A token once used by the nobles of Menevia when gambling in the Hammerdeath Arena.

name: Ash'abah Friendship Coin
description: The Ash'abah give these coins out to friends and allies to whom they owe a debt.

name: Ancient Ayleid Coin
description: This was likely found near Carzog's Demise. After all these centuries, the metal still gleams in the light.

name: Ancient Yokudan Coin
description: A tarnished Yokudan coin. The profile of an ancient warrior is just barely visible on its worn surface.

name: Oversized Souvenir Coin
description: Oversized brass souvenir coin, with a jug of theilul engraved on the obverse, and "Coin Brothers Cornerclub" on the reverse.

name: Commemorative Imperial Coins
description: These coins depict the first emperors of Tamriel: from Alessia to Savirien-Chorak.

name: Old Yokudan Coin Collection
description: A scattering of ancient Yokudan coins, set and displayed as a collection.

name: Dwemer Coin Collection
description: A scattering of what appear to be ancient Dwemer coins, set and displayed as a collection.

name: Broken-Toothed Ivory Comb
description: A fancy comb of Redguard design, a few of its teeth have broken off and are missing.

name: Ivory Comb
description: An ornate comb, carved from a horker tusk.

name: Deerbone Comb
description: This simple comb is well-polished. None of the teeth are missing.

name: Ornate Tortoiseshell Comb
description: The teeth on this elegant comb are surprisingly strong.

name: Alik'r Royal Comb
description: This is one of Duchess Lakana's precious grooming implements.

name: Diamond-Tooth Cat Comb
description: This extravagant jeweled comb was one of several created for Queen Jezerei, also known as the "Strumpet Queen."

name: Werewolf Knot Rake
description: A steel comb especially designed to untangle matted knots that accumulate in a werewolf's fur.

name: Dragonbone Comb
description: This comb, seemingly made of dragonbone, is carved as a stylized dragon head with the comb's teeth coming from its maw.

name: Timber Mammoth Ivory Comb
description: A fine-toothed ivory comb carved with a relief showing King Aeradan accepting the Camoran crown.

name: Noble's Comb and Brush Set
description: Jade comb, ivory-handled hair brush, and silver-plated scissors, in a lacquered box embossed with the arms of House Dothriel.

name: Queen's Mourning Barrette
description: After the death of the king and her children, Queen Arzhela had several ebony barrettes made to wear while in mourning.

name: Dragonshrine Chalice
description: A sculpted dragon claw grasps the stem. This one of several discovered in and around Skyshroud Barrows.

name: Ancient Dwarven Chalice
description: An ornate grail thought to be used as a drinking vessel. It was recovered from the Dwemer ruins of Bthanual.

name: Clay Cup
description: This simple clay cup is in perfect condition. There are no nicks or blemishes.

name: Rajhin's Final Cups
description: This is supposedly one of the clay cups used in the fabled drinking contest between the Khajiiti trickster god and Sanguine.

name: Porcelain Teacup
description: This dainty teacup rests comfortably in the crook of one's finger.

name: Glass Cupping Set
description: Typically used by doctors, these cups are coveted by vampires as a means of collecting and transporting meals.

name: Nedic Cup
description: An ancient stone cup—still in use. Faded Nedic motifs are just barely visible on the base.

name: Chipped Imperial Tea Cup
description: An exquisite tea cup from an Imperial tea service setting, marred by a tiny chip in the porcelain.

name: Chipped Orsinium Tea Cup
description: An exquisite and surprisingly delicate tea cup from an Orsinium tea service setting, marred by a tiny chip in the porcelain.

name: War Trophy of Kyne's Admiration
description: For defeating twelve or more enemies while fighting to defend Skyrim's honor, a Nord warrior received this cup of distinction.

name: Moon-Sugar Sipping Cup
description: Imported from Senchal, this tawny-clay, spill-proof cup allows young Khajiit cubs to discover the wonders of moon-sugar tea.

name: Sentinel Sipping Cup
description: Imported from Alik'r, this cerulean-clay cup is designed to be spill-proof for the use of young children.

name: Ash Drinking Cup
description: A simple and elegant cup, carved from a single piece of heartwood.

name: Thane Fjora's Winner's Cup
description: A small trophy, awarded for winning the annual riddle contest sponsored by the Lady of Nimalten.

name: Leather Dice Cup
description: A gambling dice cup, made from carefully stitched, cured leather.

name: Overlook Inn Royal Stirrup Cup
description: Crystal-and-silver stirrup cup sporting the royal seal, traditionally presented at the Overlook Inn before a House Rilis hunt.

name: Grandee Zizeen Teacups
description: These expensive teacups were given to Crown loyalists who supported Zizzeen in his failed attempt to win the throne.

name: Nord Guessing Cups
description: A set of three identical metal cups, Nords use them to play the popular game of "Chase the Pea." Which cup is the pea under?

name: Kagouti Tusk Drinking Cups
description: A set of sturdy drinking vessels carved from genuine kagouti tusks and engraved with House Redoran symbology.

name: Argonian Sipping Cup
description: Imported from Black Marsh, this crimson-wood cup is designed to be spill-proof for the use of young children.

name: "Daily Jagga Shot" Matching Glass Set
description: Set of seven enameled mudcrab-chitin shot glasses, with gilded rims, one for each day of the week.

name: Alik'ri Glassware
description: A pair of wine glasses made from the finest desert crystal.

name: Brandy Snifter
description: A glass curved to trap the aroma of brandy. Alas, it is empty.

name: Crystal Wine Glass
description: This glass has a tiny maker's mark etched into the base.

name: Set of Crystal Dram Glasses
description: Set of six crystal shot glasses engraved with an image of the Overlook Inn.

name: Ancient Dagoth Brandy Snifter
description: A glass specifically designed to serve Ancient Dagoth Brandy in, it concentrates the bouquet and intensifies the flavor.

name: Celestite Drinking Glass
description: A finely-wrought drinking glass made from a cool blue geode.

name: Set of Syrup Dram Glasses
description: Set of seven cut-glass jigger cups, used for sipping fermented syrups, from the Vitriarch at Cat's Eye Quay.

name: Crystalline Glass
description: A glass that bears Altmeri writing in golden text across the bottom.

name: Set of Gilt-Edged Mazte Glasses
description: Set of six greenglass mazte glasses with gilded brims, from the Hissing Guar Cornerclub in Kragenmoor.

name: White Lion Tankard
description: An iron-wood cup, carved to resemble a white lion's head. A maker's mark on the base indicates it was crafted in Lower Yorgrim.

name: Fancy "I Hate Morndas" Kaveh Mug
description: Insulated mug for hot beverages, made of turtle shell inlaid with a mother-of-pearl epigram.

name: Jagga-Junga Nesting Mugs
description: Set of eight jagga mugs, each larger than the last, for the progressive drinking game Jagga-Junga; the largest is for spew.

name: Set of Tamrith Shot Glasses
description: Set of four shot glasses etched with the crest of House Tamrith.

name: Sabre Cat Drinking Cups
description: A set of sturdy drinking vessels carved from genuine sabre cat tusks and engraved with Breton symbology.

name: Wasp-Head Balero With Chiming Ball
description: Balero, or cup-and-ball, with a giant-wasp-head cup and a copper-mesh ball with a chiming silver bell inside.

name: Alik'r Spice Decanters
description: A pair of Redguard containers designed to hold rare and expensive Alik'r spices.

name: Ceremonial Decanter
description: A porcelain vessel emblazoned with the symbols of the Eight Divines.

name: Pewter Decanter
description: This pewter decanter smells faintly of spoiled milk.

name: Etched Silver Decanter
description: This is one of several extremely valuable decanters personalized for the merchant-lords of Tamriel.

name: Metal Decanter
description: The craftsmanship on this decanter is simple, but precise.

name: Fine Direnni Decanter
description: This delicate vessel dates back to the Direnni Hegemony. Some kind of ancient glamour must be keeping it intact.

name: Viridian Decanter
description: This tall decanter was used by the Viridian Sentinel to contain the sap of the forest's oldest trees.

name: Desert Glass Decanter
description: A beautifully crafted vessel. Iridescent red flecks can be seen in the glass.

name: Earthenware Decanter
description: A ceramic decanter, crafted in the stark style of the local Iron Orc tribes but sold by merchants in Belkarth and Dragonstar.

name: Engraved Silver Decanter
description: This is one of several extremely valuable decanters personalized for the merchant-lords of House Hlaalu.

name: Earthenware Mead Decanter
description: A ceramic decanter, crafted in the flamboyant style of the Eastmarch Nord clans and sold at Voljar's Meadery.

name: Rosy Lion Decanter
description: A lavish crystal decanter bearing the symbol of the Rosy Lion Inn in Daggerfall.

name: Wine Carafe
description: The smooth lines of this carafe are very aesthetically pleasing.

name: Orsinium Pink Zinfandel Decanter
description: A rare crystal decanter from Wrothgar, it shows that Orcs can create delicate and beautiful art when they want to.

name: Decanter of Preserved Grom Globs
description: Sealed cut-glass decanter containing six grom globs meffed by dreugh at Vivec's Antlers, and preserved in vinegar.

name: Narsis Crystal Greef Ewer
description: A rare crystal decanter from Narsis in Deshaan, it demonstrates the delicate and beautiful artisanship of the Dark Elves.

name: Crystal Wine Decanter
description: A stoppered wine decanter of fine crystal.

name: Charmed Crystal Decanter
description: This crystal decanter is magically charmed to heat or cool liquor to its optimum drinking temperature, based on its type.

name: Amberware Peacock Pitcher
description: Delicate ceramic pitcher in the shape of a peacock, from Culinary Imports in Skywatch.

name: Morhwa's Milk Pitcher
description: A fine ceramic milk pitcher with a painting of the four-armed teat god.

name: Stamped Silver Pitcher
description: An exquisite pitcher that bears the mark of Betony's late master smith, Hervic Fambure.

name: Halcyon Water Pitcher
description: This crystal pitcher was made by the Nereid of Halcyon Lake. Sapphires on the pitcher's handle make it extremely valuable.

name: Ash-Slake Ale Pitcher
description: A decorative glass pitcher, used to hold and dispense ash-slake ale and other tasty Dark Elf beverages.

name: Scorpion Shell Pig-Milk Pitcher
description: A decorative pitcher made from a scorpion's shell, used to store and dispense milk produced by Wood Elf hogs.

name: Porcelain Milk Pitcher
description: A decorative porcelain pitcher, used to store and dispense milk produced by High Rock dairy cows.

name: Mudcrab-Chitin Rotmeth Pitcher
description: Chitin rotmeth pitcher, with spout-strainer to keep in the chunks, etched "Phynaster's Stride, Haven."

name: Fine Ceramic Leviathan Pitcher
description: Enameled pitcher in the shape of the legendary leviathan Ithguleoir, said to haunt the seas beyond Northpoint.

name: Fancy Mazte Pitcher
description: A fancy pewter pitcher designed to hold a favorite Dark Elf beverage, such as mazte or sujamma.

name: Fine Crystal Pitcher
description: Light striking this crystalline pitcher breaks into myriad directions and a spectrum of colors.

name: Tusk-Carved Mammoth
description: A stylized mammoth, carved from a single shard of mammoth tusk, it is obviously someone's prized possession.

name: Maormer Sea Captain's Ship Model
description: Model of a Maormeri fast frigate fashioned from mother-of-pearl and other precious and exotic oceanic materials.

name: Quicksilver Anchor
description: This exquisite little anchor was designed to be ornamental. It features a depiction of Tava wrapped around the shank.

name: "Stay Moist!" Brief-Axiom Wall Mosaic
description: Flexible "Brief-Axiom" mosaic of colored stones embedded in crocodile hide, with turquoise chips spelling out "Stay Moist!"

name: Conjectural Diorama of Silyanorn
description: Scale model in precious woods of the Barsaebic Ayleid city of Silyanorn, the predecessor of modern-day Stormhold.

name: Emblazoned Arrowheads
description: Forge-Wife Glesh created a series of these decorative arrowheads to commemorate the birth of Chief Tazgol's daughter, Lokra.

name: Personalized Wooden Disc
description: A Dark Elf name, carved into a decorative wooden disc. It's positioned so the owner never forgets what he or she is called.

name: "Field Guide To Lava" Pumice Cube
description: Light stone cube, painted on all six sides, depicting the six most common kinds of lava in Stonefalls.

name: Mudcrab Claw Memorial
description: A serrated mudcrab claw, mounted to a decorative board beneath the inscription, "It Got My Toe, I Got Its Claw."

name: Mournhold Folding Altar
description: A simple portable altar. Unfolding it reveals a scene of the Lord, the Mother, and the Wizard in all their glory.

name: Guar Sun Catcher
description: Colorful pieces of transparent glass have been carefully shaped into a small guar.

name: Frozen Man Folding Fan
description: A decorative hand fan. Unfolding it reveals a scene depicting the legend of the Frozen Man who supposedly haunts Orkey's Hollow.

name: Framed Butterfly Display
description: A framed display of various butterflies, indigenous to the moors and meadows of Rivenspire.

name: Lighthouse Centrepiece
description: A scale replica of the Koeglin Lighthouse, cast in polished bronze.

name: Matching Doomcrag Bookends
description: These bookends, modeled after the nightmarish peak, so frightened customers that few sets survived the town square bonfires.

name: Glass Owl Curio
description: This clear glass owl is small, but fine detail shows each feather and talon.

name: Gold-Plated Honeycomb
description: Gold-plated sculptural honeycomb placed in the mouth of roast suckling wild boar during the Rain's Hand Revels.

name: Hist Bookends
description: A pair of masterfully carved bookends that resemble a tangle of Hist roots.

name: Elaborate Model Swan Ship
description: Model, in wood, fabric, and twine, of a Firsthold swan ship, detailed down to the tiny ballistas on the poop.

name: Aldmeri Ship Model
description: A perfect scale model of one of the ships of the Aldmeri fleet.

name: Sea Glass Frippery
description: A chunk of colored sea glass carved into the shape of a mudcrab and mounted to a small block for display.

name: Ebony Treehenge Bookends
description: A pair of heavy ebony bookends, each cast in the shape of the Green Lady Treestone from Treehenge.

name: Miniature Shornhelm Building
description: Count Tamrith popularized the collecting of models fashioned after actual structures in Shornhelm among Rivenspire's elite.

name: Driftwood Flummery
description: A chunk of driftwood carved into the shape of a sweetroll and mounted to a small block for display.

name: Miniature Tavern
description: Some wealthy citizens collect models fashioned after actual taverns and inns found throughout Tamriel.

name: First Era Replica Tea Service
description: A tea service modeled after one from the First Era, obviously a family heirloom.

name: First Era Rivenspire Tea Service
description: An antique tea service from the First Era, obviously a Breton family heirloom.

name: First Era Riften Warm Milk Service
description: An antique service from the First Era for preparing and serving warm milk, obviously a Nord family heirloom.

name: Ruby-Encrusted Tea Set
description: An ancient tea set bearing a representation of the Imperial ruby on every piece.

name: Hist Tree Crystal Orb
description: Crystal orb containing a tiny sculpture of the Percolating Mire Hist Tree; when inverted, small white flakes shower down.

name: Matching Troll Bookends
description: These bookends, modeled after the nightmarish creatures known as trolls, so frightened customers that few sets still exist.

name: Tabletop Coin Well
description: This small, silver ornamental tub is designed to sit on a dining table where coins can be dropped in for good luck.

name: Red Brittle Wamasu
description: A stylized wamasu, carved from a fragile chunk of red brittle, also known as nirncrux.

name: Replica Chid-Moska Xanmeer
description: Small replica of a xanmeer carved in soapstone, engraved "Chid-Moska" underneath, with an "X" crudely carved at the apex.

name: Colorful Pottery
description: This colorfully painted pottery depicts the fall of the Reman Empire.

name: Baandari Pottery
description: Colorful, painted pottery in the Baandari style.

name: Iron Citrus Juicer
description: This sturdy iron juicer still has a faint lemon scent about it.

name: Copper Spice Grinder
description: The teeth of this copper spice grinder are still sharp while a soft squeaking emanates from the turn handle.

name: Hand-Crank Butter Churn
description: Just add cream to this small wooden butter churn and turn the crank for a delicious buttery spread.

name: Fahara'jad's Nostril Spacers
description: Snoring runs in Fahara'jad's family, so he had hundreds of these ebony nostril spacers made to use at night.

name: Ayleid Carving
description: This carving is not authentic, but it looks close enough to the real thing to be valuable nonetheless.

name: Finds' Whiskey Distiller
description: A device for making potent almost-a-poison whiskey in the comfort of your own home, it has Finds-Fine-Drinks' stamp of approval.

name: Dhalmora Scorpion Trap
description: A Dhalmora Argonian invention, this contraption is placed near your sleeping area to attract and capture unwanted scorpions.

name: Skeever Trap
description: A trap designed to catch unwanted skeevers. A large chunk of cheese sits patiently in the center of the contraption.

name: Fig Slicer
description: An unnecessarily complicated contraption. Almost certainly a wedding gift.

name: Crispy Frog Fryer
description: A common outdoor cooking device, perfect for preparing one of the prime food sources available in Craglorn's wilderness.

name: Netch-Hide Quill Holder
description: A stylish desk accessory that holds up to a dozen quills, crafted from genuine netch hide.

name: Commemorative Nail Clipper
description: House Redoran nobles received this gift at the celebration on 3rd Last Seed honoring the founding of the house.

name: Crispy Rabbit Fryer
description: A specialized cooking device, perfect for preparing one of the prime food sources available in the Eastmarch wilderness.

name: Voljar's Corkscrew With Inlaid Handle
description: This limited-edition corkscrew celebrates the famous meadery's one-hundredth anniversary.

name: You-Know-What Distiller
description: A distilling device for making potent You-Know-What whiskey (a favorite among the Wood Elves) in the comfort of your own home.

name: Alik'r Spice Grinder
description: Imported from Alik'r, this spice grinder can be set to produce the exact level of coarseness your recipe demands.

name: Breton Cheese Grater
description: A device for grating hard cheeses, crafted in a style made popular by the elite of Daggerfall.

name: Original Aldcroft Meat Grinder
description: An antique meat grinder, crafted in Aldcroft, is exceptionally large, with a wide auger and a polished wood handle.

name: Dagger Whiskey Distiller
description: A distilling device for making tasty and potent Dagger whiskey (a favorite among the Covenant) in the comfort of your own home.

name: Imported Steel Desktop Book Stand
description: Steel desktop stand for holding a book open for reading, inscribed "Imported by Orabess, Cormount."

name: Intricate Spring Trap
description: This incredibly complex mouse-trap is of Khajiiti design, but features a great many Dwemer parts.

name: Cricket Cage
description: A small weasel-bone cage, lovingly crafted and occupied by a single cricket. It remains eerily quiet.

name: High Priest's Portable Auri-El Altar
description: Elaborate tin folding altar to Auri-El, gilded and bejeweled, with a relief of Auri-El's Bow that emits a golden glow.

name: Dominion Eagle-Head Peatfire Andiron
description: Shovel-ended wrought iron peatfire andiron, with gilt Dominion eagle-headed handled, inscribed "Altmer Embassy."

name: Pearl-Oyster Eternal Waterfall Sculpture
description: Copper-tube eternal waterfall sculpture, with pearl-inset oyster basins and Dwemer everpump, from Greenwarden Forge.

name: Dwarven Puzzle Box
description: Imported puzzle box of Dwarven metal, in a pouch made from the most exquisite mouse fur.

name: Mystic Moons Torchbug Lanthorn
description: Filigreed mesh torchbug cage with attached juice-dripper vial and embossed tag labeled "Mystic Moons Imports—Vulkwasten."

name: Drublog Peat Hibachi
description: Iron hibachi forged in Dra'bul for trade with the Bosmer, with bowl designed to contain burning peat bricks.

name: Murkmire Spice Grinder
description: A wooden device for grinding spices, this one was made by Argonian crafters and imported from Black Marsh.

name: Heirloom Ebony Ash Yam Slow Cooker
description: Antique pre-Four Score War ebony double-bottomed ash yam slow cooker, in the Old Ebonheart style.

name: Small Copper Theilul Still
description: Compact copper apparatus for distilling moon-sugar cane into theilul, the dark Argonian rum.

name: Alchemist's Scale
description: A device for measuring the weight and volume of alchemical components, as used in Scent of Serenity in Riften.

name: Flat Brass Rotating Lunolabe
description: Device with rotating brass rings for figuring the phases of the moons on any day of the year.

name: Live-Catch Rodent Trap
description: Portable wooden trap for live-catching rodents, made at the Old Sawdust Mill.

name: High Priest's Orison Orrery
description: Jeweled rotating and counter-rotating orrery, used by Altmeri high priests to determine which Aedric planet to worship.

name: Clockwork Brass Alarm Rooster
description: Clockwork brass rooster that crows thrice at dawn, with three volume settings, from Swan's Grace Enchantments.

name: Artificer's Hand Drill
description: A miniature, hand-cranked mechanical drill used for extremely intricate work on clockwork mechanisms.

name: Perpetual Motion Gyroscope
description: This remarkable toy will spin forever, with no apparent source of power. It bears the mark of Telenger the Artificer.

name: Ebony Wood Musical Calliope
description: A hand-cranked musical calliope of exquisite craftsmanship. Its construction is of a rare ebony wood.

name: Alchemical Igniter
description: This gold-plated device, designed to ignite a smoking pipe, was crafted by the great Telenger, and bears his mark.

name: Ooze-Blender With Spiral Spinner
description: Fine ceramic ooze-blender jar with central rotating spiral spinner, engraved "Sundry Swills, Alten Corimont" on the bottom.

name: Ivory Egg Peeler
description: This bizarre device peels eggs of every size and shape with the greatest of ease.

name: Depleted Enchanting Crystal
description: Enchanting crystal, dull and depleted, mounted on a wrought-iron gem stand engraved "Stoneglow Enchantments."

name: Sotha Sil's Blessed Cogwheel
description: A tiny cog, supposedly blessed by Sotha Sil. Every hour, on the hour, it pulses with a soft yellow light.

name: Dwarven Cog Wrapped in A Note
description: The note reads, "See? I told you! There's Dwarf stuff for the taking in the Armature! —Zendrinn"

name: Small Compass
description: This pocket-sized compass fits in the palm of its user's hand and consistently points north.

name: Consistently Imprecise Compass
description: This compass reliably points east-northeast. Carried by Khajiiti travelers who want future pickpockets to get lost.

name: Gold-Filigreed Compass
description: This compass fits neatly into a pocket or pouch, and gleams like a guiding star.

name: Noble's Fancy Compass
description: The previous owner of this ornate compass took good care of it, as evidenced by its glossy surface and glistening display.

name: Ayleid White-Gold Compass
description: An antique compass of silver and gold that always points towards the White-Gold Tower in Cyrodiil.

name: Treethane's Ebony Baton of Office
description: Treethane's symbol of office, a ceremonial ebony baton with a gold finial anchoring the Seven Gold Chains of Responsibility.

name: Inscrutable Dwarven Device With Blinking Gem
description: Dwemer device, purpose unknown, with seven pistons and a blinking red gem, from the Inner Sea Armature.

name: Imperial Sceptre
description: A rod made of solid gold and adorned with silver etches and jewels. It probably belonged to royalty.

name: Scale Model Dominion Catapult
description: A small working model of a siege catapult. Miniature meatbags sold separately!

name: Dowsing Femur
description: This expertly carved divining rod is a popular tool for luckless hunters.

name: Miniature Abacus
description: A small wooden counting frame, used to make simple mathematical calculations.

name: Simple Abacus
description: This wooden abacus features white and black beads. Merchants who have difficulty tallying might find this tool useful.

name: Kothringi Abacus From Zuuk
description: Portable Kothringi abacus employing varnished sphere-scarabs as slide-beads. The four bottom central beads are marked Z-U-U-K.

name: Pomegranate Distiller
description: An implement used to ferment pomegranate juice and distill it into Alik'r's most popular variety of wine.

name: Crystal Flin Distiller
description: A crystal distilling device for making tasty and potent flin whiskey in the comfort of your own home.

name: Large Rotmeth Fermentation Alembic
description: Sizeable double-glass alembic for fermenting meat juices to make rotmeth; etched "Made by Enthoras, Master Alchemist."

name: Blessed Astrolabe
description: After its blessing by a priest of Tava, it is bad luck for this silver astrolabe to be touched by any but royal naval officers.

name: Gold Astrolabe
description: This instrument is worth its weight in gold to the merchants of Tamriel. Also of use to astronomers or mages.

name: Miniature Bronze Mead Cask
description: A limited-edition bronze cask, once filled with Voljar's Special Recipe. Produced for the meadery's two-hundredth anniversary.

name: Brass Windup Clockwork Frog
description: Windup clockwork amphibian that croaks and shoots out its tongue at the sound of a certain tone.

name: Kwama Mine Lantern Cover
description: A cover that fits over a kwama mine lantern, it focuses and directs the light or completely blocks, depending on your needs.

name: Scamp-Head Camp Alarm
description: Enchanted scamp head mounted on a staff that squawks whenever a creature approaches the outskirts of a camp.

name: Sea Drake Sextant
description: This finely tuned sextant bears the mark of the Sea Drakes and was likely owned by one of Captain Helane's midshipmen.

name: Brass Ship's Sextant
description: A finely made nautical sextant of polished brass.

name: Dwemer Bauble
description: A small spherical device of Dwemer origin that whirs and hisses. Its intended use is a mystery.

name: Windup Flying Nightingale
description: Delicate clockwork nightingale that, when wound up, can fly across the room, singing; labeled "Galarniel, Firsthold Artisan."

name: Wisp Light Globe
description: A small glass globe containing a tiny captured wisp, intended to be used as a nightlight.

name: Kerbol's Hollow Mouthguard
description: This small wooden device resembles a horse bit, but actually helps prevent teeth-grinding at night.

name: Over-Sized Tavern Dice
description: A pair of over-sized dice from a tavern somewhere in Tamriel.

name: Set of Brass Dice
description: These dice are quite heavy. The gleaming brass offsets the dots carved on each side.

name: Hadoon's Fateful Dice
description: A set of loaded ebony dice that always roll 1.

name: Bone Dice
description: A set of dice made from bones and fashioned in a tradition that honors the Yokudan god of souls.

name: Commemorative Skywatch Festival Dice
description: A pair of brass dice, whose poor construction tends to favor one side. Gamblers would pay a fair price for these.

name: Crossroads Tavern Dice
description: A pair of dice from the Crossroads Tavern in Belkarth.

name: Sotha Sil Erudition Dice
description: Oddly sided dice. Of a design attributed to Sotha Sil for educational purposes, but mostly used in games of chance.

name: Cold-Moon Inn Dice
description: A pair of loaded dice from the Cold-Moon Inn in Windhelm.

name: Y'ffre's Bones Prayer Dice
description: Odd dice designed to aid in prayers to Y'ffre, though few besides Wood Elves know how to interpret them.

name: Rosy Lion Tavern Dice
description: A pair of marble dice from the Rosy Lion Inn in Daggerfall.

name: Forebears Prayer Dice
description: Odd dice designed to aid in prayers to the Eight of the Forebears, but mostly used in games of chance in Glenumbra.

name: Baandari Trick Dice
description: A pair of Baandari dice. They seem unevenly weighted to favor one side.

name: Suede Pouch With Fine Bone Dice
description: Six dice carved from Wood Elf knuckles in a variety of polyhedral shapes, in a pouch of violet suede with a golden drawstring.

name: Watch House Tavern Dice
description: A pair of dice from the Watch House Tavern in Davon's Watch.

name: Bag of Imitation Finger-Bone Dice
description: Waxed Hissmir bloat-sac containing 16 "Dunmeri finger-bone" betting-dice—probably imitation. (Probably.)

name: Draugr Dice
description: A set of dice carved from mammoth tusk ivory, used for the popular game "Draugr, Draugr, Lich."

name: Croc-Tooth Dice and Dice Cup
description: Hardwood dice cup containing a set of dice made from crocodile teeth, from Fishcatcher's Inn.

name: Creepy Monkey Puppet
description: This hideous grimacing puppet is likely used to scold misbehaving children. The brass castanets could be resold.

name: Smuggler's Doll
description: This ratty, stained bear doll has a hidden pocket that smells faintly of skooma.

name: Child's Ambiguous Doll
description: It isn't clear if this tiny burlap monstrosity represents a frost troll or Clivia Tharn. Its steel button eyes could be resold.

name: Ivory Doll
description: A doll dressed in a handmade floral dress, with yarn for hair.

name: Wooden Marionette
description: The marionette wears a blank expression. Its maker's symbol is burned into the bottom of its left foot.

name: Dremora Ragamuffin Doll
description: It seems someone thought this scary, raggedy doll would be popular with children.

name: Wicker Effigy
description: A traditional wicker statue, used as a stand-in for the owner in dark rituals no longer sanctioned by most religions.

name: Battlereeve Urcelmo Doll
description: This surprisingly accurate wooden doll faithfully captures Battlereeve Urcelmo's likeness.

name: Breton Flogging Doll
description: A traditional Orcish children's doll. This one strongly resembles Peverel Stemuseph and appears well-worn.

name: Sap-Speaker Moppet Doll
description: A doll modeled after an Argonian Sap-Speaker, albeit with a large head and smaller body, rarely seen this far from Murkmire.

name: Captain Rana Jinx Doll
