description: A stuffed doll made of rags, crudely modeled to represent Captain Rana. Multiple needles skewer its head and torso.

name: Queen Arzhela Doll
description: Ever a favorite of the people, this doll likeness of Queen Arzhela is very popular among young girls in Northern Bangkorai.

name: Iron Orc Ragamuffin Doll
description: Someone in Dragonstar thought this creepy, poorly-stitched doll would be adored by children. They were quite wrong.

name: Nix-Guar Thing
description: Why anyone would attach the head of a nix to the body of a guar is anyone's guess, but somebody will probably pay gold for it.

name: Skald-King Moppet Doll
description: A silk doll fashioned after Jorunn the Skald-King, albeit with an enlarged head and disproportionately smaller body.

name: Thane Icehammer Doll
description: Only the children of opulence own a Thane Icehammer doll—complete with oozing side wound and extra-sharp battle-axe!

name: Wilderking Doll
description: Myth or reality? This child's doll depicts the legendary Wilderking as an enormous Elf with antlers.

name: Y'ffre Camp Guardian
description: Wood Elves construct these tiny effigies of sticks and twigs, bless them to Y'ffre, and place them to protect their camps.

name: Savage Werewolf Marionette
description: A string-operated puppet in the shape of a savage werewolf, now considered somewhat in bad taste due to events in Camlorn.

name: Magnus Cult Wicker Effigy
description: A traditional statue made of wicker, used as a stand-in for the owner in certain rituals performed by followers of Magnus.

name: Spinner's Ivory Silvenar Puppet
description: A painted ivory marionette in the image of the Silvenar, with jointed limbs for simulated bowing and blessing.

name: Sailor's "Dancing Maiden" Statuette
description: Jadeite statuette of a lissome dancer that gyrates when spun like a top, inscribed "Fuller's Break Ale" around the base.

name: Dancing Duo Silvenar Bone Marionette
description: Marionette of monkey bones dressed in the traditional cloth-of-silver robes of the Silvenar, used in the Memorial Duo Dance.

name: Dancing Duo Green Lady Bone Marionette
description: Marionette of monkey bones dressed in the traditional iridescent green garb of the Green Lady, used in the Memorial Duo Dance.

name: Baby Ape Dress-Up Doll, With Clothing
description: Mummified baby ape with painted-on Elven features and a varied wardrobe of rich and exotic doll garments.

name: King Kurog Doll
description: A doll modeled after the Orc King Kurog. The ferocious and monstrous look indicates it was probably crafted by a Breton.

name: Xeech'ki Doll
description: A small "seed doll" carved by a talented Wasseek'haleel artisan.

name: Skald-King Jinx Doll
description: A stuffed doll made of rags, crudely modeled to represent Jorunn the Skald-King. Multiple needles skewer its head and torso.

name: The Brief Queen Porcelain Doll
description: Only a handful of these haunting figurines were crafted and sold before the Skald-King took offense and outlawed the dolls.

name: Handmade Green Lady Doll
description: A handmade child's doll with intricate embroidery and beading, fashioned to look like the Green Lady.

name: Nightmare Nuzzle
description: A rag doll in the shape of a stylized ghost, Wood Elves take the nuzzle to bed when they want to experience bad dreams.

name: Stuffed Pony Guar
description: Is it a lifelike doll or an actual stuffed pony guar? And does it really matter anyway?

name: Stuffed Bantam Guar
description: A lifelike bantam guar doll intended for Dark Elf children. Either that, or an actual stuffed bantam guar.

name: Plush Hagraven Doll
description: This doll is in near-perfect condition because children found it difficult to love.

name: Warhorse Porcelain Doll
description: A delicate and beautiful representation of a warhorse, displaying the creature's majesty and grace.

name: Brave Little Scrib Doll
description: A doll modeled after the beloved baby kwama hero of Dark Elf children's stories, the Brave Little Scrib.

name: Stuffed Monkey
description: A lifelike doll intended for Wood Elf children. This is definitely an actual stuffed monkey.

name: Dancing Spriggan Thumb Puppet
description: Ingenious spriggan puppet carved from articulated bone by Menthorn of Haven; pressure on the base makes the puppet "dance."

name: Stuffed Rabbit
description: This lifelike doll intended for Breton children couldn't be an actual stuffed rabbit. Could it?

name: Kinlord Rilis Nesting Dolls
description: Thirteen nesting dolls of painted bamboo, representing Kinlord Rilis the First through Thirteenth.

name: Frost Troll Ragamuffin Doll
description: Someone in Windhelm thought these scary, raggedy dolls would be popular with children.

name: Ansei's Meditation Stone
description: These massive egg-shaped crystals were used  by the Ansei centuries ago and were passed down to their descendants.

name: Fanisea Kwama Egg
description: A kwama egg of porcelain and gem stones, crafted by the artist Fanisea. Not one of her fancy works, but beautiful all the same.

name: Farziseh's Harpy Egg
description: A harpy egg of porcelain and gem stones, crafted by the artist Farziseh. Not one of her fancy works, but beautiful all the same.

name: Ivory Three-Hole Spine Sharpener
description: Hollow ivory paperweight with three tapered sharpening-holes of different diameters.

name: Ornamental Box of Family Egg-Shards
description: Thornwood box with mother-of-pearl inlay containing a selection of family egg-shards going back several generations.

name: Kwama Egg Armillary Sphere
description: Armillary sphere showing the orbits of the Aurbis' celestial objects, etched on an Onkobra Mines kwama egg.

name: Jeweled Lensatic Egg-Sculpture
description: Strange heartwood sculpture of a lens-shaped egg inlaid with veins of copper and stones of orange chalcedony.

name: Lamia Singing Stone
description: A small, egg-shaped stone that is smooth to the touch. A faint glow hints at some magical potency locked within.

name: Golden Spikeball
description: This solid-gold decorative spikeball is awarded annually to the most valuable spikeball player at Hadran's Caravan.

name: Packet of Envelopes
description: Untarnished envelopes perfect for keeping prying eyes at bay when secured with sealing wax.

name: Official Lion Guard Envelopes
description: Envelopes bearing the official seal of the Lion Guard, suitable for sending important correspondence.

name: Cargo Manifest For Shad Astula
description: Though the academy only caters to the Pact, they purchase from the lowest bidder. Rival schools would pay highly for this.

name: Edrald's Extravagant Party Allurement
description: Nobles throughout Rivenspire often save the lavish invitations to the annual costume party held at Edrald Estate.

name: Invitation: Drinks With the Jarls
description: An invitation to attend a casual gathering with the jarls of the Rift. It appears drinks will be consumed in large quantities.

name: Invitation To the Thane's Feast
description: An embossed and elegant invitation to the Thane's exclusive annual Riften dinner festival.

name: Royal Masquerade Invitation
description: A gold-filigreed invitation to the Grand Masquerade of Alinor, a High Elven event that only takes place every 150 years.

name: Bjoulsae Racing Oar
description: Racing rowboats up and down the Bjoulsae River has been a popular pastime for centuries. This oar was made for this purpose.

name: Galatite Manacles
description: A sturdy pair of High Elf manacles. The key appears to be missing.

name: Prismatic Quill Pen
description: A well-maintained quill, plucked from a particularly colorful cardinal.

name: Plumed Quill
description: A quill made from a colorful feather. It's hardly been used.

name: Silver-Wrapped Quill
description: King Emeric gifted several of these writing impliments to the monks at Pariah Abbey.

name: Rare Owl-Feather Quill
description: Quill crafted from the feathers of the rare burrowing pixie owl of western Tamriel.

name: Kozanset Feather Quill
description: This long feather quill appears to have been plucked from an adolescent harpy.

name: Hoonding's Golden Quill
description: This quill pen is wrapped in gold and inscribed with a Frandar Hunding quote: "The pen is like the sword, but weaker."

name: Eagle Feather Quill
description: This fine feather would be of great value to collectors.

name: Albatross Feather Pen
description: A popular writing implement, especially among Redguard sailors.

name: Crow Feather Quill
description: This quill is made from the large feather of a crow.

name: Grand Fellrunner Quill
description: A lavish writing tool, barely used.

name: Guzzard-Feather Quill
description: A common writing instrument, crafted from the feather of a Craglorn guzzard.

name: Clerk's Gull-Feather Quill
description: A common but well-made quill, crafted using a seagull feather, can be found atop desks throughout Eastmarch.

name: Cardinal-Feather Quill
description: A common writing instrument, crafted from the feather of an Eastmarch cardinal.

name: Thane's Owl-Feather Quill
description: Quills crafted from the feathers of snow-owls are for the exclusive use of the Thanes of Skyrim.

name: Exquisite Harpy Feather Quill
description: Lord Diel of Daggerfall gifts a limited number of these rare writing instruments every year to colleagues and associates.

name: Auri-El Priestess Worship Wings
description: Wide shoulder-mounted worship wings constructed from the many-colored flight feathers of thousands of jungle birds.

name: Peacock Plume Writing Quill
description: This exquisite writing quill has a gold-chased adamantine nib that never blots or needs sharpening.

name: Harpy Feather-Duster
description: Horn-handled furniture duster of feathers said to come from the harpies of Silverhoof Vale.

name: House Dorell Golden Quill
description: A gold-plated writing instrument bearing the crest of House Dorell of Northpoint.

name: Crow Mother Cursed Quill Pen
description: Writing plume from Crow's Wood that will write only curses, blasphemies, and vile oaths.

name: Bird-Of-Paradise Writing Quill
description: Elaborately-plumed quill with silver nib and tooled-hide hip-belt quill-holster.

name: Thick Quill Pen
description: This quill was drawn from the corpse of a mighty Hack-Wing.

name: Keeper's Everfount Inkplume
description: Writing plume of endless ink used by Hatching Pool Keepers to keep records of eggs and their hatchlings.

name: Thane's Falcon Feather Quill
description: A writing instrument made from the majestic feather of a falcon, most often used by the thanes and jarls of the Rift.

name: Falcon Feather Stylus
description: A writing stylus made from the sharpened plume of a falcon feather.

name: Imported Feather Dangle Stick
description: Inlaid wood dangle stick with a rare Craglorn fellrunner feather on the end of its string.

name: Ivory Quill
description: The shaft of this quill has been encased in ivory mammoth tusk, the colorful plumage sticking out of the top.

name: Kozanset Ornate Feather Quill
description: This long feather quill appears to have been plucked from a mature harpy.

name: Ceramic Dibella Figurine
description: Fingerprints cover this well-worn but masterfully crafted statue.

name: Azurite Figurine
description: This valuable figurine was among several made by the monks at Pariah Abbey to honor Azura.

name: Dragon Paperweight
description: A small, heavy dragon of shaped glass, used to keep papers and other documents from scattering in a strong breeze.

name: Ayleid House Idol
description: An antique-looking statue, about the size of a wine glass, modeled after idols discovered within Ayleid ruins.

name: Trunk Guardian
description: A tiny trunk guardian statue, guaranteed to protect your stored goods from fire, mold, and greedy thieves.

name: Makela Leki Figurine
description: This small, silver figurine was made by students of the school at Leki's Blade.

name: Moonstone Cabinet Guardian
description: A small warrior figurine made of moonstone and placed by superstitious homeowners inside their cabinets to ward off thieves.

name: Golden Monkey Statuette
description: Legend says hundreds of baby monkeys were turned to gold in Bergama by an evil Orc sorcerer. This may be one of them.

name: Statuette of Trinimac
description: Statuette of Trinimac the Warrior carved from rose quartz, from the abandoned temple vaults of Bewan.

name: "Imperial" Lawn Statue
description: Small painted statue of a Cyrodilic knight standing with one arm outstretched, holding a ring to tie to a mount's reins.

name: Queen's Eye Toy Figures
description: A complete set of figurines for children to act out the adventures of the Queen's Eye.

name: Mauloch Centrepiece
description: A heavy wrought-iron statue depicting Mauloch in battle. The Seamount Clan must have very sturdy tables.

name: Argonian Seed Toys
description: These tiny figurines of animals and Argonians carved from gorapple seeds fit within a simple leather pouch.

name: Ancient Yokudan Relic
description: All that remains of this once proud statue is the head. Its stone face, eroded by time, still bears a scowl.

name: Saint Pelin Figurine
description: This porcelain model depicts the humble beadle kneeling in prayer to Julianos.

name: Abstract Silver Centerpiece
description: The sculptor may have begun molding this centerpiece with a specific likeness in mind, but he must have later abandoned it.

name: Eamond and Arzhela Spice Shakers
description: These rare porcelain spice shakers are painted to look like the king and queen. They were given out at the couple's wedding.

name: Nedic Snake Fetish
description: This aged figurine depicts a coiled snake in the Nedic style. It is in remarkably good condition.

name: Strange Nereid Centerpiece
description: An expertly crafted pewter centerpiece depicting the legendary Nereid, Shada. Something about the eyes is profoundly unsettling.

name: Celestial Spice Shakers
description: Spice shakers depicting the Warrior, Thief, and Serpent, crafted before the true extent of the Celestial situation was known.

name: Nord Trunk Guardian
description: A Skyrim tradition comes to Morrowind in the form of this tiny trunk guardian statue, guaranteed to protect your stored goods.

name: Nord House God
description: An antique-looking statue, about the size of a wine glass. It depicts one of the "testing gods" the Nords try to keep appeased.

name: High Elf Lineage Toys
description: Tiny, wood-carved High Elf aristocratic figures that fit within a silk pouch and help teach the complexities of heritage theory.

name: Sea Glass Knickknack
description: A chunk of colored sea glass carved into the shape of a lion and mounted to a small block for display, just because.

name: Orc Trunk Guardian
description: A Wrothgar tradition, this tiny trunk guardian statue is guaranteed to protect your stored goods.

name: Wyrd Sister Door Stops
description: Carved from the wood of dead trees by the Wyresses of Daenia, they resemble friendly spriggans happy to guard your home.

name: High King Emeric Porcelain Doll
description: Only a handful of these unflattering figurines were crafted and sold before the High King took offense and outlawed the dolls.

name: Ivory Hircine Totem
description: A small white figurine, carved to resemble Hircine, flanked by a stylized wolf.

name: Green Lady Fertility Fetish
description: An exaggerated jade statuette from the Green Lady Shrine in Deepwoods.

name: Champion of Silvenar Figurine With Gold Spontoon
description: Late-First-Era ceramic figurine of a Champion of Silvenar, gilded and bearing a solid-gold spontoon.

name: Rajhin Desk Idol
description: A hand-carved idol of the trickster god. Said to ward away thieves when its belly is regularly rubbed.

name: Rajhin's Shadow Pocket Idol
description: A small figurine carved to depict one of Rajhin's shadows. When carried, the owner is said to be safe from pickpockets.

name: House Tamrith Winner's Cup
description: A small trophy, awarded for winning the annual riddle contest sponsored by House Tamrith.

name: Noble House Triangle Chess Set
description: Three-sided board for Triangle Chess, with pieces representing Houses Montclair, Tamrith, and Dorell.

name: Bard Hjalif Snow-Song Porcelain Doll
description: When High King Emeric took offense and outlawed dolls with his likeness, an enterprising merchant in Northpoint made a change.

name: Hlaalu Ancestral Ash Statuette
description: Traditional closed-fist statuette of a House Hlaalu ancestor, containing yellow volcanic ash from Ash Mountain.

name: Triple Bust of the Good Daedra
description: Small sculpture of the heads of Azura, Mephala, and Boethiah carved from basalt, labeled "From Stonefang Temple."

name: Saint Veloth Nutcracker
description: A nutcracker in the shape of Saint Veloth, usually only used during Dark Elf holidays.

name: Red Indoril Ash Statuette
description: Red ash statuette of a great Indoril ancestor; may have come from the Indoril Crypt in Davon's Watch.

name: Ebony Sithis Idol
description: This small ebony statue depicts Sithis as a bare-skulled figure clutching an Argonian egg.

name: Mara Fertility Fetish
description: Flower-spouting fertility statuette, usually found on shrines dedicated to Mara throughout the Skyrim territory.

name: Yokudan Warrior Statuette
description: A miniature statue shaped to represent a Yokudan Sword Saint performing an ancient sword technique.

name: Jade Serpent Figurine
description: A serpent-shaped statuette covered in a light dusting of red-orange specks.

name: Golden Rid-Thar-Ri'Datta Idol
description: A golden idol fashioned in the likeness of Rid-Thar-ri'Datta, the first Mane of the Khajiit.

name: Brass Senche-Tiger
description: A skillfully-crafted brass model of a crouching Senche-Tiger. Its sharp teeth and fully articulated jaw can crack walnuts.

name: Onyx Serpent Carving
description: A carving that's dark as the night, and cool to the touch.

name: Sea Serpent Carving
description: A coral figurine skillfully crafted to resemble the terrifying Pyandonean sea monsters commanded by the Maormer.

name: Clan Murtag War Canteen
description: This rugged canteen was crafted from Dwarven steel and emblazoned with the Murtag Clan crest.

name: Garrison Commander's Canteen
description: This bejeweled canteen is engraved with the royal symbol of Evermore.

name: "Skooma Surprise" Canteen
description: A simple tin canteen. When the spigot is twisted three times, it connects to a secondary, much smaller reservoir.

name: Shornhelm Guard Officer's Canteen
description: An ornate and rather ostentatious drinking vessel awarded to officers in good standing with the Shornhelm Guard.

name: Ebonheart Guard Canteen
description: A standard-issue drinking container provided to guards serving the Ebonheart Pact.

name: Engraved Redguard Flask
description: A rare flask engraved with an ouroboros and distributed to members of the elite 1st Redguard Horse Brigade.

name: Silver Hip Flask
description: A lovingly polished flask that still smells of Wayrest brandy.

name: Brewer's Flask
description: This sturdy glass flask is used to mix yeast when brewing.

name: Engraved Golden Flask
description: This is one of several extremely valuable flasks personalized for the merchant-lords of Stormhaven.

name: Corundum Drinking Flask
description: A strangely shaped flask made from corundum.

name: Engraved Pewter Flask
description: This well-worn drinking flask features Seamount Clan motifs etched into the pewter.

name: Banner-Torn's Everfull Flask
description: Sjarla Banner-Torn, Bleakrock's brewer, distributes these flasks with the promise to fill them whenever you have gold to pay.

name: Sea Drake Flask
description: This silver flask was given to every member of Captain Helane's crew before their maiden voyage. Only a few remain.

name: Rain Disciple's Flask
description: This flask was given to a Rain Disciple at Halcyon Lake. It's believed to purify any water held within.

name: Apex Tower Silver Flask
description: A silver drinking flask bearing the symbol of the Apex Tower in Elinhir.

name: Flask From the Flaming Nix
description: The famous corner-club in Mournhold distributes these souvenir flasks to all their best customers.

name: Stormfist Brigade Silver Flask
description: A silver drinking flask bearing the symbol of the Stormfist Brigade from western Skyrim.

name: Dark Elf Aphrodisiac Flask
description: An imported Dark Elf alchemical concoction in a silver flask, believed to aid older Nords with their nocturnal responsibilities.

name: Redguard Swordmaster's Flask
description: A silver flask engraved with the crossed scimitars of a Redguard Master of the Swirling Blades.

name: Tall Trunk Rotmeth Flask
description: Silver-chased leather flask embossed with an image of the Tall Trunk Tavern and the words "Galithor's Tall Trunk Rotmeth."

name: Flask From the Dead Wolf Inn
description: The famous tavern in Shornhelm distributes these souvenir flasks featuring an engraving of a dead wolf to their best customers.

name: Silver Drinking Flask
description: A screw-top flask of fine silver engraved with a scrollwork pattern.

name: Mourning Springs Crystal Flagon
description: Etched-glass flagon once used for "taking the waters" at the Temple of the Mourning Springs.

name: Leather Flask
description: The leather surrounding this flask is supple to the touch, and enscribed with intricate Bosmeri writing.

name: Magnifico's Flask
description: Made from valuable quicksilver and decorated with jewels, this flask was a gift from King Fahara'jad to a Forebear Magnifico.

name: Emerald-Infused Salts
description: The finest of Wayrest have recently embraced the practice of pouring packets of this expensive powder into their baths.

name: Solid Oak Armor Stand
description: A sturdy armor stand made from solid oak.

name: Fancy Waving Octopus Jewelry Stand
description: Jewelry and ring stand, a taxidermied octopus waving all eight tentacles aloft, with jeweled eyes and silver beak.

name: Brass Pen and Ink Stand
description: Brass stand for holding writing plumes and an inkwell, engraved "Sabiru's General Goods, Fell's Run" on the bottom.

name: Bear Skull Stand
description: A bear's skull mounted on an oak stand for display. Its teeth still cracked and stained from its last gruesome battle.

name: Dressmaker's Sewing Mannequin
description: An adjustable lady's mannequin dress form bearing the insigna of Queen Ayrenn's Royal Dressmaker.

name: Glazed Chiminea
description: Beautiful Argonian motifs cover this small cooking oven.

name: Lucky Senche-Tiger Claw
description: A claw with three naturally occurring, parallel streaks on one side. Said to impart good fortune upon the owner.

name: Curtain of Claws
description: A room-dividing curtain consisting of row upon row of oversized claws, said to have been crafted by a hagraven in the Rift.

name: Curtain of Crocodile Teeth
description: A room-dividing curtain crafted with rows of giant crocodile teeth, said to have been crafted by the hags of Hag Fen.

name: Meat Strip Drying Rack
description: When the wealthy brave the wilderness, they bring along a drying rack to make their own jerky in the wild.

name: Bacon Jerky Drying Rack
description: When the rich and famous brave the wilderness, they bring along Swineherd Wickton's patented drying rack for a taste of home.

name: Four-Jar Spice Rack
description: Wire rack holding four empty glass jars, each labeled a different mineral spice: sea salt, kindlepitch, verdigris, and rust.

name: Venison Jerky Drying Rack
description: When the wealthy brave the wilderness, they bring along Chef Alskar's patented venison drying rack for a taste of home.

name: Argonian Alchemist Rack
description: Stands-In-Thought crafts these fine, wooden racks to hold and organize jars full of alchemy components.

name: Argonian Darkwood Tabletop
description: The top of an Argonian-crafted table, probably made in Murkmire and shipped to Dhalmora along with a parcel of slaves.

name: Argonian Affirmation Board
description: A board of heavy, inlaid wood, set in a series of octagonal patterns. Used for various Argonian meditative exercises.

name: Spice Rack
description: Tiny tins of spices fit in a simple wooden rack.

name: Three Banners War Game
description: A triangular board and carved wooden pieces make up this three-player game that re-creates battles between the three alliances.

name: Incomprehensible Argonian Game
description: A game, you think, of ancient Argonian design. The rules are incomprehensible, but the carved monster pieces are nice.

name: Ivory Wood Noddy Peg Board
description: A carved peg board of rare pink ivory wood, bearing the signature of the woodworker Yana, used to play the card game "Noddy."

name: Silver Nine-Shells Set
description: An antique board game, complete with a lacquered pine board and polished silver pieces.

name: Bosmer/Khajiit Gemstone Chess Set
description: Chess set of 16 malachite Bosmeri pieces and 16 tiger's-eye Khajiiti pieces, with turtle-shell board that folds into a box.

name: Five Claws Cards
description: An ornate set of Khajiiti playing cards, used in a variety of games in which the highest hand is a Five Claw Flush.

name: Shenanigans Card Game
description: A specialized deck of cards used to play the Dark Elf game known as "Shenanigans."

name: Pranks & Pleasures Card Game
description: A specialized deck of cards used to play the game known as "Pranks & Pleasures," popular in Daggerfall and other cities.

name: Deck of Commemorative Playing Cards
description: Stiff parchment playing cards with an image of the Green Lady and Silvenar on the backs to commemorate the Handfasting.

name: Ravenwatch Tarot Deck
description: Deck of 78 colorful pasteboard cards, known as the Ravenwatch Tarot, decorated with weird symbols and imagery.

name: Imperial Strife Board
description: A board of heavy, inlaid wood, set in a series of triangular patterns, used to play the Imperial game, "Strife."

name: Perplexing Ancient Nord Game
description: A game (maybe?) of Nord design, discovered near Skyshroud Barrows. There are no instructions, but the board is nice.

name: Snips and Tails Game
description: A travel-sized and much less deadly version of the Iron Orc game, "Cut It Until It Dies."

name: Silver "Perchance Acorn" Puzzle Game
description: Classic Wood Elf acorn-hiding puzzle game, with acorn, cups, and board of silver, engraved "Silversmith Menthorn, Haven."

name: "Deceiver's Dice" Game
description: A travel-sized version of the Nord drinking game played in taverns and inns throughout Skyrim.

name: "Sheep, Sheep, Goat" Game
description: A travel-sized and much less rowdy version of the Nord drinking game, made popular at the Sober Nord Inn.

name: Altmer Heritage Stacking Puzzle
description: Stacking puzzle or game in which pieces representing ancestors are stacked in pairs. Breeding mismatches result in tumbles.

name: Trinket of Queen Freydis
description: A small, topaz bead said to have fallen from Queen Freydis' battle cloak during her bid to conquer Cyrodiil.

name: The Egg of the World
description: Crystal replica of the fist-sized gem Kinlady Entila Errinorne was searching for in the mine now called Entila's Folly.

name: Akatosh Dragon Eye
description: "By the eyes of Akatosh" takes on new meaning when you have one of these expensive dragon eye gems blessed to the god.

name: Unique Rotating Prismatic Window Chimes
description: Etched-Glass rotating prisms that throw rainbows and chime on the nonatonic scale, made by Kragenmoor Khajiiti slave-artisans.

name: Eye of Sithis See-All
description: Some Dhalmora Argonians believe this serpent-eye gem, when placed beside their beds, will watch over them during the night.

name: Yokeda's Emerald Helm-Jewel
description: A large emerald attached to a small gold plate, designed to be the front piece of a First Era Yokeda's Helm.

name: Onsi's Diamond Grindstone
description: Made from hard stone and gems mined from Onsi's Breath, this grindstone can sharpen a blade for the finest cut in Bangkorai.

name: Flawless Black Pearl
description: A large and well-polished swamp pearl from the heart of Black Marsh.

name: Golden Goblet
description: The perfect cup for someone with too much gold and not enough places to pour their wine.

name: "Ancient" Clay Goblet
description: A simple grail thought to be used as a drinking vessel. Any claims it was found in ancient ruins are probably just that.

name: Ancient Yokudan Chalice
description: This centuries-old golden cup is in near pristine condition and as such can be sold for a great deal of gold.

name: Dark Elf Travel Goblet
description: A sturdy drinking vessel designed to withstand the rigors of travel, made of pewter or wood, and decorated with Dark Elf runes.

name: Ancient Pa'alatiin Chalice
description: An ornate grail thought to be used as a drinking vessel, it is believed to be from the time of the Khajiiti state of Pa'alatiin.

name: Ancient Direnni Chalice
description: An ornate grail thought to be used as a drinking vessel, it is believed to be from the time of the Direnni Hegemony.

name: Pair of Crystal Jagga Chalices
description: Jagga chalices, used for traditional wedding toasts, inscribed "Congratulations Thalrinel & Dardir."

name: Set of Four Gilane Goblets
description: Four fine glass goblets with gilt brims, imported from Gilane in southern Hammerfell.

name: House Redoran Goblet
description: A redware goblet bearing the sigil of House Redoran. A stamp on the bottom reads "Ebonheart Unified Metalworks."

name: Ancient House Dagoth Goblet
description: Rare goblet displaying the sigil of House Dagoth, the Chimer clan destroyed in the War of the First Council.

name: Wooden Drinking Goblet
description: A drinking goblet carved from a single piece of Smokefrost Rosewood.

name: Maormer Goblet
description: This elaborate mother-of-pearl goblet has intricate designs of sea snakes worked into its sides.

name: Miniature Chalice of Mara
description: These tiny, bejewelled facsimiles of the famous relic were given out as prizes for winners of the Mid-Year Festival Games.

name: Jeweled Goblet
description: Made from silver, this goblet has a handful of small red jewels attached to the cup.

name: Wooden Hangers
description: These sturdy wooden hangers look strong enough to hold the heaviest winter coat yet smooth enough to display silk lingerie.

name: Beetle-Leg Clothes Hanger
description: A sturdy clothes hanger fashioned from the leg of an assassin beetle.

name: Spider-Leg Clothes Hanger
description: A frame and hook fashioned from the leg of a giant spider and used to drape a garment upon when not in use.

name: Spinner's Ceremonial Portage Harness
description: Hand-tooled timber-mammoth-leather harness for carrying a Spinner between two porters.

name: Air Plant Shoulder Harness
description: Leather harness supporting four small ceramic pots for sacred epiphytes, air plants collected from Treehenge.

name: Senche-Tiger Training Harness
description: A training harness, only slightly gnawed.

name: Falconer's Harness
description: A high-quality leather harness designed to fit over the head of a trained falcon.

name: Etched Steel Bridle
description: A sturdy and well-crafted harness.

name: Silver-Trimmed Bridle
description: Silver buttons and buckles decorate this fancy horse bridle.

name: Black Horse Courier Bridle
description: This black leather bridle has silver buckles and the insignia of the Black Horse Couriers etched into the leather.

name: Kerbol's Golden Bridle
description: Mayor Kerbol had several reinforced golden bridles made to ensure she could control her horse even if it got spooked.

name: Silverhoof Hackamore
description: Bit-less bridle of topgrain cowhide in the style used by the Horsemen of Silverhoof Vale.

name: Clan Tumnosh Drinking Horn
description: An ornately carved drinking horn, decorated in the tradition of the Orc clan Tumnosh of Wrothgar.

name: Morihaus' Sled Horn
description: An ancient Atmoran sled horn, rumored to have been blown by Morihaus-Breath-of-Kyne during his taking of the White-Gold Tower.

name: Ornamental War Horn
description: This ornate war horn was given as a gift to a retiring general.

name: Duneripper Drinking Horn
description: This is a nearly indestructible drinking horn made from the spine of a Duneripper.

name: King Makala's Ear Piece
description: One of several small golden ear pieces once used to augment the hearing of Hammerfell's infamous ruler.

name: Ancient Brass Sackbut
description: Antique brass trombone engraved with flowing floral motifs, said to have been found in Torinaan.

name: Orcish Drinking Horn
description: The solid craftsmanship of this silver drinking horn is unmistakable. In a pinch, it could cap an echatare's broken tooth.

name: Heavy Warcaller's Horn
description: An ancient horn fashioned from an echatere tusk and likely carried into battle by one of Warcaller Targoth's lieutenants.

name: Horker Tusk Drinking Horn
description: A sturdy Nord drinking cup. Perfect for beer, mead, or ... well, it's mostly for mead.

name: Skald-King's Drinking Horn
description: King Jorunn gifted each Tribunal leader with an ornate drinking horn, which was duplicated and sold to Mournhold's elite.

name: Brass "Heen-Hoon" Hunter's Horn
description: Alit-hunter's engraved brass mating-call horn; a blast of "Heen-hoon" is said to attract the amorous male Alit.

name: Riften "Hunting Horn"
description: A horn made from a mammoth tusk. Silver filigree lines the rim. The hidden compartment within smells faintly of skooma.

name: Antique Rilis VIII Hunting Horn
description: Antique gold-filigreed minotaur hunting horn dating from the reign of Kinlord Rilis VIII.

name: Horseshoe From the Hot Iron
description: A lucky horseshoe, crafted at the Hot Iron in Bleakrock, it appears to be well made.

name: King Gardner's Golden Horseshoes
description: The former king of Wayrest so loved his horses that he had golden horseshoes forged to protect their hooves.

name: Aswala Lucky Horseshoe
description: Visitors to the famous Aswala Stables once purchased horseshoes such as these. They were thought to bring good fortune.

name: Seventh Legion Horseshoes
description: These steel-plated horseshoes were forged by Imperial smiths for members of the Seventh Legion.

name: Girvu's Lucky Horseshoe
description: This decorative, gold-painted horseshoe bears the brand of Girvu's Stables in Mournhold and supposedly brings luck to the owner.

name: Nimare's Lucky Horseshoe
description: This decorative, crimson horseshoe bears the brand of Nimare's Noble Steeds in Marbruk and supposedly brings luck to the owner.

name: Bazgara's Lucky Horseshoe
description: This decorative, silver horseshoe bears the brand of Bazgara's Horses in Daggerfall and supposedly brings luck to the owner.

name: Silver Horseshoe
description: Serves little function, but worth its weight in silver and it's studded with jewels that mark it as property of Camoran royalty.

name: Fast-Running Hourglass
description: A common time-keeping device. This one's sand runs a bit fast.

name: Antique Breton Hourglass
description: Crystal-clear glass reveals that this impeccably crafted hourglass somehow survived the Seamount invasion of Betony.

name: Maritime Hourglass
description: This small brass hourglass was likely taken from the Maiden's Breath. Its fine gray sand counts thirty minutes before expiring.

name: King's Time Hourglass
description: King Eamond of Evermore believed punctuality was a virtue and was known to give valuable hourglasses to his honored guests.

name: Slow-Running Hourglass
description: A common time-keeping device. This one's sand runs a bit slow.

name: Arch-Mage's Hourglass
description: A timepiece given to students who complete their master exams by the Arch-Mage of the Shad Astula Academy of Magic.

name: Antique Dragon Hourglass
description: An ornate hourglass held within the claws of a curled dragon with ruby eyes. It dates back to the time of King Anton I.

name: Secunda's Minute Clock
description: The glass bulbs of this hourglass are encased in a gold stand. The sand within is a grayish white and measures a minute's time.

name: Masser's Hour Clock
description: The glass bulbs of this hourglass are encased in a silver stand. The sand within is a dark red, and measures an hour's time.

name: Brass Hourglass Alarm
description: A brass hourglass with a pressure-sensitive plate inside that triggers a wind-up bell when a certain amount of sand falls on it.

name: Conch Shell Inkwell
description: This small conch shell, taken from the beach at Stros M'kai, was turned into a fetching inkwell.

name: Decorative Ink Well
description: This finely etched vessel is full of fresh ink.

name: Invisible Ink
description: The label says "invisible ink." The bottle looks empty.

name: Banker's Everfull Double Inkwell
description: Bronze pen-stand, engraved "Skywatch Coinhouse," with two auto-replenishing inkwells, one black, one red.

name: River Stone Inkwell
description: This inkwell was made by hollowing out a stone found in the Bjoulsae River.

name: Dragonstar Caravan Company Inkwell
description: A bottle of ink bearing the seal of the Dragonstar Caravan Company, distributed as a promotional item.

name: Ink of A Different Color
description: An unusual ink, crafted by the alchemists of the Uncanny Alembic in Fort Amol, great for writing letters of distinction.

name: Stinkbug Ink
description: A rare Bosmer ink. When exposed to heat, the shimmering of the ink almost makes up for the horrid smell.

name: "Shalk Blue" Tattoo Ink
description: Tattoo ink obtained by milking bloated shalks. Slightly more blue than common tattoo ink.

name: Green "Official Decree" Inkwell
description: Jade inkwell containing the green iridescent ink used for writing official decrees from the Silvenar.

name: Gold-Flecked Ink
description: The flecks of gold in this ink make it valuable to those looking to make an impression. Or forgers, pretending to be them.

name: Inkwell of Dreugh Ink
description: Glass inkwell containing bright blue ink made from dreugh ichor, brewed and bottled in Davon's Watch.

name: Temple Clerk's Triple Inkwell Stand
description: Golden stand for holding the three bottles of differently-colored ink used by Temple clerks; presented for 75 years of service.

name: Tabletop Ink-Squid Swimabout
description: Crystal water bowl intended as a "live inkwell." It holds a single black marsh-squid as a living source of ink.

name: Maormer Embassy Inkwell
description: Inkwell with bottle of benthic squid double-black ink, labeled "Property of the Maormer Embassy."

name: Kinlord's Pearlescent Inkwell
description: Bottle of rare pearlescent ink, as used by Altmeri Kinlords to calligraph official decrees on blue silk.

name: Two Moons Disappearing Ink
description: This small jar of ink vanishes when it dries, and can only be seen under the light of the two full moons.

name: Platinum Calligraphy Set
description: An exquisite calligraphy set containing platinum nibs, graht-oak nib holders, and a crystal ink vial.

name: Burnished Steel Jaw-Harp
description: The Seamount Clan has a very weak musical tradition. It's unlikely that anyone will miss this lovely instrument.

name: Ancient Yokudan Flute
description: Though it's similar to the modern instrument, no one living knows exactly how to play this antique golden flute.

name: Maormer Snake-Charmer's Pungi
description: Double reedpipe used by Maormeri serpent-mages to charm snakes of all sizes. Quite rare in the Summerset Isles.

name: Seventeen Songbird Warble-Fife
description: Small flute that can be played seventeen different ways to imitate and attract every species of songbird native to Auridon.

name: Pactbreaker's Arm-Flute
description: A flute carved from the arm-bone of someone who broke the Green Pact. Now quite illegal, but still valued by collectors.

name: Ceremonial Shawm For Royal Feast Days
description: Double-reed bass shawm, of highly-ornamented alit bone, as played during fetes by the Royal Elden Root Consort.

name: Stormhold-Style Silver Slide-Flute
description: Slide-flute, silver, of the type used for playing the traditional jig "Dancing on Eggs" in the Stormhold Fredas Night Stingaree.

name: Sterling Silver Fife
description: A small high-pitched flute with six finger holes, fashioned from the finest sterling silver.

name: Child's Drum
description: Though incredibly common, simple drums such as this one are still in high demand among bandits in need of inexpensive signals.

name: Hircine's Honor Drum
description: This beautiful drum is made from the wood of a rare tree that only grows in Bangkorai's Fallen Grotto.

name: Iron Orc Executioner's Drum
description: An executioner's instrument, in both respects. Clumps of dried blood still cling to the rugged iron counterhoop.

name: Spinner's Skin Drum
description: Upon the death of a revered spinner, a skin drum is occasionally commissioned to celebrate the spinner's life.

name: Bloodgutter Tattooed Tambourine
description: Tambourine with silver zils. The tanned skin drumhead sports a tattoo of a pirate ship and the words "Bloodgutter Bosun."

name: Snakeskin-Head Conga Drum
description: Dark wooden conga. The giant snakeskin drumhead is held on by a shiny brass tension-ring.

name: Yokudan War Drum
description: A large drum that features several different Yokudan sword designs carved in its side.

name: Guarskin Conga Drums
description: Pair of conga drums with guarskin heads, made by Ebonheart Argonians but in Dunmeri style for sale to the Dark Elves.

name: Lion Guard Bugle
description: A masterfully crafted instrument, nicked and tarnished from years of campaigning.

name: Ornate Ink Blotter
description: A fine oaken blotter, capped by a brass lion handle.

name: Hoarvor-Sac Bagpipes
description: Musical instrument, fine bagpipes made from a hoarvor's bloat-sac and probosces, decorated with parrot feathers.

name: Hoarvor-Skin Tambourine
description: The chimes on this instrument have a bright and cheerful jingle. It almost makes you forget that it's made of giant tick's skin.

name: Elaborate Clockwork Hurdy-Gurdy
description: Fine string instrument that can be played with a bow, or cranked to automatically play the Camoran March.

name: Woodhearth Nose Flute
description: "Woodhearth" style three-finger-hole nose flute with flaring mouth.

name: Out-Of-Tune Theorbo
description: 14-string bass theorbo with ivory pegs and soundboard, badly out of tune.

name: Silver-Tined Senie Kalimba
description: Coralwood thumb piano with nonatonic silver tines made by the famous artisan Llamela of Senie.

name: Hissmir Cypress-Wood Lute
description: Ten-stringed lute of resonant swamp-cypress wood, made by the famous Hissmir luthier Sings-Backward.

name: Snakeskin Concertina
description: This attractive instrument is masterfully crafted using the skin of a Hooped Tree Viper. The sound it makes is ... interesting.

name: Monsoon Celebrant's Helical Foont-Pipe
description: A hollow spiral blowpipe, made of the horn of an unknown sea creature, used for foonting to welcome the annual monsoon.

name: Alit Hunter's Silver Whistle
description: Large silver-plated slide whistle, etched with "Bolga's Guaranteed Never-Fail Alit Caller."

name: Gold Finger Cymbals
description: A pair of decorated cymbals emblazoned with Dwemer runes. As valuable to scholars as the gold from which they're made.

name: Arenthian Squeeze Box
description: A hand-held musical reed instrument played by squeezing it in and out, like a bellows. Popular with Colovian travelers.

name: Rosewood Lute
description: Though quite old, this lute is still in excellent condition. There are no noticeable scratches in the lacquered wood.

name: Gilded Conch
description: A prodigious shell trumpet, polished and lined with gold leaf.

name: Bal Foyen Netch-Hide Sackpipes
description: Sackpipes made from flexible Bal Foyen netch hide, with coralwood drones.

name: Finely-Crafted Violin
description: Crafted from the finest spruce and maple and stained to a luxuriant reddish-brown, this is a fine instrument.

name: Torchbug Lantern
description: A simple glass lantern with holes built into the cap. Perfect for catching torchbugs.

name: Earthenware Jar
description: This earthenware jar is surprisingly sturdy.

name: Oil Paints
description: These small tins contain the medium of an aspiring artist, mixed with care.

name: Opulent Family Funerary Jar
description: This expensive container, which harkens back to a style popularized in the First Era, can be found in many affluent households.

name: Jar of Scrib
description: Why someone would collect a jar full of dead scrib is unknown, but the untarnished glass might be worth something.

name: Abecean Whale Buckle Wax
description: This lacquered wooden jar is filled with pale buckle wax, likely harvested from a local Abecean whale.

name: Porcelain Snake Sweat Jar
description: A decorative porcelain jar, used to store and dispense a favorite beverage of Dhalmora Argonians: tasty snake sweat.

name: Ranic's Leather Oil
description: A jar of oil intended for use on leather. Many Dhalmora Argonians use it to keep their scales smooth and shiny.

name: Alchemist's Measuring Jar
description: A jar with marks on the inside for measuring alchemical powders and liquids, as used at Linnea's Liniments in Bleakrock.

name: Jar of Sun Cream
description: A jar of thick white paste. According to alchemists, daily application can lessen the effects of Aetherial exposure.

name: Troll Musk
description: A jar of acrid black liquid used by troll hunters.

name: Umeen's Uplifting Unguent
description: A popular ointment said to treat numerous bodily ailments, sold exclusively by Umeen at the Gem & Flask in Belkarth.

name: Ashlander Spice Jar
description: An empty spice jar, crafted and sold by a friendly Ashlander tribe from eastern Deshaan.

name: Opulent Dunmer Funerary Jar
description: This expensive container, which harkens back to a style popularized by the Chimer, can be found in many affluent households.

name: Faralel's Night Cream
description: Imported from distant Alik'r, this expensive moisturizing cream is believed to keep Dark Elves looking young and beautiful.

name: Helga's Actual Polish
description: A jar of polish, specifically formulated for use on refined metal objects. "The shine is literally spectacular!"

name: Ramina's Table Topping
description: An alchemist in Daggerfall produces jars of this expensive wood cleaner, which uses the same bottle as a popular salad dressing.

name: Beldama Foot Rub
description: One of Glenumbra's wandering merchants sells this soothing foot ointment, said to be made by the Wyrd Sisters of Daenia.

name: Glass Pickling Jar
description: A blown glass jar used for pickling ... something.

name: Jar of Pretty Seashells
description: A glass jar filled with pink and orange shells, labeled "Strident Coast."

name: Jar of Live Centipedes
description: A green glass jar containing four large live centipedes with a bow around it.

name: Alik'r Spice Jar
description: A container for holding spices, crafted and sold by a friendly Redguard trader in western Rivenspire.

name: Vireche's Breath Purifier
description: Alchemist Vireche Kel in Hoarfrost crafts this refreshing concoction that freshens bad breath and tastes great on black bread.

name: Fruit Jar Full of Goblin Teeth
description: Jar for preserving fruit containing a collection of several hundred Goblin teeth.

name: Shornhelm Triumvirate Swear Jar
description: One of the crystal jars Baron Dorell filled for every swear word he let slip during public sessions. Sadly, this one is empty.

name: Seafood Allspice Preserving Jar
description: An empty redware jar that smells of mushrooms and peat. Used to preserve the Davon's Watch seasoning known as "seafood allspice."

name: Jar of Fungal Grotto Mushroom Unguent
description: Ornamental limeware jar of fungal emollient; exudes a heady fragrance redolent of deep grottos.

name: Lizard-Eye Marbles
description: Small, round balls made of agate, used in the Dark Elf children's game, "Keepers," stored in a clear, glass jar.

name: Sing's Serene Salve
description: A popular ointment said to treat numerous bodily ailments, sold exclusively by the alchemist Sings-with-Frogs in Ebonheart.

name: Jar of Frog Ink
description: A glazed clay jar filled with frog ink. How the ink was extracted remains a mystery.

name: Fin Polish
description: A lacquered wooden jar filled with a smooth, waxy substance. Guaranteed to enhance the appearance and health of Argonian fins.

name: Shadowfen Mud Collection
description: Collection of eight sealed glass jars, each containing a sample of mud from a different region of Shadowfen.

name: Balynor's Worm Repellent
description: Wandering merchant Balynor's odiferous ointment, applied liberally, keeps a lot more than just Worm Cultists away.

name: Wax Ear Pellets
description: A sealed jar of soft wax pellets intended to be used as earplugs while sleeping.

name: Nobles' Soil-Repelling Dreugh Wax
description: Jar of expensive mildly-enchanted soil-repelling boot polish, made from rare dreugh wax by Starfall Arcana.

name: Nord Gold-Plated Snow Jars
description: Wealthy Nord households take the tradition of saving snow from each year's Wintertide Festival in sealed jars very seriously.

name: Glazed Jug
description: This glazed jug has a thick sheep's bladder stopper that can keep its contents sealed.

name: Fermenting Jug
description: A jug used to ferment homemade alcohol, usually decorated with animals native to specific parts of Tamriel.

name: Polished Harvest Jug
description: A heavy, but lovingly polished ceramic jug. It smells like a mix of fine whiskey and cheap jagga.

name: Kerbol's Blood Jug
description: This ornate silver jug is labeled with ancient runes that can be translated as "For Emergencies Only".

name: Sheepskin-Covered Jug
description: Sheepskin covers this porcelain jug to keep its contents from spoiling.

name: Nord Fermenting Jug
description: A jug used to ferment homemade alcohol, usually decorated with animals native to Skyrim or scenes of famous Nord battles.

name: Reaper's Milk Jug
description: A thick glass jug with "Reaper's Milk" embossed upon the side.

name: Suction-Sealed Water Jug
description: A heavy clay water jug with a well-designed rubber seal. Clever thieves remove the seal and use it as clandestine climbing gear.

name: The Key To Velyn Harbor
description: Large hollow brass key that can be played like a fife, engraved "First Seed Presentation: The Key to Velyn Harbor."

name: Two Moons Key
description: An ornamental key from Two Moons temple. Con artists could convince a mark that it opens something valuable.

name: Broken Crystal Key To Silyanorn
description: Key carved from some kind of blue crystal, with one tooth broken off, engraved with the Ayleidoon "S" for Silyanorn.

name: "Key" To Sanguine's Demesne
description: Carnelian cut into the shape of a key, engraved "The Key to Sanguine's Demesne, Where Fantasy is Reality."

name: Seeker's Onyx Key
description: The bits on this ornamental onyx key are jagged, long, and irregular.

name: Brass Oil Lamp
description: This simple brass oil lamp can provide light for hours. With a little polishing, it would be as good as new.

name: Obsidian Orc Lamp
description: A polished obsidian lamp, carved to resemble a snarling Orc.

name: Red Heavens Lamp
description: When this oil lamp is lit, the hundreds of embedded rubies produce a mesmerizing depiction of the constellations.

name: Gilded Eagle Lamp
description: A brass lamp with gold accents, shaped to resemble a screaming eagle in flight.

name: Velyn Harbor Leviathan Oil Lamp
description: Lamp for burning leviathan oil. Inscribed on bottom: "Another Fine Product from Trader's Crescent."

name: Welkynd Stone Night Lamp
description: Small night lamp illuminated by a dimly glowing Welkynd Stone from Erokii.

name: Firebrand Lantern
description: A wrought iron lantern bearing the heraldry of the Knights of the Flame.

name: Steel Lantern
description: Panes of glass keep the flame safe from wind. The filigree pattern on the metal causes wild shadows to dance on the walls.

name: Looted Brass Lantern
description: This sturdy brass lantern was pried off the deck of the Maiden's Breath. Even damaged, this lantern is quite lovely.

name: Arkay's Blessed Lantern
description: A lantern used by gravediggers at Pelin's Graveyard. The light is said to turn back the undead—primarily by crooked merchants.

name: Local Troll Lantern
description: A lantern made from the ribs of a troll. The label insists the troll was hunted locally in Bangkorai.

name: Nereid's Wisp Lantern
description: This lantern was created by the Neried of Halcyon Lake. It glows with magical light.

name: Seventh Legion Lantern
description: This lantern is forged from Dwarven Steel and engraved with the words: "For your loyalty to the Empire, from Septima Tharn."

name: Barkbite Ever-Burning Dark Lanthorn
description: Exquisitely-forged lantern with painted, sliding shutters, containing a firebowl of ever-burning "Nirnpith Kindlepitch."

name: Terrapin-Shell Lantern
description: A fine lantern, fashioned from a polished turtle shell and lined with copper leaf.

name: Tortoiseshell Monocle
description: This monocle's lens is now missing, but the frame made of tortoiseshell gleams like new.

name: Viridian Sentinel's Monocle
description: Though Viridian Sentinels are known for their longevity, their eyes age at a normal rate, and they require monocles for reading.

name: Shimmerene Magnifying Glass
description: Magnifying lens of imported Shimmerene glass in a brass setting with a carved tigerbone handle.

name: Tinted Spectacles in Gemstone Frames
description: Pair of blue-tinted spectacles in silver frames, set with turquoise accents, in a fine tortoise-shell carrying case.

name: Crystal Quizzing Glass
description: Crystal magnifying lens mounted on a long brass handle, microscopically inscribed "Davynu's Workshop."

name: Magnifying Spectacles
description: An experimental pair of magnifying spectacles, just like the ones created for Baron Dorell's tired eyes in Northpoint.

name: Argonian Reading Glass
description: A polished and shaped piece of glass attached to a bone handle.

name: Obsidian Night-Spectacles
description: Broad pince-snout spectacles of thin but dark obsidian, worn for the Argonian practice of "Walking with Sithis."

name: Magnifying Monocle
description: A single round of magnifying glass, just like the one used to aid Thane Unnvald's tired eyes in Riften.

name: Artificer's Loupe
description: A finely made type of jeweler's loupe, this magnifying device can clearly reveal small details.

name: Eagle's Gaze Monocle
description: A corrective lens used to enhance the vision in only one eye, enchanted to increase it's magnification a dozen-fold.

name: Ivory-Handled Reading Glass
description: A well-maintained glass lens with an ivory handle.

name: Reading Glass
description: The craftsmanship on this reading glass makes it of great value to bibliophiles.

name: Velyn Harbor Mages Guild Stationery
description: Two-score sheets of fine stationery, blank except for the symbol of the Mages Guild and script reading "Velyn Harbor Guildhall."

name: Lion Guard Regrets
description: A personal letter from a Lion Guard officer, informing of the loss of a loved one in service to the High King.

name: Wayrest Love Letter
description: An intimate letter revealing details of an illicit affair involving members of the Virane and Branck families in Wayrest.

name: Outdated Military Documents
description: While these documents are no longer useful for military strategies, a historian might find the papers intriguing.

name: Invitation: Drinks With the Neighbors
description: An invitation to attend a casual gathering with neighboring nobles. It appears drinks and small bites will be served.

name: Signed Coat of Arms Document
description: These blank documents bearing the coat of arms of a noble house and signed by a house officer would be worth a lot to a forger.

name: Disreputable Correspondence
description: A collection of scandalous correspondence between rival merchants attempting to defraud their Alliance.

name: Magistrate's Certificate
description: This certificate verifies the credentials and authority of the local magistrate. It would be valuable to a forger.

name: Sentinel Guard Patrol Schedule
description: This document contains details about patrol routes and shift schedules for the Sentinel Guard.

name: Letter of Marque
description: This letter authorizes a ship captain to attack and loot Dominion ships in support of the Sentinel Navy.

name: College of Aldmeri Propriety Acceptance Letter
description: A letter of acceptance into the Thalmor training program at the College of Aldmeri Propriety.

name: Ancient Breton Deed
description: This document is very old and nearly illegible. The varying ages of the inscriptions imply a rich history of lies and forgery.

name: Foyen Docks Bill of Lading
description: A bill of lading for cargo delivered to the Foyen Docks, it appears the cargo hasn't been picked up as yet.

name: Writ of Bal Foyen Freedom
description: When the Dark Elves freed the Argonian slaves and granted them land in Bal Foyen, these official documents were presented.

name: Invitation From Mayor Kerbol
description: This invitation was sent to a sick nobleman's daughter, inviting her to come find healing in Kerbol's Hollow.

name: Imperial Writ of Loyalty
description: This writ says the bearer is loyal to the Empire and must be treated accordingly. It's signed by Magus-General Septima Tharn.

name: Inspirational Adages of the Three
description: Every Dark Elf desk has a list of inspirational quotes attributed to the Tribunal.

name: Narsis Guard Patrol Schedule
description: An unauthorized list of guard patrols and schedules for the Hlaalu Guard in Narsis during the Llodos plague crisis.

name: Ordinator's Indulgence
description: A discharge of obligations awarded by an Ordinator for certain favors discreetly performed for the Tribunal.

name: Illicit Letters From Daggerfall
description: Steamy correspondences from a Darien Gautier of Camlorn. The frequent references to bread-eating must be some form of code.

name: Queen's Tour Schedule
description: An unauthorized list of stops and schedules for Queen Ayrenn's tour of the Dominion. Worth much to the Veiled Heritance.

name: Exoneration Writ
description: A discharge of obligations awarded by a Dragon Knight for certain favors discreetly performed for the Daggerfall Crown.

name: Perfumed Letter From Lady Laurent
description: Famed explorer Lady Clarisse Laurent wrote and signed this letter, seeking funding for her latest dungeon-delving expedition.

name: Duke Sebastien's Distinguished Decree
description: The Duke of Camlorn continues a long-held tradition by presenting special certificates to deserving citizens every season.

name: Scandalous Letters
description: A collection of unseemly letters between two members of rivalrous noble families that would be embarrassing if brought to light.

name: Illicit Letters From Windhelm
description: Romantic correspondence from an anonymous author, directed to one Darien Gautier. There is frequent reference to swordplay.

name: Chriane's Mulled Wine Companion
description: One of Gerrald Chriane's much-sought-after goat-bladder waterskins, recommended for enjoying Saturalia Bitter Mulled Wine.

name: Covert Shornhelm Correspondence
description: This message details supply routes between Shornhelm and Northpoint. Bandits would pay dearly for this information.

name: House Tamrith's Profound Proclamation
description: The Count of Tamrith continues a long-standing tradition by presenting special certificates to deserving citizens every season.

name: Invitation To the High King's Ball
description: An embossed and elegant invitation to the High King's annual Rivenspire ball.

name: Disreputable Memorandums
description: A collection of memorandums detailing a merchant's attempt to cheat a rival merchant out of a price-fixing scheme.

name: Impassioned Messages From Auridon
description: Romantic letters exchanged between star-crossed paramours in opposing alliances. Either that, or coded messages from spies.

name: Thane Unnvald's Potent Proclamation
description: The Thane of Riften continues a long-standing tradition by presenting special certificates to deserving citizens every season.

name: Disreputable Dispatches
description: A collection of dispatches revealing two competing merchants and their conspiracy to fix prices.

name: Illicit Letters From Northpoint
description: Romantic correspondence between a foreign dignitary and a wealthy jarl in the Rift. Blackmailers would pay dearly for this.

name: Blank Marbruk Builder's Permit
description: A permit to build in the city of Marbruk. It could be worth a lot to a forger.

name: Trollfight Arena Certificate of Merit
description: A certificate given to the trainer of trolls who have survived ten or more fights at Hadran's Caravan.

name: Counterfeit Dominion Passport
description: A high quality forgery of a passport bearing the Thalmor Inner Council's seal. Smugglers would pay dearly for this.

name: Gold Counter's Promissory
description: Drinks-with-Toes distributes these tokens of obligation to remind bank customers of their dealings with Drinks-Not-Investments.

name: Tomorrow's Obligations
description: A list of the tasks to be performed the next day, peculiar to the author. Of some value to burglars.

name: Bleakrock Trading Hall Shopping List
description: A list of supplies someone plans to pick up at the Bleakrock Trading Hall.

name: Captain Rana's Patrol Schedule
description: An unauthorized record of Captain Rana's personal patrol schedule. It appears the people of Bleakrock like to keep track of her.

name: Piece of A Dwemer Construct
description: The broken piece of a dwemer construct is large enough to mount on a wall, but is probably permanently broken.

name: Winged Ink Pen
description: A golden pen adorned with wings. When out of ink, the wings flutter frantically.

name: Today's Tasks
description: A list of the day's chores, peculiar to the author.

name: Covert Daggerfall Correspondence
description: This message details supply routes between Stormhaven and Glenumbra. Bandits would pay dearly for this information.

name: Caravan Schedule
description: These simple maps and notes appear to reveal a future caravan's route and schedule. A fence could resell these to bandits.

name: Outdated Map of Tamriel
description: This map of Tamriel was drawn before the Alliance War began. However, it still accurately depicts geography and distance.

name: Ancient Map of High Rock
description: This ancient map is as notable for its geographical inaccuracies as it is for its age.

name: Directions To Clockwork City
description: Scouting reports, collected rumors, and suppositions on the true location of Sotha Sil's Clockwork City.

name: Black Marsh Transportation Guide
description: A hand-drawn map of the various underground expressways formed by the roots of the Hist trees and the common routes for traders.

name: Ancient Map of Unknown Land
description: This antique map clearly shows a land currently unknown by modern cartographers and explorers.

name: Secret Roads Map
description: This map locates several hidden passes and caves that run though the mountains between Hallin's Stand and Satakalaam.

name: Silk Map of Summerset Isles
description: Sailors and collectors alike would covet this delicately woven map of the Summerset Isles.

name: Ancient Map of Evermore
description: This antique map shows how the city was arranged when it was first built centuries ago.

name: Ancient Map of Morrowind
description: This antique map is as notable for its geographical inaccuracies as it is for its age.

name: Map of Eastern Skyrim
description: A map showing the current borders of Eastern Skyrim, though it appears to have a number of errors and inconsistencies.

name: Ancient Map of Eastern Skyrim
description: This antique map from the time of Queen Freydis is as notable for its geographical inaccuracies as it is for its age.

name: Woodhearth Sewer Map
description: A smugglers' map of the Woodhearth sewers.

name: Antique Map of High Rock
description: An antique map from the time of the Direnni Hegemony. Though inconsistent with modern maps, the calligraphy is beautiful.

name: Inaccurate Rivenspire Map
description: A map of Rivenspire containing glaring mistakes. Supposedly commissioned on King Ranser's orders to confuse High King Emeric.

name: Rivenspire Map Desk Blotter
description: Desk blotter printed with a map of Rivenspire, with an inkblot half-covering Sanguine Barrows.

name: Fanciful Map of Rivenspire
description: This map from the time of King Ranser is notable for its extended borders, displaying Ranser's intentions at the time.

name: Inaccurate Riften Map
description: This map of Riften contains glaring mistakes and was supposedly commissioned on Thane Unnvald's orders to confuse the Worm Cult.

name: Covert Riften Correspondence
description: This message details supply routes between Windhelm and Riften. Bandits would pay dearly for this information.

name: Fanciful Map of the Rift
description: This map from the time of King Einar is notable for its depiction of fantastic creatures along the edges of the parchment.

name: Greenshade Tunnel Map
description: An extremely detailed map of the cave networks under Greenshade. It would be useful to anyone traveling in secret.

name: Summerset Isles Nautical Depth Chart
description: A highly detailed nautical chart of ocean depths and hazards in the strait separating Auridon and Summerset.

name: Summerset Isles Map Scroll
description: A wooden scroll case containing a beautifully hand-painted cloth map of the Summerset Isles.

name: Star Map
description: A detailed map of the Tamrielic sky, prepared by members of the Star-Gazer Order.

name: Dhalmora Sleeping Mat
description: A rolled sleeping mat in the Dhalmora style, built for comfort and portability. No backpack should be without one.

name: Mystical Mysteries Table Mat
description: A woven placemat crafted by Skyrim artisans and bearing the distinctive symbols associated with Saerdor the Mystic.

name: Mabrigash Woven Mat
description: A woven placemat crafted by the Mabrigash and bearing the distinctive pattern of the Ashlander tribe.

name: Moonhenge Meditation Mat
description: A colorful mat used by devout Wood Elves to meditate at the mystical spot known as Moonhenge.

name: Ornate Place Setting
description: The embroidery on this place setting is extraordinary. It appears to use a mix of fine gold and silver thread.

name: Dragonshrine Woven Mat
description: A woven placemat crafted by Riften artisans and bearing the distinctive landscape of a dragonshrine grotto.

name: Eagle's Strand Welcome Mat
description: Tawny welcome mat woven of saltrice straw, with a pattern depicting Eagle's Strand.

name: Dragonstar Caravan Company Placemats
description: Woven placemats bearing the seal of the Dragonstar Caravan Company and distributed as a promotional item.

name: Sovngarde Woven Place Settings
description: Woven placemats decorated with idyllic scenes of Sovngarde. They are too beautiful for common Nord feasts.

name: Silver Hoof Woven Mat
description: A woven placemat crafted by the Silver Hoof tribe and bearing the distinctive horse motif they favor.

name: Bear Skin Rug
description: The bear's head is remarkably preserved. There can be no mistake: this rug is looking at you with its beady glass eyes.

name: Area Rug
description: Dark red with an intricate navy pattern sewn into the border, this medium rug is soft to the touch.

name: Nord Bath Rug
description: A fine bath rug, imported from a small boutique in Eastmarch, features an attractive yet simple Nord design.

name: Dunmeri Throw Rug
description: A quality throw rug, imported from a small boutique in Deshaan, features an attractive yet simple Dark Elf design.

name: Bear-Skin Rug
description: A remarkable bear-skin rug made from an excellent specimen hunted in the Daenia forests.

name: Beetle-Scale Throw Rug
description: A small rug used to cover a portion of a bare floor. The spongy nature of the beetle scales makes it particularly comfortable.

name: White Senche-Tiger Rug
description: A tiger-skin rug made from a large and very rare white senche-tiger.

name: Mauloch's Meditation Mirror
description: A silver mirror of Orcish design, featuring Mauloch's Hammer on the non-reflective side and used in daily affirmation rituals.

name: Soldier's Shaving Mirror
description: Your reflection peers back at you from within the mirror.

name: Manteau Family Handmirror
description: This handmirror once belonged to the wealthy Manteau family from Wind Keep.

name: Sentinel Guard Signaling Mirror
description: This small hand mirror was made so the Sentinel Guard can communicate across long distances.

name: Grandeya's Diamond Hand Mirror
description: A small but extremely valuable mirror decorated with gold and diamonds.

name: Caravan Minder's Mirror
description: This is a small mirror carried by caravan guards and used to keep an eye out for any ambushes coming from the rear.

name: Ordinator Signal Mirror
description: A mirror bearing the symbol of the Ordinators. It is used to send simple signals and messages from a distance.

name: Feast of Dibella Centerpiece
description: Many Nord families display this silver mirror in the shape of a moth for the annual Feast of Dibella celebration.

name: King's Observer Signal Mirror
description: A mirror bearing the seal of King Casimir and used to send simple messages between agents of the king's intelligence network.

name: "Watching Silvenar" Hand Mirror
description: Ivory-handled hand mirror in which the viewer always sees the beatific face of the Silvenar over her shoulder.

name: Moon Pool Hand Mirror
description: This mirror is actually a shallow, shimmering pool of water magically contained within its oval, opalescent frame.

name: Tamrith Crystal Hand Mirror
description: The handle of this mirror was carved to match a House Tamrith stiletto hilt.

name: Rosewood Hand Mirror
description: A small silver mirror with an ornate frame of polished rosewood.

name: Errinorne Valet's Two-Way Hand Mirror
description: Silver-chased hand-mirror, devised so a valet can see from its back what it's reflecting in the front, for proper holding.

name: Celestial Mirror
description: This ancient mirror is framed by images carved into its surface resembling the celestial constellations.

name: Silver-Handled Mirror
description: The polished silver engraved onto the handle is almost as reflective as the mirror itself.

name: Ornate Shaving Mirror
description: An ornate hand-held shaving mirror crafted from fine silver and inscribed the names of Aldmeri deities.

name: Mirror of Youth
description: This ornately-framed mirror is magically charmed to show a more youthful image of the person peering into it.

name: Khajiit Windowsill Sun Reflector
description: A mirrored plaque placed on a windowsill, reflecting sunlight into a dot that senche-tigers (and some Khajiit) love to chase.

name: King Emeric's Golden Toothpick
description: Shaped specifically to fit in the narrow gaps between his teeth, Emeric had several such toothpicks made when he became king.

name: Silvermere's Road Nail
description: A nail thought to be from the horseshoe of Silvermere, ridden by Emperor Reman during his campaign against the Akaviri invaders.

name: Metal Meat Skewers
description: Long, thin skewers of steel and brass, designed to impale chunks of meat and vegetables to cook over an open fire.

name: Clip of Fine Hair
description: A clump of fine hair wrapped in a silk ribbon, intended to accent hair without being too ostentatious.

name: Silver Kebab Sticks
description: A valuable set of kebab sticks often used by Crown nobles when eating goat.

name: Bronze Hair Disc
description: This old Breton hair disc is still in excellent condition. It was almost certainly worn by a member of King Renwic's house.

name: Whale-Bone Toothpick
description: Mighty Orc tusks require an equally mighty toothpick. This one is larger than most—likely used by a Seamount Clan chief.

name: Heavy Knitting Needles
description: These needles are composed of Stonetooth steel and are larger than most. A good fit for strong Orcish hands.

name: Steel Marlinspike
description: A flawless steel pin used to mend rope. It was likely given as a gift to Captain Kaleen's most talented seamen.

name: Ivory Lamb Skewers
description: A pair of long steel skewers used to prepare kabobs. The handles are made of genuine horker tusk, carved to resemble sheep.

name: Hircine-Blessed Skewers
description: Though they were made by a Dark Witness Briar Heart, these ebony meat skewers are much prized by hunters everywhere.

name: Diamond Knitting Needle
description: When her children were young, Queen Arzhela liked to personally knit all their clothes. The king gave her many of these needles.

name: Engraved Mammoth Tusk Hair Pins
description: Intricately carved hair pins, made from expensive mammoth ivory, depict highlights of the Skald-King's life in minute detail.

name: Bone Knitting Needles
description: These knitting needles are sturdy and exquisitely-carved.

name: Ugduk's Meat Skewers
description: A general good merchant in Aldcroft sells these traditional Orc meat skewers, perfect for roasting over a fire.

name: Gem-Studded Triquetra Hat Pin
description: An exquisite hat-pin, shaped like a three-sided knot and studded with fine gems, is the perfect accompaniment to any bonnet.

name: Set of Six Frog-Kebab Skewers
description: Set of fancy frog-kebab skewers of twisted wrought iron, from the Greenwarden Forge in Elden Root.

name: Exquisite Bone Stylus
description: An antique writing tool carved from a wolf's mandible.

name: Eagle-Bone Chopsticks
description: A set of polished eating utensils, made from carved eagle bones.

name: House Montclair Celebratory Sparkle Stick
description: Stoneglow Enchantments crafted these party favors for Baron Montclair's fortieth birthday, leading to the Great Fire of 1E 580.

name: Dark Elf Sewing Needles in Pin Cushion
description: Distinctive bone sewing needles traditionally utilized by Dark Elf crafters, stuck into a mudcrab-shaped pin cushion.

name: Folio-Binding Kit With Head-Needle
description: Fine snakeskin sewing kit for binding folios of parchment, with an Argonian head-spine needle.

name: Stormhold "Stingaree" Tail Prosthesis
description: Fancy lacquered giant-wasp thorax with flexible bands for tail attachment, worn in the "Fredas Night Stingaree."

name: Nord's Hammer Hair Pins
description: Fancy hair pins with a hammer head and pointed handle, a popular Nord symbol, found in homes throughout the Rift and beyond.

name: Collection of Belaying Pins
description: Curious collection of sailing ship belaying pins, each one labeled with the name of a shipwreck.

name: Sload Pustule Lancet
description: A rare item of Sload manufacture, left behind after their long occupation of Errinorne Isle.

name: Handheld Loom
description: This loom's small size makes it easily transportable, and the needle is constructed of a valuable ebony.

name: Silver Skewers
description: Skewers that would valuable to a werewolf hunter—if they weren't made of orichalcum, and painted silver to look less valuable.

name: Set of Monkeybone Bug Tweezers
description: Case of six fine tweezer utensils used for eating live bugs, carved from flexible monkeybone and inscribed "Silvenar Supplies."

name: Goat-Hair Butterfly Net
description: A net, woven from the finest goat hair, designed to catch butterflies.

name: Nocturnal Nord Hair Net
description: The only way to protect Nord braids from pillow hair is by using one of these silver mesh hair nets while sleeping.

name: Royal Wasp Wrangler's Capture Net
description: Collapsible net of strong Scuttle Pit spidersilk for live capture of giant wasps by the Camoran Royal Wasp Wrangler.

name: Cloth-Of-Gold Torchbug Hair-Cage
description: Glittering cloth-of-gold net with flexible band; it is snugged over one's hair, and then filled with a dozen winking torchbugs.

name: Long-Handled Bat-Catcher's Net
description: Wide-mouthed net with extensible handle, as used by the famous Crestshade Bat-Catchers.

name: Bamboo-Twig Whisker Snood
description: Semi-rigid cheek cauls of flexible bamboo twigs with fur pins; worn to keep whiskers from bending while asleep.

name: Wasp Netting
description: A mesh made from ogre sinew. Some Wood Elves swear it provides unmatched protection from the giant wasps of Green's Marrow.

name: Decorative Nord Netting
description: A common net decorated in the Nord style, with sea shells, feathers, beads, and other trinkets, creating a hanging work of art.

name: Spidersilk Food Net
description: Travelers often use these nets when camping to suspend their food above the reach of any bears.

name: Pewter Portrait Frame
description: This small pewter frame can hold a miniature portrait or drawing.

name: Risque Etching
description: This revealing etching of a masked courtesan was deemed too provocative to display in mixed company.

name: "Cavorting Dremora Among the Ruins"
description: This whimsical painting depicts what wealthy citizens must imagine Dremora are like: All smiling and dancing in an unnamed ruin.

name: Curious Family Portrait
description: A painting of an unnamed ancestor of a wealthy family. The eyes seem to follow you wherever you go.

name: Fahara'jad Coronation Portrait
description: This rare painting depicts the coronation of King Fahara'jad. Its frame is made of orichalcum.

name: "Ancient Ezduiin" Painting
description: Framed painting of the site of Ezduiin, depicting it as it appeared before it was ruined in the Mallari-Mora incident.

name: Painting of King Hidellith
description: Framed oil portrait of Queen Ayrenn's father, the late King Hidellith.

name: Forged Painting
description: A very good forgery of a very famous Aldmeri painting.

name: Bleakrock Isle Scenery Painting
description: A small painting in a frame that sits on a nightstand, it shows a distinct piece of Bleakrock scenery by the artist Oro.

name: Giraud Family Portrait
description: This large portrait features all the members of a large family who were once prominent farmers in Northglen.

name: "Frolicking Trolls of Eastmarch"
description: A copy of this whimsical painting depicts how Bretons imagine the frost trolls of Skyrim: smiling and dancing in the snow.

name: Curious Royal Painting
description: A painting of an unnamed ancestor of King Casimir. The eyes seem to follow you wherever you go.

name: Skywatch Festival Advertisement
description: A hand-drawn advertisement for the celebration in Skywatch.

name: Defaced Tribunal Reredos
description: Magnificent carved three-panel mahogany screen depicting the Tribunal, defaced by claw-marks.

name: Toad Muffin Pan
description: This pan bakes exactly seven toad muffins—a number that is generally considered good luck.

name: Steel Warming Pan
description: A steel bed warmer, cool to the touch but full of fine charcoal ash.

name: Bed Warmer
description: A round metal contraption for warming the bed with hot coals on frigid winter nights.

name: Beetle Puffs Pastry Pan
