description: This pastry pan makes a dozen sweet beetle puffs, a Dhalmora delicacy favored by Argonians and other adventurous eaters.

name: Rabbit Roasting Pan
description: A favorite meal throughout Bleakrock Isle, this deep porcelain casserole is the perfect size to hold a stuffed rabbit.

name: Deerskin Dustpan
description: This dustpan was made using multiple layers of deerskin so that it's both flexible and sturdy.

name: Olive-Wood Pipe
description: A lacquered wooden pipe, cut from a Craglorn olive tree.

name: Gorapple Muffin Pan
description: This tin pan has enough cups to make exactly three gorapple muffins—a lucky number associated with the Tribunal.

name: Sweetroll Pastry Pan
description: This pastry pan has enough cups to make exactly nine sweetrolls—one for each of the Eight with a bonus pastry for good luck.

name: Rabbit Meatball Frying Pan
description: A frying pan that features multiple ball-shaped indentations for preparing perfect rabbit meatballs for hungry Nords.

name: Jagga Tart Fluted Ring Pans
description: Fluted ring pans for making jagga tarts, a Wood Elf delicacy consisting of fermented pig's milk and squirrel preserves.

name: Khajiit Travel Skillet
description: No Khajiit journeys into the wild without sticking one of these cooking vessels in her pack. Perfect for making fried sweetcake.

name: Cast Iron Skillet
description: This cast iron skillet is practical and well-made—a must-have for any chef.

name: Miniature Mundus Stone Model
description: A wandering merchant who visits Craglorn once every season sells these small, stone paperweights in the shape of Mundus Stones.

name: Diminutive Mundus Stone
description: A wandering merchant who visits Eastmarch once every season sells these small, stone paperweights in the shape of Mundus Stones.

name: Mammoth Paperweight
description: A small, heavy mammoth of shaped glass, used to keep papers and other documents from scattering in a cold wind.

name: Pewter Paperweight
description: It's heavy and it just sits there—the perfect paperweight.

name: Ayleid Paperweight
description: Retrieved from the ruins at Salas En. No one knows its original purpose, but it makes a great paperweight.

name: Guar Paperweight
description: A small, heavy guar of shaped clay, it is a popular desk accessory in Dhalmora and the surrounding countryside.

name: Iliath Temple Paperweight
description: Heavy basalt paperweight carved in the likeness of the Iliath Temple.

name: Quartz Crystal Tower Paperweight
description: Quartz paperweight in the shape of a miniature Crystal Tower; glows faintly in the dark, gradually changing colors.

name: Welkynd Chip Paperweight
description: Taken from a keystone outside the great Ayleid ruin of Betnikh. It still glows a faint blue and emits a low hum.

name: Crude Tooth Paperweight
description: This grisly paperweight features a molar taken from a Dogeater Goblin perched atop a resin block.

name: Ash Mountain Paperweight
description: A heavy stone from the volcano in Stonefalls, perfect for keeping papers from scattering in a strong breeze.

name: Amber-Encased Torchbug
description: This unfortunate torchbug was caught in a flood of sap a long time ago. Polished to a shine, it is now an amber paperweight.

name: Tower Paperweight
description: A small, heavy stone tower in the High Breton style, with gemstone windows. Used to keep papers from scattering in the wind.

name: Narsis Mushroom Parasol
description: A parasol in the Narsis style, shaped to resemble a Morrowind mushroom and carried to repel rain or sun.

name: Daggerfall Carrying Canopy
description: A distinctive parasol with dangles and frills, made popular by wealthy matrons during the first Daggerfall Covenant.

name: Betty Netch Parasol
description: A rare parasol imported from Morrowind, shaped to resemble a betty netch and carried to repel rain or sun.

name: Baandari Trading Post Parasol
description: Khajiiti reed-and-papyrus folding parasol, with "Compliments of the Baandari Trading Post" on the handle.

name: Camoran Bat-Wing Bumbershoot
description: Ivory-handled black folding umbrella fashioned from the waxed wings of giant bats, with the red Camoran Royal Seal.

name: Wamasu Hide Frilly Parasol
description: Imported from Craglorn at great expense, this covering provides protection from sun and rain, and features a bone-grip handle.

name: House Indoril Shoulder-Mounted Parasol
description: Folding shoulder-mounted parasol of blue-dyed premium netch-hide displaying the symbol of House Indoril.

name: Canonreeve's Silken Parasol
description: Silk-paneled sun umbrella displaying the symbol of the Thalmor, from Island Woodworks in Skywatch.

name: Spidersilk Parasol
description: A brightly colored collapsible parasol of fine-spun spidersilk with an intricately-carved mahogany handle.

name: Monkey-Hide Parasol
description: An umbrella used in the Alik'r to protect exposed skin from the sun. It is no longer used exclusively by nobles.

name: Clement Climate Picnic Parasol
description: Minor-magical parasol that, when opened, protects the area beneath and nearby from bad weather; from The Eldritch Seal.

name: Evermore Parasol
description: Citizens of Evermore traveling into Southern Bangkorai often carry these parasols to protect themselves from the desert sun.

name: Princess Elara's Parasol
description: Knowing her daughter enjoyed long walks outside the castle walls, Queen Arzhela had dozens of these fancy parasols made.

name: Snakeskin Umbrella
description: A clever Wood Elf invention, designed to keep travelers dry during rainstorms.

name: Wax Paper
description: Wax paper for composing letters.

name: Quire of Official Thalmor Stationery
description: 24 sheets of highest-quality vellum, each bearing the distinctive eagle watermark of the Thalmor.

name: Transferable Promissory Note
description: I.O.U. drawn on the general funds of the Treasury of the Tree, made out to "Bearer."

name: Burial Mound Etchings
description: Etchings from the ancient crypts at the base of Cath Bedraud.

name: Fresh Vellum
description: The pages are fresh-cut and smooth to the touch.

name: Sheaf of Blank Parchment
description: Each piece of parchment is unstained, unmarred, and unfolded.

name: Faded Wanted Poster
description: A wanted poster from a distant city with exceptional artwork. A fence may purchase this as decoration for an outlaws refuge.

name: Sheet Music Folio
description: Contains sheet music for such classics as "Lusty  Argonian Maid" and "No Way Am I Going to Eat this Stew."

name: Pristine Durzog-Hide Napkins
description: King Kurog of Orsinium presented these napkins as a gift to one of the noble houses of Wayrest.

name: Compilation of First Concerns
description: A list of the day's priorities, in order of importance. The reverse is blank, and could be reused.

name: Echatare Vellum
description: Imported by boat from Orsinium. This vellum still smells of woodchips and the sea.

name: Star-Gazers' Observatory Stationery
description: Common parchment sheets bearing the embossed seal of the observatory in Belkarth.

name: Konunleikar Certificate of Merit
description: Participants in any of the Konunleikar games received a Certificate of Merit. Signed by Thane Mera, it is suitable for framing.

name: Signed Konunleikar Event Schedule
description: A broadsheet featuring the daily schedule of events for the Konunleikar festival. This one was signed by King Jorunn.

name: Three Banners War Pact Propaganda
description: A broadsheet trumpeting the Ebonheart Pact's claim to the Imperial throne, written in flowery, adjective-laden language.

name: Voljar Gift Certificate
description: A certificate that can be redeemed at Voljar's Meadery in Eastmarch for bottles or casks of mead.

name: The Bastard's Last Will and Testament
description: Many versions of the last will and testament of Yoregg the Bastard have turned up, but none have been deemed authentic. Yet.

name: Lion Guard Enlistment Form
description: Official enlistment form for the Lion Guard, signed and stamped but with the enlistee's name still waiting to be filled in.

name: Curious Parchment
description: This parchment bears a disturbing resemblance to human skin. It's probably just calf-skin. Right?

name: Quire of Fine Vellum
description: Twenty-four sheets of smooth ivory-colored kidskin parchment.

name: Shornhelm Triumvirate Official Parchment
description: Expensive parchment embossed with the Seal of Shornhelm and used by the ruling Triumvirate for official correspondence.

name: Provisioner's List
description: A list of groceries that need to be picked up at Mendyn Indrano's shop in Ebonheart.

name: Davon's Watch Banker's Note
description: The Bank of Davon's Watch provides every client with one of these receipts for items deposited in their vaults.

name: Davon's Watch Herald's Notes
description: Notes for tomorrow, used by the town criers who announce the news in the squares of Davon's Watch.

name: Fish-Skin Parchment
description: The pages of this catfish-skin parchment are remarkably wide. The beast must have been massive.

name: Gold Leaf Stationery
description: A mere glint of light turns this gilded stationery into a shining parchment.

name: Ornate Vellum Stationery
description: This gold-flecked stationery is smooth to the touch, and would serve as a fine writing surface.

name: Embossed Lion Guard Stationery
description: Special parchment with an embossed Lion Guard symbol, used for official correspondence and documentation.

name: Royal Wedding Invitation
description: This is an invitation to Duke Nathaniel's wedding to Princess Lakana at Alcaire Castle.

name: At-Tura Stationery
description: Count Hosni at-Tura had his insignia stamped onto these papers to be used for his personal correspondences.

name: Daggerfall Covenant Correspondence Sheets
description: A stack of stationery featuring the embossed seal of the Daggerfall Covenant. What it was doing in Eastmarch is anyone's guess.

name: Konunleikar Invitation
description: An invitation to an exclusive Konunleikar party limited to Windhelm's most important movers and shakers.

name: Official Dominion Stationery
description: A forger could use this stationery to make a tidy sum of money.

name: Feather Pillow
description: This long, fluffy pillow looks brand new, like no head ever rested upon it.

name: Canary Down Neck-Pillow
description: A small, soft pillow that makes sleeping out in the wilds almost feel like home.

name: Gold-Embroidered Pillow Case
description: King Fahara'jad invites many young ladyfriends to the palace. They receive a valuable pillow case when they depart.

name: Lusty Argonian Keepsake Pillow
description: The bawdy Lusty Argonian traveling tents of Bal Foyen gift these plush pillows to guests to remember each visit.

name: Crawling Night Pillow
description: Dhalmora Argonians fill their pillows with live centipedes—they love the sensation of wriggling creatures against their heads.

name: Dark Den Remembrance Pillow
description: The infamous Dark Den fest hall and brothel gifts these plush pillows to discerning guests upon the conclusion of their visit.

name: Raven-Feather Pillow
description: A small head pillow filled with fluffy raven feathers and featuring a traditional Nord design of clinking, overflowing tankards.

name: Wool-Filled Pillow
description: Eastmarch sheep produce a soft, fluffy wool—perfect as a filling for these comfortable travel pillows.

name: Baandari Horse Pillow
description: This padded pillow filled with seagull feathers and butterflies keeps a Baandari trader comfortable on long journeys.

name: Chaste Harpy Keepsake Pillow
description: The infamous Chaste Harpy fest hall gifts these plush pillows to discerning guests upon the conclusion of their visit.

name: Elder Down Pillow
description: This supple leather pillow is filled with the downy feathers of an aged duck.

name: Embroidered Silken Baandari Pillow
description: Silken pillow embroidered to depict the Great Gate of Corinthe, labeled "Property of Silver Moons Inn."

name: Embroidered Silk Silvenar Pillow
description: Silk-covered throw-pillow with embroidered scene showing a procession of Spinners being carried through Silvenar.

name: Downy Pillow
description: This pillow is made of high quality duck down.

name: Embroidered Tavern Pillow
description: Pillow or seat-cushion embroidered with an image of the Dusklight Inn of Hoarfrost Downs.

name: Embroidered Vivec's Antlers Pillow
description: Silken pillow with an embroidered image of Vivec drowning the Akaviri invaders at Vivec's Antlers.

name: Tasseled Pillow
description: A large pillow emblazoned with the Imperial ruby. Created from a lavish, finely-spun material, it is soft to the touch.

name: Fusozay Cushion
description: A Khajiit novelty cushion that, when placed on a chair and sat upon, produces an embarrassing flatulence sound.

name: Meerschaum Sweetgnat Kiseru
description: Long-shanked, small-bowled pipe carved from meerschaum, used in Karthdar for smoking small dried bugs like sweetgnats.

name: Curious Khajiiti Pipe
description: This stylish glass pipe smells faintly of moon sugar, and has a thin blue residue on the rim of the bowl.

name: Thunderbug-Shell Pipe
description: An enameled bug-smoking pipe with a capacious bowl formed from a thunderbug's carapace.

name: Skooma Pipe
description: This skooma pipe would sell well on the black market.

name: Enameled Clay Catnip Pipe
description: Catnip pipe painted with images from the tale "How Khenarthi Taught the Clouds to Dance."

name: Bramblebreach Pipe
description: A long and heavy pipe, constructed of smooth wood. The skilled craftsmanship sets it apart from others of its kind.

name: Festive Fingerbone Mouth Harp
description: Musical instrument, a set of reeded pipes of varying lengths carved from fingerbones and painted with bright festival hues.

name: Xal Thak Dental Marimba
description: Small marimba, with mallets, made of carefully-selected resonant reptile teeth on a nonatonic scale.

name: Ever-Blooming Bonsai Tree
description: Rectangular pot containing a living bonsai, a miniature Auridon Gorapple perpetually blossoming pink blooms.

name: Cut-Glass Slug Terrarium With Elden Tree
description: Delicate terrarium for pet slugs with three cut-glass sides and a ceramic Elden Tree sculpture for the slugs to climb on.

name: Branch of Falinesti
description: One of many counterfeit branches of the legendary moving tree of Falinesti.

name: Vivec's Antlers Land Coral Bonsai
description: Living sprig of land coral from Vivec's Antlers, in a redware pot depicting Vivec's drowning of the Akaviri.

name: Elaborate Hist Centerpiece
description: An imposing willow wood sculpture. Small polished jades have been inset between the roots to represent eggs.

name: Living Model of Elden Root
description: This painstakingly accurate model of the city of Elden Root was created using an actual, still-living miniature tree.

name: Potted Valenwood Flytrap
description: A rare carnivorous plant found only in the deepest forests of Valenwood. Its leaves are a powerful aphrodisiac.

name: Satin Roses
description: These delicate flowers were made by hand out of red satin. The long green stems look to be made of wood.

name: Dried Royal Bouquet
description: This bouquet of desiccated flowers was carried by one of the bridesmaids at King Emeric's wedding to Queen Maraya.

name: Angof's Angry Vines
description: Despite the probable danger, some citizens have begun collecting clippings of Angof's vines to display in their homes.

name: Rare Flowering Violet
description: A well-nurtured violet plant. Its purple flowers are quite lovely.

name: Glass Pedestal Cake Stand
description: Complete with a glass dome to keep unwanted pests away, this pedestal cake stand is perfect for displaying fresh cakes or pies.

name: Memorial Covenant Plate
description: A gold-tinged plate commemorating the formation of the Daggerfall Covenant, issued for the tenth anniversary of the alliance.

name: Covenant Commemorative Saucer
description: This saucer was decorated with the royal crest to commemorate the 5th anniversary of the Daggerfall Covenant.

name: Beetle Shell Cheese Plate
description: A plate designed to serve cheese, made from the shell of a giant beetle.

name: Bountiful Silver Plate
description: This large, silver plate is engraved with an image of Morwha, the Yokudan goddess of fertility.

name: Snow-Bourne Plate
description: An elegant crystal dinner plate bearing the crest of the Snow-Bourne clan, probably brought all the way from Windhelm.

name: Argonian Scale Beetle Cheese Plate
description: A plate designed to serve scuttle beetle cheese, made from Argonian scales (presumably prior to the formation of the Pact).

name: Ebonheart Commemorative Plate
description: This plate, decorated with the seals of Morrowind, Skyrim, and Black Marsh, commemorates the formation of the Ebonheart Pact.

name: Silver-Plated Souvenir Execution Plate
description: Plate embossed with an image of a Wood Orc hanging from a gallows, inscribed "The Hanging of Chief Orhg, Vulkwasten, 2E 578."

name: Skald-King Commemorative Plate
description: A hand-painted souvenir plate commemorating the coronation of Jorunn, the Skald-King.

name: Antique Silver Flatware
description: Four place settings of antique silver flatware set into a velvet-lined wooden box.

name: Fine Altmer Dishware
description: These extravagant porcelain plates look very out of place in Stros M'Kai.

name: Hallin's Stand Resistance Plates
description: Nobles in Hallin's Stand use these silver plates, engraved with the insignia of Sentinel, to show their true loyalties.

name: Bone Dishware
description: Bosmer dishes, carved from the bones of large game.

name: Mudcrab Shell Dinner Plates
description: A set of sturdy dinner plates fashioned from genuine mudcrab shells and engraved with Wood Elf symbology.

name: Engraved Copper Plates
description: A set of burnished copper flatware. Each piece has been stamped with the mark of the famous Argonian smith, Haj-Ja.

name: Silver Etched Cake Platter
description: The floral design etched into this cake platter is very elegant. You would not serve just any cake on this platter.

name: Silver Carving Platter
description: Heirloom silver carving platter, it bears the crest of a specific family of wealth and means.

name: Swamp Eel Serving Platter
description: A large, ornate platter, traditionally used to present and serve roasted swamp eel at Argonian feasts.

name: Pejureel's Party Platter
description: Chef Pejureel in Dhalmora sells a surprising number of these turtle-shell platters. Perfect for any party.

name: Bleakrock Crow Trio Platter
description: A platter designed to serve crow three ways: stuffed, roasted, and boiled. Crafted by the artisans of Thonarcal's Timberworks.

name: Hallin's Stand Silver Platter
description: This large silver platter is engraved with an image of the majestic city in Southern Bangkorai.

name: Mudcrab Serving Platter
description: This broad silver platter has several indentations for propping up steamed mudcrabs.

name: Kerbol's Serving Platter
description: The town of Kerbol's Hollow is known for its communal feasts, for which the mayor purchased many golden serving platters.

name: Silver Serving Platter
description: A grand silver platter with an etched rendering of Elinhir on the face.

name: Red Brittle Serving Platter
description: A beautiful platter crafted from red brittle, probably from before the dangers of unstable nirncrux were fully documented.

name: Guar Roast Serving Platter
description: A large, ornate platter, traditionally used to present and serve roast guar meat at Dark Elf dinner festivals.

name: Pinewood Party Platter
description: A large, rectangular platter of pinewood, perfect for piling high with Nord delicacies for the next Konunleikar.

name: Jarl's Silver Carving Platter
description: Commemorative silver carving platters, bearing the crest of a specific jarl, are crafted on his or her coronation day.

name: Roast Peacock Serving Platter
description: A large, ornate platter, traditionally used to present and serve peacock roasts prepared for High Elf festivals and banquets.

name: Spiced Brewet Serving Platter
description: A large, ornate platter, traditionally used to present and serve beef roasts prepared in wine and spices for Breton holidays.

name: Antique "Fort Zantonius" Serving Platter
description: Antique Imperial brass serving platter, with wooden handles, engraved with an image of (now-ruined) Fort Zantonius in its prime.

name: Deepwoods Thunderbug Serving Platter
description: Serving platter of lacquered thunderbug carapace, painted to depict the Green Lady Shrine in Deepwoods.

name: Mahogany "Dancing Duo" Serving Platter
description: Serving platter of imported mahogany, painted with a stylized depiction of Silvenar and Green Lady dancing a sarabande.

name: Two Moons Platter
description: A silver-plated platter embossed with the images of Jone and Jode.

name: Redguard Salted Mutton Platter
description: A platter designed to serve salted mutton, made in the distinctive style of the crafters of Sentinel.

name: Ash Mountain Serving Platter
description: Silverware platter with decorative engraving, inscribed "View of Ash Mountain from Senie, with Windmill."

name: "Eel-Strangler" Serving Platter
description: Traditional platter depicting a triumphant Lord Zuthorix the Eel-Strangler, who slew his enemies with conger-eel garrottes.

name: Nord Salted Mutton Platter
description: A platter designed to serve salted mutton, made in the distinctive style of the crafters of Riften.

name: Framed Duchess Portrait
description: This painting features the late Duchess of Wind Keep—a beautiful woman with eyes that betray a quiet grief.

name: Wax Portrait Card
description: This wax portrait card depicts simple but compelling artwork. A fence could resell this to collectors.

name: Small Canvas Portrait
description: The man in this portrait has eyes that follow you. Luckily, it is small enough to be shoved in a bag before becoming too creepy.

name: Firsthold Painting
description: A richly textured oil painting of the first settlement of Auridon.

name: Vulkhel Guard Harbor Painting
description: The detail of this painting is so vivid, one can practically hear the waves lapping against the docks.

name: Saint Pelin's Portrait
description: This striking portrait of Saint Pelin is one of several that formerly lined the halls of Bangkorai Garrison.

name: Disquieting Family Portrait
description: A somewhat disturbing portrait. Perhaps it's the way their eyes follow you. Or the rictus grins. Or the additional tail.

name: Narsis Dren Portrait
description: This signed, limited-edition portrait of the famed Dark Elf dungeon-delver can be found in the nightstands of ardent admirers.

name: Risque Boudoir Portrait
description: A portrait of a buxom young Nord wearing nothing but a horned helmet and a provocative smile.

name: The Brief Queen in Profile
description: A portrait of Queen Nurnhilde, dressed in full battle regalia, depicting her calm reflection before the siege of Windhelm.

name: Queen Mabjaarn's Risque Etching
description: Wild and carefree before taking up the crown, this revealing etching of Mabjaarn Flame-Hair is credited to Fjokki the Bard.

name: Hectahame Sketch
description: An artist's rendering of the mysterious ruin of Hectahame.

name: "Cheesemaker of Goldfolly" Engraving
description: Framed engraving of the famous scene showing the making of bat-cheese from the long-lost giant dairy bats of Goldfolly.

name: Portrait of the Mane
description: The great spiritual leader of the Khajiit is here captured in simple artistic style.

name: Painting of the Westwind Lighthouse
description: Framed oil painting of the famous Westwind Lighthouse, signed by the artist, Romain Jurard.

name: Painting of the Unknown Queen
description: A hauntingly beautiful woman stares out from this painting, known only as the Unknown Queen. Every wealthy household has a copy.

name: Disturbing Argonian Portrait
description: An Argonian family portrait, you find something mildly disquieting about the way the eyes follow you as you move.

name: Telvanni Wizard-Painting of Heimlyn Keep
description: Magical three-dimensional painting of Heimlyn Keep, quite old, signed "Keeper Vildras Telvanni."

name: Painting of "The Slave-Coffles of Thorn"
description: Small reproduction of the popular and heartbreaking silhouette-painting of the infamous House Dres slave-raid on Thorn.

name: Painting of the Brief Queen
description: A hauntingly beautiful Queen Nurnhilde stares out from this painting. Every wealthy household owns a copy of the Brief Queen.

name: Gold-Framed "Two Beacons" Diptych
description: Diptych, two oil paintings in a dual gilded frame, one of the South Beacon at dawn, the other of the North Beacon at night.

name: Painting of the First Altmeri Landfall
description: Gilded sunwood framing an oil painting depicting the ships from Aldmeris at Nine Prow Landing, with Torinaan stepping ashore.

name: Wilderking Sketch
description: A rare sketch of the legendary Wilderking, and worth a great deal to collectors and myth-hunters.

name: Miniature Portrait of Queen Ayrenn
description: The queen has never looked more stunning in two dimensions than in this locket-sized portrait.

name: Framed Snowflake Display
description: A framed display of various snowflakes, lovingly mounted and catalogued by a diligent Nord—before they melted.

name: Decorative Cheese Crock
description: A heavy, earthenware crock tinged with gold, designed to store strong and pungent cheeses for later consumption.

name: Gold-Tinged Nord Cheese Crock
description: A heavy earthenware crock tinged with gold, designed to store strong and pungent Nordic cheeses—without stinking up the house.

name: Fine Porcelain Chamber Pot
description: A prime example of High Elf craftsmanship, this pot appears to have been recently cleaned. The only scent you detect is roses.

name: Saint Pelin's Chamber Pot
description: This silver chamber pot was made by the Knights of Saint Pelin as a gift for wealthy donors among Evermore's nobility.

name: Covenant Chamber Pot
description: This silver plated chamber pot is engraved with the symbol of the Daggerfall Covenant. Fortunately, it has never been used.

name: Ceramic Dark Elf Chamber Pot
description: A lavishly decorated chamber pot of rich Morrowind earthenware, only slightly used.

name: Royal Camoran Travel Teapot
description: Self-heating brass travel pot for boiling beetle-tea, bearing the sigil of the Royal House of Camoran.

name: Ceramic Shornhelm Chamber Pot
description: A lavishly decorated chamber pot of rich Breton earthenware, only slightly used.

name: Copper Saltrice Steamer
description: Copper-bottomed double-boiler steamer, engraved with the motto "The Finest Saltrice comes from Sathram!"

name: Khajiiti Cast-Iron Baking Pot
description: Cast-iron casserole pot with cover for slow-baking sweet pastries, labeled "Property of Sathram Slave Quarters."

name: Kragenmoor Cook Pot
description: A distinctive cooking vessel with a square opening and a round base, it appeals to the aesthetics of the Elves of House Dres.

name: Earthenware Riften Chamber Pot
description: A lavishly decorated chamber pot of rich earthenware in the Nordic design, never used. You think.

name: Nord Fondue Pot
description: A small copper pot used to serve melted cheese, and eaten by dipping bread into it with long-stemmed forks.

name: First Era Dunmeri Tea Service
description: An antique tea service from the First Era, obviously a Dark Elf family heirloom.

name: Tamrith's Favorite Tea Pot
description: House Tamrith uses only imported Alik'r tea pots such as this one, sold exclusively at Broken-Yoke Mercantile in Shornhelm.

name: Marcy's Kawala Tea
description: This packet of tea comes with its own tea strainer, because the Kawala Tea of Marcy is not strained.

name: Porcelain Teapot
description: A unique mixture of clay was heated until it became smooth and translucent and then meticulously painted to create this teapot.

name: Antique Khajiiti Teapot
description: This finely polished teapot is covered in Khajiiti motifs and smells faintly of sweet grass.

name: Pouch of Bronzed Acorns
description: While it's not clear what purpose they served, this handful of acorns is secured by the drawstring of this satin pouch.

name: Concealed Valuables Pouch
description: A black silk pouch with attached hooks and wires, allowing it to be hidden within a variety of furniture.

name: Redguard Messenger Pouch
description: A large messenger pouch bearing the water symbol of Ra'Gada, the Warrior Wave. Used to carry letters and other correspondence.

name: Embroidered Purse
description: A supple leather pouch with a fish embroidery stitched in fine blue thread.

name: Pouch of Candied Gorapples
description: The contents of this pouch are pungent and inedible. Some thieves use them to throw off the scent of pursuing animals.

name: First Teeth Pouch
description: A satin draw-string "First Teeth" pouch, in the Imperial tradition. It could be resold once the teeth inside are discarded.

name: Royal Correspondence Pouch
description: King Emeric and Duke Nathaniel often exchange their correspondences in fancy leather pouches.

name: Leather Pouch
description: Typically used to hold coins, this pouch has already been relieved of its contents. The fine leather might be worth something.

name: Undead Expulsion Pouch
description: A small pouch containing blessed items. It is said to ward off some types of undead creatures.

name: Lamia-Scale Moon-Sugar Pouch
description: A pouch used for keeping moon-sugar safe and dry. Its Lamia-scale construction is illegal throughout most of Tamriel.

name: Satakalaam Love Pouch
description: Satakalaam nobles anonymously place scintillating notes in each others' love pouches as part of a bizarre adult game.

name: Kindlepitch Powder Pouch
description: A pouch made specifically to carry kindlepitch powder, the quartermasters of Fort Zeren designed it to be fire resistant.

name: Linnea's Wolf's Blight
description: The Bleakrock alchemist makes extra gold selling pouches filled with various herbs that supposedly ward off wolves.

name: Pouch of Parrot Food
description: Captain Lerisa's love of pets is well-known. This mixture of exotic seeds and nuts was made special for her prized parrots.

name: Troll-Hair Kindling Pouch
description: The troll hair in this pouch makes it much easier to start a fire in the wilds.

name: Pact Correspondence Pouch
description: The leaders of the Ebonheart Pact often exchange important correspondences in fancy leather pouches.

name: Kindlepitch Pouch
description: A pouch of kindlepitch, for igniting fires when you don't feel like using steel and flint.

name: Dragonscale Purse
description: This small purse, purported to be made of real dragonscale, features a silver clasp in the form of a stylized dragon.

name: Giantskin Pouch
description: Nord clerics who follow the older traditions use these bags to hold ritual components for religious ceremonies.

name: Bag of Gemstones
description: These gemstones should sell nicely on the black market.

name: Deerskin Gold Pouch
description: A small pouch made of embroidered deerskin, designed to hold gold or other valuables.

name: Dominion Envoy's Official Security Pouch
description: Sealable message pouch of waterproof leviathan hide displaying the golden eagle of the Dominion, for envoy's correspondence.

name: Camoran Dynasty Private Stock Bugsmoke
description: Pouch containing a double-handful of the special bugsmoke mix prepared exclusively for the royal family.

name: "Where's Falinesti?" Boardgame
description: Folding boiled-leather board with pouch of turquoise game pieces for the "Where's Falinesti?" casual boardgame.

name: Bosmeri Noble's Omnium-Gatherum
description: Combination folding corkscrew, pipe-cleaner, and crystal quizzing glass, with the crest of House Caerllin, in a chamois pouch.

name: "Traitor's Tor" Game
description: A travel-sized version of the strategy game that re-creates the last battle in Ranser's War.

name: Secreted Valuables Pouch
description: A cleverly designed pouch designed to be hidden within clothing so as to avoid the attention of pickpockets.

name: Firestarter Kit in Waterproof Pouch
description: Waterproof pig-bladder pouch labeled "Oldgate Meat Hut" containing flint, steel, and a quantity of tinder.

name: Orkey's Undead Ouster
description: A small pouch containing items blessed by a priest of Orkey, it is said to ward off all sorts of undead creatures.

name: Fine Leather Coin Purse
description: Someone spent a great deal of gold here. Judging by the state of the linens, it's best not to think about what they spent it on.

name: Argonian Tail Stocking
description: A specialty item with strategically placed pouches to hold warmed stones. Some Argonians just can't abide a cold tail.

name: Mantikora Teeth
description: A fine leather pouch filled with the massive molars of a full-grown mantikora.

name: Pouch of Thumb Tacks
description: This pouch of thumb tacks can be used to post handbills, keep maps in place, or cause great amounts of posterior distress.

name: Lizardskin Wallet
description: A wallet crafted from soft, fine lizardskin.

name: Gargoyle-Skin Wallet
description: Fashioned from the hardened skin of a gargoyle, this wallet could stop an arrow from piercing one's heart.

name: Errinorne Impskin Wallet
description: Pouch-wallet of finest lavender impskin, embossed with the sigil of House Errinorne of Skywatch.

name: Antique Riding Crop
description: A polished, well-made riding crop, from early in the Second Era. Many are stored away as heirlooms by Dark Elf families.

name: Red Asp Riding Crop
description: When he wants to make an impression, Ufa the Red Asp wields an ornate leather riding crop decorated with rubies and silver trim.

name: Suthay-Raht Riding Crop
description: Riding crop made of a tanned and cured Khajiit's tail, ending in six short knotted leather strips.

name: Riding Crop Heirloom
description: An elaborate riding crop, at least a century old. The suggestive patterning implies it never saw the inside of a stable.

name: Guar-Mount Riding Crop
description: Jointed shalk-leg riding crop made for steering a guar by flicking its cheeks, inscribed "Sulfur Pools Farm."

name: Knotted-Rope Frame
description: The pieces of knotted rope set in this small frame depicts various types of nautical knots.

name: Silk Rope
description: A strong and lightweight coil of rope.

name: Cyrodiil Battle Tassel
description: The distinctive tassel is often worn for luck by warriors preparing to enter battle in war-torn Cyrodiil.

name: Rock-Climbing Gear
description: Explorers and adventurers could find great use for this gear.

name: Kinhouse Tassel
description: A tassel hung from clothing to denote a Dark Elf's rank in his or her particular kinhouse.

name: Sheep's Gut Rope
description: Rope woven from sheep's gut, extra strong.

name: Crosswych Knotted Rope
description: A length of rope featuring Crosswych knots tied off at regular intervals, making it excellent for climbing.

name: Spelunking Tools
description: Valuable to any adventurer or cave delver, these spelunking tools are in excellent condition.

name: Stout Grass Rope
description: A coil of strong, fibrous rope. This sturdy weave is an old Argonian secret.

name: Spool of Twine
description: This tightly wound spool of twine has many uses, although its original owner probably used it to tie packets of letters.

name: Spidersilk Twine
description: A coil of rope braided from a thousand strands of silk meticulously gathered from spiders' webs.

name: Senche-Skin Overnight Bag
description: This fancy luggage item is made from the skin of a Senche Tiger. The tiger's claws and teeth are used as fasteners.

name: Ruby-Studded Book Bag
description: A lavishly decorated sack for carrying around books or other personal objects. It bears the symbol of House Hlaalu.

name: White Crocodile Hide Valise
description: A medium-sized travel bag fashioned from the hide of an extremely rare white crocodile.

name: Sabre-Skin Caddy Sack
description: A small sack made of oiled sabre-cat skin, perfect for holding and organizing personal items.

name: Amethyst-Studded Correspondence Bag
description: A lavishly decorated sack for carrying letters and other correspondence, it bears the symbol of the Aldmeri Dominion.

name: Sapphire-Studded Book Bag
description: A lavishly decorated sack for carrying around books or other personal objects. It bears the symbol of the Daggerfall Covenant.

name: Aswala Grandee's Saddle
description: To promote their horse-breeds, the Aswala family gifted these bejeweled saddles to several prominent nobles.

name: Knights of Saint Pelin Saddle
description: This weathered saddle was made for the Knights of Saint Pelin.

name: Magus-General's Saddle
description: This fancy Imperial saddle is made from fine leather and ebony adornments. It's also shaped to fit Septima Tharn's arse.

name: Gem-Encrusted Guar Saddle
description: This saddle, studded with precious gems and bearing the scales of House Hlaalu, is one of a select few gifted to master traders.

name: Senche-Tiger Saddle
description: If someone were to ride a senche-tiger, this is what they'd use.

name: Shornhelm Cavalry Saddle
description: A saddle bearing the mark of the once-famous Shornhelm Cavalry that used to patrol the Rivenspire roads.

name: Dres Guar Saddle and Caparison
description: Fancy silver-chased saddle and caparison for a riding guar, displaying the Kragenmoor Dres crest.

name: Riften Cavalry Saddle
description: A saddle bearing the mark of the once-famous Riften Cavalry that used to patrol roads throughout the Rift.

name: Longhaven Saddle
description: A master-crafted saddle that is as comfortable to sit on as its gold embroidery is valuable.

name: Red Rooks Missive
description: This sealed scroll, emblazoned with the Red Rooks bandits' symbol, only retains its value to a fence if it remains unopened.

name: Polished Leather Scroll Case
description: This scroll case still smells of ancient vellum and ink.

name: Dwemer Grocery List
description: This old list contains various ingredients that can no longer be found in Tamriel but may still be of interest to a historian.

name: Perfumed Letter
description: This heavily perfumed scroll contains a very suggestive missive from one noble to another. It is signed with a kiss.

name: Scroll of the Lonely Traveler
description: This parchment, neatly rolled and tied with leather, keeps adventurers company during long, lonely nights on the road.

name: Fahara'jad Decree of Mercy
description: Signed by King Fahara'jad, this document can get a criminal released from jail.

name: Elaborate Blueprints
description: These sketches are the handiwork of the scholar, Neramo. The images depict the inner workings of a Dwemer automaton.

name: Saint Pelin's Scroll Case
description: The Knights of Saint Pelin maintain a library of obscure historical scrolls at Bangkorai Garrison.

name: Tharn Family Scroll Case
description: This ostentatious scroll case is used by members of the Empire's ruling family to exchange correspondences.

name: Belkarth Broadsheet
description: A broadsheet featuring news of Craglorn and the Three Banners War, published irregularly and often woefully out of date.

name: House Hlaalu Marque of Trade
description: A House Hlaalu contract granting a merchant the right to conduct business throughout Deshaan until 31st Evening Star.

name: House Redoran Commendation
description: Scroll emblazoned with the House Redoran crest that bears a heartfelt commendation for an important service to the house.

name: Skald-King's Sonnet
description: Jorunn rarely gets to flex his bardic muscles any more, but he sometimes pens a poem as an acknowledgment for a personal favor.

name: Seaside Sanctuary Harbor Rights
description: A forger or a smuggler could make some coin selling these docking rights to Woodhearth's harbor.

name: Treaty Documents
description: A copy of Dominion treaty documents, valuable to forgers.

name: Lion Guard List of Outrageous Offenses
description: A list of personages currently out of favor with the Lion Guard.

name: Tarren Tolk's Tall Tales
description: Amusing and often bawdy anecdotes and fables detailing a Breton's adventures in Alik'r.

name: Daggerfall Guard Patrol Schedule
description: An unauthorized list of guard patrols and schedules for the Daggerfall Guard during the Bloodthorn crisis.

name: Royal Lineage Papers
description: These official papers detail a distant claim to the Daggerfall throne. A clever fence could easily ransom these documents.

name: Signed Heraldic Papers
description: These blank heraldic papers are signed by the Daggerfall Court. They would be worth a fortune to a forger.

name: Inspirational Illuminations of the Light
description: Every Breton's desk in Shornhelm has a list of inspirational quotes meaningful to the followers of the Light.

name: Lineage of House Ranser
description: These official papers detail a claim to the Shornhelm throne by a surviving yet distant relative of King Ranser.

name: Dunmeri Travel Writing Instruments
description: A case containing quills, inks, and parchment. Popularized by Morrowind natives, it is perfect for literate travelers on the go.

name: Lineage of Clan Ironhand
description: Official papers that detail a claim to the Skyrim throne by Clan Ironhand. Is someone trying to promote Thane Unnvald?

name: Signed Heraldic Document
description: These blank heraldic documents are signed by Thane Unnvald of Riften. They would be worth a small fortune to a forger.

name: Hand-Drawn Constellation Map
description: A meticulously detailed map of the stars. The Warrior, Mage, and Thief are the most prominent constellations.

name: Dragonstar Caravan Company Bill of Lading
description: Transportation charges with a summary of cargo and weight for a single delivery. It could be valuable to smugglers.

name: Recipe: Walla-Ri's Skooma
description: A complex recipe for an extremely pure and unusually strong form of skooma. A fence could sell this to many wealthy clients.

name: Pewter Seal
description: The owner of this seal probably feels very important when he uses it to stamp his initials into the wax that seals his letters.

name: Gold Coast Ink Stamp
description: A stamp used by the Gold Coast Mercenaries to seal their correspondences.

name: Crown Seal
description: This seal is used to mark correspondences between high-ranking Crown nobles.

name: Garrison Commander's Seal
description: A copy of the seal used by the Bangkorai Garrison's commander to correspond with Evermore.

name: King Eamond's Seal
description: This seal was affixed to all of King Eamond's personal correspondences. It is extremely valuable to a forger.

name: Corporate Seal
description: This heavy brass seal bears the mark of the Dragonstar Caravan Company.

name: Gladiator's Brand
description: A strange Daedric seal. Rumor has it that gladiators of Dragonstar Arena all bear this mark.

name: Maulborn Plague Seal
description: An engraved seal bearing the official stamp of the Maulborn, used to mark those afflicted with the Llodos plague.

name: Tribunal Temple Seal
description: An official seal bearing the mark of the Tribunal Temple and used to identify temple correspondence.

name: Daggerfall Royal Stamp
description: This official stamp belongs to Daggerfall's royal family. It could be extremely valuable to a forger.

name: Polished Woodblock Stamp
description: This hand-carved stamp produces an ornate Khajiiti design when inked and pressed to paper.

name: Dominion Customs Inspector's Tags
description: A half-dozen Customs Inspector's cargo tags, marked "Pre-Inspected—Do Not Delay." A smuggler would pay a premium for these.

name: "Fists of Thalmor" Seal Stamp
description: A bronze seal stamp embossed on its face with a "Fists of Thalmor" symbol.

name: Great Seal of Silvenar
description: Heavy, fist-sized silver stamp embossed with the Municipal Seal of Silvenar, which still shows traces of green wax from use.

name: Shornhelm Royal Stamp
description: An official stamp used by the Triumvirate of Shornhelm. A forger would pay much for this.

name: Riften Jarl's Stamp
description: An official stamp created especially for the jarls of Riften. Forgers would find this extremely valuable.

name: Fallowstone Hall Signet Stamp
description: A metal sealing wax stamp bearing the official seal of Fallowstone Hall.

name: Blackcaster Mage Insignia
description: A small seal that bears the image of one of the Apex Towers in Elinhir.

name: First Era Imperial Seal
description: An ancient seal bearing the image of Saint Alessia. She's depicted cradling the mythical Amulet of Kings.

name: Thalmor Signet Set
description: A small gold case containing a set of official Thalmor signet stamps and a parcel of sealing wax.

name: Sealing Wax
description: A partially-melted stick of red wax, used for sealing letters.

name: Firebrand Sealing Wax
description: The Knights of the Flame use this specific type of wax to seal their correspondences.

name: House Hlaalu Sealing Wax
description: A stick of sealing wax sold by the merchants of House Hlaalu and used throughout Deshaan and beyond.

name: Leather Armor Wax
description: Resplendent Protection in Aldcroft guarantees this wax will keep your leather smooth and supple.

name: Crimson Sealing Wax
description: A stick of cherished Grahtwood beeswax, dyed a deep red.

name: Musk-Scented Sealing Wax
description: A stick of pink insect wax with a pronounced musky aroma.

name: Northpoint Sealing Wax
description: A stick of sealing wax sold by the merchants of Northpoint and used throughout Rivenspire and beyond.

name: Ritual Daedra Skull
description: A scamp skull, carved with strange glyphs and arcane symbols, most likely for unlawful ritualistic purposes.

name: Memento Mori
description: A collection of personal mementos: a lock of hair, a small chip of bone, a scale fragment, and other sentimental items.

name: Ornate Skull Goblet
description: This was fashioned from the skull of a fallen Bloodthorn Cultist. At least they're good for something.

name: Troll Skull Slumgullion Serving Bowl
description: Serving bowl made from a troll skull, with jawbone ladle, for serving Jaqspur's Slumgullion, i.e., Whatever-We-Caught-Soup.

name: Giant Bat Skull Paperweight
description: Exotic paperweight made from the skull of a giant bat from Shadowfate Cavern.

name: Decorative Goblin Skull With Ruby Eyes
description: Painted ornamental Goblin skull, with ruby eyes, mounted on a plaque that reads, "Former Defiler of Hightide Hollow."

name: Shrew-Skull Jar-Top Opener
description: Fancy jar-top opener that uses the open-mouthed skull of a giant shrew, labeled "Courtesy of Beleth's Swamp Food."

name: Ornamental Crocodile Skull
description: Superb decorated crocodile skull, ornamented with golden fangs, amethyst-geode eyes, and bird-of-paradise feathers.

name: Silken Arm-Sling
description: This sling was crafted to help a wounded soldier care for a broken arm.

name: Dunmeri Battle Sling
description: A guar-hide sling designed to support injured arms while still allowing enough mobility to return a wounded Dark Elf to battle.

name: Khajiit Tail Sling
description: A snake-skin sling that supports the proud Khajiit tail. It protects tails from injury or cradles injured tails while they heal.

name: Orcish Battle Sling
description: A crocodile-hide sling designed to support injured arms while still allowing enough mobility to return a wounded Orc to battle.

name: Lion Guard Spyglass
description: This spyglass, engraved with the Lion Guard crest, contains a secret compartment for carrying important items or documents.

name: Burnished Spyglass
description: A finely polished collapsible telescope.

name: Gold Coast Spyglass
description: This spyglass was originally intended for nautical use. The symbol of the Gold Coast Trading Company is stamped onto the side.

name: Commemorative Spyglass
description: An expensive spyglass, handed out at a noble's party as a gift to favored guests.

name: Brass Spyglass
description: There's hardly a dent in this beautiful spyglass.

name: Heavy Wooden Spyglass
description: A gift from Bhosek to his most trusted lieutenants. While the wood is beautifully carved, the optics are far from precise.

name: Murcien's Spyglass
description: Military officers stationed in Murcien's hamlet use these spyglasses to watch for signs from across the river in Evermore.

name: Star-Gazer's Optical Instrument
description: A spyglass specifically designed to gaze into the night sky and chart the movement of the stars.

name: Jaqspur Captain's Arboreal Spotting Scope
description: Brass folding telescope with wristband, used by arboreal archers for spotting targets; made by Greenwarden Forge.

name: Northpoint Commemorative Spyglass
description: An expensive spyglass, sold in Northpoint and bearing the name and seal of the seafaring city on its polished wood casing.

name: Renrijra Captain's Perspective Glass
description: Fine brass folding telescope of Khajiiti manufacture, marred slightly by salt-water corrosion.

name: Jeweled Kaleidoscope
description: A beautifully ornate kaleidoscope, trimmed in gold and encrusted with multicolored gems.

name: Colovian Cipher Device
description: A brass cylinder of rotating disks, engraved with letters and connected by a central axle, used to decipher Colovian messages.

name: Fahara'jad's Rod Replica
description: A replica of the royal staff carried by King Fahara'jad, this rod is often given as a gift by Forebear nobles to their children.

name: Carved Mahogany Walking Stick
description: An elegant walking stick. Perfect for a low-impact Sundas stroll—or for making an impression at parties.

name: Engraved Alik'r Walking Stick
description: This is one of a handful of walking sticks King Fahara'jad gave as gifts to the nobles of Wayrest at his daughter's wedding.

name: Velothi Expedition-Staff
description: A distinctive walking staff used by the Chimer during their migration to Morrowind following the prophet Veloth in antiquity.

name: Tribunal Walking Stick
description: Vivec gifted Jorunn and his thanes with ornate walking sticks, which were duplicated and sold to Windhelm's elite.

name: Troll Bone Measuring Stick
description: This long, perfectly straight troll bone has been notched to help measure short lengths.

name: Star-Gazer's Walking Stick
description: Sings-to-Stumps, a Belkarth carpenter, crafts these simple walking sticks for Star-Gazers and anyone who does a lot of walking.

name: Mabrigash Walking Stick
description: One of several walking sticks with carved symbols of the Ghost Snake. Provided as gifts by the Farseer Bodani.

name: Measuring Wand
description: A small length of tapered wood featuring incremental slashes used for determining the measure of things.

name: Dragon Cult Walking Stick
description: This walking stick features a coiled dragon wrapped around the shaft and probably belonged to an illegal worshipper of Alduin.

name: Crafter's Ruler
description: Cuts-with-the-Grain swears by this measuring stick, which is engraved with the words "measure twice, cut once."

name: Sabre Cat Walking Stick
description: A finely-crafted wooden walking stick with a silver tip and a handle carved in the appearance of a sabre cat's head.

name: Marble Bust of Prince Naemon
description: Bust of Queen Ayrenn's younger brother sculpted from white marble by Aurelenya of Firsthold.

name: Deadwood Knickknack
description: A chunk of deadwood carved to resemble a monkey and mounted to a block for display, most likely by a Khajiit, just because.

name: Ancient Saxhleel Statue
description: Likely taken from one of the Argonian ruins near Hissmir, this statue depicts a crouching Argonian holding a stylized turtle.

name: Ebony Kwama Scrib
description: This exquisite ebony statue, depicting the hero of the Dark Elf fairy tale, is part of a limited series by the sculptor Nerile.

name: Volcanic Rock Kwama Scrib
description: This exquisite statue, depicting the hero of the Dark Elf fairy tale, is part of a limited series by the sculptor Nerile.

name: Brazen Minatory Ordinator Bust
description: Brass bust of a disapproving ordinator; its eyes seem to follow one around the room.

name: Yokudan House Idol
description: An antique-looking statue, about the size of a wine glass, modeled after the house idols popular with the Yokudan people.

name: Indistinct Marble Bust
description: This marble bust appears to be of a bald Elf. The features are too generic to make out who it is.

name: Sotha Sil Statuette of Dwarven Metal
description: Dwarven-metal statuette of Sotha Sil as a Dwarven Centurion, inscribed "Crafted by Zephalas at Armature's Upheaval."

name: Brothers of Strife Sculpture
description: Sculpture depicting the Brothers of Strife, carved from a single large feldspar crystal.

name: Mother Morrowind Fertility Fetish
description: Iridescent green-gold glassite statuette of a beatific Almalexia, arms crossed over her pregnant belly.

name: Dibella's Bosom Night Favor
description: A bust of the god of beauty and erotic instruction, kept in Nord bedchambers to make nightly activities more ... invigorating.

name: Ever-Dipping Cliff Racer Statuette
description: Exquisite hand-carved cliff-racer statuette that pivots on a hip-hinge, forever dipping its beak and then straightening up.

name: Whittled Cat Head
description: A knob of wood whittled into the shape of a cat's head.

name: Golden Sword-Singer Bust
description: This golden bust was modeled after the head of one of the most notable Sword-Singers in the history of the Alik'r.

name: Marble Bust of Queen Ayrenn
description: Bust of the Queen of Alinor sculpted from white marble by Aurelenya of Firsthold.

name: Thane Jeggi's Drinking Tankard
description: A large, ornate flagon bearing the mark of Thane Jeggi Gap-Tooth. It is said he has these hidden throughout the Nine Holds.

name: Breton Travel Mug
description: A sturdy pewter mug designed to withstand the rigors of travel. Decorated with symbols familiar to anyone from High Rock.

name: Antler-Fur's Choice Drinking Mug
description: The select ale brewed at Fort Amol's Deldwine's Inn is only served in these mugs. They are decorated with tiny antlers.

name: Double-Sided Nightcap Toasting Mug
description: Rare double-sided amberware mug, used by kinlords and kinladies for toasting each other with a nightcap at bedtime.

name: Rustic Wooden Mead Mugs
description: Crafted by woodworkers at Sand and Dust, these oversized drinking vessels were popularized by Thane Unnvald at his inauguration.

name: House Baelborn Ornate Stein
description: An ornate drinking vessel that bears the crest of House Baelborn of Glenumbra.

name: Engraved Stein
description: A polished steel stein featuring an elaborate engraving of a man fighting a bear.

name: Pewter Beer Stein
description: This stein could hold a substantial amount of refreshing liquid.

name: Konunleikar Drinking Helm
description: The Royal Crafters only made a handful of these commemorative helmets that feature four mugs of ale and a straw to drink from.

name: Altmer Travel Mug
description: A sturdy drinking cup designed to withstand the rigors of travel, made of pewter or wood, and decorated with High Elf symbols.

name: "Hearty Hoarvor" Jagga Tankard
description: Tankard made of alit cuir bouilli infused with the distinctive aroma of jagga; displays the crest of the "Hearty Hoarvor."

name: Ornate Dead Wolf Tankard
description: The Dead Wolf Inn in Shornhelm uses specially crafted tankards engraved with the famous dead wolf with lolling tongue symbol.

name: Jester's Day Dribble Tankard
description: Hilarious joke tankard with a dribble-hole below the brim, bearing the crest of The Sloshing Tankard Inn.

name: Fell's Run Champion Mug
description: A pewter tankard awarded to the weekly winner of the Fell's Run Drinking Competition.

name: "Ebony Flask" Shein Stein
description: Black-enameled limeware tankard with pewter lid, showing the sigil of the Ebony Flask in Ebonheart.

name: Flagon From the Withered Tree
description: The famous tavern in Riften distributes these souvenir flagons featuring an engraving of a withered tree to favored customers.

name: Ornate Tapped Vein Tankard
description: The Tapped Vein Tavern in Shor's Stone uses specially crafted tankards engraved with the famous motto: Drink, Die, Drink Again.

name: Covenant Tankard
description: A standard-issue steel tankard. No Daggerfall Covenant officer would be caught dead in the field without one.

name: Dragonstar Arena Tankard
description: A gaudy drinking vessel bearing the symbols of the recently opened Dragonstar Arena, sold to audience members as souvenirs.

name: Nilata Crystal Shard
description: This is a lifeless shard broken off an Ayleid crystal in the Nilata Ruins.

name: Glowing Shard
description: A sharp glowing shard of arcane enegy collected outside of Spellscar.

name: Slaughterfish Cooking Rock
description: A wide, flat, well-oiled rock that makes a perfect cooking vessel for splayed slaughterfish, a Bleakrock delicacy.

name: Piece of Fallen Sky
description: This jagged chunk of cold, blue rock apparently fell out of the lights in the sky—along with other unusual objects.

name: Rare Fossil
description: This well-preserved shell was likely found on the beaches outside Haven.

name: Carved Pumice Stone
description: This block of abrasive rock has been carved to fit the hand, making it easier to erase ink from parchment.

name: Ebony Whetstone
description: This valuable whetstone once belonged to General Godrun.

name: Aldmeri Nautical Waystone
description: A magical stone used to guide Aldmeri ships to their destinations in ancient times.

name: Hoonding's Prayer Stone
description: A smooth stone engraved with a quote: "Be resolute, fear no sacrifice, and surmount every difficulty to win victory."

name: Green Clay Eyepads
description: Eyepads placed over the eyes at night to help prevent wrinkles. Less expensive than the magicka-infused variety used by nobles.

name: Brightly Glowing Malondo Stone
description: Nearly-depleted Malondo Stone emits a brilliant golden glow; engraved "Souvenir of Quendeluun."

name: Seamount Clan Law-Stone
description: A lovingly polished stone that was engraved with all the laws of Clan Seamount. Use and age have rendered it illegible.

name: Chipped Stone From Skyshroud Barrow
description: This piece of cracked masonry contains etchings that identify it as originating at Skyshroud Barrow in Bleakrock.

name: Majolrun's Warming Bath Stones
description: Majolrun of Bleakrock makes a nice side business by providing stones enchanted to keep bath water and bedsheets warm and comfy.

name: Cracked Yokudan Memory Stone
description: Unstable images and vague, distant voices swirl and flicker around this broken relic.

name: Piece of the Palace of Ysgramor
description: A chunk of stone from the damaged Palace of Ysgramor. A number of these have illegally found their way into Nord homes.

name: Lorkrata Hills Keepsake
description: A small stone, possibly Ayleid in origin, found in the Lorkrata Hills and kept as a memento.

name: Unusual Stone From the Lorkrata Hills
description: This stone might be an Ayleid relic … or not. Stones of this kind are highly sought after for their colorful striations.

name: Brothers of Strife Gemstone Bookends
description: Sculptural bookends carved from chrysolite to look like the Brothers of Strife, leaning into a row of books from each end.

name: Unusual Stone From Northwind Mine
description: This stone might be an ancient Dwemer relic … or not. Its strange glowing specks make it quite valuable.

name: Khenarthi's Roost Paperweight
description: Chunk of rose quartz cut into the shape of the island, inscribed "Compliments of Mistral Treasury" on the bottom.

name: Corner of Bewan's Fabled Trinimac Altar
description: Broken chunk of sculpted marble, glowing slightly, said to have come from Bewan's long-lost altar to Trinimac.

name: Orc Challenge Stone
description: According to legend, an Orc would place this stone on his shoulder and dare an opponent to knock it off to accept a duel.

name: Guardian Stone
description: A greywacke stone depicting one of the three guardian constellations.

name: Depleted Welkynd Stone
description: Dull welkynd stone, depleted of the ancient magicka that once made it glow, engraved with the Ayleidoon "L" for Loriasel.

name: Rahni'Za Whetstone
description: An expertly cut whetstone, given to students at the Rahni'Za sword school.

name: Nord Sharpening Stone
description: A whetstone etched with Nord symbology, used to grind and hone the edges of steel tools and implements.

name: Signaling Sun Dial
description: This sun dial serves two purposes: it tells time but also doubles as a heliograph to send messages across the battlefield.

name: Kozanset Window Sundial
description: This small sundial is designed to sit in a window and help the chefs at the Kozanset ovens monitor their cook-times.

name: Evermore Officer's Sundial
description: This small sundial has diamonds on the gnomon. King Eamond required his generals carry these to ensure their punctuality.

name: Silver Moondial
description: This small silver tool is covered in stylized constellations that glow in the dark. It provides direction on moonless nights.

name: Shalk-Resin Window Sundial
description: A sundial made of shalk resin, small enough to sit on a windowsill, used to track cooking times in complex Dunmeri recipes.

name: Bronze Windowsill Sundial
description: A sundial made of bronze, small enough to sit on a windowsill, used to track cooking times in complex Breton recipes.

name: Ebony Mephala Idol
description: This priceless little idol is shaped like a spider and used in the secret worship of the Daedric Prince, Mephala.

name: Falinesti Idol
description: A small carving of the mysterious moving tree of Falinesti.

name: Golden Anvil of Zenithar
description: A small, golden anvil, awarded to members in good standing of the Daggerfall Merchants Guild.

name: Stendarr Pendant
description: A pendant on a silver chain, worn to invoke the protection of Stendarr.

name: Carved Dragon Figurine
description: A devotional carving representing the dragon-god Akatosh.

name: Unknown Holy Symbol
description: A religious icon from an earlier age, the god it represents has been long forgotten.

name: Oaken Fertility Totem
description: This finely crafted icon was carved for Hunt-Wife Lurgush. It depicts a pregnant Orc holding a large acorn.

name: Star-Gazer's Lapel Pin
description: An ornate pin, traditionally worn on the right side of the chest, that identifies the wearer as a member of the Star-Gazers.

name: Shad Astula Graduation Pin
description: A pin given to students who complete their studies at the Shad Astula Academy of Magic.

name: Jarl's Best Sleeve Pin
description: An ornate pin, traditionally worn on the right sleeve. It identifies the wearer as a favored servant of a jarl.

name: Gem-Studded Snowflake Hat Pin
description: An exquisite hat-pin, shaped like a snowflake and studded with fine gems, is the perfect accompaniment to any bonnet.

name: Treethane's Seal
description: A replica of Treethane Fariel's official seal. A forger would find this quite valuable.

name: Daggerfall Adventurers Club Lapel Pin
description: An ornate pin, traditionally worn on the left collar, it identifies the wearer as a member of Daggerfall's Adventurers Club.

name: One Lion Tooth Earring
description: A single lion tooth earring, fashioned from semi-precious stones. Its mate appears to have been lost somewhere along the way.

name: Camoran Chamberlain Badge
description: Platinum lapel badge displaying the sigil of the Camoran Dynasty, as worn by the royal chamberlains.

name: Thalmor Canonreeve's Sigil Pendant
description: Jeweled eagle pendant worn as a symbol of office by a Canonreeve of the Thalmor.

name: Treethane's Ceremonial Gorget
description: Symbol of office, a Treethane's neckpiece, sporting an avian design picked out in iridescent feathers of green and turquoise.

name: Daggerfall Covenant Hair Pins
description: Fancy hair pins bearing a lion, the symbol of the Daggerfall Covenant, found in homes throughout Rivenspire and beyond.

name: House Tamrith Holy Symbol
description: A religious icon bearing the crest of House Tamrith and the Light of Arkay symbol, sparingly distributed to house members.

name: Diamond-Studded Julianos Lapel Pin
description: An exquisite lapel-pin, in the shape of Julianos' triangle and studded with diamonds, is a favorite accessory for any mage.

name: Hlaalu "Golden Scales" Paperweight
description: Small gold paperweight in the form of a pair of scales, the symbol of House Hlaalu.

name: Ulathi Silver Spiderweb Armlet
description: Jewelry of the Ulath Ashlanders, a fine silver armlet worked in the semblance of a spiderweb to honor Mephala.

name: White Rose Warden's Knout Brooch
description: White Rose Prison Warden's symbol of office, a platinum brooch in the shape of a truncheon ending in a short three-lashed whip.

name: First Era Rank Insignia
description: A rank insignia bar from the First Era, when a now-forgotten king tried to fancify and standardize Nord military wear.

name: Holy Symbol of Jhunal
description: A religious icon bearing an owl, the symbol of the god of knowledge, it's rare to find one of these among the warlike Nords.

name: Diamond-Studded Kyne Lapel Pin
description: An exquisite lapel-pin, in the shape of Kyne's soaring hawk and studded with diamonds, is a favorite accessory for any Nord.

name: Golden Azurah Icon
description: Golden icon depicting Azurah as a Khajiit with eight-pointed pupils in her wide, oversized eyes.

name: Royal Progress Commemorative Brooch
description: Silver and diamond brooch worn to celebrate Queen Ayrenn's current Royal Progress through Auridon.

name: Royal Battlereeve's Command Baton
description: This symbol of command for a Royal Battlereeve is fashioned of yellow sunwood and capped with a glowing Malondo Stone.

name: Gilt Star-Gazer Sigil
description: A shining seal worn by senior members of the academic order known as the Star-Gazers.

name: Holy Symbol of Y'ffre
description: This elaborately painted clay symbol molded into the shape of Y'ffre, the Forest God, was sparingly distributed to his priests, the "Spinners."

name: Resolutes of Stendarr Pin
description: A silver pin identifying its wearer as a member of the group "The Resolutes of Stendarr." A thief or a conman would prize this.

name: Etched Troll Tooth
description: A large tooth taken from the mouth of a troll. An unknown scrimshander etched Kyne's War Prayer into the enamel.

name: Wooden Serpent Totem
description: A rough-hewn totem shaped to resemble the Serpent constellation.

name: Bramble-Band of Brackenleaf's Briars
description: Armband of living, interwoven bramble-vines. It symbolizes those brave enough to qualify as one of Brackenleaf's Briars.

name: Dibella Napkin Holders
description: Each of these fashionable napkin holders was molded into a voluptuous depiction of the goddess of beauty.

name: Glass Spice Shakers
description: A pair of spherical glass shakers painted to resemble the Tamrielic moons. They appear to be of Khajiiti origin.

name: Exotic Bosmer Spice Shakers
description: Something smells ... off ... about these spice shakers, but they should fetch a good price from gourmets.

name: Matching Silver Spice Shakers
description: A set of silver spice shakers, in stylized shapes of Knights of the Dragon. Made exclusively by Metalworks of Daggerfall.

name: Matching Ivory Spice Shakers
description: A set of ivory spice shakers, in stylized shapes of bat-winged men. Considered to be in poor taste by certain Rivenspire nobles.

name: Brothers of Strife Spice Shakers
description: A set of matching spice containers fashioned to look like the Brothers of Strife statues in Stonefalls.

name: Matching Mammoth Tusk Spice Shakers
description: Mammoth tusk spice shakers, in the stylized shapes of a fox and a bear. Made exclusively at the Ringing Anvil in Riften.

name: Argonian Spice Shaker
description: A ceramic container with shaker holes in its lid, designed to hold spice and dispense small amounts.

name: Spider-Shaped Trivet
description: A small metal plate, shaped like a spider, with short legs designed to protect a tabletop. This design is popular in Stonefalls.

name: Carved Shell Dish
description: This intricately carved seashell can be used as a tray to hold jewelry.

name: Porcelain Sheep Tureen
description: The top of this well-crafted porcelain sheep can be removed to reveal its use as an elaborate serving dish.

name: Pewter Gravy Boat
description: This gravy boat is shaped like an actual boat.

name: Glazed-Clay Nix-Hound Tureen
description: The top of this well-crafted clay nix-hound can be removed to reveal its use as an elaborate serving dish.

name: Crocodile Gravy Boat
description: A gravy boat in the shape of a crocodile, crafted by artisans from central Tamriel.

name: Wasso-Leaf Napkins
description: A roll of light and aromatic napkins fashioned from the leaves of a prized wasso plant.

name: Matching Imperial Spice Shakers
description: A set of ivory spice shakers, in stylized shapes of Imperial Knights, made exclusively by crafters in Cyrodiil.

name: Morrowind Fungus Grater
description: Captain Rana had a number of these graters sent to Bleakrock so its residents would never be without perfect fungus shavings.

name: Porcelain Beetle Tureen
description: The top of this well-crafted porcelain beetle can be removed to reveal its use as an elaborate Wood Elf serving dish.

name: Silver Gravy Boat
description: The craftsmanship of this vessel is exquisite. It appears to be the work of a Skywatch silversmith.

name: Gargoyle Head Spice Shakers
description: These gargoyle heads from southern Bangkorai were hollowed out to hold spices. The spice can be poured out from the eye sockets.

name: Eagle-Shaped Gravy Boat
description: A simple, themed gravy boat. Useful and aesthetically pleasing.

name: Dragon Gravy Boat
description: A gravy boat in the shape of a dragon, crafted by Ceramic Masterpieces of Skyrim.

name: Warped Oaken Flatware
description: These plates appear to have been "sung" into existence using Wood Elf magic.

name: Three-Tier Serving Tower
description: Made of clear glass, each tier of this serving tower is smaller than the preceding one.

name: Glass Serving Tray
description: This tray is carefully placed and bears a thin layer of dust.

name: Silver Tea Tray
description: This tea tray has been polished so well you can see your reflection in it.

name: Cutting Board
description: A solid cutting board with only a few knife nicks in the wood.

name: Shellbug Jewelry Tray
description: Polished to a smooth shine, this piece of Shellbug Chitin could be used to hold jewelry or coins.

name: Stoneware Serving Tray
description: Perfect for bringing food to the table, this stoneware serving tray has a handle on each side for easy transportation.

name: Commemorative Pact Mudcrab Claw
description: A mudcrab claw inscribed with the dragonhead of the Ebonheart Pact, Fetches-Glitter distributes these to honor the alliance.

name: Shrunken Hagraven Head
description: An ancient, shrunken head of a Hagraven, thought by Reachmen to be a powerful talisman of good luck.

name: Stonefire Molag Bal Effigy
description: A likeness of Molag Bal, intricately carved from solid obsidian with ruby eyes. Used by Stonefire Cultists in dark ceremonies.

name: Lucky Wolf's Foot
description: A huge wolf paw affixed to a sturdy iron chain. It would be worth much to bandits and other tacky dressers.

name: Mummified Monkey Paw
description: Considered an item of good fortune by the Wood Elves, this mummified monkey paw is nevertheless kind of creepy.

name: Baandari Elder's Bear-Fur Fez
description: Glossy black bear-fur fez with squirrel-tail tassel in the style favored by the Master Pedlars of Redfur Trading Post.

name: Ranser's Lucky Skeever's Foot
description: One of the lucky charms enchanted by the court magician Reezal-Jul, this was likely carried into battle by King Ranser himself.

name: Red Squirrel Paw
description: The preserved paw of a rare red squirrel, considered by many Khajiit to be a good luck charm.

name: Temple Location Talisman
description: A small charm, imbued with an enchantment that always points it toward the Tribunal Temple in Mournhold.

name: Hunter's Golden Charm
description: This small golden bear figurine is said to have been blessed by Hircine himself.

name: Crocodile Charm
description: A charm made from the skin and teeth of a crocodile. They are distributed to the Dro-Dara Plantation's most esteemed visitors.

name: Iron Orc Arrow Head
description: A souvenir from a battle or a lucky charm found in the wilderness, this arrowhead is clearly in the rough Iron Orc style.

name: Deathclaw Ordure
description: A hunter in Bleakrock sells these petrified piles produced by the giant bat as good luck charms of a sort.

name: Breton Love Charm
description: A charm believed to improve the love life, especially popular among Breton nobles and merchant lords.

name: "Undead Repelling" Arkay Talisman
description: Talisman bearing the symbol of Arkay, said by the Keepers of the Ossuary of Telacar to repel the undead.

name: Blood-Curse Talisman
description: A talisman sold in all of Rivenspire's cities, they began appearing shortly after the start of the so-called blood-curse.

name: Talisman of Saint Octavien
description: Bronze talisman depicting the Breton Saint Octavien, a Priest of Arkay slain with a scythe by Daedra-worshipers.

name: Blood-Curse Charm
description: A talisman sold in the alley behind Occult Obsession in Shornhelm, it is said to ward off the blood-curse ravaging Rivenspire.

name: Riften Location Talisman
description: A small charm, imbued with an enchantment that always points it toward the city of Riften.

name: Wizard's Malachite Syrabane Talisman
description: Malachite talisman carved to represent the Ring of Syrabane, said to increase the efficacy of spells, from the Eldritch Seal.

name: Giant's Lucky Thumb
description: A petrified thumb, taken from an unlucky giant and now considered a good luck charm by some superstitious Nord.

name: Viridian Tree Charm
description: This charm is carved from soft wood and shaped like a tree. The tree's leaves are emeralds, making the charm extremely valuable.

name: Mammoth's Tusk Lucky Charm
description: The tip of a mammoth's tusk carved by Jorven Oldhammer, studded with nine bluesnow diamonds—one for each of the Nine Holds.

name: Amber Wyrd Charm
description: A good luck charm crafted and blessed by the Wyrd Sisters. It is rare to find such a charm outside the forests of Daenia.

name: Charm of Ill Omens
description: A small charm, reportedly found in Hozzin's Folly, it is said to bring dark thoughts and ill fortune to whoever possesses it.

name: Pilferer's Ward
description: A small charm placed with valuable objects to repel thieves, burglars, robbers, and other criminal elements.

name: Deepcrag Kwama Charm
description: This charm made from the chitin of a kwama warrior is one of several given to esteemed visitors to the Deepcrag Den kwama mine.

name: Oldgate Location Talisman
description: A small charm, imbued with an enchantment that always points it toward Oldgate in Rivenspire.

name: Wyrd Sisters' Wolf Charm
description: This hand-carved wooden wolf charm is sacred to the Wyrd Sisters of Viridian Wood.

name: Hunter's Hircine Good-Luck Talisman
description: Small brass totem of an antlered Wood Elf, with a green gem pendant on its chest.

name: Winter Warding Talisman
description: A talisman sold in back alleys, it supposedly keeps Argonians warm despite the cold of the Rift, but keep a blanket handy.

name: Colorful Tapestry
description: An elaborate woven tapestry depicting scenes of knights and mages doing battle with mudcrabs.

name: Tall Papa's Starry Tapestry
description: This tapestry was fashioned by a Crown artisan to depict the starry sky over the desert.

name: Phaer Tapestry
description: This tapestry is elegantly woven, depicting an idyllic scene in the village of Phaer.

name: Lighthouse Tapestry
description: A finely woven tapestry depicting the Saintsport Lighthouse at dusk.

name: Saint Pelin's Fall Tapestry
description: This tapestry depicts the heroic sacrifice made by Saint Pelin when an army of vampires sieged Bangkorai Garrison.

name: Alik'r Bath Rug
description: A fine bath rug, imported from a small boutique in Sentinel. It features an attractive yet simple Redguard design.

name: Oldgate Lancers Tapestry
description: Rolled-up tapestry depicting the Oldgate Lancers in the Charge of the Shornhelm Knights at the Battle of Glenumbria Moors.

name: Spidersilk Kragenmoor Tapestry
description: Rolled-up tapestry of woven spidersilk depicting a street scene in Kragenmoor, with Dark Elves, guar, and Argonian slaves.

name: White Rose Prison Tapestry
description: Rolled-up Imperial tapestry depicting a fortification in a teeming swamp, embroidered "Souvenir of White Rose Prison."

name: Errinorne Ancestry Tapestry
description: Rolled-up tapestry depicting the noble ancestry of House Errinorne, dating back to the Late Merethic Era.

name: Royal Rilis Galliard Carpet
description: Hand-knotted wool carpet used for dancing the Royal Rilis Galliard, with footprints indicating proper foot placement.

name: Woven Yokudan Rug
description: A finely woven rug that depicts multiple images of warriors assuming bladed and unarmed fighting stances.

name: Do'Krin Monastary Tapestry
description: A finely-woven tapestry depicting Alkosh, the First Cat, and the creation myth of the ja-Kha'jay, or Lunar Lattice.

name: Folding Lean-To
description: A small, portable shelter with three cloth walls and a roof, used to create a quick camp in the wilderness.

name: Folding Leather Tent
description: This leather tent has been folded carefully to make it easy to transport.

name: Fort Zeren Tent
description: A small, portable tent bearing the symbol of Fort Zeren.

name: Fort Morvunskar Tent
description: A small, portable tent bearing the symbol of Fort Morvunskar.

name: Vinedusk Rangers Tent
description: A small collapsible tent bearing the symbol of the Vinedusk Rangers.

name: Midnight Boot Polish
description: This tin of boot polish was custom-made from exotic ingredients for Count Hosni at-Tura.

name: Good Body's Unsightly Unguent
description: A popular ointment that treats numerous bodily ailments, sold exclusively by a traveling merchant who arrives once every season.

name: Golden Pill Tin
description: A pill tin plated with solid gold, it must belong to a very wealthy sick person.

name: Seamount Clan Warpaint
description: This dark green paint is thick and remarkably smooth. Perfect for decorating the craggy face of a Seamount warrior.

name: Mystic's Majestic Face Cream
description: No one knows what Bar-Beekus originally intended as the purpose of this emulsion, but Dark Elves love it as a moisturizer.

name: Linnea's Luscious Foot Polish
description: A popular foot ointment made and sold exclusively at Linnea's Liniments, it can even be found in homes as far away as Windhelm.

name: Bosmer Wood Polish
