description: An aromatic lacquer used to polish wooden tables and chairs.

name: Dark Witness Skulker's Paste
description: A tin filled with a thick, black-blue paste. Used by the Dark Witness clan, primarily during night-time raids.

name: Glenmoril Wyrd Leg Cologne
description: The sisters of the Glenmoril Wyrd mix a pungent concoction of herbs and apply it to their legs for the pleasure of their wolves.

name: Dark Witness War Paint
description: This tin of deep blue war paint is a favorite among Reachmen from the Dark Witness clan.

name: Aleeto's Soothing Lip Balm
description: A salve that helps seal in moisture to protect lips from the drying effect of cold wind, concocted by Aleeto of Fort Amol.

name: Lurz's Vampire Repellent
description: Lurz gra-Shatul's odiferous ointment, applied to the neck, keeps a lot more than just vampires away.

name: Untamed Elixirs Silvered Pill Tin
description: A pill tin bearing the mark of the Untamed Elixirs alchemy shop in Shornhelm, provided to its most exclusive customers.

name: Scent of Serenity Silvered Pill Tin
description: A pill tin bearing the mark of the Scent of Serenity alchemy shop in Riften, provided to its most exclusive customers.

name: Jungle Camouflage
description: Skin paint. Perfect for blending in with heavily foliaged terrain. It would be highly useful to an adventurer or mercenary.

name: Zuttag's Alchemical Kindlesticks
description: A silver container of fire-lighting sticks tipped with kindlepitch, manufactured by the incomparable Zuttag the Alchemist.

name: Vibrant Paint Set
description: Three small tins tied together with a bit of string. Each cup contains one of the three primary colors: red, blue, or yellow.

name: Prettifying Night Cream
description: Imported from distant lands, this expensive moisturizing cream is believed to keep nobles looking young and beautiful.

name: Torchbug Makeup
description: Who would put makeup on a torchbug?

name: Motalion Reverence Token
description: This valuable golden token was stolen from a crypt in the Motalion Necropolis.

name: Malacath's Promise Token
description: Orc clans in the Dragontail Mountains often leave these ebony tokens in places where they've sworn to return for revenge.

name: Token of the Red Asp
description: The Red Asp of Hallin's Stand gives tokens to those whom he feels he owes a personal favor.

name: Dragonstar Arena Token
description: This token was used for betting at the Dragonstar Arena—until they stopped accepting tokens. Now it's a collectors item.

name: Dragonstar Caravan Company Obligation
description: A token bearing the seal of the Dragonstar Caravan Company that identifies the bearer as owing a debt to the organization.

name: Sober Nord Obligation
description: A token bearing the mark of the Sober Nord in Windhelm. It identifies the bearer as carrying a tab at the tavern.

name: Usurer's Obligation
description: Esiree of Aldcroft distributes these tokens of obligation to remind customers of the debts they owe her.

name: Shor's Stones Tokens
description: A collection of Shor's Stones tokens, obviously important to their owner, such as gaudy cloth patches and other nostalgic items.

name: Hadran's High Roller Chips
description: The highest denomination of gambling chips from Hadran's Caravan, worth a great deal at the betting tables.

name: Argonian Scale Scraper
description: A metal blade especially designed to groom an Argonian's scaly body by removing mites, dirt, and residual build-up.

name: Great House Body Razor
description: A sharp blade designed to maintain a Dark Elf's preferred smooth and hairless physique.

name: Gorapple Peeler
description: A double-bladed tool for peeling the skin from a gorapple or other fruits with hard skins.

name: Tooth Sharpener
description: A tooth sharpener, employed by those who eat a great deal of meat.

name: Corkscrew-Handle Nail Knife
description: A small, curved blade with a corkscrew handle, designed to keep an Orc's nails neat and trim.

name: Claw Sharpeners
description: These are very fine claw sharpeners, useful especially to Khajiit.

name: Clam-Shell File
description: An attractive file used to dull (or sharpen) an Argonian's claws.

name: Moon-Sugarcane Machete
description: Broad-bladed steel tool for harvesting moon-sugarcane. "Windcatcher Plantation" is burned onto the haft.

name: Chrysamere Letter Opener
description: This solid gold letter opener is an miniature replica of the ancient Paladin's Blade "Chrysamere."

name: Elaborate Feather Lure
description: This huge fishing lure looks far too large and ungainly to use. It's covered in beads, feathers, mirrors, and large steel hooks.

name: Sword Master's Letter Opener
description: This letter opener, shaped like a scimitar with a ruby hilt, is presented to Redguard officers to open official correspondence.

name: Do'Krin Monastary Candle Snuffer
description: A sterling silver instrument bearing the imprint of the Do'Krin Monastary, used to safely extinguish candles.

name: Blessed Spade
description: This digging spade is decorated with semi-precious stones and was blessed by a priest of Zeht.

name: Lucky Foyen Dock Spike
description: This heavy iron dock spike, engraved with the words "Foyen Docks" on one side, is considered to bring good luck to the bearer.

name: Set of Kwama Scrib Dining Spikes
description: Six quartz-handled spikes. Good for impaling kwama scribs to wooden plates so they may be eaten alive—as is tradition.

name: Lead Sieve
description: This lead sieve is used to strain liquids when cooking. A fence could resell it to skooma brewers.

name: King Emeric's Nosehair Trimmers
description: Emeric's mother had several pairs of these small, Orichalcum scissors made to ensure her son was well-groomed.

name: Silver Herb-Scissors
description: These valuable scissors include multiple sets of blades to better shred herbs for cooking.

name: Nord Ear-Hair Clipper
description: A set of tiny shears designed to keep a Nord's thick ear hairs neat and trim.

name: Fur Grooming Kit
description: The perfect kit for dapper cats and feline dandies.

name: Lefthanded Pincer-Crab Claw Scissors
description: Scissors made from the howdy-claw of a Striped Pincer Crab, left-handed, with child-safe tips.

name: Steel Farming Shears
description: A critical tool in any farmer's arsenal, these shears are designed specifically to cut invasive vines.

name: Fish-Bone Shears
description: This pair of fish-bone shears are remarkably light and very, very sharp.

name: Ivory Shoehorn
description: An expertly carved mammoth-tusk shoehorn.

name: Giant Wasp Thorax Shoehorn
description: Fancy and flexible shoehorn fashioned from the thorax of a giant wasp, with a long wasp-leg handle set with a blue zircon.

name: Metal Shovel
description: A sturdy metal shovel, useful to any serious adventurer.

name: Saltrice Paddy Muck Shovel
description: Muck shovel with a solid Nord-forged blade, and coralwood haft with "Hrogar's Hold" burned into the wood.

name: Mud-House Dedicatory Shovel
description: Ceremonial shovel used to add a final pat of muck to a mud-house, with "Forsaken Hamlet" crudely scrawled on the blade.

name: Ornamental Bone Saw
description: A bone saw with an imported blade and an elaborate ivory handle inscribed "In Loving Memory."

name: Carpenter's Folding Saw
description: Portable, folding wood-saw, with "Hammer and Saw, Shornhelm" etched on the handle.

name: Glass Bone Saw
description: Because sometimes amputation is the only option.

name: Copper Measures
description: This set of fine copper measures is often used by merchants to charge by weight.

name: Caravan Master's Scale
description: Merchants claim this type of scale features a degree of accuracy that lesser instruments do not.

name: Polished Dragon-Scale Writing Tablet
description: The polished scale of some huge creature (probably a dragon), used as a portable writing surface by some scholarly Nord.

name: Oiled Straight-Razor
description: This razor has been well-maintained. The wood appears imported, but the blade is clearly the work of Forge-Wife Glesh.

name: Scrib Pestle and Mortar
description: A Dark Elf stone bowl and grinding tool, used to crush kwama scrib into a paste for cooking and alchemical preparations.

name: Marble Mortar and Pestle
description: This tool is hewn from marble and very well-maintained. It still smells vaguely of mint and coriander.

name: Torchbug Pestle and Mortar
description: A stone bowl and grinding tool, used to crush torchbugs into a paste for cooking and alchemical preparations.

name: Pearl-Handled Mudcrab Cracker
description: This rare, jeweled mudcrab cracker is from a set used in the kitchen at the palace in Sentinel.

name: Mudcrab Shell Cracker
description: This essential Argonian tool for obtaining the succulent meat inside a steamed mudcrab can be found throughout Bal Foyen.

name: Centipede-Leg Writing Instrument
description: A common but well-made pen, crafted using the leg of a centipede, can be found atop desks throughout Dhalmora and Bal Foyen.

name: Golden Writing Pen
description: A gift from Sotha Sil to acolytes serving in the Tribunal Temple.

name: Explorer's Pick
description: This sturdy pick was given to all of Headman Bhosek's engineers. It probably saw ample use outside the Bthzark ruins.

name: Jade Fish Hook
description: Despite its beauty, this fish hook has definitely seen some action.

name: Antique Sewing Kit
description: Spools of fine thread and an array of steel needles rest inside this polished cherrywood kit.

name: Burnished Steel Mess Kit
description: This well-maintained kit bears Forge-Wife Glesh's mark. Its weight and sturdy construction are astonishing.

name: Orichalcum Work-Hammer
description: A worker's hammer crafted from Orichalcum for extra durability.

name: Ornamental Hammer
description: Etchings depicting the fall of Orsinium cover this decorative hammer. "Never Forget" is emblazoned on the handle.

name: Falconhead Work-Hammer
description: The steel head of this work-hammer is molded into the shape of a broad-billed river falcon.

name: Blacksmith's Hammer
description: A sturdy hammer for crafting metal.

name: Metal Back Scratcher
description: A back scratcher for taking care of those hard-to-reach itches.

name: Dra'bul Nail File With Turquoise Handle
description: Turquoise-handled steel file forged in Dra'bul for smoothing nails or sharpening tusks.

name: Wrought-Iron Claw File
description: A double-sided claw file. One side is coarse, the other fine. Engraving on the handle says "Moonfire Forge."

name: Spool of Fishing Line
description: This long spool of fishing line needs only to be attached to a rod in order to haul in a delicious meal.

name: Bosmer Fishing Rod
description: An ingenious mechanical fishing rod carved from bone.

name: Extensible "Strangler Teaser" Pole
description: Seven-part extensible rod of horn and antler, used by the youth of Karthdar in their charming game of "Strangler Teaser."

name: Flatiron
description: This simple flatiron can be used to press clothes. In a pinch, it can squash a skeever flat.

name: Boarbristle Brush
description: This simple brush is surprisingly stiff. It could just as easily be used to brush a mount.

name: Wolf-Hair Ink Brush
description: A fine brush with midnight black bristles. Supposedly the bristles are taken from pelts of Carved Hill wolves.

name: Halcyon Hairbrush
description: This hairbrush has a handle made of pearls from Halcyon Caverns.

name: Pearl-Handled Princess Hairbrush
description: King Eamond gave Princess Elara a set of these beautiful hairbrushes for each of her birthdays.

name: Bone Carved Handbroom
description: A Wood Elf's handbroom, carved from the bone of a small animal. Its bristles are hair.

name: Senche Whisker Brush
description: The head of this beautifully carved ink brush is composed of hundreds of genuine Senche whiskers.

name: Grooming Brush
description: This bronzed Khajiiti hand-brush is perfect for grooming both fur and manes.

name: Senche-Jaw Hairbrush
description: A hairbrush made from the jawbone of a senche-tiger.

name: Pearl-Handled Hairbrush
description: A fine quality hairbrush with a pearl handle. Upon closer inspection, the bristles appear to be made from giant whiskers.

name: Butcher's Tools
description: A perfect set of Wood Elf butcher's tools.

name: Cliff Darter Basting Bulb
description: A cooking tool shaped like a cliff darter, it distributes liquid to moisten and flavor food during the cooking process.

name: Tanglehaven Scalp-On-A-Stick
description: Scalp dangling from an arm-bone, used for playing the traditional Tanglehaven game "Which Head, Whose Head?"

name: Rolling Bone Back Massager
description: Bear-bone back massager made of six polished and clear-lacquered vertebrae in rolling sockets.

name: Lizard-Fist Stormhold Auctioneer's Gavel
description: Auctioneer's gavel made from an Argonian's fused-together fist bones, formerly used for officiating at House Dres slave sales.

name: Brass Calipers
description: These simple handheld calipers can be used to measure, grip, or hold down loose papers.

name: Asha'abah Roasting Tongs
description: King Fahara'jad gifted several of these gold tongs to Ash'abah tribal leaders after they slew the infamous necromancer, Suturah.

name: Orichalcum Milking Pail
description: When the Orichalcum mines were showering gold on Wayrest, the king gifted pails like this to the region's prominent farmers.

name: Bleakrock Snow Bucket
description: A metal bucket with a lid, residents of Bleakrock fill it with anything they want to keep cold and then shove it into the snow.

name: Ivory-Gripped Honing Steel
description: The ivory used in this tool's handle is curious. Perhaps it was taken from one of the great beasts of the Abecean Sea?

name: Nord Scrimshander's Tools
description: A set of tools used to carve large mammoth tusks, made in the Nordic style.

name: Scorpion Shell Peeler
description: A double-bladed Wood Elf tool for peeling the carapace from a scorpion to get to the succulent meat inside.

name: Blood-Orange Peeler
description: A double-bladed tool for peeling the skin from a blood-orange or other fruits with hard rinds.

name: Brass Navigator's Quadrant
description: Brass device used by a ship's navigator to help determine its location; engraved with the name "Albatross."

name: Corundum Tooth File
description: A popular Wood Elf luxury item. Perfect for achieving a clean, predatory smile.

name: Crimson Cove Torrid Tango Scrimshaw
description: Scrimshaw leviathan tooth, carved to depict two Bosmer dancing the Torrid Tango, signed "Cap'n Kathner."

name: Silver Crab Cracker
description: A hinged tool of silver, used for cracking mudcrab shells.

name: Polished Pickaxe
description: Though its function may not be glamorous, the pickaxe's gleam and polished handle were clearly constructed by a master smith.

name: Orichalum Pitons
description: These sturdy pitons are masterfully crafted. Climbing the sheer cliffs of Betnikh requires tools of this quality.

name: Bone Carving Tools
description: A Wood Elf's tools for carving implements out of bone.

name: Werewolf Claw Clippers
description: A set of silver claw clippers used to trim a werewolf's fast-growing, jagged claws.

name: Luxurious Pony Guar Grooming Set
description: Splendid ivory-handled set of implements for grooming a pet pony guar, including scale picks and chamois buffing spoon.

name: Skooma Refinement Tools
description: Tools for the refinement of skooma. Valuable to both criminals and law enforcement.

name: Fang Polishing Kit
description: A kit of specialized tools for cleaning, sharpening, and polishing vampire fangs.

name: Decorative Manicure Set
description: Leather case containing nail clippers, file, and scissors, all in fanciful bird shapes, from Hammer and Saw.

name: Toad Cleaning Kit
description: An array of precise cutting tools used in the preparation of Aojee-Sakka—a popular, albeit extremely dangerous culinary dish.

name: Traveler's Shaving Kit
description: A high-quality shaving kit in a leather case, consisting of a folding straight razor, a horse hair brush, and a shaving bowl.

name: Red Asp Head Potion Opener
description: This petrified red asp head has the fangs exposed to help pry corks from potion bottles.

name: Lady Laurent's Trowel
description: This ornate but rugged trowel is made of Dwarven steel. It's one of several made for Lady Laurent.

name: Seventh Legion Trowel
description: This silver trowel is used by Imperial archaeologists working as part of the Seventh Legion.

name: Banned Orc Tusk Letter Opener
description: This fine yet highly illegal letter opener carved from genuine Orc tusk was probably made before the formation of the Covenant.

name: Silver Tweezers
description: The elegance of these tweezers suggest they are used for plucking only the finest hairs from noble heads.

name: Silver-Plated Tweezers
description: A pair of gleaming tweezers marked by the Imperial ruby. It's possible they once belonged to an Imperial surgeon.

name: Hoops & Holes Mallet Set
description: A custom set of long-handled wooden mallets in a fine deerskin bag, used to play the noble's game "Hoops & Holes."

name: Wooden Toy Sword
description: This toy sword was carved to match an Imperial gladius. A fence could resell it to bandits in need of training swords.

name: Stuffed Bergama Lizard
description: Stuffed lizards are a common gift for children in the Alik'r. They sometimes even wear tailored clothes.

name: Play Sword
description: This wooden saber is remarkably well-made. Perfect for the young and aspiring warrior, waiting for the call of Rahni'Za.

name: Wooden Horse and Cart
description: A toy favored by the children of traveling merchants, the cart features moving wheels while the horse attaches to the front.

name: Wooden Building Blocks
description: Children spend hours stacking these painted wooden building blocks. They spend minutes knocking them over.

name: Leather Vosh Ball
description: A leather ball used in the Orc sport, Vosh, which translates as "Courage." It is rarely played outside Orcish strongholds.

name: Warrior Wave
description: A small, carved ball of polished topaz, designed to represent Ra'Gada, the Warrior Wave.

name: Leather Bouncing Ball
description: This large leather ball is inflated with air so that it bounces. It's a popular toy for children.

name: Tattooed Mammoth-Ball Trophy
description: Grapefruit-sized leather ball, hairy, tattooed with "Silvenar Rangers, Mammoth-Ball Champions, 2E 565."

name: Mahogany Lawn Bowling Set
description: Leather case containing balls of imported mahogany for lawn bowling, with a note reading "Game next week at the Run Inn."

name: Teeba-Hatsei Ball
description: This remarkably heavy ball is used in the popular Argonian sport of Teeba-Hatsei, or "Hip and Tail Ball."

name: Bilboquet
description: This wooden children's toy consists of a wooden cup on a handle and a ball attached by a string.

name: Stuffed Giant Centipede With Googly Eyes
description: An arm's-length centipede stuffed with pinfeathers. The painted quail's-egg eyes seem to follow you.

name: Pink and Green Finger-Trap
description: A children's novelty toy made from multicolored twine.

name: Baandari Finger Puzzle
description: A popular children's toy with a sinister history. Its ability to tangle up hands has made it a popular tool for thieves.

name: Stuffed Mouse Toy
description: A favorite among playful Khajiit, crafted by stuffing a dead mouse with cotton and sewing a small bell to its tail.

name: Wooden Guar Pull-Toy
description: A child's wooden pull-toy with round wheels and a pull-string.

name: Lion Guard Wind-Up Doll
description: A toy Lion Guard soldier, its clockwork gears allow it to march into battle by winding the mechanism with a key.

name: Lion Guard Figurine of Action
description: Since Buttlebye's Toys closed its doors, these lifelike figurines have become quite collectible among Glenumbra's wealthy.

name: Clockwork Toy Soldier
description: This wind-up clockwork toy was crafted by Telenger the Artificer himself, and was probably gifted to the child of a noble.

name: Aldmeri War Toys
description: These tiny Aldmeri soldiers and siege engines are molded brass. They fit within a simple silk pouch.

name: Glenumbra Moors War Toys
description: Tiny soldiers and siege engines, carved from ivory and modeled after the Battle of Glenumbra Moors, held in a fox-fur pouch.

name: Daggerfall War Toys
description: These tiny Daggerfall soldiers and siege engines carved from wood fit within a simple wool pouch.

name: Ebonheart War Toys
description: These tiny Ebonheart soldiers and siege engines are carved from ivory. They fit within a simple mammoth-fur pouch.

name: Crystal Sweetroll
description: Whomever carved this trinket clearly had a deep love and appreciation for sweetrolls.

name: Polished Iron Hand
description: A gift from Chief Tazgol to a mutilated would-be usurper. "Better luck next time" is engraved on the palm.

name: Stone Warrior's Hand
description: This life-like stone hand was broken off a statue in Southern Bangkorai. It's hard to imagine that it was sculpted.

name: Mummified Hand
description: A dried-up Anka'Ra hand taken as a trophy. It didn't just move ... did it?

name: Divad Hunding's Petrified Finger
description: This petrified finger allegedly belonged to the legendary Sword-Singer Divad Hunding.

name: Mummified Finger
description: A finger gnarled in a way to suggest the hand it belonged to was gripping something.

name: False Eye
description: Made of roughly carved glass, this garishly painted eye could never be mistaken for the real thing.

name: Exquisite False Eye
description: A polished marble eye with an emerald inset. A kingly gift from Chief Tazgol to a wounded lieutenant.

name: Seeker's Meditation Stone
description: This black meditation stone has been molded by the Primeval Seekers into a likeness of Hermaeus Mora.

name: Glass Eye of Distinction
description: A glass eye stored in a fine wooden box. The color of the iris changes based on the mood of the possessor.

name: "Authentic" Dragon Claw
description: This curved object is dark black and has a very sharp point. Rumored to be a dragon claw, its authenticity has not be verified.

name: Good Luck Charm
description: A talisman sold in back alleys and shadowy stalls. It is said to protect the possessor from ill fortune and bad luck.

name: Saint Veloth Charm
description: A common religious charm, this one is devoted to Saint Veloth, patron of outcasts and spiritual seekers.

name: Ysgramor's Palace Talisman
description: A small charm, imbued with an enchantment that always points it toward Ysgramor's Palace in Windhelm.

name: Silken Dream Catcher
description: The monks of Pariah Abbey crafted several of these charms to offer as gifts to the children of Stormhaven's nobility.

name: Kothringi Dream Catcher
description: Small bits of string and beads are woven together into a small circle. There is a single black feather attached at the bottom.

name: Multicolored Sea Glass
description: A fair-sized piece of colorful sea glass set on a small stand and displayed as a household ornament.

name: Dark Elf Wicker Effigy
description: A traditional statue made of wicker, used as a stand-in for the owner in certain rituals no longer sanctioned by the Tribunal.

name: Argonian Nightmare Trap
description: Sold exclusively by a Hlaalu trading agent in Black Marsh, this Argonian effigy wards off bad dreams and night terrors.

name: Arkay's Undead Repellent
description: A small pouch containing items blessed by a priest of Arkay, it is said to ward off all sorts of undead creatures.

name: Twig-Of-Falinesti Compass
description: A twig hangs from a silken strand. Supposedly from Falinesti; said to always point to the Walking City, it spins uncertainly.

name: Treehenge Compass Twig
description: Gilded graht-oak twig; suspended from a short cord, it turns slowly and stops, always pointing toward Treehenge.

name: Spinner's Ceremonial Gilding
description: Gilded accessories attached to a Spinner's ceremonial portage. Often provided as gifts on festival days.

name: Field Assistant's Protective Periapt
description: Heimlyn Keep Field Assistant's blessed periapt, inscribed with prayers to protect the wearer from Daedric possession.

name: "Stillrise Stagger" Timer Top
description: Elaborate tortoise-shell top spun while playing "Stillrise Stagger" to determine how long a player must hop without falling.

name: Ayleid Ritual Fetish
description: A rare fetish usually found in Ayleid ruins. It would be valuable to scholars studying the ancient Elves.

name: Breton Funeral Urn
description: An urn containing the ashes of a beloved member of a Breton family.

name: Ceramic Urn
description: An urn painted with idyllic scenes of farm life in Tamriel. It should resell nicely once the ashes are dumped out.

name: Saarthal Burial Urn
description: A relic from the first city built by Atmoran settlers in Skyrim, destroyed by the Snow Elves in the Merethic Era.

name: Portable Chamber Pot
description: A chamber pot of rich earthenware, designed for use in the great outdoors when a tree just isn't good enough.

name: Ancient Ayleid Amphora
description: Blue-glazed pointed-bottom urn with two handles, inscribed with the Ayleidoon "E" for Erokii.

name: Filigreed Ash Urn With Portable Altar
description: Ancestral ash urn, pewter with gold filigree, with folding altar stand to enable worship on one's travels.

name: Silver-Chased Three-Tea Samovar
description: A three-bellied copper samovar. Each silver-chased urn has its own spigot for serving the Three Respectful Teas.

name: Silver Ladle
description: A polished spoon with a date skillfully engraved on the handle.

name: Filigreed Serving Spoon
description: A spoon for serving very fancy puddings, stews, soups, or casseroles.

name: Wooden Serving Spoon
description: This large wooden spoon features a small guar on the bowl, perfect for when one is making Guar Quiche.

name: Princely Soup Spoon
description: When Prince Azah was a child, he liked to use different spoons to taste each bowl of soup on the table before choosing one.

name: Gilded Souvenir Spoon
description: This gold-trimmed spoon was purchased as a souvenir from the city of Elinhir.

name: Ceremonial Cauldron-Stirring Hand-Spoon
description: Ceremonial long-handled cauldron-stirring spoon shaped from a skeletal forearm and hand encased in beetle-amber.

name: Tormented Spire Lava Spoon
description: Basalt spoon that, when stirred in a liquid withershins, heats up and warms the liquid, even to boiling.

name: Dreugh-Shell Sithis Spoon
description: Open-bottomed "Sithis Spoon" of Bogmother dreugh-shell, used in the ritual of the Empty Feast of Nullity.

name: Imported Bosmeri Eye-Spoons
description: Incomplete set of 5 copperplate Bosmeri pointed eye-spoons, in display case labeled "Ottaesa's Imports."

name: Polished Wooden Spoon
description: A stained and polished Saxhleel ladle, highly sought after by many Imperial chefs.

name: Jarl's Favorite Silver Soup Spoon
description: Some jarl, his name lost to time, proclaimed he would only eat soup with a silver spoon. Now, many Nords follow the tradition.

name: Copper Soup Ladle
description: A copper ladle for serving soups and sauces.

name: Ingenious Clockwork Saw-Spoon
description: Antique brass spoon with retractable sawtooth arms. Hucksters in Mistral claim they are of Dwemeric design.

name: Set of Silvenar Marrow Spoons
description: Set of six heirloom silver-plated marrow spoons, each stamped with the Great Seal of Silvenar in its bowl.

name: Elsweyr Serving Ladle
description: This fine wooden serving ladle is painted with a pattern that resembles a senche-tiger's stripes.

name: Windhelm Salad Tongs
description: It is now common practice for Nord households to stock a set of salad tongs for use when unexpected Dark Elf visitors drop by.

name: Mudcrab-Shaped Dustpan
description: A short-handled shovellike utensil used to remove dust and dirt, shaped like a mudcrab and crafted by Sanabi the Carpenter.

name: Chef Xavier's Better Spatula
description: An improved version of the essential cooking utensil, crafted and sold by Chef Xavier of Daggerfall.

name: Long-Handled Mudcrab Flipper
description: Broad wooden spatula with long bamboo handle; used by Roost beachcombers to flip mudcrabs onto their backs.

name: Graht-Oak Rolling Pin
description: This heavy rolling pin crafted from the trees of Valenwood has some heft, perfect for flattening dough.

name: Polished Marble Rolling Pin
description: This otherwise pristine rolling pin bears a large crack. If rumors are true, Hearth-Wife Sholg occasionally uses them as clubs.

name: Etched Iron Tenderizer
description: A heavy kitchen tool used to prepare meat. The handle features a stylized wolf skull engraving.

name: Bjoulsae River Ladle
description: This long-armed ladle was designed for drawing water from the deepest part of the Bjoulsae River.

name: Commemorative Corkscrew
description: After King Ranser's defeat, Emeric threw a party for the nobles of High Rock and handed out these as party favors.

name: Dishonored Potion Opener
description: This potion opener is decorated with a crude depiction of Satakal as a serpent, with fangs exposed.

name: Green Lady Corkscrew
description: A brass corkscrew with a jade handle shaped in a stylized representation of a reclining Green Lady.

name: Stormfist Style Flatware
description: Cutlery produced by Stormfist clan artisans, most likely dating back to before the reign of Jorunn the Skald-King.

name: Lion Guard Meal Kit
description: Compact eating and cooking utensils for use while camping or participating in military campaigns, popularized by the Lion Guard.

name: Rustic Wooden Serving Utensils
description: Crafted by woodworkers of Deleyn's Mill, these oversized utensils were popularized by King Casimir at the Feast of Five Days.

name: Two-Tined Carving Fork
description: A large carving fork with a stout handle and two sturdy metal tines.

name: Willow Branch Toasting Fork
description: Iron toasting fork wrought into the shape of a delicate willow branch, from the Guard's Forge.

name: Redoran Carving Fork
description: A large carving fork bearing the symbol of House Redoran upon its stout handle. The matching knife is nowhere to be found.

name: Imported Cheese-Toasting Fork
description: Steel two-tined fork with a long haft and a mahogany handle, metal blackened at the end.

name: House Dorell Carving Fork
description: A large carving fork bearing the symbol of House Dorell upon its stout handle. The matching knife must have been lost.

name: Frog Gig With Folding Haft
description: Xal Ithix-style barbed four-tined frog gig, with double-hinged folding haft made of Mud Tree bamboo.

name: Redoran Carving Knife
description: A large carving knife bearing the symbol of House Redoran upon its stout handle. The matching fork must have been lost.

name: Top Quality Clamming Fork
description: Short-handled steel spade fork for digging up clams, with non-warping mangrove handle, from Moonfire Forge.

name: Pyandonean Fork
description: This exquisitely designed jade serving fork appears to be a striking sea serpent, with its two fangs serving as its tines.

name: Silver-Plated Juggling Forks
description: Set of three long silver-plated forks for the juggling game "Forks Akimbo," popular at Redfur Trading Post.

name: Yokudan Cutlery
description: This set of ancient forks, knives, and spoons was finely crafted, but is now valued for its age rather than its usefulness.

name: Aldmeri Cutlery
description: This Aldmeri cutlery is finely filigreed and fit for the Queen herself.

name: Yokudan Style Flatware
description: Cutlery modeled after Yokudan silverware and sold by Thalia the Blacksmith in Belkarth.

name: 36-Sermon Tableware Set
description: A 36-piece silverplate tableware set with one spoon, knife, or fork for each of Vivec's Thirty-Six Sermons.

name: Solid Gold Cutlery
description: A set of shining eating utensils composed entirely of gold. It's fit for use by a royal family.

name: Red Oak Cutting Board
description: A freshly sanded and well-oiled cutting surface.

name: Trader's Rest Silver Dining Utensils
description: Three meat-forks, two knives—a partial set of silver-plated dining utensils, each engraved with "Property of Trader's Rest."

name: Dwarven-Metal Serving Utensils
description: Set of serving utensils of iridescent Dwarven metal, engraved "Crafted at Armature's Upheaval by Dalotha."

name: Wyrd Sisters' Whisk
description: An oak whisk, carved out of a single piece of wood and used to prepare eggs for cooking.

name: Ivory-Handled Whisk
description: A staple of every Nord kitchen, this gravy whisk features a polished ivory handle decorated with Nordic patterns.

name: Porcelain Vase
description: A fragile vessel—almost certainly antique.

name: Floral Vase
description: Form follows function. This vase is used to hold flowers and it has flowers painted on it.

name: Jade Vase
description: This wide vase is delicately carved with small flowers. It  has a distinct green coloring to it.

name: Delicate Ceramic Bud Vase
description: White and rose pink bud vase of subtle floral curves, from Skywatch Mercantile.

name: Malachite Tower Vase
description: This tall, thin vase is made from malachite and shaped like a Breton Watchtower.

name: Mara's Floral Star Vase
description: A traditional Nord wedding gift, the four-pointed floral star is a popular symbol associated with Mara, the goddess of love.

name: Mara's Hands Vase
description: This porcelain vase was molded to look like a pair of clasped hands nurturing the flowers within.

name: Volcanic Glass Vase
description: A decorative vase. Crafted from volcanic glass that was harvested from the mountains of Stonefalls.

name: Ebony Vessel of the Abyss
description: Conical black vase used for meditation; a look into its interior is like peering into an endlessly-deepening black nothingness.

name: Silver Vial of Alit Horn Powder
description: A small, delicate silver vial filled with powdered alit horn, used by Orc shamans in fertility rituals.

name: Bloodthorn Ampoule
description: A stoppered vial wrapped in thorny vines that bears the symbol of the Bloodthorn cult. It probably contains something dangerous.

name: Phial of Lamp Oil
description: A ceramic cask filled with pure oil.

name: Phial of Leovic's Blood
description: This tiny phial contains blood of the former Emperor Leovic, supposedly collected at his regicide.

name: King Donel's Beard Shavings
description: A vial of beard hairs from Donel of Deleyn.

name: Vial of Soil From Hrol's Hillock
description: This vial of soil is purportedly from the hillock King Hrol fertilized before his death.

name: Ash'abah Moon Salve
description: The Ash'abah use a secret formula to create this mixture. When smeared on exposed skin, it protects one from sun blush.

name: Vial of Comet Dust
description: A small vial of dust that allegedly fell from the sky when the starry comet streaked over the Iliac Bay.

name: Vial of Sand From the Far Shores
description: This small vial of sand allegedly came from the Aetherial realm the Redguards call the "Far Shores."

name: Smelling Salts
description: Plain smelling salts, for awakening the faint of heart.

name: Argonian Scale Softener
description: A batch of exotic moisturizing lotion made for Lord Ernil Dres by his Argonian slaves and stored in small vials.

name: Hlaalu Merchant's Flin Barometer
description: Hlaalu traveling merchant's combination barometer and whiskey-flask, a portable storm glass filled with flin.

name: Unopened Vial of Glue
description: An unopened vial of adhesive made from rendered Skeever skins.

name: Vial of Stardust
description: A vial full of a gleaming dust. It serves no function, but a Star-Gazer or similar scholar pays well for such curiosities.

name: Vial of Vampire Blood
description: A small vile of dark, viscous blood. This would be quite valuable to a necromancer, or a desperate alchemist.

name: Strange Shornhelm Keepsakes
description: A collection of Shornhelm keepsakes, obviously important to their owner, including vials of blood and other bizarre items.

name: Fine Leather Waterskin
description: An empty waterskin made of supple leather and stoppered with a cork.

name: Rabbit-Hide Waterskin
description: A well-made drinking container, bearing the crafter's mark of Arma Derone of Eagle's Brook in Glenumbra.

name: Sturdy Wood Elf Waterskin
description: This supple waterskin was fashioned from a wild boar's stomach.

name: Elegant Waterskin
description: A supple leather pouch that boasts silver engravings. It can hang at your side, fit in your pack, and quench your thirst.

name: Scorpion Shell Whistle
description: A loud whistle fashioned from the shell of a dead scorpion.

name: Polished Sandlewood Birdcall
description: This masterfully crafted birdcall is one of a select few used by Hunt-Wife Lurgush and her companions.

name: Guar Call Whistle
description: A tiny whistle bearing the mark of Esqoo the herder. He commissioned many, since he's always losing his guar—and his whistles.

name: Alabaster Bandit Whistle
description: Since bandits began appearing in Bleakrock, many citizens have begun to carry around whistles to sound when they require aid.

name: Hand-Carved Abecean Whistle
description: A small whale-bone whistle, carved to resemble a reclining mermaid. A popular item in Saintsport.

name: Brass Warning Whistle
description: A simple aerophone bearing the mark of a particular Dark Elf house, travelers carry these to call for help or send warnings.

name: Bat-Bone Whistle
description: A light and delicate bone from a giant bat, carved into a harmonious whistle by a Wood Elf crafter.

name: Khajiit Monkey Call
description: A simple aerophone bearing the mark of a Khajiiti hunter, it produces an amazingly lifelike monkey call.

name: Daggerfall Guard Captain's Whistle
description: A silver whistle engraved with the Daggerfall crest. Many citizens have cheap brass replicas to alert the Guard in an emergency.

name: Bird Call Whistle
description: A simple aerophone bearing the mark of the Beldama Wyrd Sisters, many foresters carry these to attract birds and fowl.

name: Houndsman Wolf Whistle
description: Brass whistle on a gold chain, engraved with a howling wolf and full moons. It seems to make no sound when winded.

name: Marine Officer's Platinum Whistle
description: Platinum three-note officer's whistle, engraved with the seal of the First Auridon Marines.

name: Silver Vinedusk Ranger Birdcall
description: A silver birdcall gifted to members of the Vinedusk Rangers by King Camoran, and used to send innocuous signals.

name: Tall Wooden Stilts
description: These stilts make for fun entertainment. They also allow one to reach high objects—such as second story windows.

name: Goblin-Wood Cutting Board
description: A carpenter in Davon's Watch crafts these hardwood cutting boards used by chefs and cooks throughout Morrowind.

name: Bone Lots
description: A handful of graven welwa knuckle bones, thrown to aid in divination.

name: Mages Guildmaster's Bookmark
description: Bookmark of platinum foil, an image of Arch-Mage Shalidor on one side, and "Return to Davon's Watch Guildhall" on the other.

name: Pirate Grappling Hook
description: The metal hook is so heavy that dislodging it from a ship's wall is a significant challenge.

name: Boar-Bladder Hand Warmer
description: An enchanted triple-sealed bladder. When squeezed, the fist-sized bulb warms rapidly.

name: Dwarven Steel Griddle
description: A griddle purportedly found in an ancient Dwemer ruin. According to an inscription on the handle, the Dwemer enjoyed pancakes.

name: Dining Table Dung Beetle House
description: Small pearl- and agate-studded pod-house used to contain the large dung beetle released to clean up the table between courses.

name: "Amorous Giantess" Royal Ensemble
description: Set of bedroom stilts and large furry mittens for enacting the erotic charade "The King and the Amorous Giantess."

name: Canonreeve's Ruby-Throated Nonesuch
description: Moonstone-fretted silversilk ruby-throated nonesuch. The amber tail-label reads "Property of the Thalmor."

name: Blue Satin and Velvet Caul
description: Patterned hair-snood of bright blue satin and darker blue velvet, with a light crespine to hold it on.

name: House Ravenwatch Doily
description: A doily with the Ravenwatch heraldry, distributed during a rare public banquet held at the secluded castle.

name: Holgunn's Unexpurgated Beetle-Shot Proclamation
description: A rare proclamation of Fish Stink Tavern's Beetle-Shot cocktail as the official drink of the Pact—rescinded the next day.

name: Fine Fishbone Head-Spine Snood
description: Semi-rigid snood worn while sleeping to prevent disarrangement of an Argonian's head-spines.

name: Brass Khajiiti Finger-Pen
description: Brass nib that fits over a Khajiit's index fingernail, converting it into a fountain pen.

name: White-Gold Wax Tablet
description: A tablet that functions as a portable writing surface. Markings across the top indicate it came from the Imperial Palace.

name: Jeweled Toothbrush
description: A gaudy toothbrush, encrusted with valuable jewels, commissioned by foreign royalty.

name: Ancient Yokudan Arrowhead
description: This antique arrowhead may have aged, but the quality craftsmanship of the fletchers from Old Yokuda is still clear.

name: Oiled-Leather Portmanteau
description: Waterproof luggage of tooled horsehide, made for sea travel, with inner tag reading "Sourt's Sacks, Shornhelm."

name: Baandari Moon-Sugar Basters
description: These basters are sold by the Baandari for the express purpose of basting roasted meats repeatedly with moon-sugar syrup.

name: Akaviri Lord-Marshal's Baton
description: Ivory baton capped with the carved head of a snow bear. The carving indicates a Kamal Akaviri Lord-Marshal's symbol of command.

name: Savage Nord False Beard and Mustache
description: Comically hirsute false beard and mustache, worn when playing the "Strapping Skyrim Skald" game.

name: Exile's Bedroll
description: This Redguard bedroll was used by the exiles who fled from Hallin's Stand and sought safe harbor from the King of Evermore.

name: Nordic Rabbit Fur Bedroll
description: A compact bedroll, accented with rabbit fur in the Nord style. No backpack should be without one.

name: Bronze Blue Bunting Perch
description: Broad-based bronze bird perch for a blue bunting, with a slim brass chain and anklet, engraved "Brightsteel Armory" underneath.

name: Dwemer Tonal Diagram
description: A schematic utilizing the principles of tonal architecture, indecipherable by any but the lost Dwemer people.

name: Seal-Skin Buoy
description: A tightly stitched inflatable bladder. "Maiden's Breath" has been branded onto the side.

name: Fancy Desk Blotter
description: A fancy version of a common desk blotter, perfect for absorbing excess or spilled ink. The ivory handle is made from whalebone.

name: Deluxe Desk Blotter
description: A deluxe version of a common desk blotter for the desk of a wealthy patron, perfect for absorbing excess or spilled ink.

name: Naga-Skin Bandit Blotter
description: Felt-lined absorbent blotter made from the soft-scaled underbelly of a condemned Naga bandit.

name: Mammoth-Rib Nord-Striders
description: A pair of curiously straightened stilts, taken from the ribcage of a living timber mammoth—an odd gift of the Green.

name: Antique Clyster With Platinum Filigree
description: Antique Bosmeri First-Era tin clyster with platinum filigree, reinforced croc-leather spout, and ivory pump handle.

name: Pouch of Amber Buttons
description: A handful of buttons, fashioned from ancient graht-oak resin.

name: Supernal Dreamers Omen Cards
description: An ornate set of cards, supposedly used by Supernal Dreamers cultists to aid in calling forth Daedric spirits known as Omens.

name: Daedric Tarot Cards
description: A set of hand-painted Tarot cards featuring depictions of the various Daedric Princes.

name: Tribunal Prayer Cards
description: A set of hand-painted prayer cards based on the Homilies of Blessed Almalexia.

name: Oven Mitts
description: A pair of novelty oven mitts fasioned to look like cats' paws.

name: Constellation Coaster Tiles
description: Set of twelve glazed ceramic drink coasters based on the Ayleid constellation tiles of Veawend Ede.

name: Spider-Web Cocoon
description: This fist-sized spider-web cocoon from northeast Bleakrock appears to be intact. An alchemist would pay well for this.

name: Banner-Torn Brews Decorative Stopper
description: The topper on this empty jug is extraordinary—a porcelain pig with a barrel of Aera's Ale around its neck.

name: Kwama Cuttle Earplugs
description: A pair of kwama cuttle earplugs, used to muffle snores and other nocturnal noises of Dark Elf sleeping companions.

name: Kwama Cuttle Nose Plugs
description: A pair of nose plugs fashioned from kwama cuttle, Dark Elves wear them to keep insects from crawling in while they sleep.

name: Burnished Silver Handle
description: Does a wardrobe really need a handle? Not when a fence can resell it for silver scrap.

name: Drublog Lotion Warmer, With Cruet
description: Drublog-forged iron lotion warmer stand, with candle holder beneath a circular eyelet to hold the ceramic lotion cruet.

name: Glow Worm Farm
description: A display case filled with loam, which serves as a habitat for a Dark Elf youngster's pet glow worms.

name: Aldmeri Tea Cozy
description: This tea cozy is patterned with the golden eagle of the Aldmeri Dominion.

name: Lucky Pig's Ear
description: A dried pig's ear, believed by some to bring good luck—to everyone other than the pig.

name: Royal Beeswax Earplugs
description: A pair of ear plugs, purportedly infused with the royal jelly of a hive's queen. Not for use in regions with a bee population.

name: Seafoam Earplugs
description: Made from hardened seafoam, some Redguards use these to keep bugs from crawling into their ears while they sleep.

name: Senche-Stalked Earplugs
description: A pair of earplugs which hiss softly when senche-tigers approach within thirty paces. Indispensable for light outdoor sleepers.

name: Teahouse Comfort Fan
description: This simple silk fan is imprinted with an ancient Khajiiti rune, quite fashionable at the tea parlors of Dune.

name: Lucky Nereid's Foot
description: Blue-skinned and web-toed nereid's foot, expertly taxidermied, reputed to bring its owner good luck.

name: Giant Bat Kite
description: A kite shaped and decorated to resemble a giant bat, perfect for flying on the breeze on warm, sunny days.

name: Golden Gorapple Replica
description: An exact replica of the rare specimen of fruit, sculpted with the utmost care.

name: Beeswax Heart
description: This beeswax heart details the long life of a loving couple. A fence could melt it down and resell the fine wax to forgers.

name: Hoarvor-Proboscis Mud Snorkel
description: Night-snorkel to enable breathing when sleeping immersed in mud, a hoarvor proboscis engraved with paeans to Padhome.

name: Antique Hookah
description: This elaborate waterpipe is unique to Craglorn. Stylized Nedic motifs have been etched into the silver trim.

name: Spry Spriggan Twirling Hoop
description: This large wooden hoop is spun overhead as part of the popular children's game known as "Spry Spriggan."

name: Bronzed Baby Teeth
description: A jar containing the bronzed teeth of young children, saved as remembrances in the Breton tradition.

name: Orichalcum Incense Burner
description: This Orichalcum incense burner was crafted recently in Wayrest and then shipped up the Bjoulsae River to be sold in Bangkorai.

name: Intense Incense of Mara
description: A more powerful and extremely prohibited version of the common calm-inducing scent that permeates most Nord bedchambers.

name: Dark Elf Incense Burner
description: An incense burner engraved with an image of Almalexia and the words "Mother Morrowind."

name: Natural Hand Soap
description: A bar of sweet-smelling soap, used throughout Tamriel to wash hands and other particularly grubby body parts.

name: Butterfly Kite
description: An expertly crafted kite shaped like the blue butterflies of Skyrim—quite popular with homesick Nords visiting Auridon.

name: Uveran Promotional Kagouti Bank
description: Ceramic coin-bank in the shape of a painted kagouti, with a coin slot on its back, engraved "Compliments of Uveran Bank."

name: Harpy-Wing Kite
description: Modeled after the harpies of Shrieking Scar, these playful kites can often be seen flying atop the Daggerfall highlands.

name: Spidersilk Box Kite
description: A high-performance box kite made with light wooden struts and multicolored spidersilk.

name: Kwama Scrib-Head Bugsmoke Ashtray
description: With the failure of the Burroot Kwama Mine, the owners tried to recoup by fashioning items from kwama carapaces.

name: Nix-Hound Leash
description: A sturdy leather leash used in the training of nix-hounds.

name: Luminescent Bookbinding
description: This netch-skin bookbinding was obviously imported and still retains a cool blue glow.

name: Wamasu-Hide Tarpaulin
description: This sturdy tarp is tightly stitched and extremely durable.

name: Derali Lizard Leash
description: This leash was used by one of the most prominent lizard-racing families in all of the Alik'r.

name: Miniature Lighthouse
description: A miniature of one of the beacons of Auridon.

name: Almalexia's Lock
description: This lock of hair was supposedly given as a sign of Almalexia's favor. Why the color has faded is anyone's guess.

name: Bleakrock Braid Memento
description: A lock of thick, auburn hair, tied in the distinctive Bleakrock Braid and saved in remembrance of someone dear.

name: Queen Freydis' Curly Ringlets
description: A lock of curly red hair sealed in a jar, proclaimed to be from the head of Queen Freydis of Eastern Skyrim.

name: Horrible Mummified Banekin
description: Grotesque mummified body of a small humanoid Daedra; a label around its ankle reads "Proof of the existence of Broken Tusk!"

name: Bronzed Egg Tooth
description: A prized childhood keepsake, coated in bronze.

name: Rubber Squeeze Mouse
description: Realistic squeaking mouse, twice life-size, fashioned from cooked gray rubber at The Hissing Phial.

name: Morrowind House Fungus
description: A smaller variety of the large, glowing mushrooms that dot the Morrowind countryside, set in a pot and used to beautify a home.

name: Filigreed Falinesti Acorn
description: A fist-sized acorn preserved with a coat of dark lacquer and trimmed with gilt edging around the cap.

name: Mara's Bosom Aromatic Oil
description: A sweet-smelling oil, burned at night to make a Breton's bedchamber soothing and fragrant.

name: Snow-Owl Kite
description: A kite shaped and decorated to resemble a snow owl, perfect for flying on crisp, clear winter days.

name: Green Pact Prayer Card
description: Several prayers to the Green are inscribed on this card, which is made from very finely-cut bone.

name: Buca's Tasty Tooth Polish
description: Paste made from torchbugs and other natural ingredients, formulated to clean and polish teeth. Available at The Subtle Philter!

name: Four Imp-Repelling Pinwheels
description: When placed in the cardinal directions around a camp, these elaborate pinwheels are said to repel imps from the area within.

name: Gold-Blink Torchbug-Dance Pinwheel
description: Silver pinwheel with blinking gold-glow finial that attracts dozens of torchbugs, enchanting them into a circling dance.

name: Bloodsport Pass
description: A small stone plaque, bearing the symbol of the Hammerdeath Arena, provides entry to the bloodsport events.

name: Fahara'jad Lineage Plaque
description: This golden plaque is engraved with the names of King Fahara'jad's ancestors.

name: Vivec's Ivory Plaque
description: This small, ivory rectangle contains a verse attributed to the Warrior-Poet and is a common gift among the wealthy of Morrowind.

name: All Flags Navy Campaign Ribbon
description: Rare vintage officer's campaign ribbon for participation in the naval assault on Thras in 1E 2260.

name: Silver Dowsing Rods
description: If you can't use magic to find water, you can use these rods. Or is this magic, too?

name: Spinner's Ruched Silken Furbelow
description: A Spinner's ruched and flounced furbelow of turquoise silk and golden chamois, with gilt edging.

name: Bjoulsae River Sand Scrub
description: The fine grains of sand gathered from the bottom of the Bjoulsae River are excellent for keeping one's face looking young.

name: Eyes of the Queen Disguise Kit
description: A kit of false beards, mustaches, noses and other prosthetics. A small marking indicates it was made for the Eyes of the Queen.

name: Hollow Scorpion Carapace
description: Wood Elves make a game of trying to hollow out a scorpion carapace without damaging the shell. This one survived intact.

name: Scorpion-Tail Bookmark
description: This dried scorpion tail has been flattened to act as a bookmark.

name: Packet of Moon Ripened Squash Seeds
description: A packet of enchanted squash seeds. When planted under moonlight, they will grow fully by the next day's dusk.

name: Imported Bronze Grit Sieve
description: Bronze sifter for removing lumps from a grit-box, engraved "Imported from Senchal by Ranabi" on the handle.

name: Goblin-Sized Weighted Shackles
description: Heavy leg-irons for restraining Goblin slaves who are flight risks. Etched with the symbol of The Watcher's Forge, Skywatch.

name: Dres Slaver Shackles
description: A set of House Dres slaver shackles, slightly used.

name: Bone Ship Carving
description: The details of this ship are as pointed as the jagged bone that forms it. It was probably created by a skilled craftsman.

name: Pristine Writing Slate
description: This smooth writing surface has yet to be touched by chalk or charcoal.

name: Velyn Hill Crabshell Mudsled
description: Personal mudcrab-shell mudsled, with leather harness and "Velyn Hill Mud-Luge" inscribed on the seat.

name: Swim Flippers and Coral Snorkel
description: Swim flippers of flexible netch-hide, with a snorkel made of land-coral from Vivec's Antlers.

name: Mammoth Snout Surprise Snorkel
description: A rubber-lined mammoth snout snorkel. A label reads, "Delight your friends with Doubts-the-Moon's submerged mammoth surprise!"

name: Nilyne's Natural Hand Sanitizer
description: Nilyne Hlor of the Serk sells a lot of this hand soap, marketing it as a way to limit the spread of Llodos and other plagues.

name: Silver Sandal Spikes
description: Footracing is a common sport in parts of the Alik'r and some runners use these sandal spikes to get a competitive edge.

name: High Kinlady's Diamond-Tipped Spurs
description: Diamond-tipped silver spurs for the riding boots of a High Kinlady, in the style worn in Skywatch and Firsthold.

name: Silver Spurs
description: Polished to a glimmering sheen and marked with engravings that identify them as belonging to the house of King Eamond.

name: Chicken-Mudcrab Thing
description: Why anyone would attach the head of a chicken to the body of a mudcrab is anyone's guess, but somebody will probably buy it.

name: Chieftain's Heirloom Toad-Atlatl
description: Enameled flinging-stick ending in a shallow cup, used in the traditional Murkwater game "The Toad Flies at Dusk."

name: Keeper's Licorice Worm Dowsing Rod
description: Orichalc dowsing rod used for finding the underground teeming-holes of licorice worms, which Keepers feed to hatchlings.

name: Elegant Velvet-Lined Tail Lifter
description: Elegant folding tail lifter made of flexible spry-wood inlaid with red cedar, with a velvet-lined lift-cuff.

name: Jeweled Treethane Castanets
description: Gem-studded carapace castanets, two pair, used by treethanes in a glittering staccato flurry to call a meeting to order.

name: Konunleikar Bookmark Keepsake
description: The Mages Guild distributed these stylish leather bookmarks in honor of the Skald-King's Konunleikar celebration.

name: Supple Redguard Blade Polisher
description: An exquisitely worked strip of lion hide, treated with an oil of snake venom and ground beetle carapace. Worth every gold piece.

name: Supple Nord Blade Polisher
description: An exquisitely worked strip of tiger hide, treated with an oil of giant blood and ground chicken wings. Worth every gold piece.

name: Foxtail Book Marker
description: A thin sliver of fine wood used to mark one's place in a book, this one also has a fox-tail attached at the top.

name: Gold Tassels
description: These tassels would look good in any room. They would sell well to the right buyer.

name: Ivory Teeth
description: Someone is missing their false teeth.

name: Malachite Needle
description: Using malachite to make needles is popular among Bretons in Eastern High Rock.

name: Crimson Ship Ticket
description: A ticket for passage on the Crimson Ship, never used by its owner.

name: Shornhelm Players Performance Tickets
description: A pair of tickets for the annual performance of the play, "Ranser! You Madman!" at the Dead Wolf Inn.

name: Caravan Scrip
description: A promise of payment that identifies itself as issued by the Dragonstar Caravan Company.

name: Aetheric Lodestone
description: This extremely rare, perfectly round orb is highly magnetic and threaded with veins of glowing blue Aetherium.

name: Collectors' Sload-Carved Leviathan Tooth
description: Rare Eltheric leviathan tooth, even more sought-after due to it being carved with looping, untranslatable Sload script.

name: Jade Finchbone Toothpick
description: A jade toothpick carved to look like a finchbone. Perfect for picking meat from between one's teeth.

name: Trained Torchbug in A Bottle
description: When you shake the container, the torchbug inside this bottle flies in a pattern depicting five of the constellations.

name: Garden Troll Varmint Defender
description: Carved from ironwood by the Matrons of Shor's Stone, these friendly trolls are happy to protect your garden from unwanted pests.

name: Tuft of Hair
description: These wispy blond strands are tied with a purple ribbon. The ribbon is high enough quality to resell.

name: Blessed Horker Tusk On Gilt Plaque
description: Horker tusk carved with spiraling prayers to Y'ffre with three blessings from the Silvenar, mounted on a gilt wall plaque.

name: Greymist Falls Scrimshaw Tusk
description: Delicate scrimshaw carving on imported horker tusk depicting a couple picnicking at Greymist Falls.

name: Culanda Reading-Wand
description: Ivory wand surmounted with a glowing culanda stone, labeled "Property of Stormhold Mages Guild."

name: Sword-Singer's Finger-Weights
description: These small weights help strengthen the fingers of students at Leki's Blade.

name: Pair of Elden Tree Scroll Weights
description: Smooth marble weights, oval, for holding a scroll open on a desk, each engraved with an image of the Elden Tree.

name: Camel Whip
description: A finely woven leather whip, made for directing Craglorn camels.

name: Wasp-Wing Betrothal Veil
description: Heirloom Argonian betrothal veil woven of the wings of Shadowfen wasps, both ordinary and giant.

name: Nord Battle Wraps
description: These leather wrappings bind and encase wounded body parts so a Nord or like-thinking warrior can rush back into battle.

name: Gem-Studded Copper "Bedroom Yam"
description: A strangely-elongated copper ash yam, studded with peridot "eyes," discreetly engraved "Avani's Forge, Ebonheart."

name: Canteen Cozy
description: Used by travelers and soldiers alike, this simple cozy will keep a canteen's contents warm for hours.

name: Ball of Royal Ochre Mohair Yarn
description: Ball of top-quality mohair yarn, dyed with the rare and valuable Torval Royal Ochre pigment.

name: Fragrant Perfume Bottle
description: The bottle says this scent is called "Brooding." It smells like rotting crabapples.

name: Cologne of Cumberland
description: This bottle of sweet smelling oil is an exquisite cologne mixed by the royal alchemist for the noble families of Cumberland.

name: Bottle of First Era Sancre Tor Red
description: An extremely rare vintage, quite valuable to collectors. A symbol of a runestone is etched into the bottle.

name: Werewolf Musk Oil
description: Perfume distilled from the musk of a werewolf. Some use it as a fragrance, others as a way to avoid prowling werewolves.

name: Voluminous Volcanic Vapors
description: A sweet-smelling oil, burned at night to make one's bedchamber calm and fragrant.

name: Torchbug Hair Tonic
description: A clear jar full of glowing liquid distilled from torchbugs, some young men and women apply it to try to make their hair glow.

name: Scent of Magicka Cologne
description: A bottle of flowery perfume. The label promises to make anyone smell like a powerful magic-user.

name: Miniature Crystal Wine Bottle
description: A limited-edition tiny wine bottle produced for a local winery's hundredth anniversary.

name: Gold Coast Cleaning Oil
description: A small bottle of oil used by the Gold Coast mercenaries to clean and oil their leather armor.

name: Beetle Drippings Thinking Oil
description: A bottle of pungent oil rubbed into the scalp. The vapors are said to help concentrate on repetitive tasks.

name: Royal Seraglio Perfumed Oil
description: A bottle of fragrant oil that some find to be a mild aphrodesiac. Others find its smell appalling.

name: Summerset Vintage
description: A very old, very valuable bottle of Summerset wine.

name: Color-Changing Ink
description: An unusual ink crafted by alchemists at Good Titrations in Dhalmora, it appears as one color but transforms into another color.

name: Essence of Bleakrock
description: A wild and wintery cologne for the discerning Nords of Bleakrock, it's surprisingly crafted from a recipe by Biiri the Dark Elf.

name: Beetle-Be-Gone
description: Guaranteed to keep biting insects out of your bed linens. It works great if you don't mind your bed smelling like rotten limes.

name: Kollopi Root Mouth Freshener
description: The dry taste of the kollopi root may not be pleasant, but it absorbs all odors, leaving one's breath smelling perfectly fresh.

name: Red Asp Courting Oil
description: This oil creates an intoxicating aroma. The Red Asp and his colleagues use it for wooing women and disabling their enemies.

name: Ogondar's Unusual Vintage
description: An inexpensive but tasty wine bottled and sold at Ogondar's Winery, northeast of Belkarth.

name: Guroanii's Blazing Brew
description: A tasty ale with a hint of spice, bottled and sold at the Flaming Nix in Mournhold. Great for playing "Netch, Kwama, Netch."

name: Aurona's Breath Freshener
description: Alchemist Aurona in Mournhold crafts this refreshing concoction that eliminates bad breath and removes tarnish from silver.

name: Frostbite Spider Musk Oil
description: Perfumed oil distilled from the musk of a frostbite spider. Some Nords regularly apply it to their wrists and ears.

name: Vivec's Volcanic Vapors
description: A sweet-smelling oil, burned at night to make a Dark Elf's bedchamber calm and fragrant.

name: Kinhouse Cologne
description: A bottle of spiced perfume from the alchemists of House Indoril, which comes in different fragrances specific to each house.

name: Bottle of First Era Golden Wine
description: An extremely rare vintage, considered to be an antique. The symbol of three coins is etched into the bottle.

name: Deldwine's Unusual Vintage
description: A foul-tasting liquid that turns one's urine the same color of ink used by Pact officials. Desperate forgers might pay for this.

name: Aleeto's Invigorating Tincture
description: A popular salutary said to treat numerous romantic ailments, sold exclusively at the Uncanny Alembic in Fort Amol.

name: Essence of Mammoth
description: An expensive fragrance created by alchemists in Windhelm, popular with wealthy maidens and matrons for special occasions.

name: Bottle of First Era Snowfire Wine
description: An extremely rare vintage, considered priceless by some collectors. The symbol of a flame is etched into the bottle.

name: Monkey Musk Oil
description: Perfumed oil distilled from the musk of a monkey. Khajiit regularly apply generous amounts behind their tail and ears.

name: Wart-Away Foot Balm
description: A soothing ointment sold exclusively at Menoit's Emporium in Crosswych, it supposedly removes warts and foot fungus.

name: Bear Musk Oil
description: Perfumed oil distilled from the musk of a black bear. Bretons regularly apply generous amounts behind their wrists and ears.

name: Orc Sweat Cologne
description: An expensive fragrance created by alchemists in Aldcroft, popular with wealthy Bretons who want to unleash their inner Orc.

name: Bottle of First Era Collequiva
description: An extremely rare vintage, sought after by former Imperial nobility. The symbol of a peach is etched into the bottle.

name: Amorous Incense of Mara
description: An expensive and illegal fragrance used to enhance romantic activity in the bedchambers of wealthy Bretons.

name: Bottle of Vintage "Old Repugnant" Rotmeth
description: Unopened bottle of Old Repugnant rotmeth, vintage 544, "Green Leaf Brewers, Cormount."

name: Bottle of Torchbug Ink
description: Bottle of glowing ink that, when applied to parchment, draws greenly luminous letters.

name: Bottle of Five-Filtered Eel Unguent
description: Fancy green-glass bottle of eel unguent filtered five times through cheesecloth for purity.

name: Carved Ivory Lotion Bottle
description: Ornamental carved ivory bottle labeled "Green Witch Brand Wrinkle Remover" and containing a glowing chartreuse unguent.

name: Aristocrat's Alabaster Perfume Bottle
description: Alabaster perfume bottle with squeeze bulb and brass atomizer, half full of "Eau de Boar Bacon."

name: Chriane's Infused Libation
description: An tasty liquor with a hint of herbs, bottled and sold by Gerrald Chriane in Shornhelm.

name: Essence of Ravenwatch
description: House Ravenwatch has been manufacturing and selling this fragrant cologne since before the rise of King Ranser.

name: Bottle of First Era Blood Wine
description: An extremely rare vintage from the Ravenwatch Vineyards. The symbol of a heart is etched into the bottle.

name: Ampulla of Spiced Rum
description: Unopened two-handled bottle, labeled "Feduzdal's Finest Spiced Rum, Kragenmoor."

name: Argonian Cologne
description: A small glass bottle filled with a strong-smelling liquid. It's a scent that only Argonians could find alluring.

name: Vintage Snake Sweat Perfume
description: Fine crystal perfume bottle containing bladder-aged "snake sweat," vintage 2E 555.

name: Aklief's Alabaster Ale
description: A tasty brew with a hint of fruit and spice, bottled and sold by Aklief at Nimalten's Riverside Inn.

name: Essence of the Rift
description: A distinct and fragrant cologne for the discerning Nord, it's surprisingly crafted from a recipe by Darva the Dark Elf.

name: Nord Sweat Cologne
description: An expensive fragrance created by alchemists in Riften, popular with wealthy Dark Elves who want to unleash their inner Nord.

name: Bottle of First Era Ice Wine
description: This extremely rare vintage from the Stormcloak Vineyards is worth more as an antique than as a consumable beverage.

name: Bottle of Red Claw Polish
description: Bottle of bright crimson claw polish, with applicator brush, for use when both moons are dark ("Sangiin's Midnight").

name: Bottle of Catnip Perfume
description: Delicate perfume bottle containing aromatic catnip fragrance, from The Hissing Phial.

name: Bottle of Pyandonean Snake Essence
description: Maormer perfume: the liquid in this bottle has a strong reptilian odor.

name: Bottle of Vintage Sylph-Mead
description: Unopened bottle of vintage sylph-mead, quite valuable to connoisseurs, from the now-abandoned Glister Vale Hiveworks.

name: Bottle of Kinlord's Flagstaff Vigor Pills
description: Large green-glass bottle of Kinlord's Flagstaff vitality lozenges, "concocted from rare ingredients" by Aldmeri Essences.

name: Desert Cologne
description: Opening this gilded and polished bottle of liquid releases an overwhelming smell. At least you can sell the bottle.

name: Colovian Reserve Wine
description: A vintage bottle of wine that will only get better with time, if you can avoid drinking it.

name: Ghost Orchid Perfume
description: A crystal vial of perfume scented with ghost orchid, one of the rarest and most coveted flowers in all of Tamriel.

name: Grandma Singa's Hairball Remedy
description: A bottle of Singa-dra's Digestive Aid and Hairball Remedy Elixer. Now in delightful Cod flavor!

name: Poplar Bark Headache Strips
description: A bottle of chewable strips of poplar bark, designed to relieve headaches. It's increasingly poplar!

name: Ship in A Bottle
description: A finely-crafted model of the Abecean Monarch, an Altmer ship of the All Flags Navy, constructed inside a small-necked bottle.

name: Cyrodiil Combat Canteen
description: An ornate and rather ostentatious drinking vessel provided to those who volunteer to fight in the Three Banners War.

name: Caravaneer's Canteen
description: A sturdy steel canteen, emblazoned with the caravaneer's guild heraldry. A valuable tool in trade negotiations.

name: Engraved Silver Flagon
description: This imposing tankard has the seal of the Screaming Mermaid engraved on it.

name: Snow-Squatter's Wrap
description: Some say only milk-drinkers use these fur-lined wraps when relieving themselves at night, yet most Nords keep one by the door.

name: Belt of Smaller Carpentry Tools
description: Guar-leather belt carrying an assortment of smaller carpentry tools, labeled "Property of Stonecrush Lumber Camp."

name: Crossed Scimitars Buckle
description: A metal buckle bearing the image of crossed scimitars, a symbol with profound meaning to Redguards.

name: Snakeskin Cuffs
description: One loop of these snakeskin bindings can be adjusted to fit a wrist or an ankle. The other is fitted for a common bedpost.

name: Horse-Hide Falconer's Gage
description: This triple-layered glove was crafted for a Forebear noble and decorated with a depiction of Tava.

name: Belkarth Oven Mitt
description: This heavy woolen glove is perfect for pulling kebabs out of a hot clay oven.

name: Mammoth-Hide Falconer's Gage
description: A well-made falconer's glove made of finely-stiched mammoth leather.

name: Decorative House Dres Pot Holders
description: Padded mittens for handling hot objects, scenes of Dres masters and their Argonian slaves decorate the quilted surface.

name: Duneripper Scale Ankle Cuff
description: This honorary ankle cuff was given as a bonus to the workers who tiled the royal palace in Sentinel.

name: Calf-Skin Hand Warmer
description: A muff purportedly created by "indigenous tribal crafters" and sold exclusively in high-end shops throughout Tamriel.

name: Silent Mire Hand Warmer
description: A muff crafted by the Argonians of Silent Mire and sold exclusively to the highest echelon of Dark Elf society by House Hlaalu.

name: Teeba-Hatsei Hip Pad
description: Worn by Murkmire "hip-and-tail-ball" players, this padding of wood and dried wasso leaves is a conversation piece in Bal Foyen.

name: Sep Cultist's Cilice
description: A silver barb-lined strap to dig into the wearer's chest, held in a small box. They are used by members of a secret cult of Sep.

name: Rilis Tabard
description: A hand-embroidered coat of arms.

name: Blue Satin Goblin House-Slave's Suit
description: Blue satin sailor's-suit with white lace trim, for a Goblin slave serving the nobility on feast days.

name: Argonian Tail Band
description: A band of colored leather worn as a decorative element on the tails of some Dhalmora Argonians. This one has bells attached.

name: Cloven Silver Circlet
description: An old circlet likely worn by some of Betony's lesser royalty, split in twain by an axe strike and mounted to a plaque.

name: Antler Headdress
description: A purely decorative headdress affixed to the heads of statues on holy days.

name: Holiday Antler Circlet, With Bells
description: Child-sized birthday wear: a croc-leather brow circlet mounted with forehead antlers, and a silver bell hanging from each point.

name: Broken Nord Helm
description: A cloven Nord helmet, mounted on a cracked longboat oar.

name: Broken Ornamental Horned Helm
description: Full-helm, broken, ornamented with curved horns, with maker's-mark of "Defender's Domain."

name: Broken Akaviri Hoplite's Blade
description: Akaviri swordsman's steel blade, broken and missing its hilt, a souvenir of the recent invasion.

name: House Tharn Family Crest
description: This highly-detailed embroidered crest of House Tharn, dating back to the First Era, is of great historical and artistic value.

name: Bear-Claw Parchment Clasp
description: A clasp cleverly crafted from the claw of a snow bear to hold sheets of loose parchment together.

name: Autographed Green Lady Silhouette
description: Silhouette graven on copperplate of the late Green Lady, personally autographed by Her Verdant Highness.

name: Jade Cameo Sculpture
description: This lovingly polished relief sculpture depicts a Dunmer in profile.

name: Enchanted Broom
description: An otherwise unremarkable broom, enchanted to sweep an entire room by itself when its owner claps thrice.

name: Bloodthorn Yoke
description: A chain of braided, thorn-covered vines that bites into the flesh, supposedly worn by members of the Bloodthorn cult.

name: String of Thrassian Pearls
description: Precious stones of radiant blue from the Coral Kingdoms, where no Man or Mer dares tread, passed down from the First Era.

name: Queen Nurnhilde's Nail Clipping
description: A locket with a nail supposedly clipped from the corpse of Queen Nurnhilde before her interment.

name: Ivory Lapel Pins
description: These delicate lapel pins have strange symbols carved into their delicate curves.

name: Mournhold Memento Box
description: A collection of Mournhold mementos, obviously important to their owner, including locks of hair and other sentimental items.

name: Braided Feather Ornament
description: An elaborate ornament featuring a splash of feathers, cowry shells, and dyed reed ribbons.

name: Sentinel Cutlery
description: A set of expertly crafted Redguard cutlery, imported from Alik'r for use only by the most discerning chefs.

name: Cabbage Slicer
description: To the untrained eye, this bronze cabbage slicer appears to be of Dwemer design. Everyone else knows they're made in Daggerfall.

name: Ebony Spoon
description: It's hard to imagine who would waste ebony ore to forge a spoon, but that doesn't make it any less valuable.

name: Pocket Knife
description: Too small to be used in combat, this small knife would be perfect for general daily use while out and about.

name: Bright Butcher's Cleaver
description: A fat cleaver with a notch designed specifically for scraping meat from bones.

name: Magnifica's Nail Trimmer
description: A small, golden device used by Hammerfell's nobles to trim their nails.

name: Shalk-Resin Nail Trimmer
description: A small device made of hardened shalk resin, designed to keep a Dark Elf's nails neat and trim.

name: Nord Cheese Chopper
description: A polished metal chopping blade designed to slice chunks from massive cheese wheels. The hilt is carved to look like a dragon.

name: Baan Dar Whittling Knife
description: Ostensibly designed for whittling, Khajiit and Wood Elf alike are known to employ these blades in popular tavern games.

name: Ayleid Flesh-Sculpting Flenser
description: Ancient, corroded flenser as used by Ayleid "flesh sculptors," engraved with the Ayleidoon "N" for Ne Salas.

name: Fine Steel Skinning Kit
description: An imported Khajiiti skinning kit, only lightly used.

name: Fine Steel Paper Opener
description: A small, dull sword-shaped opener for cutting open envelopes and untrimmed books; engraved "The Fighting Edge, Shornhelm."

name: Oyster-Shell Drawknife
description: This woodworking tool was deftly constructed. Its nacre blade shimmers in the light.

name: Dreugh-Claw Paring Knife
description: This small cooking knife appears to be an antique.

name: Ivory-Handled Eel Flensers
description: Set of razor-sharp ivory-handled eel knives for tableside skin-flensing; in a handsome presentation box.

name: Envelope Opener With Rilis Sigil
description: This platinum-chased envelope opener bears the sigil of House Rilis on its pommel.

name: Bosmer Cutlery
description: A set of finely shaped cutlery made entirely of silver. Sets like these are highly valued by Bosmer who follow the Green Pact.

name: Edifying Illusio-Scope
description: Bulging device with inward-facing goggles and a crank that, when turned, shows the viewer  moving images of Bosmer procreation.

name: Cathay-Raht Bedroom Accoutrements
description: Brightly painted Khajiiti paraphernalia for playing "Hircine's Tiger Hunt," a popular bedroom game.

name: High King's Lion
description: A medal shaped like a lion's head, High King Emeric awards the Lion for acts of heroism and special service to the crown.

name: Sentinel Lion Medal
description: A Redguard medal bearing the image of a lion on the front and a Sentinel maker's mark on the back.

name: Tarnished Medal of Valor
description: A golden emblem bearing the Covenant's heraldry, cast aside and forgotten.

name: Wayrest Medal of Bravery
description: One of many military decorations King Emeric bestowed upon his knights after their victory in Ranser's War.

name: Cyrodiil Badge of Honor
description: A prestigious gold medal given to warriors wounded in the Three Banners War.

name: Dwarven Compass
description: Made of simple copper, this Dwemer device is used to measure or maintain orientation.

name: First Auridon Marines Medal
description: A sterling silver veteran's medal presented to those who have served in the First Auridon Marines.

name: Fine Arkay Talisman
description: This golden talisman may have been worn by Frederique Lynielle. The clasp is broken, but it remains a beautiful piece.

name: Tribunal Medal of Honor
description: One of many military decorations the Tribunal bestowed upon their best soldiers after defeating the Akaviri.

name: Cyrodiil Service Medal
description: The Skald-King honors soldiers who return from the War of Three Banners with one of these prestigious gold medals.

name: Cyrodiil Medal of Honor
description: High King Emeric honors soldiers who return from the War of Three Banners with one of these prestigious silver medals.

name: Orc Tusk Consolation Medal
description: Catgut strung with a dozen Wood Orc tusks, attached to a bone disc; engraved "Drublog Orc Hunt, Runner-Up."

name: Chimer Talisman of Boethiah
description: Ancient copper disc depicting the once-great temple to Boethiah on Ash Mountain.

name: Commemorative "Broken Shackles" Medal
description: Bronze medal depicting a set of broken shackles, inscribed "Jubilee Day 572, Lukiul Uxith."

name: Dres Grandmaster Memorial Medal
description: Golden medal memorializing Grandmaster Thalthil Dres, who established Dres as a Great House by his slave-raid on Thorn.

name: Icon of Almalexia Blessing Iliath Temple
description: Icon depicting Almalexia blessing Iliath Temple, with the Lady rendered in geniune gold leaf.

name: Naemon Commemorative Matriculation Token
description: Gold token commemorating Prince Naemon's matriculation to the Sapiarchs' Labyrinth in 2E 573.

name: Star-Gazer Medal
