description: A large, ebony medal with three constellations carved into the back of it, representing the Warrior, the Mage, and the Thief.

name: Wooden Kynareth Talisman
description: This talisman looks well-traveled. Strands of worn leather dangle like hanging moss.

name: Household Napkin Holder
description: A metal band displaying a family motif to decorate and identify the owner of a particular linen napkin.

name: Indoril Councilor's Seal
description: Heavy gold seal of House Indoril; used to press the house seal into warm wax when sealing official envelopes.

name: Gold-Plated Napkin Holder Set
description: A very rare set of gold-plated napkin holders used at the feast celebrating the coronation of King Hidellith.

name: Imperial Napkin Holders
description: These expensive ebony napkin holders were a gift from a Colovian noble to High King Amdashir of Hammerfell.

name: Brass Wedding Pin
description: This simple pin symbolizes an eternal bond of love. If its bestower wasn't so cheap, it would be worth more for resale.

name: Silver Serviette Holder
description: A set of eight serviette holders, decorated with delicate filigree.

name: Ancient Rilis Guard Binder
description: Ancient and fragile copper buckler, originally carried by a member of the Royal Guard of Kinlord Rilis, the First of Firsthold.

name: Souvenir Imperial Heater
description: A souvenir from a battle with Imperial forces, this cracked and dented shield has been mounted to a plaque.

name: Curious Steel Platter
description: Upon close inspection, this centuries-old platter was originally an ornate Breton buckler. Now it's only good for serving food.

name: Cracked Argonian Shell Boss
description: A souvenir from a battle with Pact forces. There is a prominent crack in the turtle-shell casing.

name: Cloven Centurion's Scutum
description: This cracked Imperial shield is hundreds of years old. A fragile heirloom, now useless for the battlefield.

name: Thunderbug Climbing Cleats
description: Ankle gaiters with in-turned cleats made of thunderbug mandibles, used for climbing trees to archery platforms.

name: Jester's Day Ox-Hoof Cleats
description: When attached to boots, these cleats leave prints like oxen for Jester's Day pranks; they still smell slightly of ox-dung.

name: Jester's Day "Platform Boots"
description: Hilarious attachable prank stilts for standing in deep puddles to make them seem shallow. "Gets 'em every time," says the label.

name: Calf-Skin Baby Shoes
description: A pair of baby shoes, never worn.

name: Nix-Hound Booties
description: Councilor Tredere Redoran commissioned specially crafted footwear for her beloved nix-hound, Flanish.

name: Nord Snowshoes
description: A well-crafted pair of Nord snowshoes with intricately-woven mesh and polished bentwood frames.

name: Hozzin's Snowshoe
description: A single contrivance consisting of a frame of stretched-leather thongs that, in pairs, enable a wearer to walk across deep snow.

name: Fine Waterproof Stilt-Boots
description: Waterproof snakeskin stilt-boots for fishing in the shore-swamps, crafted at Vineshade Lodge.

name: Replica Staff of Magnus
description: Only a mage could tell the difference between this and the authentic staff. A smuggler or con artist could find much use for it.

name: Stuffed Troll Head
description: A stuffed and mounted troll head, the eyes surprisingly alert and bright, they seem to follow you with hungry anticipation.

name: Golden Mudcrab Plaque
description: Gilded mudcrab mounted on dreugh-shell plaque, inscribed "Best in Class, Sunscale Strand Mudcrab Heave."

name: Mounted Trophy Slaughterfish
description: This large slaughterfish is displayed on a simple wooden mount. A plaque underneath claims it to be the largest ever caught.

name: Mounted Stag Head
description: Inanimate, but still imposing. It would make an excellent decorative piece on any mantle.

name: Stuffed Nix-Hound
description: Hlanus Hlaalu's son adored his many nix-hounds, so much so that when they died, he had them stuffed.

name: Elden Tree Golden Acorn Plaque
description: Fist-sized golden acorn mounted on a wall plaque, reading "Winner, Annual Elden Tree Speed Climb."

name: Lifelike Stuffed Dog
description: A prized pet dog, stuffed and mounted for display, shows how far wealthy citizens will go to keep memories alive.

name: Creepy Stuffed Crow
description: A prized pet crow, stuffed and mounted for display, shows how far wealthy Rivenspire citizens will go to hold onto the past.

name: Stuffed Kwama Scrib
description: A stuffed and mounted baby kwama. It is undeniably adorable.

name: Mounted Troll Head
description: Though it makes an unsightly trophy, someone was clearly very proud of killing this young she-troll and mounted her head.

name: Depressing Stuffed Goat
description: A prized pet goat, stuffed and mounted for display, shows how far wealthy Riften citizens will go to hold onto the past.

name: Stuffed Scamp Head
description: A stuffed and mounted scamp head, the eyes surprisingly alert and bright, covered with a fine layer of dust.

name: Dragonstar Arena Consolation Prize
description: The steel-dipped spine of a failed Dragonstar Arena competitor. Typically presented to next of kin, or sold on the black market.

name: Ornamental Taxidermied Alit Head
description: Carefully-preserved alit head, tanned skin stretched over skull, painted with Green Pact symbols, with emeralds for eyes.

name: Mounted Bat's Head
description: A massive bat head, mounted on a stone plaque. The fangs are still sharp.

name: Stuffed Bat
description: It seems someone fired an arrow right through this bat's head, then had it stuffed and mounted for bragging rights.

name: Stuffed Camel Head
description: A stuffed and mounted camel head, the eyes surprisingly alert and bright, covered with a fine layer of dust.

name: Stuffed Sentinel Cat
description: Fahara'jad's daughters adopted many stray cats. The girls loved them so much, that when they died, he had them stuffed.

name: Lifelike Stuffed Chicken
description: A prized pet chicken, stuffed and mounted for display, shows how far wealthy Daggerfall citizens will go to keep memories alive.

name: Thizzrini Grand Champion Medal
description: This medal, in the shape of a three-sided pyramid, is engraved with depictions of a swordmaster, sorceror and summoner.

name: Stuffed Fox
description: A stuffed, taxidermied fox mounted on a polished mahogany base.

name: Mounted Gargoyle Head
description: As difficult as killing a gargoyle may be, removing one's head is even harder, making this noble's trophy extremely valuable.

name: Golden Royal Fishing Statuette
description: Gold-plated statuette of a leaping trout engraved "Royal Camoran Fishing Tournament, 2E 561."

name: Pet Monkey Red Vest and Fez
description: Tiny embroidered red vest and tiny red fez with yellow tassel; a label inside the lapel reads "Noryariel, Tailor."

name: Combination Letter Opener and Rodent Skewer
description: Small slim blade the length of an index finger, weighted for throwing across the room, but harmless to all but small rodents.

name: Ivory-Handled Plume Trimmer
description: A small, slim pair of scissors that fold into a handle of timber-mammoth ivory.

name: Souvenir Cyrodiil Hammer Head
description: A souvenir from a battle in the War of the Three Banners, this detached warhammer head makes a compelling paperweight.

name: Three Banners War Memorabilia
description: Mementos recovered from fallen warriors in the Three Banners War and preserved for posterity by a Craglorn relic hunter.

name: Dwemer Hammer Hilt
description: The hilt of an ancient Dwemer warhammer, retained as an heirloom by some Dark Elf family.

name: Orc Chieftain's Spearhead
description: A souvenir from the Breton-Orc conflicts of the past, this ornate spearhead was probably wielded by an Orc chieftain.

name: Royal Mahout's Ceremonial Ankus
description: Bejeweled ankus of the First Era formerly used on holidays by a mahout of the Royal Camoran Timber Mammoth Corps.

name: At-Tura Scimitar Sheath
description: Count Hosni at-Tura is known for keeping a vast collection of ornate scimitar sheaths from all over Hammerfell.

name: Aldmeri Ceremonial Saber
description: A purely ornamental saber. The refined artistic design is matched only by the fragility of its construction.

name: Nedic Sword Pommel
description: The pommel of an ancient Nedic sword, retained as an heirloom by some Breton family.

name: Sword-Disciple's Jewelled Pommel
description: A pommel fashioned in the Yokudan style, and possibly constructed in that faraway land.

name: Snake-Sword Hilt
description: The hilt of an Akaviri weapon, undoubtedly a souvenir taken from a fallen Snake during the war.

name: Atmoran Dagger Hilt
description: The hilt of an ancient Atmoran dagger, retained as an heirloom by some Nord household.

name: Wooden Letter Opener
description: Decorative lines are carved into the handle of the dark wooden letter opener.

name: Silver Shaving Razor
description: A shave doesn't get much closer with this silver razor.

name: Monkeybone Fruit Peeler
description: A thin, curved tool made from monkeybone and designed to peel fruit.

name: Golden Letter Opener
description: Taken from a well-stocked Aldmeri tradeship, this tool has Dominion heraldry emblazoned on the handle.

name: Royal Accolade of the Hunt
description: A golden recognition medal from the Skald-King, awarded to the master hunters of Skyrim.

name: Seven Satin Tail-Bows
description: Seven superb tail-bows, each in the traditional color associated with a day of the week.

name: Bone Orchard Memorial Arrow
description: After burial in the Bone Orchard, the bereaved family is presented with a memorial arrow made from the deceased's ulna.

name: Memorial Broken Arrow Plaque
description: A broken arrow mounted on a mudcrab-shell wall plaque. "In Loving Memoriam" is burnt into the shell.

name: Thulvald's Ebony Log Splitter
description: A triangular ebony wedge, perfect for splitting wood. It bears the symbol of Thulvald's Logging Camp.

name: Presentation Wooden Training Sword
description: Coralwood Dunmeri training sword, inscribed "Fort Arand Troop Trainer, Ten-Year Award—May the Three Bless You!"

name: Club Insignia
description: A small pumice worry-stone, carved with the symbol of an exclusive club of merchants and traders.

name: Redguard Rank 1 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Redguard Rank 2 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Redguard Rank 3 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Redguard Rank 4 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Redguard Rank 5 Art
description: This box contains arms with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Orc Rank 1 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Orc Rank 2 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Orc Rank 3 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Orc Rank 4 Art
description: This box contains arms and armor with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: Orc Rank 5 Art
description: This box contains arms with a refreshed style. Tell us what you think of them!

name: The Artist's Latest Works
description: Within this box are collections of new art for considered critique and perusal.

name: Aproned Shirt
description: This simple linen workshirt has an aproned bib attached to the front.

name: Paneled Shirt
description: This simple linen workshirt is composed of simple panels.

name: Stitched Shirt and Vest
description: This simple linen workshirt has an attached vest.

name: Layered Blouse
description: This simple linen workshirt is double-layered, with a bloused collar.

name: Layered Shirt
description: A simple, double-layered linen workshirt and vest.

name: Corseted Shirt
description: A low-cut linen shirt with a corseted waist.

name: Vested Shirt and Cuffs
description: A respectable shirt with matching vest and cuffs.

name: Long-Sleeved Tunic
description: A simple, belted tunic with long sleeves.

name: Short-Sleeved Tunic
description: A simple, belted tunic with short sleeves.

name: Long-Sleeved Wrapped Shirt
description: A wrapped, belted tunic with long sleeves.

name: Short-Sleeved Wrapped Shirt
description: A wrapped, belted tunic with short sleeves.

name: Sleeveless Wrapped Shirt
description: A wrapped, belted sleeveless tunic.

name: Wrapped Shirt and Vest
description: A wrapped, sleeveless tunic and vest.

name: Side-Stitched Trousers
description: Sackcloth trousers, roughly stitched together and bound at the ankle.

name: Aproned Kilt and Trousers
description: An aproned kilt and trousers, durably made.

name: Trousers and Tails
description: Made for hard travel or city-living style.

name: Loose-Fit Trousers
description: Fitted and comfortable. Definitely not trousers for work.

name: Traveler's Boots
description: Well-made and lightly worn. Great for style, hard riding, or hard walking.

name: Plain Sandals
description: Generally considered more comfortable than boots.

name: Cuffed Boots
description: Turn-cuffed boots made for heavy labor or travel.

name: Fingerless Gauntlets
description: Repaired several times and well-worn.

name: Fingerless Gloves
description: Made without fingers, for some reason.

name: Stitched Long Gloves
description: Lightly-worn gloves for riding or travelling.

name: Stitched Long Dress
description: A durable, well-mended dress for work or casual wear.

name: Bloused Long Dress
description: A double-layered dress for work or casual wear. Rather warm.

name: Layered Long Dress
description: A double-layered dress for work or casual wear. Rather warm.

name: Corseted Long Dress
description: A low-cut corseted dress.

name: Vampire Dust
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Vampire Fang
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Perfect Roe
description: Beautiful and fragrant, Perfect Roe is prized by Provisioners the world over as an ingredient in the rarest of recipes.

name: Dunmer Cultural Garb
description: This stylish Dark Elf clothing displays a variety of garish colors.

name: Illegible Page From the Oghma Infinium
description: This torn page depicts multiple circular diagrams adorned with Daedric letters in a deep, black ink.

name: Piece of Volendrung's Handle
description: Reputedly of Rourken clan make, this shattered hilt-shard is emblazoned with the blunt runes of the Dwarves.

name: Golden Tooth of A Golden Saint
description: A detailed emblem depicting an elderly man with three faces is carved into this gleaming tooth.

name: Haft of A Daedric Scythe
description: This hilt begins and ends with silver guards, though the blades are missing. A single, fanged Daedric letter adorns each hilt.

name: Bone Fragment From the Spine of Ashpit
description: This grey block is so light as to be hollow, and it sheds dust of a similar color as if it were made of the stuff.

name: Star Tooth Shard
description: This thin slice of crystal glows with a soft, inner light.

name: Blade From A Razor Pit
description: Daedric inscriptions adorn this scalpel-thin blade in a stark, blood-red.

name: Petal From the Sanguine Rose
description: From a rare flower said to bloom in the myriad planes of Oblivion.

name: Jar of Wild Hunt Vapor
description: An Altmeri label on this jar of thick, vacuous liquid claims it was collected in the wake of a Wild Hunt in Skyrim.

name: Dwemer Animunculi Schematics
description: These complex schematics detail several types of Dwemer builder constructs.

name: Vein From the Heart of Lorkhan
description: This red, crystal vein is said to have been chipped from the Heart of Lorkhan itself.

name: Vial of Ashpit Air
description: This small ampoule is filled with a thick, roiling vapor. A small label with Mages Guild letterhead reads, "Air from Ashpit."

name: Haft-Shard of Sunder
description: A massive splinter of rune-carved oak, this artifact seems to be evidence of Kagrenac's legendary tools.

name: Banner of House Dagoth
description: This ancient banner is torn, but the seal of the infamous House Dagoth shines through despite the grime and tattered cloth.

name: Ruby From the Ruby Throne
description: This sparkling gem is the size of a grown Orc's fist and has been shaped to form a simulacrum of the Imperial Ruby.

name: Box of Shehai Essence
description: This wooden box is covered in Yokudan runes. Altmeri writing on an attached label reads, "Essence of Shattered Spirit Sword."

name: Auriel's Quiver
description: This ivory case is embossed with gold. Scholarly markings identify it as "Auriel's Quiver," for whatever that's worth.

name: Sword-Singer Manual
description: This well-worn collection of pages lacks a proper cover, but contains detailed diagrams and illustrations of sword techniques.

name: Dwemer Red Mountain Standard
description: This tattered banner bearing the seal of some forgotten Dwemeri house is said to have come from the battlefield of Red Mountain.

name: Shatter-Shard of Mehrunes' Razor
description: This piece of shattered black metal seems to drink light. Part of an emblazoned Daedric script runs along its length.

name: Lantern of the Golden Era
description: This fog lamp bears the crest of the "Golden Era," flagship for the fabled All-Flags Navy.

name: Hairbrush of the First Mane
description: The headdress worn by Rid-Thar-ri'Datta was woven from the manes of two dozen chieftains. It required a lot of brushing.

name: Hunding's Blade-Shard
description: A shard from the shattered blade of Frandar Hunding himself, a relic of the battle at Hattu Mountain.

name: Prayer Cloth of the Yokudan War-Gods
description: An ancient wall scroll studied by the Maidens of the Spirit Sword, somehow spirited away from the now-lost island nation.

name: Serpent-Veil of Orgnum
description: Tattered silk embroidered with Maormer runes of rulership and bearing the entwined image of mating sea serpents.

name: Many-Hued Bird Feather
description: Touching this feather brings a happy little tune, and a brush of mania, to your mind.

name: Ancestor Moth Pupa
description: A green-hued casing from the molt of a rare Ancestor Moth. It smells ever so faintly of fresh grass and clean water.

name: Stamp of the Black Drake
description: A cracked stamp, an official seal from the reign of Durcorach, the first of the Longhouse Emperors.

name: Deathbringer Clan Facepaint
description: This small pot of facepaint smells pungently of blood. The sigil of Valkynaz Seris is stamped on the bottom of the glass.

name: Skaal-Carved Horker Tusk
description: This scrimshaw depicts the early ancestors of the Skaal people running their boats aground on the isle of Solstheim.

name: Bendu Olo's Sextant
description: The precision of this instrument is uncanny despite its age—a worthy tool for Baron-Admiral Bendu Olo of the All Flags Navy.

name: Fang of Krahjotdaan
description: Faded inscriptions cover the surface of this prodigious yellow fang. They depict the slaying of the high dragon Krahjotdaan.

name: Sacred Inkwell of Marukh the Seer
description: This finely crafted inkwell was likely used by the prophet Marukh during the days of the Alessian Order.

name: Bolt of the Numidium
description: A massive dwarven bolt, unnaturally warm to the touch. Scholarly markings link it to the legendary Brass God, Numidium.

name: Scute of the Mock Turtle
description: Most scholars dismiss tales of a massive turtle dwelling beyond the Weir Gate as pure nonsense … but this shell is really big.

name: Blood of St. Pelin
description: This crystal phial is full of what is said to be the blood of St. Pelin the martyr. Even if emptied, the blood always returns.

name: Plait of Jurgen Windcaller's Beard
description: This ancient nord coffer contains a long braid of gray hair. The plait almost certainly came from the chin of Jurgen Windcaller.

name: Eldergleam Amber
description: A gleaming golden amber that sings a faint and soothing melody. It could only have come from the ancient tree, Eldergleam.

name: Ashes of Lamae Beolfag
description: Looking at these ashes elicits a deep revulsion. They were likely taken from the pyre of the first vampire, Lamae Beolfag.

name: Phial of Daedric Whispers
description: This glass phial appears to be empty, but utters dark and seductive whispers when uncorked. The voice is likely that of Mephala.

name: Morihaus Wing Feather
description: A massive golden feather that is lighter than a sparrow, but stronger than steel. This may be a relic of the legendary Morihaus.

name: Shard of the Ideal Masters
description: This sliver of crystal buzzes angrily, releasing intermittent pulses of purple light. It may be a fragment of an Ideal Master.

name: Ancient Dragonguard Burial Mask
description: This ancient silver mask is of Akaviri design. It bears the likeness of a hissing serpent devouring the dragon Vuljotnaak.

name: Bucket
description: "A Bucket helm? Nope, sorry—who would wear such a thing? It's far too silly and undignified. Be off. …Ha ha ha, fooled you! That sounds splendid! Where can I get one?" —Sir Cadwell of Codswallop

name: Broom
description: "Lifts-Her-Tail: 'But, my lord, your broom is so very long and stiff! To move it back and forth, I shall have to use both hands!'" — Excerpt from The Dusty Argonian Maid

name: False Teeth Collection
description: A small collection of false teeth, in a mixed assortment of brass and iron. Some are still flecked with dried blood.

name: Twisted Nose Ring
description: This bronze-plated hoop became twisted when it was torn from the nostril of a combatant, skin chunk and all.

name: Decorative Scalp
description: A long set of hair pleats threaded with small glass beads, still attached to a dessicated chunk of skull and skin.

name: Not-So-Lucky Nose Needle
description: A long steel needle, once slotted firmly through the nose of a mighty warrior before it was forcibly removed.

name: Tattoo-Skin Wrist Cozy
description: This wristband shows off the delicate tattoo artistry sought out by the skin's original owner.

name: Polished Gut-Rock
description: The remnants of a painful buildup passed through the body. Some are polished to a dull sheen and sold by artistic alchemists.

name: Skeever Skull Trophy
description: A massive alit fang driven straight through the skull of a skeever. The fang is decorated with rustic symbols.

name: Kwama Egg Stein
description: A crude stein fashioned from a resin-hardened kwama egg.

name: Scorpion Barb Sewing Needle
description: A thick barb from a giant scorpion, modified with an eyelet to accommodate ropy thread.

name: Scrimshaw Boot Scraper
description: The end of a carved mammoth's tusk serves as the perfect instrument to scrape mud off of one's boots.

name: Harpy Feather Pillow
description: A small road pillow stuffed with harpy feathers. It smells absolutely terrible.

name: Traveling Smith's Kit
description: A dusty satchel with a scratched hammer, tongs, and a cracked set of bellows.

name: Moon-Sugar Chawbox
description: A small tin box for holding "chewing sugar," a thick form of moon-sugar favored by Baandari traders.

name: Practice Sword Hilt
description: The cracked hilt of a wooden practice sword. It is sized for a child's hand and carefully wrapped in a piece of cloth.

name: Cast Iron Toothed Spoon
description: A well-used travel utensil, still flecked with its owner's last meal.

name: Tin of Wound Resin
description: A small tin of amber resin, used to seal up small cuts after a fight.

name: Torn Dominion Rank Insignia
description: A rank insignia torn from the uniform of a Dominion officer. Dark stains suggest they did not survive the encounter.

name: Torn Pact Rank Insignia
description: A rank insignia torn from the uniform of a Pact officer. Dark stains suggest they did not survive the encounter.

name: Torn Covenant Rank Insignia
description: A rank insignia torn from the uniform of a Covenant officer. Dark stains suggest they did not survive the encounter.

name: Wolf Leg Baton
description: A wolf's leg reinforced with an iron rod makes for a fierce and festive parade ornamentation.

name: Cocoa-Coated Leaf Pack
description: A small leather pack filled with cocoa-dusted leaves. When added to tea, it adds a delightful chocolatey tang.

name: Royal Cartographer's Kit
description: This sturdy satchel contains a silver-coated sextant, fine vellum, inks, and a number of quills.

name: Axe-Haft Incense Holder
description: An incense holder made from the scarred base of a battleaxe haft. A crude inscription reads "Peace, Not Blood."

name: Dwemer-Metal Shavings
description: A leather pouch containing Dwemer metal shavings, meticulously sliced from a construct.

name: Finger Bone Charm
description: A calcified finger bone hangs from a simple wrist chain. There is no indication of its original owner.

name: Obsidian Mini Cleaver
description: A stone meat cleaver, sized for the hands of a small child. It is razor sharp to the touch.

name: Orichalcum Mystery Sphere
description: A dozen colored glass beads cross its surface. Touching a bead causes the color to change, but nothing else seems to happen.

name: Hematite Worry Stone
description: A silvery-black worry stone with the symbol of Mephala on its surface. Rubbing it causes blinding headaches.

name: Horrified Flesh-Mask
description: The dried, frayed face of an elf. The expression on its face is one of abject horror. Either a trophy or a conversation piece.

name: Preserved Sheogorath Tract
description: A bottle of an unidentified liquid, in which floats a chapbook of mad lore. It's unclear how the book got inside the bottle.

name: Ivory Abacus Rod
description: This ivory rod has six flat sides, each inscribed with simple equations. Intended to help young scholars learn their maths.

name: Dwarven-Rune Handkerchief
description: A high quality silk handkerchief, artfully embroidered with Dwemeri runes across its surface.

name: Sload Stomach Pouch
description: A torn coin pouch, apparently made from the voluminous stomach of a Sload bloat-warrior.

name: Wamasu Organ Lantern
description: A metal frame sheathed in leather, surrounding the "lightning organ" of a wamasu. It gives off a bright, intermittent light.

name: Imga Fur Hand Warmer
description: A luxurious hand warmer made from a thick, warm pelt. A sewn label inside claims it was made from a "treacherous" Imga.

name: Hist Bark Cane
description: A cane made of twisted and blackened bark. Putting an ear to the wood allows one to hear quiet sobbing, as if from far off.

name: Dreugh Wax Corker
description: A wax stopper for any open bottle. Some swear it makes the contents more flavorful; others claim it adds a waxy aftertaste.

name: Sanguine Devotional Card
description: An illustrated card depicting the Daedric Prince Sanguine offering the bearer a bottle.

name: Pouch of "Coins"
description: Flattened brass discs good for fooling less-than-sober gamblers. Best used in poorly lit rooms.

name: Skeever Tail Stirring Stick
description: A skeever's tail, preserved in wax. Some believe stirring one's drink with it brings good luck. Others believe it's disgusting.

name: Prurient Kerchief
description: A kerchief with a red-stained beeswax kiss pressed into it. A blackmailer might find this useful.

name: Pocket Goblin
description: A small pewter Goblin. It is said to bring good luck when dropped into any drink. (But not wine. Never wine.)

name: Cat Whisker Ear Scraper
description: A small stick with cat whiskers glued to the end, intended to clean one's ears. A forger might have use for this.

name: Tippler's Tiny Tidbit Tin
description: An empty circular tin with four-section divider. Typically used to carry morsels that pair best with drink.

name: Piffle Trumpet
description: A tiny conical brass bell tapering into a small tube. When held to the ear, one can overhear distant gossip at loud parties.

name: "Gentle Touch" Servant Baton
description: A baton with a sponge on the end. Once sold as a merciful way to strike misbehaving servants, it has since found other uses.

name: Autographed Calling Card
description: A signed, sloppily illustrated card depicting someone of indeterminate race and gender. A forger might find use for this.

name: Palm Flask
description: A small wooden container with a hidden reservoir. It can easily be hidden in a coin pouch, a sleeve, or the palm of one's hand.

name: Hooked Scraper
description: A small hooked metal tool designed to clean grime from beneath nails or claws.

name: Tin of Eyeblack
description: A foul-smelling, waxy black paste. Rubbing this around the eyes helps reduce the sun's glare. Also useful for sneak thieves.

name: Footwear Repair Kit
description: A folded leather kit with tools for repairing sandals, shoes, and boots. It could be useful for traveling forgers.

name: Baling Hook
description: A metal hook with a wooden handle, often used for carrying bales of hay. Sneak thieves could fashion it into a crude grapnel.

name: Joint Salve Jar
description: A tiny unguent jar. The label claims its powerful numbing properties reduce joint pain. It could be useful to skooma slingers.

name: Bloody Buttons' Ragamuffin
description: A ghastly doll depicting the villain of the popular children's tale. Its eyes are red-painted buttons. (It's probably paint.)

name: Knee Pillow
description: A small square of padding with a strap to wrap around one's knee.

name: Swaddler's Sack
description: A variety of tightly wrapped bandages, stored in a small leather pouch.

name: Planter's Monocular
description: A small, hardy spyglass. Initially sold for farmers in separate fields to see distant hand signals, it's mostly used for spying.

name: Secret Ointment Jar
description: The label claims the jar contains horse liniment, but a hidden internal label declares it "Proud Stallion Bedroom Ointment."

name: Mustache Wax
description: This ghastly-smelling kwama wax is perfect for making facial hair set "just so."

name: Bloody Tongue Stud
description: Some dried blood still clings to this brass tongue piercing. As does a little bit of tongue.

name: Wolfen Socks
description: Hand-knitted socks shaped to fit over the unique structure of a werewolf's foot.

name: Scribbled Farm Ideas
description: A torn sheet with dozens of scribbled and crossed-off ideas. The only legible note: "Werewolf Farm: endless wolf steaks."

name: Wolf Trick Mirror
description: Looking into the mirror shows you a vision of a wolf superimposed over your face.

name: Shredded Pants
description: These simple cotton pants are ripped to shreds, seemingly from powerful legs tearing through the fabric.

name: Bristled Fang Brush
description: An oversized toothbrush caked with blood. The cuts into the bristles seem designed to fit large fangs.

name: Fang Charm
description: A carefully-made plaster cast of a humanoid fang attached to a simple chain.

name: Bronze Tail Chain
description: Bristled fur still clings to this intricate chain, apparently intended to be worn on the tail of a full-sized werewolf.

name: Silver Piercing Needle
description: Clearly meant as a body piercing, the blood clinging to this needle still sizzles audibly.

name: Golden Fang Caps
description: These gilded tooth caps are shaped to fit over the fangs of a wolf.

name: Bag of Letter Tiles
description: Cloth bag of small wooden tiles, each with a letter burned into its face. Used in a traditional commoner spelling game.

name: Petrified Bull Charm
description: What at first glance appears to be a short, withered cane is actually an ossified bull member … perhaps a lucky charm?

name: Disappointing Birdhouse
description: A set of seven rough-cut wood squares, sloppily nailed together to form a very badly-made birdhouse.

name: Practice Whittlestick
description: A whittled stick of wood, twisted and formed at the end into intricate angles and points. A daily project for an apprentice.

name: Twisted In-Law Carving
description: A careful carving of a twisted, cruel-looking woman. On the bottom is scrawled "Namira take your first-born, the Mother-in-Law."

name: Favored Shears
description: A pair of clothing shears, well worn from use. A name was once inscribed on the handle, but work has worn it away.

name: Burnt Spellbook
description: The charred husk of a leather spellbook, only recognizable by the runes on the cover. It is warm to the touch.

name: Rune Chunk
description: A shattered piece of a once-potent runestone. It hums quietly with latent power.

name: Portal Seed
description: A marble-sized enchanted rock, a common component in apprentice-level portal creation.

name: Spell Gel
description: A jar of sweet-smelling goo labeled "Spell Gel: Hair resin for the active mage!"

name: Taxidermied Kitten
description: A stuffed kitten curled into a ball, appearing very lifelike in death. The leather tag on the collar reads "Thesis Project."

name: Vanus Galerion Doll
description: A crude straw representation of Mages Guildmaster Vanus Galerion. A quill is shoved through the doll's eye.

name: Shalidor's Nail Clippings
description: A small glass phial with curled, yellowed nail clippings inside. Label reads "Archmagus Shalidor."

name: Spidersilk Kerchief
description: A plain gray kerchief. Primarily used to wipe sweat from one's brow, but strong enough to double as an emergency tourniquet.

name: Temporary Hobbling Stone
description: A smooth, flat stone. It creates a convincing limp when placed inside a footwrap. Useful for paupers in need of added sympathy.

name: Tin of Dubbin
description: A small tin of waterproofing wax. This could be valuable to anyone who travels in wet climates. Or pirates.

name: Poorly Groomed False Teeth
description: A set of disgusting false teeth designed to fit over one's natural, presumably less disgusting teeth.

name: Disgusting Prosthetic Nose
description: A false nose with what appears to be a large, hairy boil at the end of it. It could be resold to an actor, or perhaps a spy.

name: Prayer Kerchief
description: A colorful kerchief with inspirational prayers worked along the border. Bandit gangs with similar colors could use this.

name: Balithil's "Potato Porridge"
description: Mushy, foul-smelling, and lukewarm to the touch. The very thought of consuming this is repellent.

name: Simple Stitching Awl
description: This awl is fashioned from bone.

name: Netch-Hide Lunch Sack
description: This empty netch-hide sack smells faintly of hearty bread and pungent cheese.

name: Brassy Livestock Whistle
description: A brass whistle in the shape of a leaping guar. Its clarion tone is designed to beckon delicious beasts.

name: Wine-Stained Jug
description: An empty wine jug of Imperial design, labeled with the phrase, "Good Will, Good Wine."

name: Dried Prayer Garlands
description: Lay priests occasionally hang dried flower garlands from tree branches in offerings to the gods.

name: Logic Fob
description: This heavy fob, meant to hang from a bracelet or belt, is mathematically exact in its dimensions.

name: Pungent Incense
description: This pungent incense is traditionally used to mask the odor of rotting corpses.

name: Claw of Akatosh
description: This large claw, most likely from a troll, is carved with a prayer. Young children are told they're the claws of dragons.

name: Lacquered Feather
description: While lacquered and preserved, this feather catches the air gracefully when released into the wind.

name: Blessed Seed
description: A germinating seed that's been trapped in resin and carved with a prayer. Sometimes ritually planted with a crop.

name: Lucky Horn Pendant
description: A sealed horn inscribed with a prayer granting its holder luck.

name: Zenithar's Measure
description: A heavy pewter scale weight engraved with a blue star. Kept in the coinpurse for financial luck in trying times.

name: Horn of the Chieftain
description: An ox horn elaborately inscribed in the Colovian style with an ancient highlands prayer.

name: Stuffed Rat Carcass
description: Stuffed with dried grain, this rat carcass seems to be useful for not only holding down papers but also impromptu tossing games.

name: Darksky Ritual Sand
description: A pouchful of dyed sand, used by certain occult groups to ritually stain skins and mark foreheads.

name: Hist-Soaked Vine Clippings
description: Soaked in the hist sap, these vine clippings have become brittle and odiferous.

name: Caliper Cozy
description: A knitted pouch for a traveling blacksmith. Keeps soot from one's apron and caliper handles from biting flesh on cold days.

name: Forgeburn Unguent
description: A jar of lime-green paste to be rubbed upon one's face after a busy day in the forge. Smells faintly of mudcrab effluvia.

name: Ash-Begone Soap
description: A bar of "soap" that is likely a small block of bleached pumice. The blood it draws helps wash soot-stained hands clean.

name: Utility Sash
description: A leather workman's sash, fitted with multiple cloth loops to hold nails, small tools, or small vials.

name: Never-Wet Whetstone
description: An enchanted whetstone. One side exudes a thin sheen of oil when touched to metal.

name: Steel Calipers
description: A pair of steel calipers intended for superior measuring, gripping, or holding down of loose papers.

name: Smith's Rolling Rule
description: A metallic contraption for measuring heated metal objects. (Truthfully, it's a precisely hash-marked steel rolling pin.)

name: Orichalipers
description: This pair of orichalcum calipers provides the best possible measuring, gripping, or holding down of loose papers in Tamriel.

name: Scar Cream
description: A jar of vile-smelling goop. The label insists it can remove scars if applied daily, and liberally, for five consecutive years.

name: Miniature Silver Puzzlebox
description: An intricate, handheld puzzlebox with a complex internal mechanism. Attempting to solve the puzzle also polishes the silver.

name: Fishing Hook
description: A heavy fishing hook.

name: Boning Knife
description: A thin, flexible knife for cleaning fish in the field.

name: Musty Bait Tin
description: It doesn't smell recognizably like anything. It does smell bad, however.

name: Simple Feather Lure
description: A small white feather, for tying to a fishing line.

name: Hauler's Straps
description: A bundle of leather straps meant to assist in the movement of heavy objects.

name: Refreshing Retching Tablets
description: A tin of hardened scrib-jelly tablets packed with scents and herbs. Evidently they freshen breath and intoxicate nix-hounds.

name: Vial of Perfumed Rouge
description: A vial of strongly-scented facial cosmetics, for dressing up one's complexion while masking the stench of the common folk.

name: Scented Cosmetic Padding
description: A scented pouch of something soft. Perfect for filling out anywhere one feels might be … lacking.

name: Forge-Blind Drops
description: A vial of grayish liquid with a small dropper. Said to protect one's vision from bright forge fires when dripped onto the eyes.

name: Bellows Sealant
description: A jar of sticky red sap meant to seal tiny punctures to forge bellows. The label insists the mixture isn't flammable.

name: Spool of Bendy Wire
description: A small spool of wire. The wire is soft enough to bend and hard enough to retain its shape once bent.

name: Arrowhead Mold
description: A small mold for a common arrowhead. The certification stamped on the base would be of interest to crooked smiths.

name: Forge Mark Stamps
description: A set of personalized stamps used by smiths throughout Tamriel. A forger with a forge might find this valuable.

name: Folding Calipers
description: A pair of brass folding calipers for a traveling smith. The grips lock on place when unfolded, nearly doubling its size.

name: Used Candlestick Mold
description: Though the mold itself is worth something, its greater value comes from the partial silver candlestick fitted snuggly inside.

name: Folding Pocket Rule
description: A stack of hinged, hand-length, hash-marked metal rectangles. They form a leg-length rulestick when rotated and locked in place.

name: Burn Jelly
description: A jar of greasy blue numbing paste applied directly to fresh forge burns. "Do not apply to tongue," the label also reads.

name: Used Dibella Figurine
description: A highly detailed mold used to form a figurine of Dibella. The partial golden remnants of a previous attempt are still inside.

name: Portable Bellows
description: When the metal nozzle is removed and stowed, this small, handheld bellows collapses into a finger-thick circular disc.

name: Ever-Breath Smith's Bit
description: An enchanted bit that absorbs common airborne impurities when clenched between the teeth. Best to wash before reuse.

name: Maormer Waterstone
description: A small, glowing stone that clears water of impurities. Perfect for a smith's trough, or a poisoner looking to refine a recipe.

name: Smith's Detailing Pad
description: A single fireproof pad, meant to fit over a hand or glove. A flame atronach's claw extends from the back.

name: Embossed Throwing Shoes
description: Hard-tempered and neatly forged, these horse shoes are embossed with the symbol of the Rilis household of Auridon.

name: Crawler Tube
description: A simple wooden tube used to carry live crawlers. Alternatively, to hide one's gold beneath live crawlers.

name: Hook Sponge
description: At least a dozen intricately fashioned fishhooks jabbed into a sponge. Useful for fisherfolk and desperate cutpurses.

name: Pole Ring Pouch
description: A small pouch with replacement metal rings. Though intended for fishing poles, bandits could use these to fashion rope traps.

name: Measuring Strap
description: A hash-marked leather strap rule, slightly shrunken from water damage. Useful for boastful fisherfolk and crooked merchants.

name: Shiny Copper Spinner
description: A lightweight piece of shiny copper, cut to attract a fish's eye in murky water.

name: Ash
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Ashen Blood of Malacath
description: A potent tincture, useful for myriad arcane practices.

name: Old Orsinium Blood Soup
description: Made with the very finest of meats, bloods, and meats and bloods.

name: Key Fragment
description: A fragment of an ornate key of Imperial make. Gathering 60 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults; 150 will open the Trophy Vaults in the Imperial City Prisons or the White-Gold Tower.

name: Mara's Blessing
description: This delicate, gold-chased cameo depicts the goddess Mara and is a traditional Imperial wedding gift.

name: Rubedite Ingot
description: An ingredient for crafting metal weapons and armor.

name: Carved-Bone Key
description: This cold iron key resembles a charred, skeletal finger. It should unlock the Bone Shard Trophy Chest.

name: Star Dew
description: A stellar ingredient for crafting Champion potions.

name: Lorkhan's Tears
description: A lunar ingredient for crafting Champion potions.

name: Sanded Ruby Ash
description: An ingredient for crafting wooden weapons and shields.

name: Purified Azure Ash
description: An ingredient for crafting wooden weapons and shields.

name: Ancestor Silk
description: An ingredient for crafting cloth armor.

name: Rubedo Leather
description: An ingredient for crafting leather armor.

name: Jehade
description: Jehade

name: Rejera
description: Rejera

name: Dominion Cold Fire Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose fireball causes burn damage to structures and foes.

name: Pact Cold Fire Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose fireball causes burn damage to structures and foes.

name: Covenant Cold Fire Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose fireball causes burn damage to structures and foes.

name: Dominion Cold Fire Ballista
description: Creates a ballista siege weapon whose bolt causes flame damage to structures and also damages foes over time.

name: Pact Cold Fire Ballista
description: Creates a ballista siege weapon whose bolt causes flame damage to structures and also damages foes over time.

name: Covenant Cold Fire Ballista
description: Creates a ballista siege weapon whose bolt causes flame damage to structures and also damages foes over time.

name: Covenant Cold Stone Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose stones cause great damage to structures and foes.

name: Pact Cold Stone Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose stones cause great damage to structures and foes.

name: Dominion Cold Stone Trebuchet
description: Creates a trebuchet weapon whose stones cause great damage to structures and foes.

name: Vampire's Bite
description: Grants the Vampire skill line to the user.

name: The Werewolf Secret
description: Grants the Werewolf skill line to the user.

name: Cleansing Ritual
description: Removes Vampirism or Lycanthropy from the user.

name: Crown Experience Scroll
description: Created by a Priestess of Meridia, for whom time is relative.

name: Key To the Greedy Gut
description: This key looks to open the locked door on the bottom floor of the Greedy Gut inn in Orsinium

name: Crown Crafting Motif 1: High Elf Style
description: Use to learn the High Elf crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 5: Breton Style
description: Use to learn the Breton crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 8: Orc Style
description: Use to learn the Orc crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 6: Redguard Style
description: Use to learn the Redguard crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 3: Wood Elf Style
description: Use to learn the Wood Elf crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 4: Nord Style
description: Use to learn the Nord crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 2: Dark Elf Style
description: Use to learn the Dark Elf crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 9: Argonian Style
description: Use to learn the Argonian crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 7: Khajiit Style
description: Use to learn the Khajiit crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 13: Primal Style
description: Use to learn the Primal crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 12: Barbaric Style
description: Use to learn the Barbaric crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 11: Ancient Elf Style
description: Use to learn the Ancient Elf crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 14: Daedric Style
description: Use to learn the Daedric crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 15: Dwemer Style
description: Use to learn the Dwemer crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 18: Akaviri Style
description: Use to learn the Akaviri crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 20: Yokudan Style
description: Use to learn the Yokudan crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 17: Xivkyn Style
description: Use to learn the Xivkyn crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 10: Imperial Style
description: Use to learn the Imperial crafting style.

name: Dark Ether
description: A thick glob of glowing ethereal residue. Gathering 60 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults.

name: Ethereal Key
description: This crystalline key is covered in a viscous blue gel. It should unlock the Dark Ether Trophy Chest.

name: Mark of the Legion
description: A bronze emblem bearing the seal of Legion Zero. Gathering 60 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults.

name: Legionary Key
description: The bow of this heavy brass key resembles a broken red diamond. It should unlock the Legionary Trophy Chest.

name: Monstrous Tooth
description: A massive Daedric molar. Gathering 60 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults.

name: Monstrous Enamel Key
description: This smooth enamel key resembles a beastly fang. It should unlock the Monstrous Tooth Trophy Chest.

name: Bloody Claw
description: A small claw that remains eerily sharp. Gathering 60 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults.

name: Clawed Key
description: This thin steel key is sharp as an assassin's razor. It should unlock the Bloody Claw Trophy Chest.

name: Planar Armor Scraps
description: A sundered chunk of Daedric armor. Gathering 60 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults.

name: Planar Key
description: This dark ebony key emits a low, menacing tone when Daedra are near. It should unlock the Planar Armor Trophy Chest.

name: The First Charter
description: This fabled tome outlines the first laws for the original settlement of Orsinium.

name: Horn of Beasts
description: Last sounded during the Siege of Old Orsinium, this horn once summoned the beasts of Wrothgar to the city's defense.

name: Guthrag's Mask
description: Once, this mask allowed Orcs to walk disguised among all the races of Tamriel. Now, it stands as a historic oddity.

name: Centurion's Signet
description: The Emperor awarded this signet to the first Orsimer to earn the rank of Centurion in the Imperial Legion.

name: Frostbreak Chalice
description: A goblet emblazoned with the seal of the fort, some Orcs believe it imbued restorative powers on any liquid drunk from it.

name: Trinimac House Idol
description: This ancient statue once protected the home of a worshiper of Trinimac.

name: Nuzava's Anvil
description: The travel anvil of the famed forge-wife of Morkul Clanhold, it was said no other smith could use it.

name: Map of Clans
description: This ancient map displayed the original 13 Orc strongholds at the end of the Dawn Era, but much of it is faded and hard to read.

name: Dwarf Light
description: A mechanical-looking lantern made by the Dwemer. It no longer functions, but the exquisite crafting is a wonder to behold.

name: Torc of Baloth Bloodtusk
description: This heavy necklace of gold and bearing the symbol of the hammer once belonged to the legendary Orc leader.

name: Heart of Zandadunoz
description: This vile relic, once a beating heart, serves as a phylactery that supposedly has the power to recall the titan from Oblivion.

name: Thukhozod's Bracer
description: According to legend, the first Thukhozod crafted and wore this armband to display his warrior's prowess.

name: Liquid Silver
description: A vial of heavy, viscous silver, cool to the touch and moving like a thing alive.

name: Black Quill
description: An enchanted quill made from the feather of a hagraven, legend claims that whatever it writes is never forgotten.

name: Eye of Zthenganaz
description: According to legend, the Eye was used to spy upon the Orsimer until it was cursed by a powerful shaman.

name: Scepter of the Riekr King-Chief
description: Once the symbol of power for an Orc chief, the scepter recently rested in the hands of the riekr king-chief.

name: Hammer of Glass
description: Though the hammer appears made of glass, it is as hard as diamond.

name: Mad Urkazbur's Ice-Effigy
description: Made entirely of ice, this tiny replica of the ogre elder refuses to melt.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Style
description: Use to learn the Glass crafting style. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Axes
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Axes. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Belts
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Belts. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Boots
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Boots. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Bows
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Bows. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Chests
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Chests. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Daggers
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Daggers. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Gloves
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Gloves. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Helmets
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Helmets. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Legs
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Legs. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Maces
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Maces. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Shields
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Shields. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Shoulders
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Shoulders. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Staves
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Staves. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 16: Glass Swords
description: Use to learn how to make Glass Swords. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 16: Glass Style
description: Use to learn the Glass crafting style.

name: Ferrous Salts
description: An ingredient for crafting in the Yokudan style.

name: Goldscale
description: An ingredient for crafting in the Akaviri style.

name: Ancient Scale
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Goldscale, which is used to make Akaviri equipment.

name: Malachite
description: An ingredient for crafting in the Glass style.

name: Malachite Shard
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Malachite, which is used to make Glass equipment.

name: Old Helm
description: An old helm with a maker's mark from Morkul Stronghold. It's too battered to wear, and the name etched within is too faded to read.

name: Crown Lesson: Riding Speed
description: Increases your character's riding speed by 1 per lesson. Riding Speed allows you to move faster while mounted and takes effect on your character regardless of the mount you have set active. Your current Riding Speed is 0/60.

name: Crown Lesson: Riding Stamina
description: Increases your riding stamina by 1 per lesson. Riding Stamina helps prevent being dismounted, allows your mount to sprint longer, and takes effect on your character regardless of the mount set active. Your current Riding Stamina is 0/60.

name: Crown Lesson: Riding Capacity
description: Expands your character's inventory by 1 slot per lesson. Riding Capacity allows you to carry more items and takes effect on your character regardless of the mount you have set active. Your character's current Riding Capacity is 0/60.

name: Recipe: Psijic Ambrosia, Fragment I
description: This is the first of seven parts of the Psijic Ambrosia Recipe.

name: Recipe: Psijic Ambrosia, Fragment II
description: This is the second of seven parts of the Psijic Ambrosia Recipe.

name: Recipe: Psijic Ambrosia, Fragment III
description: This is the third of seven parts of the Psijic Ambrosia Recipe.

name: Recipe: Psijic Ambrosia, Fragment IV
description: This is the fourth of seven parts of the Psijic Ambrosia Recipe.

name: Recipe: Psijic Ambrosia, Fragment V
description: This is the fifth of seven parts of the Psijic Ambrosia Recipe.

name: Recipe: Psijic Ambrosia, Fragment VI
description: This is the sixth of seven parts of the Psijic Ambrosia Recipe.

name: Recipe: Psijic Ambrosia, Fragment VII
description: This is the seventh of seven parts of the Psijic Ambrosia Recipe.

name: Laurel
description: An ingredient for crafting in the Mercenary style.

name: Crafting Motif 19: Mercenary Style
description: Use to learn the Mercenary crafting style. Requires Rank 9 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

description: Use to learn how to make Mercenary Axes. Requires Rank 9 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Sigil of Imperial Retreat
description: This carefully etched talisman possesses the power to transport its user back to their Alliance Base.

name: Cyan Tincture
description: A potion of curious origin. Rumoured to aid spellcasting.

name: Glowing Cyan Tincture
description: A potion of curious origin. Rumoured to greatly aid spellcasting.

name: Glowing Green Tincture
description: A potion of curious origin. Rumoured to greatly aid fighting ability.

name: Green Tincture
description: A potion of curious origin. Rumoured to aid fighting ability.

name: Shifting Violet Tincture

name: Heavy Red Tincture
description: A potion of curious origin. Rumoured to aid stealth and intrusion.

name: Arm Cops of the Powerful Assault
Arm Cops of the Shield Breaker
Daedric Embers
description: These chipped shards of Daedric animus emit a faint glow, like fading blue coals. Gathering 150 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults.

name: Daedric Shackles
description: These gnarled iron shackles are extremely heavy and cold as ice. Gathering 150 will grant access to one of the city's hidden Trophy Vaults.

name: Harvest Dirk
description: This dagger looks like it was forged from an actual Harvester's claw. Can that really be true?

name: Protector's Resolve
description: This greatsword appears to be ideal for a sentry who needs to hold a door at all costs.

name: The Unbroken
description: This strange flame staff is constructed of some unfamiliar material. Could it have come from Infernace itself?

name: Molag Kena's Touch
description: This exotic shock staff seems to crackle with internal energy even when at rest.

name: Lost Hatchet
description: A handaxe. Now overlooked, it's clear that someone once cared for it lovingly.

name: Subjugation Fist
description: A brutal hammer, aptly named, and suitable to the Overfiend's mission.

name: Toxic Cleaver
description: Gazing upon this unwholesome weapon, it's suddenly not hard to believe in the vile legends of Ayleid flesh sculpture.

name: The Vigilant One
description: A bow suitable for a sentry who needs to be alert for intruders—and also remain wary of a hovering Watcher.

name: Abomination's Clout
description: Grasping this powerful weapon by the haft makes the wielder's hands feel somehow unclean, though no actual taint appears.

name: Warden's Trust
description: Apparently even Daedric minions need Restoration magic to recover from wounds.

name: Warden's Courage
description: When holding the Lord Warden's sword, one can somehow sense the strength of his resolve.

name: Frostbite Staff
description: Just touching this staff sends a chill through one's frame. Better get some warmer gloves.

name: Daedric Shackles Key
description: This key resembles a twisted Daedric chain and is cold to the touch. It should unlock the Daedric Shackle Trophy Chest.

name: Daedric Embers Key
description: This key appears to be made from glowing blue crystals. It should unlock the Daedric Embers Trophy Chest.

name: Light Tel Var Satchel
description: This small, well-stitched satchel contains a handful of Tel Var Stones.

name: Medium Tel Var Sack
description: This rugged leather sack contains a wealth of Tel Var Stones.

name: Hefty Tel Var Crate
description: This sturdy crate is stuffed to the brim with Tel Var Stones.

name: Unknown Imperial Reward
description: Usually contains a piece of equipment. Very rarely contains a Xivkyn Polymorph Collectible.

name: Superb Imperial Reward
description: Usually contains a piece of equipment. Occasionally contains a Xivkyn Polymorph Collectible.

name: Glass Style Motif Fragment
description: This is a small part of a text that, when combined with others, can teach you about the Glass Style.

name: Scamp's Tel Var Sack
description: This ragged, motley sack contains a few Tel Var Stones.

name: Merethic Restorative Resin
description: This ancient Elven formula, recently reconstituted by the Mages Guild, mystically restores even the most brittle and tattered parchment, making it legible again and enabling its binding into books.

name: Armor Enchantment Box
description: This large box has some unknown item inside.

name: Weapon Enchantment Box

name: Orzorga's Red Frothgar
description: Ice-cold dredged berry mash, in the old Orcish style.

name: Orzorga's Tripe Trifle Pocket
description: A breaded pocket of minced gut and less appealing things, sweetened with beet sugar.

name: Orzorga's Blood Price Pie
description: A pie of stewed blood and minced heart, among other things. Served cold.

name: Orzorga's Smoked Bear Haunch
description: Wrothgar's hearth-wives agree — the bear's haunch is just as tasty as its stuffed head.

name: Blacksmith Survey: Wrothgar I
description: A rare map indicating a generous cache of raw materials.
