name: Servant's Outfit
description: The symbol of the Iron Wheel is worked subtly into the fabric of this simple servant's outfit.

name: Crab-Slaughter-Crane
description: This massive slaughterfish is large enough to swallow a mudcrab and a crane in one hungry gulp. Its eye seems to follow you, wherever you go.

name: Rubedite Ore
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make rubedite ingots.

name: Rough Ruby Ash
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make sanded ruby ash wood.

name: Raw Ancestor Silk
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make ancestor silk.

name: Clothier's Satchel X
description: A reward for the delivery of crafted goods.

name: Blacksmith's Crate X
description: A reward for the delivery of crafted goods.

name: Woodworker's Case X
description: A reward for the delivery of crafted goods.

name: Enchanter's Coffer X
description: A reward for the delivery of crafted goods.

name: Provisioner's Pack VII
description: A reward for the delivery of crafted goods.

name: Alchemist's Vessel VII
description: A reward for the delivery of crafted goods.

name: Rubedo Hide Scraps
description: Ten of these items can be refined to make rubedo leather.

name: Sealed Wedding Invitation
description: An intricately decorated but sealed wedding invitation, addressed to Lord Wallavir.

name: Malacath's Wrathful Flame
description: This is an obsolete item. It no longer has any in-game value and is safe to destroy.

name: Rkindaleft's Hidden Pressure Vent
description: This is an obsolete item. It no longer has any in-game value and is safe to destroy.

name: Cheap Locket
description: A cheap, clearly fake gold locket.

name: Wrothgar Daily Contract Recompense
description: Compensation from the Dragonstar Caravan Company for fulfilling a daily job contract in Wrothgar.

name: Summerset Hills 572
description: A bottle of white wine. According to the label, it is renowned for its "overpowering subtlety."

name: Hubalajad Palace Kitchen Key
description: An elaborate ivory key.

name: Silver Anvil Paperweight
description: This miniature anvil is wrought from the finest silver—a paperweight fit for a chief.

name: Fine Echatere Vellum
description: This vellum is aromatic and smooth to the touch. Perfect for writing both poetry and death-threats.

name: Silver Knuckle-Stamp
description: A massive silver signet, carved to resemble an Orc fist. A fine tool for sealing threatening letters.

name: Echalette-Skull Ink Well
description: This inkwell appears both delicate and intimidating. The beast's tiny tusks serve as perfect pen-holders.

name: Polished Steel Grudge-Pen
description: A heavy steel pen, filled with blood and ink. Perfect for correspondence with your most hated enemies.

name: Troll-Skin Brooding Sack
description: This small leather sack practically begs to be squeezed. Great for relieving stress and focusing anger.

name: Echatere Bullhook
description: A long oaken staff with an ornate bronze hook. The rancher this belonged to must be wealthy indeed.

name: Ornate Defiance-Stone
description: A polished riverstone, covered in threatening motifs. Flinging this at a chief's door can prompt a battle for clan leadership.

name: Tumnosh Lantern
description: This finely-wrought silver lantern was likely used by a wealthy foreman in Graystone Quarry.

name: Signed Vosh Ball
description: This vosh ball bears the signature of a famous champion—presumably written before his career-ending skull fracture.

name: Truffle Identification Card
description: This painstakingly researched guide to local truffles is a must-have item for any true Orcish culinarian.

name: Jathsogur Social Club Pin
description: Before falling out with their Wood Orc cousins, visitors from Orsinium received this gold pin depicting a fortress on a hill.

name: Bloodtusk Centerpiece
description: This lovingly polished centerpiece depicts legendary Orc hero Baloth Bloodtusk slaying the treacherous villain Gaiden Shinji.

name: Orichalc Kurog Bust
description: A disturbingly accurate bust of the Orc sovereign, King Kurog.

name: Polished Clan Brand
description: This heavy iron brand bears the seal of one of Wrothgar's lesser clans, but the craftsmanship is peerless.

name: Varnished Bone Chimes
description: These suspended ogre-bones have been dyed black and issue ghostly hollow tones when the wind blows.

name: Morkul-Forged Tea Kettle
description: This kettle is absurdly heavy and features a series of hard, sharp edges—perfect for making tea or slaying your enemies.

name: Dueling Durzog Candlesticks
description: A pair of silver candlesticks carved to resemble two durzogs at play.

name: Ivory Blood Basin
description: The interior of this ivory bowl is stained red by years of heavy use. How the blood was used is anyone's guess.

name: Embroidered Mudcrab Bib
description: A finely embroidered bib. The stitching depicts a mudcrab being eaten whole by a smiling Orc chef.

name: Ash-Hands Battle Wash
description: The water in this glass vessel is black as pitch—used for washing the hands before battle.

name: Malacath's Wound Paste
description: This foul-smelling black paste burns like fire when applied to old wounds—keeping rage fresh until vengeance is doled out.

name: Fine-Obsidian Dental Kit
description: This polished obsidian box is full of small clamps, chisels, and picks. Likely the property of an Orc pit-fighter.

name: Gilded Drinking Tusk
description: A huge horker tusk, lined in gold and covered in ornate etchings.

name: Ornate Tattoo Kit
description: A well-loved pine box full of tattoo needles, both large and small.

name: Polished Tumnor
description: This stone appears to be an ornate grave marker. Archaeologists or family members would likely pay top coin for it.

name: Warpaint Mortar
description: This ancient stone mortar is covered in Orc clan script. It was likely used in the ancient and bloody art of Orc warpaint.

name: Antique Graver
description: This steel engraving tool has maintained its sharpness despite years of heavy use. Malacath's face is hewn into the grip.

name: Cedar Boot Keepers
description: Foot-shaped spring-loaded cedar forms tucked into wet hunting boots, to control odor and help keep their shape.

name: Breton Pummel-Doll
description: A young Orc's most beloved toy, this ragged leather doll has been whipped, punched, and stabbed repeatedly.

name: Loon-Down Throw Pillow
description: This pillow is filled with genuine chub loon down. One side bears Trinimac's visage, stitched in white lace.

name: Lavender Helm-Freshener
description: A supple leather pouch filled with aromatic lavender and exotic spices. A perfect remedy for the smelliest headwear.

name: Heavy Bronze Nose-Ring
description: This fine bronze jewelry is remarkably heavy. The nose that once bore it might be difficult to look at.

name: Fine Leather Tooth-Purse
description: This fine silken purse contains a handful of tusks and molars—likely extracted as part of a blood price.

name: Fine Tusk Wax
description: According to the bottle, "Uncle Boorg's Tusk-Shine" will make your tusks shine brighter and bite harder.

name: Ornate Ashwood Switch
description: This beautifully carved switch is the work of a master woodworker. Guaranteed to tame even the most unruly youth.

name: Vosh Rakh Initiation Kerchief
description: This once golden sash is coated with dried blood. The old runes stitched upon it suggest it is used for initiation rituals.

name: Stainless Dueling Jock
description: A sturdy steel jock for protecting one's most valuable assets in an Orsinium street-duel.

name: Ivory Earplugs
description: A pair of durzog fangs carved and sanded to function as earplugs. These are no doubt an annoyed spouse's prized possessions.

name: Lacquered Malacath Totem
description: This stone totem is disturbing to behold. Malacath's gruesome features are dyed a rusty brown by repeated applications of blood.

name: Polished Sleeping Stone
description: This huge polished river stone functions as a traditional Orc pillow. Once common, they've become collector's items.

name: Scented Hair Oil
description: This thick black oil smells of woodsmoke and lavender. "The aromatic combination to drive Orcs wild!" claims the label.

name: "A Forge-Mother's Wisdom," 1st Edition
description: A picture book of affirmations and avenged transgressions by Forge-Mother Targak. Reprints are wildly popular in recent years.

name: Old Orsinium Coins
description: A small pouch of rare and valuable coins minted in the furnaces of the old Orsinium, in the First Era.

name: Code of Malacath Paperweight
description: A medium-sized paperweight carved from obsidian stone, inscribed with the traditional Code of Malacath.

name: Commemorative Whiskey Flask
description: A silver flask inscribed with a likeness of the "Old Kindlepitch Whiskey" label, commemorating the product's 200th anniversary.

name: Bone-Handled Grooming Kit
description: A kit of Orcish bone-handled grooming tools, including toenail clippers, a mustache comb, an earwax remover, and a tusk file.

name: Weighted Gambling Dice
description: Gambling dice carved from horker ivory, weighted so that they always come up "double skulls."

name: Orsinium's Remembrance War Drum
description: A small, finely-crafted war drum of polished wood with an elk skin drumhead, dating back to the First Era.

name: Brass Mess Kit
description: A well-made mess kit of polished brass, inscribed with the emblem of Shatul clan.

name: Bearskin Bedroll
description: A beautifully-crafted bedroll of soft, white fur made from snow bear hide.

name: Azurian Caviar Spoon
description: A small silver spoon for serving caviar of the finest Azurian Sturgeon, King Kurog's personal favorite.

name: Morkul Clan Travel Kit
description: A wooden box containing a whetstone, a metal file, a flask of oil, and gritpaper. The box bears the seal of Morkul clan.

name: Cat-Man Ventriloquist Puppet
description: A popular Orsinium puppet. This mockingly derisive caricature of a Khajiit merchant is used to entertain children.

name: Portrait of Yashnag Gro-Yazgu
description: A full-color oil painting of the famous Orc warlord, Yashnag gro-Yazgu, set into a gilded frame.

name: Musical Snuff Box
description: A sterling silver snuff box with a wind-up mechanism that plays music when opened.

name: Signed Gulob Stick
description: A wooden cudgel used in the violent sport Gulob. Supposedly signed by the late One-Tooth Skrib, but likely a forgery.

name: Ladies Durzog Skin Purse
description: A fashionable ladies purse of fine durzog skin, made by the famous clothier Olfim gra-Olfa.

name: Spidersilk Sheets
description: A full set of finely-spun spidersilk sheets made to fit a "troll-sized" bed.

name: Longhouse Play Set
description: A child's dollhouse fashioned to resemble an Orc longhouse, filled with intricately-detailed miniature furniture.

name: Bone Porcelain Tea Service
description: A set of four cups and saucers with a matching tea kettle, made from fine porcelain composed of bone ash, clay, and feldspar.

name: Hearth-Wife Doll
description: A beautifully made child's doll, made to look like a smiling, rosy-cheeked Orc Hearth-Wife.

name: Giant Snow Bear Rug
description: A fluffy, white bearskin rug. Made from a particularly large snow bear found in the farthest northern reaches of Wrothgar.

name: Fox Fur Gutcatcher
description: A mid-length, silk-lined hunting blanket made from the finest red fox fur, used to catch gore when gutting a caught fox.

name: Copper Censer
description: A finely-wrought copper vessel made for burning incense, with images of Malacath inlaid in the surface.

name: Morkul Clan Banner
description: A banner bearing the seal of Clan Morkul, made from fine spun spidersilk.

name: Riddle'Thar's Box of Pranks
description: A wooden box containing an assortment of joke and prank items, imported from the far-off markets of Elsweyr.

name: Malacath's Brass Arse Warmer
description: A flat brass pan with a perforated lid bearing the angry visage of Malacath. Filled with hot coals, it can warm beds or chairs.

name: Stuffed Albino Chub Loon
description: An extremely rare albino chub loon, stuffed and mounted for display.

name: Antique Spyglass
description: A very old hand-tooled spyglass, dating back to the time of Old Orsinium.

name: Enchanted Handwarmer
description: A sealed metal container inside a small velvet bag, enchanted to continuously give off heat without burning any fuel.

name: House Cricket Cage
description: A small cage made from fine silver wire, intended to contain a small house cricket—considered good luck in Orsinium.

name: Carved Onion Flute
description: An instrument called a "kazoo" that adds a buzzing, timbral quality to one's voice. Also known as a "misery whistle."

name: Hand-Knitted Woolen Scarf
description: An impractically long, hand-knitted, absurdly multi-coloured scarf. Sold primarily to foreigners in Orsinium.

name: Fox Fur Ear Muffs
description: A beautifully-made pair of fox fur ear muffs, perfect for winter hunting expeditions.

name: Murtag Clan Tacklebox
description: This tacklebox of carved wood contains an entire set of hand-made fishing lures. The mark of Murtag clan is burned into the top.

name: Shatul Clan Echatere Paint
description: A complete set of unused echatere paint in the distinctive color palette of Shatul clan.

name: Dreamweaver Wisp Mobile
description: A hanging sculpture of blown glass with small wisps trapped inside. Its dazzling light is said to foster pleasant dreams.

name: "Orc-Cordian" Squeeze Box
description: A bellows-driven musical instrument popular among the various Orc clans of Wrothgar.

name: Ornate Diagna Banner
description: This bright blue banner is tattered and threadbare, but definitely authentic—a battle flag for the ancient Order of Diagna.

name: Silver Nosehair Clippers
description: Long, thin, sterling silver scissors used for grooming unsightly nose hair. The same brand preferred by King Kurog.

name: Harpy Feather Calligraphy Set
description: A set of exquisite calligraphy pens fashioned from harpy feathers with an assortment of multi-colored inks.

name: Hearth-Wife's Hand Mirror
description: This hand mirror has a dark mahogany handle inlaid with semi-precious stones and gold filigree.

name: Gilded Trinimac Parchment Weight
description: When the cold Wrothgar winds blow, this heavy statuette of Trinimac keeps papers and parchment on the desk.

name: Bottle of Imported Abecean Ink
description: Squid ink of deepest black, imported from the far-off Abecean Sea, in an ornamental broad-bottomed bottle.

name: Snow Harpy-Feather Writing Quill
description: Exotic writing quill with a silver nib crafted from a long white snow harpy flight feather.

name: Pocket Mammoth Snow Globe
description: Shake this glass snow globe to see its adorable baby pocket mammoth in a blizzard of fine flakes.

name: Silver Butcher-Knife Letter Opener
description: Fancy letter opener shaped like a miniature butcher knife, wrought in fine silver and engraved, "Compliments of Ragbarlag."

name: Intricate Clockwork Snowy Owl
description: Windup brass and ceramic snowy owl that turns its head, blinks, and hoots raspily. Imported from Necrom.

name: Ivory Horker's-Head Bottle Opener
description: Ornate mammoth-ivory bottle opener carved to look like a horker's head, with metal tusks for prying off bottle caps.

name: Gem-Studded Bear Mount Bridle
description: Dress bridle of echatere-leather studded with small precious stones, as issued to the Royal Orsinium Bear Cavalry.

name: Presentation Set of Sharpening Stones
description: Three sharpening stones of different density and coarseness in a jadeite presentation box, engraved "Morkul Forge."

name: Gilt Malacath Travel Icon
description: Folding diptych containing a gold-foil icon of Malacath, used by the devout as a prayer-object when traveling.

name: Orsinium Crest Orichalc Clippers
description: Heavy-duty orichalc-alloy nail clippers, for use on bear or echatere claws, engraved with the Royal Orsinium Crest.

name: Silver Mirror With Ivory Handle
description: Opulent silvered hand mirror with a mammoth-ivory handle, in a padded oiled-mammoth-leather travel case.

name: Alabaster Bust of King Golkarr
description: Hand-sculpted alabaster bust of King Golkarr, who ruled Orsinium during the legendary thirty-year siege.

name: Horker-Toss Prize Plaque
description: Nice imported mahogany plaque with mounted horker tusk, inscribed "Runner-Up, Frostbreak Fort Horker Toss."

name: Rose Quartz Gambling Dice
description: Pair of over-sized rose quartz dice with onyx pips, in a leather dice cup engraved "The Greedy Gut Tavern."

name: Commemorative Ale Tankard
description: Two-pint lacquered ale tankard with golden crown-shaped lid, painted "Kurog's Coronation" in bright gold letters.

name: Precious Stone "Payback" Game Set
description: Oak folding board for the Orcish "Payback" game, with oaken box containing 32 pawns, 16 onyx and 16 moonstone.

name: Judicial Blood Price Gold Scale
description: Scale for weighing out blood price amounts, with different gold weights labeled "Chief," "Wife," and "Warrior."

name: Orsinium Seal Shaved-Ice Cups
description: Set of four cut-glass shaved-ice cups, each bearing the Royal Seal of Orsinium.

name: Fancy Filigreed Spice Rack
description: Spice rack of filigreed copper tracery containing blown-glass bottles, labeled "Chef Obgurob's Selection."

name: Ornamental Skull Beer Stein
description: Beer stein made of a sawed-off silver-chased human skull; the handle is a dagger haft with a turquoise pommel.

name: Set of Snow Ogre Nail Spoons
description: Splendid gift set of eight gilt spoons with scrimshaw handles, the bowls crafted from snow ogre fingernails.

name: Silver-Plated Baby Shoes
description: A pair of silver-plated miniature sabatons, labeled "Baby's First Steel-Plated Footies."

name: Begemmed Egg Timer
description: Exquisite gem-encrusted time-glass set for five minutes, the time it takes to hardboil a chub loon egg.

name: "Malacath's Vengeance" Tapestry
description: Rolled-up tapestry of fine silk depicting the giant Orc-Father crushing Breton and Redguard soldiers underfoot.

name: Miniature Elk-Antler Castanets
description: A miniature pair of silver elk antler castanets to be slipped on thumb and finger, for the Hunt-Wife's Dance.

name: Bretonball Victory Plaque
description: Wall plaque with two crossed and gilded Bretonball rackets, with a metal plate engraved "Most Valuable Thwacker."

name: Commemorative Ice Axe
description: Ornamental ice axe with mammoth-ivory handle, inscribed "Glacier Days 577." Includes pair of wall-mount hooks.

name: Royal Orsinium Cavalry Bugle
description: Parade dress bugle with silk hanging pennant displaying the Orsinium Royal Seal, as used by the Bear Cavalry.

name: Looted Redguard Battle Flag
description: Folded battle flag of the First Ska'vyn Camel Scouts, torn in three places and spotted with blood.

name: Fine Patterned Winter Blanket
description: Romantic winter blanket of echatere cashmere, patterned with red hearts intertwined with the word "REVENGE."

name: Sumptuous Fertility Pillow
description: Chub loon-feather pillow encased in tanned topgrain snow ogre hide, embroidered in silverthread with fertility symbols.

name: Poseable Stuffed Riekr Mannequin
description: Fine taxidermied Riekr skin mounted on a fully-poseable articulated mannequin, useable as hat stand, coat tree, or knife target.

name: Gold-Leaf Trinimac Worship-Plaque
description: Trinimac worshiper's gold-leaf god mask, mounted to a plaque dedicating the Feast of the Immortal Subterfuge.

name: Snow Harpy Masquerade Wings
description: Scrupulously-preserved pair of snow harpy wings attached to a feather-covered leather harness with adjustable straps.

name: Orsimer Enemies Ear Collection
description: Display board mounted with 28 preserved ears from Breton, Redguard, and Reachman warriors; formerly hung on the wall.

name: "Orcish Intimacy" Tusk Sheaths
description: Pair of elegant tusk sheaths, padded and rounded, of the finest topgrain horker hide, oiled for softness.

name: Echatere Cashmere Sleeping Mask
description: Opaque sleeping mask lined with luxuriously soft echatere cashmere, labeled "North Coast Furriers."

name: "Hooting Lullaby" Ocarina
description: Exquisite ceramic ocarina in the shape of a snowy owl; it plays with a gentle, resonant hooting tone.

name: Four Luxurious Flipper Mittens
description: Two pairs of flawless fur-lined flipper mittens with golden wrist grommets, for playing "The Burrowing Horkers."

name: Skating Chub Loon Music Box
description: Unique glass-topped music box: a tiny chub loon skates across its surface while the clockwork plays "Arctic Zephyrs."

name: Bejeweled Bear Fat Applicator
description: Antique silver-cylindered bear fat applicator, with an emerald-spangled plunger handle.

name: Imperial City Gear
description: This box contains a full suite of equipment from the Imperial City.

name: CRAFTED: Law of Julianos
description: This box contains a full suite of Infused, Legendary-quality, CR 160 equipment, of the Law of Julianos item set.

description: Use to learn how to make Ebonheart Pact Staves. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 27: Ebonheart Pact Swords
description: Use to learn how to make Ebonheart Pact Swords. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 27: Ebonheart Pact Style
description: Use to learn the Ebonheart Pact crafting style.

name: Eagle Feather
description: An ingredient for crafting in the Aldmeri Dominion style.

name: Dragon Scute
description: An ingredient for crafting in the Ebonheart Pact style.

name: Lion Fang
description: An ingredient for crafting in the Daggerfall Covenant style.

name: Crafting Motif 29: Soul Shriven Style
description: Use to learn the Soul-Shriven crafting style.

name: Cichlid
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Cherry Barb
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Bala Shark
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Sparking Anglermouth
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Crestfish
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Beggar Shark
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Glass Catfish
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Firemouth
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Hew's Rasbora
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Keuppia
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Fringed Mudskipper
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

name: Daggertooth
description: A rare fish found only in the warm waters of Hew's Bane.

Inferno Staff of the Lunar Bastion
Ice Staff of the Lunar Bastion
Lightning Staff of the Lunar Bastion
Restoration Staff of the Lunar Bastion
Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Foot Armor
description: This large box contains Foot Armor from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Hand Armor
description: This large box contains Hand Armor from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Waist Armor
description: This large box contains Waist Armor from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Leg Armor
description: This large box contains Leg Armor from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Head Armor
description: This large box contains Head Armor from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Ring
description: This large box contains a ring from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Chest Armor
description: This large box contains Chest Armor from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Shoulder Armor
description: This large box contains Shoulder Armor from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Amulet
description: This large box contains an Amulet from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Unidentified Bahraha's Curse Weapon
description: This large box contains a Weapon from Bahraha's Curse.

name: Tuneless Harp of Fiirgarion the Bard
description: Given to Fiirgarion at a rigged competition for best entertainer in Valenwood, where he famously took first prize. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Hairball Spittoon of Darloc Brae
description: Kept handy for the Golden Beast for his post-battle grooming rituals. It has a faint acrid smell.  NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Burial Mannequin of Calarthor Camoran
description: Made to stand in for Calarthor's body, lost in the fight against the Colovians, but unused when he turned up lost in the woods. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Divad Hunding's Dribble Bowl
description: Allegedly held under Divad Hunding's chin by an attendant as he quenched his fierce desert thirst. Stained with wine, or blood. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: King Farangel's Unpublished Ode To Wayrest
description: The disjointed scribblings of an epic ballad about the beauty and wonder of Wayrest, purportedly penned by the king himself. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Yokeda Sesnit's Paperweights
description: These were vital to preventing the vast inventories of the Elden Yokeda's conquests from spilling about his chambers. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Raven Direnni's Inflammable Rug
description: Purportedly one of the first magical items created after the famed mage discovered the principles of enchantment. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Princess Rayelle's Half-Hearted Love Letters
description: Unenthusiastic overtures to King Emeric's good looks and virility, written at the behest of her father. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: King Jorunn's Automatic Cheesewheel Vivisector
description: This Dwarven crescent blade is the central component of Skyrim's one and only machine powered cheese slicer. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Akaviri Armistice Banquet Tray
description: Fashioned from armaments in a symbolic gesture of peace, it spilled enough drinks at the Grand Moot to nearly dissolve the pact. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Shaman Chirah's Devotion Shovel
description: Believed to be a blessed instrument of Z'en, the Kothringi christened many endeavors by breaking ground with this shovel. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: King Dumac's Royal Latrine Cloth Roll
description: Originally believed to be a banner of the Dwarven royal house of Red Mountain, it was taken down after the error was discovered. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Ysgramor's Sload-Skin Wine Sack
description: Slick and elastic, this wine sack can distend to many times it original volume. Few can stomach using it, for many reasons. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Prince Hubalajad's Trash Urn
description: The prince's funerary urn became the final place of rest for letters about his unpaid debts in the failing years of his legacy. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Treethane Niriel's "Living Plant-Wear" Book Set
description: "Flourish with a Flourish," foremost authority on Bosmer zoetic fashion, inscribed on live flora. This printing has dried out. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Coronation Decanter of Prince Naemon
description: Crafted to commemorate Prince Naemon's ascent to the throne. It bears the cracks of a violent impact. NOTE: This item is on Kari's Hit List! Bring it to the Thieves Den and place it in the library to prove you're a Master Thief.

name: Yokudan Paperweight
description: A heavy piece of carved stonework from a Yokudan ruin, used as a paperweight.

name: Spotless Goods Signet Stamp
description: A signet stamp bearing the official seal of the Spotless Goods Shipping Concern, highly valued by smugglers and forgers.

name: Two-Faced Coin
description: A gold coin bearing a likeness of the Mask of Clavicus Vile on both sides.

name: Shark Tooth Necklace
description: A woman's necklace made from polished shark teeth.

name: Child's Wind-Up Toy
description: A tin wind-up toy made to resemble a mechanical Dwemer spider.

name: Bookbinding Kit
description: A set of tools and materials used for repairing or replacing the leather covers of worn books.

name: Maormer Spyglass
description: A brass spyglass engraved with a raunchy Maormer limerick.

name: Wooden Dragonfrog Carving
description: An excellent likeness of a dragon frog carved from a single piece of orange ironwood.

name: Senche Tigerskin Bedroll
description: The skin of a Senche Tiger with a sewn-in silk lining, used as a bedroll in the wilderness.

name: Copper Mess Kit
description: A well made, hinged hunter's mess kit of polished copper.

name: Chukoo Bones
description: A set of carved and brightly painted animal bones, used for the popular fortune telling game Chukoo.

name: Spidersilk Ladies Scarf
description: A ladies scarf made of fine-spun spidersilk, with silver thread filigree.

name: Haj Mota Jelly Curative
description: Jelly made by boiling haj mota shells. Believed to flush toxins from the body and cure acne and insomnia.

name: Minstrel's Uka-Lute
description: A miniature, playable stringed lute of lacquered wood, favored by wandering minstrels for its portability.

name: Fend-Em-Off Insect Repellent
description: A bottle of extremely potent insect repellent. The label claims, "Keeps even kotu gava away for hours!"

name: Ship's Signal Lantern
description: A brass-and-glass ship's lantern fitted with a set of hinged shutters, used for ship-to-ship communication at sea.

name: Silk Parasol
description: A brightly-colored sun parasol made from embroidered silk.

name: Privacy Disc
description: A disc of leather with attached stick. Hold to cover the mouth, preventing the lip-reading of private conversations.

name: Document Forging Kit
description: A velvet-lined wooden box containing various inks, writing implements, seals, and official-looking stamps.

name: Eavesdropping Earhorn
description: A brass horn with a sound-amplifying membrane, designed to be pressed against a wall or door to eavesdrop on conversations.

name: Brass Monkey
description: A rather macabre "good luck" idol, made by encasing the corpse of a real monkey in brass.

name: Daedric Playing Cards
description: A set of hand-painted playing cards with trumps made to look like Daedric Princes.

name: Carved Wooden Leg
description: A fancy prosthetic peg-leg carved from mahogany and inset with small gems.

name: Mudcrab Cracker Set
description: A set of silver crab crackers, essential for getting to the meat of a mudcrab quickly and easily.

name: Haj Mota Shell Jewelry Box
description: A jewelry box crafted of carved haj mota shell with silver inlay.

name: Maormer Slave Manacles
description: Iron Manacles of the type used by Maormer slave traders.

name: Morag Tong Interrogation Kit
description: A leather satchel bearing the symbol of the Morag Tong, containing devices like thumbscrews and sharp implements.

name: Maritime Depth Measurer
description: A rope of woven spidersilk on a hand-cranked brass wheel, marked with units of measurement, used to measure ocean depths.

name: Honeysap Everchew Treats
description: An imported package of chewing gum made from the rare and tasty moon-sugar honeysap of Elswyr.

name: Shorty Shalum's Height Enhancers
description: A pair of carved wooden wedges designed to be inserted into shoes, subtly increasing the wearer's apparent height.

name: Pacrooti's Mole Asses
description: A jug of a peculiar and popular brand of molasses, bottled and sold by an enterprising young Khajiit.

name: Pirate Ship Model
description: Its brass nameplate identifies this intricately-detailed model of a Maormer pirate vessel "The Wandering Gale."

name: Ship's Cargo Net
description: A finely-woven cargo net folded inside a canvas bag, apparently never used.

name: Prince Hubalajad Tapestry
description: A colorful woven tapestry depicting Prince Hubalajad, the founder of Abah's Landing.

name: Wooden Juggling Clubs
description: A set of three lacquered wooden clubs or batons, commonly used by street preformers in Abah's Landing.

name: Gilded Vanity Mirror
description: A fine silver vanity mirror, set into a gilded frame.

name: "Battle On the High Seas" Game
description: A game of ship-to-ship pirate battles played using wooden pegs, strategically placed on a peg board.

name: Scrimshander's Dice Cup
description: An ornate dice casting cup carved from a single piece of whale bone.

name: Incriminating Correspondence
description: One merchant's letter to another, containing incriminating evidence of cargo smuggling.

name: Hand-Crafted Cornett
description: A conical wooden wind instrument, covered in leather, with finger holes and a small ivory mouthpiece.

name: Silver Toenail Clippers
description: A pair of sterling silver toenail clippers inscribed with the owner's initials.

name: Brass Duck Call
description: A brass whistle on a chain, made to emulate the sound of a duck, used by hunters.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Style
description: Use to learn the Morag Tong crafting style.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Axes
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Axes.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Belts
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Belts.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Boots
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Boots.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Bows
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Bows.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Chests
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Chests.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Daggers
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Daggers.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Gloves
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Gloves.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Helmets
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Helmets.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Legs
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Legs.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Maces
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Maces.

description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Shields.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Shoulders
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Shoulders.

name: Crafting Motif 30: Morag Tong Staves
description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Staves.

description: Use to learn how to make Morag Tong Swords.

description: Use to learn the Morag Tong crafting style.

description: Use to learn the Skinchanger crafting style.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Axes
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Axes.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Belts
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Belts.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Boots
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Boots.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Bows
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Bows.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Chests
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Chests.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Daggers
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Daggers.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Gloves
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Gloves.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Helmets
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Helmets.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Legs
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Legs.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Maces
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Maces.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Shields
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Shields.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Shoulders
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Shoulders.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Staves
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Staves.

name: Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Swords
description: Use to learn how to make Skinchanger Swords.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 31: Skinchanger Style
description: Use to learn the Skinchanger crafting style.

name: Jubilee Cake Voucher
description: Good for one special-occasion cake from the renowned baker, Chef Donolon. Use to start the chef's quest. Look for Donolon's bakery barge in the ports of Vulkhel Guard, Davon's Watch, and the Harbor District of Daggerfall.

name: The Rid-Thar's Moon Pearls
description: Moon Pearls are considered sacred, often displayed behind the altars of the greatest Temples of the Two-Moons Dance. This pair is said to have been blessed by the prophet Rid-Thar-ri'Datta himself.

name: Royal Redtail Hawk Writing Quill
description: Feather from a redtail hawk, sacred to Tava, fashioned into a writing quill with a golden nib. Reserved for use by the nobility.

name: Turquoise Dragon Frog Paperweight
description: Paperweight of a dragon frog carved from a huge nugget of turquoise, with "No Shira Citadel" engraved on the bottom.

name: Prince Hew's Haj Mota Toupee
description: Recreation of Hubalajad's haj mota-shaped toupee, including the original emerald eyes, mounted on a half-bust of the late noble.

name: Gilded Toku Gava Ink Pen
description: A golden pen in the shape of a giant mosquito; the scrivener holds the thorax and writes with the proboscis.

name: Gurges and Associates Silver Keychain
description: Finely-wrought silver keychain with a crystal fob. Etched with the seal of Gurges and Associates, the "fallen house."

name: Ra Gada Style Platinum Pen Knife
description: Folding pen knife with platinum handle, wrought in the Ra Gada style of the second, or Tavan wave of settlers.

name: Hubalajad Jackal Collar
description: Collar for one of Prince Hubalajad's notorious pack of hunting jackals, which turned on and devoured their own trainer.

name: Ra Gada Lodestone Compass
description: Vintage antique, a compass from one of the fifty-six ships of the second, or Tavan wave of Ra Gada settlers.

name: Platinum Yokudan "Sad Duck" Whistle
description: Platinum-chased slide whistle used to mock the overcautious by playing a sad, descending string of notes in a minor key.

name: Noble's Cloth-Of-Gold Book Protector
description: Elaborately-embroidered cloth-of-gold book bag, made to carry a noble's copy of the Book of Circles.

name: Silver "Tears of Zeht" Canteen-Flask
description: Silver teardrop-shaped pouch flask for a Redguard priest, embossed with "Tears of Zeht," though rarely used to contain water.

name: Orichalc Diagna Statuette
description: Orichalc statuette of Diagna, God of the Sideways Blade, holding a severed head, an ancient work clearly Yokudan in origin.

name: Magnifico's Ivory Hammergammon Set
description: The Magnifico Z'za's folding hammergammon board of precious wood inlays, with ivory pieces and jade multiplier die.

name: "Flaming Ways" Commemorative Plate
description: Gold plate commemorating Prince Hubalajad's accidental burning of the Abah's Landing shipyard.

name: Clockwork Dragon Frog Firestarter
description: Antique First-Era noble's novelty device, a clockwork dragon frog that spits a small puff of flame.

name: Grandee's Alabaster Auspice Ibis
description: Alabaster statuette of a sacred ibis, hinged at the hips, said to lean forward to give a favorable answer to a question.

name: Hel Shira's Fancy Camel Goad
description: Sword noble's jewel-encrusted camel goad, used when mounted and in full dress uniform for special occasions.

name: Princess Zoon'da's Golden Cuff
description: A leather cuff with embroidered swirls once worn by Hubalajad's eldest daughter, stolen and then reclaimed in a famous tale.

name: Silver "Lady Morwha" Teaspoon Set
description: Set of ornate silver teaspoons honoring Morwha, goddess of love and fertility, one spoon for each of her four breasts.

name: Golden Sep Adder Candlesticks
description: Pair of gold candlesticks wrought in the form of rearing sep adders, wings spread and fanged mouths open.

name: Platinum "Camel Wedding" Platter
description: Painted platinum platter depicting Hubalajad symbolically claiming his peninsula by marrying a sacred white camel.

name: Silver Royal Taneth Hand Mirror
description: Silver and glass hand mirror with the royal seal of Taneth embossed on the back.

name: Baby Haj Mota Snuff Box
description: A filigreed snuff box made from the shell of an infant haj mota.

name: Golden Lawn Bowling Trophy
description: Golden trophy, a hawk's talon holding a "jack" ball engraved "Abah's Landing Bowls Champion, Mid-Year 541."

name: Prince Hew's Gold Swim Weights
description: Prince Hubalajad vowed to strengthen his muscles by swimming in Abah's harbor wearing these golden weights. Used once.

name: Lacquered Foot Bath
description: Gilded lacquered tray used to soak sore feet in salted waters.

name: Mounted Extinct Flightless Bird
description: Rare taxidermied example of the now-extinct gooblet, a flightless bird that lived along the Hammerfell coast before the Ra Gada.

name: Gem-Encrusted Philosophy Skull
description: Exquisite memento mori, a desk or office skull to remind one to do honor to Ruptga every day, for life is short.

name: Gold-Tipped Obsidian Dowsing Wand
description: Dowsing wand, reputedly magical, sold to Prince Hew as an infallible guide to a fountain of immortality elixir. Used once.

name: Hilarious Lodestone Bowling Balls
description: Metallic balls for can't-fail lawn bowling made for Prince Hew from lodestones. Used once.

name: Silvered Zither With Matching Blindfold
description: Black silver-stringed zither with silver soundbox edging, with matching blindfold to maintain the Prince's privacy.

name: Seven Pairs of Golden Toebells
description: Seven different pairs of finely-wrought golden bells, one for each week day, for attaching to curly-toed slippers.

name: Prince Hulajabad's Double Bosoms
description: Two-bosom harness worn by Prince Hew in the title role for the play "Lady Morwha's Latest Marriage." Used once.

name: Iridescent Boneshaver Cloak
description: Magnificent cloak of iridescent gooblet feathers worn by a priest of Onsi during Boneshaver's Sword Banquet.

name: Gold-Foil Tavan Back Banners
description: Antique First-Era "Tavan Wings" back banners, of gold foil mounted on a structure of ductile copper.

name: Oversized Tu'whacca Mask
description: Elaborate, oversized ibis-head mask with emerald eyes, worn by a priest of Tu'whacca in the March of Wisdom.

name: Ornate Spring-Wound Alarm Clock
description: Wind-up device keeps time for twelve hours, can be set to ring at a certain hour. Inscribed "Imported by Tall Papa's Hoard."

name: Jar of Golden Kohl Eye Shadow
description: Jar of exotic eye shadow, a light-colored kohl containing flecks of actual gold, worn on holidays by grandeyas and magnificas.

name: Prince Hew's Prismatic Sleep Mask
description: Dream-catcher eye mask made from thousands of tiny crystal prisms, intended to catch and preserve dream images. Used once.

name: Ivory-Handled Gooblet Cat Toy
description: Ornate cat toy, a string of feathers from the extinct gooblet bird hung from an elaborately hand-carved ivory wand.

name: Jadeite Saint Leki Reliquary
description: Small, exquisitely-carved jadeite box containing a lock of black hair, said to be a relic of Leki the Sword-Saint.

name: Bottle of Fennec Musk Perfume
description: Crystal bottle of rare and costly fennec musk perfume, very fashionable among the nobility of Gilane, Taneth, and Rihad.

name: Merchant's Secret Ledger
description: A thinly bound book with a hand-scrawled record of illicit transactions filling the pages.

name: Hagraven Silver-Quill Pen
description: Long and elegant, this hagraven feather has been manicured and inset with silver. It's strong and sharp as a shiv.

name: Bundle of Potential Blackmail
description: A sordid collection of love letters chronicling a torrid extramarital affair.

name: Blackwater Ink
description: A stoppered flask of thick black fluid that reflects a pearlescent gleam in the light.

name: Proof of Pardon
description: A leaf of thick paper stock exonerating the owner of a heinous crime.

name: Book of Debtors
description: A meticulously updated record of outstanding loans, annotated with potential collateral and leverage on deadbeat borrowers.

name: Amber Torchbug Charm
description: A marble of polished amber containing a torchfly. The trapped insect still emits a faint glow in pitch darkness.

name: Petrified Dragon Frog
description: Claimed to be the fossil of a dragon frog ensorcelled to adorn the court of Prince Hew. More likely a masterful carving.

name: Asp-Tongue Knot
description: Two asp's tongues, tied into an intricate knot and dried. Said to ward away poisonous beasts, and liars.

name: Camel Map of Hew's Bane
description: A hardy rectangle of camel leather with an intricate map of Hew's Bane tattooed into the skin.

name: Two-Share Tankard
description: A hefty pewter tankard with a hollow grip and concealed mechanism intended to discreetly spike the mug's contents.

name: Wire Weave Rope
description: Sturdy hemp, threaded with spun strands of ebony to fortify it against cutting.

name: Elven Vegetable Peeler
description: An elegant and razor-sharp kitchen utensil. Ruddy stains along the glass blade seem too dark for beets.

name: Game of Glass Jacks
description: At first glance, a harmless game of reflexes, but the pieces are a little too sharp for that to be their intended purpose.

name: Silver Oyster Fork
description: Thin tines on the end of a wedged handle are meant to split open the boiled delicacies.

name: Sea's Bounty Bracelet
description: A string of barnacles polished to a sheen and set with perfect ocean pearls.

name: Elaborate Skooma Pipe
description: This vessel of salvaged Dwemer mechanisms is a small furnace meant to intensify the user's smoking experience.

name: Ebony Orcish File
description: An implement of Orc craftmanship meant to wear the hardest materials down smooth. Makes a good saw in a pinch.

name: Mudcrab Bowl
description: A large mudcrab shell smoothed down and shaped into dishware. Light, durable, and aesthetically pleasing.

name: Whiskey Refortifier
description: A divine bouquet of peat and spirits emanate from this empty cask. It is designed to flavor whatever ale is stored within.

name: Minnow-Tin Scent-Block
description: A tin of deep sea minnow-brine, praised by pearl divers as a shark repellent.

name: Mourner's Tumbler
description: A squat crystal drinking glass with the residue of many somber nights being set out and left untouched.

name: Flint-Steel Finger Caps
description: A pair of snug fitting caps meant for the thumb and middle finger. Great for lighting ovens and party tricks.

name: Dragon Frog Trivet
description: A taxidermied dragon frog splayed out into a protective pad to place hot cookware upon.

name: Empty Ornate Scabbard
description: A beautifully crafted sheath for a dagger, sans the dagger.

name: Cerulean Fountain Spout
description: A smooth colorful ceramic spout from one of Abah's Landing's many fountains.

name: Slaughterfish-Tooth Grappel
description: A sinister looking climbing hook made from steel and set with many barbed slaughterfish teeth for grip.

name: Blood Rug
description: Easily washed, stain-proof, and backed in rubber, it'll forget the night before sooner than its owners.

name: Shrunken Claw
description: The grisly paw of a large cat, or possibly a Khajiit, kept with belongings as a ward against burglars.

name: Reeking Blanket
description: A light linen cloth enchanted with a potent smell of fermenting fish. A custom's agent's worst enemy.

name: Jack of Cork
description: A quilted tube stuffed with a soft buoyant wood. Used to assist with flotation.

name: Marsh Waders
description: Thick, ugly rubber overalls crafted to keep out bog water and everything living within.

name: Unwrapped Silk Turban
description: Gossamer fine and threaded with gold, this head wrap would be gorgeous if one knew how to style it.

name: Silk Prick Pocket
description: Pocket-liner meant to be slipped into doublets with large, inviting pockets. The fishhook linings trap incautious pickpockets.

name: Ornate Prosthetic Hook
description: A sturdy steel hook, to be attached to a vambrace upon the wrist of an amputee. The metalwork is particularly elegant.

name: Bodice Ripper
description: A concealed razor allegedly invented by a lady of the night, to be sewn into underclothes. Bodices aren't what it rips.

name: Opal Snuffbox
description: A small vessel carved out of precious stone. This one appears to be filled with finely ground tobacco.

name: Arkay Votive Figure
description: A tiny statue of the god of the cycle of birth and death, often praised upon rising from slumber for granting another day.

name: Winsome Welwa Remembrance Pillow
description: A scented pillow gifted to patrons of the Winsome Welwa. A lipstick kiss clings to the fabric.

name: Fancy Negligee
description: This lacey bedtime garment hasn't been laundered for some time to preserve its lingering floral scent.

name: Illustrated Manual of Hew Coiffuture
description: A faithful, illustrated recreation of Prince Hew's most famed hair styles and, supposedly, steps for their construction.

name: Sugar-Bear Perfume
description: An animal scent mixed with hints of moon-sugar, said to inspire amorous feelings.

name: Three Block Jigsaw Puzzle
description: Barely more challenging than the two block version and too large to choke on.

name: Steel Calipers With Guar-Skin Grip
description: A versatile instrument for measuring thickness. The grip retards heat conduction, allowing for measurements at the forge.

name: Sturdy Awl
description: This spike could probably be driven through iron as easily as the leather it's intended for.

name: Shaping Hatchet
description: A small hand ax meant for planing down a log or block of wood before applying more precise tools.

name: Hook Plumb
description: A powerful, finger-sized lodestone on a rope, intended to collect swallowed fish hooks. Works on fish or people.

name: Glass Hook Case
description: A small leather case containing two dozen elaborate glass fishhooks.

name: Rotating Moondial
description: A small cork-infused dial. Placed in water, it spins three times clockwise until it points at the moon Secundus.

name: Counter-Rotating Moondial
description: A small cork-infused dial. Placed in water, it spins six times counter-clockwise until it points at the moon Masser.

name: Toothsayer Stone
description: A polished sliver of geode. Placed beneath the tongue, any teeth which will begin to rot within the year emit a faint scream.

name: Illustrated Jeweler's Portfolio
description: A book of colorful illustrations depicting a variety of royal jewelry throughout Tamriel.

name: Pocket Rules For Kick the Khajiit
description: Kicking is featured prominently, and remains the only consistent feature in an otherwise arbitrary collection of guidelines.

name: Cork Discus
description: A lacquered disc of flight-worthy cork popular for water sports.

name: Wax Effigy Candle
description: A fine wax effigy, painted in bright colors, with a small wick protruding from the head.

name: Used Marbles
description: A set of matching rust-flecked iron marbles. This collection has seen more than a few games, but it's still good.

name: Wooden Hoop
description: A versatile, if simple, tool for the imagination. Toss it, roll it, jump it, juggle it. The possibilities are limitless.

name: Safekeeping Doll
description: This lumpy cloth dolly has a split in the seam where its previous owner kept small secret treasures from parents and bullies.

name: Legionnaire Figurine
description: A posable wooden figure of an Imperial soldier complete with tin armor and blunt weaponry.

name: Slaughterfish Repellent
description: A repugnant slurry of alchemical refuse commonly believed to offer protection from slaughterfish. May be harmful to the user's health.

name: Rune Tag
description: A small enchanted piercing applied to throw backs in an attempt to track their schools in following fishing seasons.

name: Coughing Tincture
description: This mixture causes involuntary coughing fits to help expel water from the lungs or prank your friends.

name: Hook Sash
description: A leather-backed cloth for keeping fish hooks handy, adjustable to be worn around the body or an appendage.

name: Fishle
description: Tamriel's first and only brand of fish call. Its only saving grace is it makes a useful nautical signal.

name: Egg Skimmer
description: A downy fine net used for scooping eggs from the shallows of spawning pools.

name: Worm Food
description: A rust-proof can of soil and rot meant to sustain bait over a long trek or extended fishing trip.

name: 1001 Remedies For Slaughterfish Bites Field Guide
description: Simple illustrations fill this abridged pocket edition. Closer to one hundred.

name: Guar Tallow Candle
description: Fragrant, slow-burning, and found in any town with a guar population.

name: Recycled Dwarven Lamp
description: This functional lamp was cobbled together from scrap found in Dwemer ruins.

name: Torch Bug Cage
description: An oversized lantern intended as a cozy torch bug nest. Cost effective, but provides barely enough light to read by.

name: Sturdy Iron Lantern
description: Excellent for interior lighting and mining operations, but prone to rusting when exposed to the elements.

name: Glow Stick
description: An apprentice magician's enchanted torch. Glows softly so long as a little magicka is supplied.

name: Dirt Magnet
description: A lodestone that gathers all manner of dust and debris when brushed over a surface. Great for cleaning, but a pain to clean.

name: Anti-Tumble Tumbler
description: Through some bizarre form of levitation, this glass will never tip without significant force applied. A straw is advised.

name: Perfect Metronome
description: Once set in motion this device will keep a steady pace until stopped.

name: Echo Box
description: A small wooden jewelry box that repeats the last thing whispered into it one more time. Popular among working spouses.

name: Transplanting Pot
description: Gnarled wooden pot that seems to breathe a little extra life into a sapling while it awaits a new plot.

name: Rash Ointment
description: A jellied paste for soothing irritated skin. The shelf life is astoundingly long.

name: Corn Pads
description: These little cushions are applied to the skin with resin to mitigate irritation from tight footwear.

name: Hemo-Loam
description: This dusty clay becomes thick and firm when moist, making it well-suited to covering cuts until actual aid can be rendered.

name: Joint Hammer
description: A rubber mallet used to crack arthritic joints. Largely considered barbaric and ineffective, it persists as a layman's remedy.

name: Set of Chisels
description: An assortment of chisels fit to cover most hewing needs.

name: Ball-Peen Hammer
description: Consisting of a traditional flat headed hammer and a rounded peen suited for metal working techniques.

name: Travel Sewing Kit
description: A compact case with a range of needles and common colored threads at the ready to patch damaged clothing on the road.

name: Steel Tooling Bits
description: Several styles of bit for a foot-powered auger or drill.

name: Clothier's Tape
description: A flexible strip of supple leather dyed white and brightly marked for taking measurements.

name: Bag of Nails
description: Enough well forged nails to complete an ambitious project or two.

name: Table Vise
description: Able to be mounted to a work bench and sturdy enough not to lose its grip when force is applied.

name: Spidersilk Fishing Nets
description: Nets woven from the silk of giant spiders. Incredibly strong, but treated to remove the natural stickiness.

name: Fish Gut Stink Bag
description: A bag magically treated to reduce odor, currently full of fish effluvia. Occasionally confused by pickpockets for a coin pouch.

name: Crocodile Repellent
description: A tonic that erroneously claims to repel crocodiles. Superstitious fisherfolk sprinkle it on their boots every morning.

name: Warming Waistpouch
description: A pouch attached to smallclothes, intended to hold heated stones. Keeps fisherfolk warm when in waist-high water.

name: Saltwater Taxidermist's Kit
description: A small kit with all the tools needed to mount and display a variety of saltwater dwellers. Plaque not included.

name: Mudcrab Monocle
description: A monocle enchanted to surround any observed mudcrab with a soft, buttery-yellow glow. Does not work at night.

name: Miner's Blue Beacon
description: This small blue gem blinks softly in the proximity of poisonous, but odorless gases. Shatters if exposed to direct sunlight.

name: Winter Twaddler's Friend
description: A small copper disc with two thumb holes on opposite sides. Produces a warm sensation when rotated in folded hands.

name: Dwemer Nostril Comb
description: Tiny counter-rotating comb made of dwarven steel. Keeps unkempt nostril hair tidy and luxurious.

name: Soul Gem Waistpocket
description: A detachable waistpocket worn beneath the clothes, intended to keep soul gems from the hands of pickpockets.

name: Corpse Handling Kit
description: A small satchel containing a variety of tools needed to handle and preserve a corpse.

name: Lacquered Navicula
description: A portable incense holder carved in the shape of an Imperial ship.

name: Velvet Medallion Holder
description: A small velvet pouch intended to keep religious medallions in pristine condition while traveling. (Currently empty.)

name: Better Blade Hilt Mold
description: A popular set of molds for untrained blacksmiths. Produces a standardized hilt that is slightly uncomfortable for everyone.

name: Hanging Armor Creche
description: A space-saving collection of connected straps and hooks. Attach to a smithy's rafters to store an entire set of armor above you.

name: Smooth Hands Forge Wand
description: A small quartz wand. When touched to recently forged metal, the trip glows bright blue if the object is still too hot to hold.

name: Maker's Stamp Kit
description: A small metal rod with interchangeable and interlocking heads, designed to more easily craft unique maker's marks.

name: Cozy Caliper Set
description: A set of ten calipers of varying sizes, held in a fine leather case with velvet interior.

name: Caliper Dip
description: A thick black paste coated on caliper heads and baked dry. Said to provide a better grip on worked metal.

name: All Right Awl-Wright's Kit
description: A smith's kit for fashioning awls, first popularized in the Imperial City. Collector's items since the Planemeld.

name: Illustrated Arms Folio
description: A book of colorful illustrations depicting a variety of weapons throughout Tamriel.

name: Illustrated Amor Folio
description: A book of colorful illustrations depicting a variety of armor fashions throughout Tamriel.

name: Dollmaker's Kit
description: A small kit containing all the material needed to fashion dolls. The fine components could be resold to unscrupulous merchants.

name: Slaughterfish Bobber
description: A bobber with a simple enchantment to glow a soft green when it detects the presence of slaughterfish.

name: Orichalcum Mudcrab Cracker
description: An ornate orichalcum shell cracker. Good for mudcrab dinners, or for torturing live mudcrabs still in their cages.

name: Fast Forge Fire Salts Vial
description: When sprinkled amidst the coals, the forge can be fired to its hottest temperature in less than a minute.

name: Tailor's Best Friend
description: A statuette allowing one to design outfits in miniature. A clever mechanism inside can expand the statuette by a hand's width.

name: Statuette of A Daedric Dog
description: Statuette of a dog with a strangely human expression on its face; said to be associated with Clavicus Vile.

name: Kyne's Token
description: A Nord ornament, polished from much handling, sacred to Kyne, goddess of the storm.

name: Copper Dragon Claw
description: A three-toed Dragon's-foot wrought in copper; its function is unknown.

name: Attunement Sphere
description: A strange globe of Dwarven metal, ancient and mysterious.

name: Dwemer Puzzle Cube
description: A square device of Dwarven metal, with untranslatable runes on every surface.

name: Satchel of Laundered Goods
description: This sack contains valuables that were obtained… less than legally.

name: Crafting Motif 35: Dro-M'Athra Style
description: Use to learn the Dro-m'Athra crafting style. Requires Rank 10 of any of the Metalworking, Tailoring, or Woodworking passives.

name: Crafting Motif 35: Dro-M'Athra Axes

name: Large Laundered Shipment
description: A crate that was 'conveniently lost' from a caravan or tradeship. Nobody will suspect that the mundane goods inside are anything less than legitimate.

name: Stale Sweetroll
description: A common food.

name: Battle Axe of the Shadow Dancer
Inferno Staff of the Shadow Dancer
Ice Staff of the Shadow Dancer

name: Stone of Instant Inspiration
description: Meant solely for testing. Grants full skill ranks in all crafting disciplines.

name: Large Stolen Shipment
description: A crate that was stolen from a caravan or tradeship. Opening this in public may draw unwanted attention.

name: Grease
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 3 poisons

name: Ichor
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 10 poisons

name: Slime
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 20 poisons

name: Gall
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 30 poisons

name: Terebinthine
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 40 poisons

name: Pitch-Bile
description: An Ingredient for crafting level 50 poisons

name: Tarblack
description: An ingredient for crafting Champion poisons.

name: Night-Oil
description: An ingredient for crafting Champion poisons, black as night.

name: Alkahest
description: An ingredient for crafting Champion poisons, black as Sithis' heart.

name: Coarse Chalk
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Fine Chalk, which is used to make Thieves Guild equipment.

name: Unidentified Elite Heavy Armor
description: Contains a Renowned-quality item from the Fasalla's Guile or Warrior's Fury item sets.

name: Unidentified Elite Medium Armor
description: Contains a Renowned-quality item from the Marksman or Leki's Focus item sets.

name: Unidentified Elite Light Armor
description: Contains a Renowned-quality item from the Vicious Death or Robes of Transmutation item sets.

name: Unidentified Elite Weapon
description: Contains a Renowned-quality item from the Vicious Death, Robes of Transmutation, Marksman, Leki's Focus, Fasalla's Guile, or Warrior's Fury item sets.

name: Unidentified Elite Jewelry
description: Contains a Renowned-quality item from the Vicious Death, Robes of Transmutation, Marksman, Leki's Focus, Fasalla's Guile, or Warrior's Fury item sets.

description: Ten of these items can be refined into Tainted Blood, which is used to make Assassins League equipment.

name: Guard's Shilling
description: Ten of these items can be refined into a Polished Shilling, which is used to make Abah's Watch equipment.

name: Gold Coast Daily Contract Recompense
description: Compensation from the Dragonstar Caravan Company for fulfilling a daily job contract in the Gold Coast.

name: Unidentified Sithis' Touch Weapon
description: This large box contains a Weapon from the Sithis' Touch item set.

name: Unidentified Sithis' Touch Foot Armor
description: This large box contains a piece of Foot Armor from the Sithis' Touch item set.

description: This large box contains a Ring from the Sithis' Touch item set.

description: This large box contains a Shoulder Armor from the Sithis' Touch item set.

name: Unidentified Sithis' Touch Necklace
description: This large box contains a Necklace from the Sithis' Touch item set.

name: Litany of Blood
description: This copy of the Litany of Blood will allow you to reference your victims more easily.

name: Torchbug Thorax
description: An ingredient for alchemy.

name: Beetle Scuttle
description: An ingredient for alchemy.

name: Spider Egg
description: An ingredient for alchemy.

description: An ingredient for alchemy.

description: An ingredient for alchemy.

description: An ingredient for alchemy.

name: Black Honeycomb
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Black Beeswax, which is used to make Dark Brotherhood equipment.

name: Dark Carapace
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Boiled Carapace, which is used to make Morag Tong equipment.

name: Stone of Instant Knowledge
description: Meant solely for testing. Grants full knowledge of all Motifs, and then some.

name: Runebox: Xivkyn Dreadguard
description: Contains a Xivkyn Dreadguard Polymorph. This container can be traded, mailed, and posted to Guild Banks and Guild Stores - however, once opened, the Runebox (and its contents) are bound to your account.

name: Runebox: Xivkyn Tormentor
description: Contains a Xivkyn Tormentor Polymorph. This container can be traded, mailed, and posted to Guild Banks and Guild Stores - however, once opened, the Runebox (and its contents) are bound to your account.

name: Runebox: Xivkyn Augur
description: Contains a Xivkyn Augur Polymorph. This container can be traded, mailed, and posted to Guild Banks and Guild Stores - however, once opened, the Runebox (and its contents) are bound to your account.

name: Unmarked Sack
