name: Gold Coast Trading Co. Seal Stamp
description: Solid gold stamp used for pressing the symbol of the Gold Coast Trading Company into wax when sealing envelopes.

name: Ivory Anvil Lighthouse Paperweight
description: Paperweight carved from timber mammoth ivory representing the Anvil Lighthouse.

name: Soul Gem Window Prism
description: Ornament, a window prism fashioned from a depleted soul gem, inscribed 'Jodis Windbite, Enchanter.'

name: Embroidered Coin Purse
description: Ornate embroidered coin purse with brass clamshell closure, 'Presented by the Bank of Kvatch.'

name: Aquilarios Quizzing Glass
description: Crystal magnifying lens with silver frame and handle engraved with the House Aquilarios crest.

name: Golden Handcuffs Key
description: Fancy gold handcuffs key with attached label: 'The Withered Rose, Room Naught.'

name: Silken Backpack Liner-Insert
description: Red silk backpack liner for care and transport of delicate lingerie, labeled 'Purple-Plumes' Bags, Anvil.'

name: Silver-Chased Antique Hourglass
description: Antique Reman-Empire 'Akatosh' hourglass, with silver-chased frame and containing gold-flecked sand.

name: Kvatch Arena Perspective Glass
description: Collapsible pocket telescope with crystal lenses, its brass housing engraved 'Kvatch Arena: Don't Miss a Thing!'

name: Red "Ruby Throne" Folding Stool
description: Folding camp stool with seat of fancy red leather tooled in diamond designs, from Anvil Ironworks & Tannery.

name: Jeweled Nixad Marionette
description: String-controlled puppet made from a nixad's carapace, adorned with gemstone eyes, teeth, and toes.

name: Jadeite Baandari Tarot Deck
description: 34-card Baandari tarot deck of engraved jadeite placards, imported from Alabaster.

name: Eight Blessings Libation Shot Glasses
description: Set of eight engraved shot glasses, one for each Imperial Divine, from The Eight Blessings, Kvatch.

name: Crystal Alembic Carafe
description: Fancy crystal carafe blown in the shape of an alchemist's alembic, engraved 'The Dabbler's Den, Kvatch.'

name: Minotaur Hoof Pincushion
description: Coastal Clothiers' decorative pincushion of mahogany and stuffed chamois in the shape of a minotaur's hoof.

name: Alabaster Dibella Statuette
description: Alabaster statuette of the goddess Dibella emerging from her bath, inscribed 'House of Dibella, Anvil.'

name: Reman Dynasty Nesting Dolls
description: Collectible set of five painted nesting dolls representing Reman I, Kastav, Reman II, Brazollus Dor, and Reman III.

name: Ornamental Varla Stone
description: Depleted Varla Stone mounted in a golden cradle inscribed 'Ayleid Relic of Garlas Malatar.'

name: Silver-Lidded Commemorative Stein
description: Picturesque ceramic stein with hinged silver lid inscribed, 'Enrick's Pub: 200 Years of the Finest Ale!'

name: Aquilarios Crest Hunting Horn
description: Minotaur hunting horn engraved with the crest of House Aquilarios and the phrase, 'Hounds Halloo!'

name: Dibellan Sibyl Finger Cymbals
description: Several sacred silver finger cymbals assembled with Dibellan symbols for a Sibyl of the chapel to jangle.

name: Diocletia's Pattern Book, Autographed
description: Autographed presentation copy of 'A Colovian Lady's Pattern Book' by Diocletia, the Tailor of Skingrad.

name: Lord Jarol's Marathon Trophy
description: Stylized gold statuette of a runner in full stride, inscribed 'Second Place, Lord Jarol's Marathon, 2E 576.'

name: Antique Anti-Venom Toadstone
description: Silver coffer containing a polished, semi-precious toadstone, once thought to neutralize poison if placed in a drink.

name: Bejeweled Dwarven Metal Dog Bowl
description: Rare Dwemeri bowl converted to a pet's food dish, with the name 'Snarly' picked out in precious stones.

name: House Jarol Folding Parasol
description: Folding parasol with ivory ribs and lavender silk panels, one of which is embroidered with the House Jarol crest.

name: "Investiture of the Primate" Tapestry
description: Carefully-folded tapestry by the famous loom artist Gloria Medilus depicting the holy investiture of Primate Artorius.

name: Deluxe Silver-Handled Leg Exerciser
description: Top-of-the-line silvered 'Thigh Lord' leg exerciser, hardly used, engraved 'Happy Anniversary, Dearest.'

name: "Fata Morgana" Crystal Fairy Castle
description: Fanciful and mildly-enchanted cut-glass crystal castle, hovers twinkling in the air one foot above whatever surface it's over.

name: Infernal Prayer Rug With Black Candles
description: Round hand-knotted rug of red wool with silver fringe and large black handprint symbol, with 13 black candles, partly burned.

name: Dibellan Sibyl's Golden Feather Boa
description: Luxurious golden scarf made from the dyed pinfeathers of 1,000 chub loons, as worn by Sibyls of Dibella.

name: Noble's White Satin Burial Shroud
description: Lavish Imperial noble's burial shroud, five paces of the finest white satin, labeled 'Iocanis Medilus, Stylemaster.'

name: Coin-Concealing Under-Doublet Money Belt
description: Superb hundred-drake padded money belt, worn under a noble's attire, labeled 'Compliments of Anvil Repository.'

name: Akatosh Chanter's New Life Stole
description: Ceremonial silk and satin stole with embroidered hourglasses, as worn by Akatosh Chanters during the New Life Festival.

name: Antique Akatosh Primate's Crosier
description: Akatosh Primate's crosier with golden hourglass at its finial, in the style of the reign of Empress Hestra.

name: Rain-Repellent "Umbrella Bird"
description: Exquisite sateen-feathered mock bluebird with epaulet-clip, mildly enchanted to repel raindrops from the wearer.

name: Anvil Ironworks Razor and Strop
description: Aristocrat's deluxe straight razor, engraved 'Anvil Ironworks,' with matching strop of minotaur hide.

name: Cap'n Slitweasand's Silken Eyepatch
description: Black silken eyepatch of Cap'n Goreius the Weasand-Slitter, notorious pirate of the Akaviri Potentate period.

name: Bottle of Rare "Sanguine's Rose" Perfume
description: Small scarlet bottle of rare and expensive 'Sanguine's Rose' perfume, reputed to have aphrodisiacal properties.

name: Ancient Ayleid Insect Eliminator
description: Small blue glowing crystal set in a metallic floral mount; magically slays intruding insects with tiny lightning bolts.

name: Art Book, "Allure of the Sweetroll"
description: Rare art book, 'Ong's Passion: Allure of the Sweetroll,' depicting healthy unclad Imperials holding artfully placed sweetrolls.

name: Exquisite Carved Reman-Era Fan
description: Antique folding fan, exquisitely carved from some kind of dark chitin, dating from the brief reign of Emperor Kastav.

name: Imperial Coronation Invitation
description: This ornate invitation, a souvenir of the coronation of Varen Aquilarios, is imprinted with gold leaf on fine parchment.

name: Dibella Prayer Token
description: This silver token from the Great Chapel of Dibella is inscribed with a prayer honoring the goddess of beauty and love.

name: Gold Coast Trading Signet Ring
description: A metal signet ring used to seal the official documents of the Gold Coast Trading Company with sealing wax.

name: Brass Anvil Paperweight
description: A brass paperweight made to look like a miniature blacksmith's anvil, bearing the seal of the city of Anvil.

name: Constable's Badge
description: A silver-plated badge carried by constables who work for the Kvatch Vigalents.

name: Gottshaw Inn Beer Stein
description: A beer stein with a hinged cover, inscribed with the name of The Gottshaw Inn and Tavern.

name: Red-Sails Pirate Flag
description: A folded flag of red silk, bearing the symbol of the Karthman Red-Sails: a fanged skull with an eyepatch.

name: Kvatch Arena Champion's Trophy
description: A trophy given out to tournament winners and champions who survive the Kvatch Arena.

name: Ship's Sextant
description: A ship's sextant made of polished brass.

name: Taxidermy Sep Viper
description: A Sep Viper, stuffed and mounted in an attack pose, with its dragon-like wings extended.

name: Mechanical Rat Trap
description: A well-made spring-loaded device used to kill rats and other vermin.

name: Stone of St. Alessia Replica
description: A costume jewelry replica of a famous amulet sacred to the followers of St. Alessia.

name: Stuffed Minotaur Toy
description: A stuffed child's toy made to look like a smiling minotaur.

name: Anvil Lighthouse Model
description: A scale model of the lighthouse in Anvil's harbor, which overlooks Anvil Castle.

name: Portrait of Rislav the Righteous
description: A portrait, done in oils, of Rislav Larich, former King of Skingrad.

name: All-Flags Navy Tapestry
description: A woven tapestry depicting the story of the All-Flags Navy and their voyage to do battle with the Sload of Thras.

name: Pirate's Spy Glass
description: A ship's spyglass, crafted of brass and bone, bearing the name of the pirate ship 'Maiden.'

name: Arrow Fletching Kit
description: A leather case containing a fletching jig, an assortment of feathers, and twine, used for fletching arrows.

name: Everlasting Candles
description: A package of dining room candles specially enchanted so that they will light, but never melt.

name: Leather Wineskin
description: A wineskin crafted of soft doeskin with a detachable shoulder strap.

name: Leather Riding Crop
description: A nobleman's riding crop made out of hardened, braided leather.

name: Falconer's Glove
description: A heavy leather glove fitted with restraining straps, used by hunters with trained falcons.

name: Toy Ballista
description: A working scale model of a ballista siege weapon, lovingly crafted of rosewood.

name: Metalworker's Hand Saw
description: A small, fine-toothed hand saw specifically designed to cut through metal.

name: Picnic Set
description: A leather day pack specifically designed to hold plates, cups, cutlery, and food for picnics in the outdoors.

name: Fossilized Draugr Skull
description: This ancient, fossilized skull of an undead creature has a horned helm covered with runes permanently fused to it.

name: Game Board and Playing Pieces
description: A gameboard with an inlaid hexagonal grid and carved bone playing pieces, used for the popular game 'Spoils of War.'

name: Sculpting Tools
description: A small hammer and set of chisels, used by stone sculptors to create statues, bas reliefs, and other carvings.

name: Shipwreck in A Bottle
description: A detailed shipwreck model bafflingly constructed inside a glass bottle with a tiny neck.

name: Theatrical Makeup Kit
description: A hinged metal box containing grease pencils, brushes, tubes of greasepaint, and several fake beards and mustaches.

name: Transforming Werewolf Doll
description: A rubbery doll of some unknown material that reshapes itself from the form of a Nord into a werewolf when placed in hot water.

name: River Troll Marionette
description: A marionette puppet, manipulated from above by strings, in the form of a hideously ugly River Troll.

name: Fisherman's Tackle Box
description: A hinged wooden box carved with images of fish and other marine creatures, with a set of nested storage trays inside.

name: Well-Made Fishing Net
description: A large, intricately braided fisherman's net of unusually high quality.

name: Mudcrab Trap
description: A submersible trap crafted from a wooden crate and netting, designed to capture live mudcrabs.

name: Miniature Fiddle
description: A tiny but fully functional stringed fiddle and bow.

name: Khajiiti Dream Dice
description: Carved multi-sided dice inscribed with runes denoting good or bad fortune, superstitiously thought to interpret dreams.

name: Order of the Hour Prayer Candle
description: An ornate candle intended to suggest the recitation of various prayers to Akatosh at intervals, as the candle burns down.

name: The Constellations of Nirn
description: A picture book guide to finding and recognizing the constellations in the night skies of Nirn.

name: Dwarven Measurement Converter
description: A metal sliding rule that purportedly converts Dwemer weights and measures to standard Imperial.

name: Khajiiti Moondial
description: A brass Khajitti device used to tell time using the positions and phases of the moons, Jone and Jode.

name: Unauthorized Order of the Hour Hourglass
description: A fine, silver-chased hourglass. Only a limited number were created before the Order of the Hour commanded the maker to desist.

name: Akatosh Meditation Beads
description: Made from finely carved soapstone, these beads have symbols of Akatosh painted upon them.

name: Golden Gaff Letter Opener
description: A letter opener made from a gaff hook dipped in gold. Created to commemorate the Pirate Queen.

name: Gold Coast Trading Company Paperweight
description: A solid ebony puck with 'GCTC' etched on the top. Though heavy, it is not aerodynamic enough to hurl at an enemy.

name: Fashionable Mudcrab Inkwell
description: A hollow, blown-glass inkwell, shaped like a mudcrab. A blown-glass Colovian fur helm screws into the top to preserve the ink.

name: Imperial Prefect's Seal
description: An official seal of Anvil's former Imperial Prefect. Once unique, many copies have appeared since the Pirate Queen's arrival.

name: Varen's Versatile Pail
description: A once-ubiquitous iron pail used in the construction of Varen's Wall. The few that weren't melted down are collector's items.

name: Miniature Stained Glass Parasol
description: A miniature parasol made of gold and stained glass. An ingenious mechanism allows the glass leaves to unfold.

name: Anvil Lighthouse Sundial
description: A telescoping portable sundial that extends into a replica of the Anvil lighthouse. A small ruby within serves as the flame.

name: Dibella's Night Lantern
description: A handheld bullseye lantern with a single pane of red stained glass. Primarily used in brothels, they are also of use to spies.

name: Intricate Whittled Kvatch Cathedral
description: An accurate wooden replica of Kvatch's cathedral. Mendicants of Akatosh carve these while reflecting on the concept of patience.

name: Colovian Personal War Tent
description: A large rectangle of canvas, stakes, and rope. Now rare, these portable lean-tos were distributed to workers at Varen's Wall.

name: Order of the Hour Candlestick
description: An elaborate silver candlestick with a depiction of Akatosh coiled up from the base. A candle is placed amidst the coils.

name: Letter of Fiscal Absolution
description: A letter from Anvil's former Imperial Prefect, absolving the bearer of taxation for a single year.

name: County Kvatch Map Tapestry
description: A slightly faded tapestry map of County Kvatch, created before the time of Varen's Rebellion.

name: Commemorative Varen Aquilarios Mortar and Pestle
description: A mortar bearing images of the Longhouse Emperors fleeing in fear. The pestle has a sternly carved Varen Aquilarios on the end.

name: Dibellan Censer
description: A silver censer molded in the shape of Dibella. The incense flows from tiny holes in her flowing hair.

name: Colovian Burred Elm Fur Helm Stand
description: A marble-based elm stand with multiple arms pointing upward. Can hold eight Colovian fur helms at once.

name: Colovian Washing Bowl
description: A fine silver bowl with etched imagery of past Colovian successes.

name: Kvatch Dressing Mirror
description: A highly polished metal mirror. Standing where the etched eyes and mouth overlap your own shows the optimum viewing distance.

name: Dibellan Worry Idol
description: A soapstone idol carved to look like Dibella. Said to increase the holder's romantic appeal if regularly burnished.

name: Anvil Lighthouse Centerpiece
description: An elaborate centerpiece with five detachable serving dishes. Removing the lighthouse top provides room for a sixth.

name: Gold Coast Trading Company Decanter
description: A brass decanter popular on ocean-going vessels. An ingenious stopper seals if the decanter tips rapidly.

name: Pirate Queen Portrait
description: A portrait of Anvil's Pirate Queen. The artist perfectly captured her sneer of disdain.

name: Minotaur Horn Warhorn
description: A warhorn fashioned from a particularly large minotaur's horn. Contrary to rumor, it doesn't produce a braying sound when blown.

name: Longhouse Legion Banner Fragment
description: A section of banner from one of the 'Longhouse Legions' who opposed Varen's Rebellion, recovered by the victors.

name: Dead Man's Astrolabe
description: A trick astrolabe enchanted to subtly alter its readings. Sought after by unscrupulous sailors who wish to strand their rivals.

name: Gold Coast Trading Company Sextant
description: An authentic silver sextant from the Gold Coast Trading Company, provided for ten years of faithful service.

name: Silver Scull
description: A silver-chased short oar said to produce less noise in water. Those who aren't gullible would buy it for its decorative traits.

name: Bronzed Pirate Head
description: A decapitated head encased in bronze. Purportedly of someone who displeased the Pirate Queen.

name: Prefect's Resignation Replica Collar
description: A bejeweled silver replica of the slave collar worn by Anvil's Imperial Prefect while being paraded through its streets.

name: Order of the Hour Lapel Pin
description: An exquisite golden lapel pin fashioned in the shape of an hourglass.

name: Kvatch Pocket Mannequin
description: A portable wooden mannequin intended for clothiers to create their fashions in miniature. Popularized in Kvatch, before the war.

name: Bronzed Daedroth Teeth Hairpins
description: A set of three bronzed daedroth teeth. Ideal for keeping unruly hair in place and less fashionable rivals in their place.

name: Silken Prayer Shawl of Akatosh
description: A silken prayer shawl covered in tasteful symbols of Akatosh.

name: Monogrammed Colovian Fur Stockings
description: A pair of Colovian fur stockings, prized for their watertight nature. This pair is monogrammed with cloth of gold.

name: Outlawed Cameo of Count Ephrem Benirus
description: A once-common ivory cameo of Anvil's former count. Though the Pirate Queen ordered their destruction, a few of them remain.

name: Perfidious Accusation Sleeping Mask
description: A painted mask fashioned to look like an individual's face, with open, staring eyes. Worn at night to discourage sneak-thieves.

name: Longhouse Betrayers' Chamberpot
description: A silver chamberpot. Etchings of the Longhouse Emperors recoiling in fear adorn the sides.

name: "Any Port in A Storm" Boudoir Game
description: Six sets of eyeless leather hoods, fur-lined restraints, and earplugs for Dibellan adherents to worship somewhat anonymously.

name: Bejeweled Finger Cymbals
description: A set of bejeweled finger cymbals, fashioned in the Taneth style.

name: Maormer Bone Jaw Harp
description: A jaw harp supposedly made from Maormer bone, which is said to be naturally springy. Highly sought after by unscrupulous bards.

name: Fighters Guild Bounty Box
description: This large box contains an Ornate Item, and a Set item.

name: Novice Assassin's Kit
description: This small box contains a few items that a novice assassin might find useful.

name: Filthy Shroud
description: Ten of these items can be refined into a Pristine Shroud, which is used to make Draugr equipment.

name: Bent Whiskers
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Defiled Whiskers, which is used to make Dro-m'Athra equipment.

name: Dark Brotherhood Reward Satchel
description: This small satchel contains items that an assassin might find useful.

name: Toxin Satchel
description: This oilskin satchel, latched and sealed with wax, contains a gift from your supplier.

name: Unidentified Sithis's Touch Item
description: This large box contains an item from the Sithis's Touch item set.

name: Assassin's Potion Kit
description: This small box contains a few potions that an assassin might find useful.

name: Palatine Sabertooth
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Hammer Bombil
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Spotted Bass
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Sleeper Shark
description: A rare shark found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Scorpionfish
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Rattail
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Bullface Wingfin
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Longmouth Pike
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Gold Coast Crayfish
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Ghastly Batfish
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Spiny Frogfish
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Black Anvil Loach
description: A rare fish found only in the sunny waters of the Gold Coast.

name: Stone of Instant Experience
description: Meant solely for testing.

name: Battle Axe of the Eternal Yokeda
Inferno Staff of the Eternal Yokeda
Ice Staff of the Eternal Yokeda
Lightning Staff of the Eternal Yokeda
Restoration Staff of the Eternal Yokeda
Battle Axe of the Vicious Ophidian

The Serpent's Egg-Tooth
description: On every New Life the Serpent breaks out of its Celestial Ovum to writhe across the heavens for another year, dropping its fang of ophidian ivory to Tamriel below.

name: The Costumer's Wardrobe
description: This box jostles with many Costumes, Hats, Polymorphs, and Skins.

name: The Alchemist's Crate
description: This box jangles with multitudinous vials of Water, Oil, and preserved Reagents.

name: Crafter's Limitless Library
description: Within this single book is the knowledge of all the crafting styles you do not yet know - but none that you already do. If you know all available crafting styles already, this book does nothing.

name: The Traveled Crafter's Crate
description: This crate is laden with the materials to make equipment in every style and trait yet known.

name: The Crafter's Materials Crate
description: This crate is heavy with refined materials.

name: The Ultimate Crafting Crate
description: This crate is bulging with other boxes, each full of things any crafter could want or need. If you simply can't carry everything, be sure to purchase more Inventory or Bank Space!

name: Serpent's Languid Coffer
description: This weekly reward was given to you by the Undaunted for performing daring feats in the Trials of Craglorn. The items inside scale to your level at the moment you open the box.

name: Serpent's Coiled Coffer
description: This weekly reward was given to you by the Undaunted for performing daring feats in the Trials of Craglorn. The items inside scale to your level at the moment you open the box.

name: Crow Caller
description: The rarest crow callers have been known to summon more than just birds during the Witches Festival. See what strange and sinister secrets await you!

name: Celestial Serpent's Mundane Trophy
description: A piece of the Serpent's Stone.

name: Cloudy Gradual Ravage Health Poison I
TEL VAR: Thews of the Harbinger

description: A great, oval scarlet gemstone in an ancient setting of wrought silver.

name: The Forgemaster's Medallion
description: A Daedric talisman said to be associated with Mehrunes Dagon.

name: Medallion of Bats
description: A bat skull with red gem eyes, said to be the symbol of a Vampire Lord.

name: Gilded Skull of An Ancient Empress
description: Said to be the cranium of a great First Era empress, embellished with gold foil.

name: Donolon's Portable Pantry
description: This portable pantry contains a vast array of ingredients for Provisioning.

name: Recipe: Donolon's Infinite Book
description: This well-worn book is beset with flour. No matter how many pages you turn, you never seem to get to the end.

description: This trunk feels portentously heavy with stone chunks.

name: Oxblood Fungus Spore
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Oxblood Fungus, which is used to make Minotaur equipment.

description: Ten of these items can be refined into Pearl Sand, which is used to make Order of the Hour equipment.

name: Sapphire Stardust

name: Amber Bead
description: Ten of these items can be refined into an Amber Marble, which is used to make Hollowjack equipment.

name: Grinstones
description: This item can only be found by deconstructing Grim Harlequin-style equipment.

name: Grintooth
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Grinstones, which is used to make Grim Harlequin equipment.

name: Night Pumice Pebble
description: Ten of these items can be refined into Night Pumice, which is used to make Ebony equipment.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 46: Frostcaster Style
description: Use to learn the Stalhrim Frostcaster crafting style.

name: Disposable Swallower's Sword
description: This false sword is made from spun sugar. It rapidly dissolves after a single use. Though intended for beginner sword-swallowers, no particular skill is needed beyond the ability to open one's mouth.

name: Disposable Juggling Knives
description: These false knives appear authentic, but are actually made from kwama cuttle that softens quickly when handled. Preferred by stage performers to delight and amaze with seemingly "perilous" knife tricks.

name: Swamp Gas Acorn Pill
description: This foul-smelling acorn shell is slathered in grease for easy swallowing. After dissolving in one's stomach, the acorn's contents react quickly and explosively.

name: Fire-Breather's Oil Bun
description: This small wad of steamed dough can be tucked between tooth and cheek. Performers bite down to release the reservoir of oil within, then spray it across a lit torch to spectacular effect.

name: Mud Ball
description: A single gooey mud ball, ready for tossing at an unsuspecting target.

name: Unidentified Enchantment
description: This small box has a powerful enchantment inside.

Lava Foot Soup-And-Saltrice
description: A seasonal meal enjoyed during the New Life Festival. A good serving of this Dark Elf meal keeps the scrib on the surface of the broth.

name: Bergama Warning Fire
description: A seasonal drink enjoyed during the New Life Festival. This Redguard drink is served piping hot, and sharpens the imbiber's wits rather than dulls them.

name: Incomprehensible Artifact
description: This tangle of cogs, springs, and wire was clearly made with some purpose in mind. Whatever that purpose could be, is anyone's guess.

name: Betnikh Twice-Spiked Ale
description: A seasonal drink enjoyed during the New Life Festival. This Orc ale is exceptionally foamy, which helps create "gastric affirmation."

name: Jagga-Drenched "Mud Ball"
description: A seasonal dessert enjoyed during the New Life Festival. This Wood Elf treat is made with bone flour and senche-passed coffee beans. It is quite sticky.

name: Old Aldmeri Orphan Gruel
description: A porridge traditionally served during the New Life Festival. As porridge goes, this High Elf meal is surprisingly tasty.

name: Rajhin's Sugar Claws
description: A mischievous dessert enjoyed during the New Life Festival. This Khajiit treat is more moon-sugar than pastry.

name: Alcaire Festival Sword-Pie
description: A hearty meat pie enjoyed during the New Life Festival. This Breton meal is served with a miniature bone sword cooked inside. Recovering the sword is said to grant the luck of Magnus—and an occasional cracked tooth.

name: Snow Bear Glow-Wine
description: A hearty mulled wine enjoyed during the New Life Festival. This Nord drink is always served piping hot.

name: Sailor's Warning Festival Grog
description: This potent drink is one of the few banned by all fleets in Tamriel. Though a spilled mug doesn't actually strip tar from a ship's deck, it is absolutely capable of removing rational thought from those who imbibe it.

name: High Hrothgar Festival Mints
description: These breath mints are supposedly concocted at a remote mountain peak. Chewing a handful produces a glacial sensation and an exceptionally frosty breath.

name: Undaunted Plunder
description: These assorted valuables were gained by defeating some of the most dangerous foes the Undaunted have ever faced. To cash them in, sell them to any merchant.

name: Dark Moonstone
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Ruby Nirncrystal
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Daedric Amber
description: Sell to a merchant for gold.

name: Regulus
description: Used in crafting metal furniture.

name: Bast
description: Used in crafting cloth furniture.

description: Used in crafting leather furniture.

name: Mundane Rune
description: Used in crafting stone furniture.

name: Alchemical Resin
description: Used in crafting alchemically treated furniture.

name: Decorative Wax
description: Used in crafting decorative food or finishing touches.

name: Heartwood
description: Used in crafting wooden furniture.

name: A Sealed Letter
description: This letter has no sender listed, but is addressed to you directly.

name: Cherry Blossom Twig
description: A consumable enchanted twig that showers another person with vibrant cherry blossoms.

name: Sparkwreath Dazzler
description: This unstable alchemical concoction creates a whirling wreath of sparks in front of you when used.

name: Plume Dazzler
description: This unstable alchemical concoction creates two small plumes of sparks in front of you when used.

name: Spiral Dazzler
description: This unstable alchemical concoction creates a spiral of sparks around you when used.

name: Jester's Festival Box
description: This box contains odds and sundries intended to delight Jester's Festival celebrants.

name: Tanzelwil Culanda Stone
description: The bright golden light of this crystal has illuminated the honored tombs at Tanzelwil for generations.

name: Veiled Crystal
description: Though the sealing magic this crystal once held is broken, it still emits a soft light.

name: Mehrunes Dagon Brazier
description: This brazier once held a Sigil Stone capable of maintaining a gate to the Deadlands.

name: High Elf Throne
description: Queen Ayrenn favors a simple, elegant throne of marble and gold, a style that has become popular among her supporters.

name: Ancient High Elf Statue
description: The High Elves maintain these statues represent their honored ancestors, though some scholars insist they're of Ayleid design.

name: Ayleid Throne
description: Based on a design favored by Laloriaran Dynar, last king of the Ayleids.

name: Shackle Control Stone
description: Crafted from ebony-alloy cold-iron in Coldharbour's Black Forge.

name: Coldharbour Chandelier
description: The cold blue light from this pillar of crystal has illuminated cruelties beyond measure.

name: Cowering Statue
description: An effigy representing all those who recoil in fear before the cruel domination of Molag Bal.

name: Light of Meridia
description: A shining remembrance of the broad spectrum of heroes who fight for Meridia.

name: Molag Bal Banner
description: A banner brought back in triumph from the heroic challenges of Coldharbour.

name: Aulus's Captive Audience
description: It's comforting to know that at least one person will stick around until the end of your speech.

name: Ukaezai's Ward
description: With any luck, this petrified Ayleid never even felt the loss of his arm.  Or his head.

name: Guardian Mane
description: Normally found protecting holy sites of the Khajiit, this guardian statue was excavated from the Falinesti Winter Site—lending new credence to the legends of Rahjin's activity in the area.

name: Orrery Control Pillar Replica
description: Daraneth crafted several such replicas as part of her studies on the Osseous Orrery.

name: Valenwood Brazier
description: An eternal fire commemorating heroic achievements on the behalf of the citizens of Grahtwood.

name: Fires of the Wilderking
description: The ancient legend of the Wilderking turned out to be the living truth of modern Greenshade.

name: Sea Elf Banner
description: A banner originally taken as a trophy, following the defeat of the invading Maormer at Seaside Sanctuary.

name: Hectahame Arboretum Relic
description: This human skull emits a peculiar light, reminiscent of the night sky.

name: Wood Elf Path Marker
description: The Wood Elves could find their way through Valenwood blindfolded—these markers are instead for their guests, who may not find the forests so welcoming.

name: Wood Orc Dream Catcher
description: It's well documented that Wood Orc shamans collect dreams, but what they do with them is a closely guarded secret.

name: Wood Orc Malacath Banner
description: Like their cousins in northern Tamriel, most Wood Orcs honor Malacath.

name: Wood Elf Union Trellis
description: One tree may bend or break in the storm, but two together can support each other through any weather.

name: Handfast Pedestal
description: An altar for solemnizing the sacred marriage vows of the Wood Elves.

name: Handfast
description: A memorial for the heroic resolution of the Bosmeri existential crisis in Malabal Tor.

name: Colovian Projection Crystal
description: This crystal emits a gentle violet glow, even while separated from the rest of the projection apparatus.

name: Moonmont Lunar Altar
description: Attuned to the the light of the two moons, this shrine can be refocused to several different lunar phases.

name: Khajiiti Shrine Guardian Statue
description: These stylized senche-cats can be found watching over shrines throughout Reaper's March.

name: Waxing Moons Wall Tile
description: Depicts Jone and Jode, both in the waxing phase.

name: Waning Moons Tile
description: Depicts Jone and Jode, both in the waning phase.

name: Full Moons Tile
description: Depicts Jone and Jode, both full and bright.

name: New Moons Tile
description: Depicts Jone and Jode, both new and dark.

name: Wyrdstone
description: Marks an area that is under the protection of the Beldama Wyrd.

name: Torn Lion Guard Banner
description: The Lion Guard are at their strongest with their backs against a wall.

name: Breton Gravewatcher Statue
description: These enormous statues were originally commisioned to watch over the dead in Cath Bedraud.

name: Bloodthorn Vines, Small
description: These vines show no sign of further growth, but their gentle movement still disquiets.

name: Hagraven Totem
description: Folk legends claim that if you camp in the Hag Fens, you will awaken to find yourself rooted in place, your body slowly twisting into the form of a withered tree.

name: Knights of the Flame Banner
description: A banner representing the noble knightly order of Alcaire in High Rock.

name: Spirit Warden Azura Statue
description: A replica of the celebrated statue of Azura in Pariah Abbey.

name: Wayrest Guillotine
description: Nightmares about guillotines are remarkably common in Wayrest.

name: Replica Dreamshard
description: Witnesses confirm that this replica is faithful to the original appearance of the mystical object.

name: Vaermina Statue
description: Originally commisioned by a noble to give a face to the nightmares that plagued him night after a night. It didn't help.

name: Constellation Tile: the Ritual
description: Recovered from ruins in the Doomcrag, this tile depicts the constellation of The Ritual.

name: Constellation Tile: the Shadow
description: Recovered from ruins in the Doomcrag, this tile depicts the constellation of The Shadow.

name: Constellation Tile: the Tower
description: Recovered from ruins in the Doomcrag, this tile depicts the constellation of The Tower.

name: Wagon of Death
description: You're going to give these people an honest burial, right?

name: Tamrith Coffin Lid
description: It's said that the dead rise so often in Rivenspire that they put the handles on the insides of the coffin lids.

name: Tamrith Coffin
description: Make your bedroom a dead-room with a coffin from haunted Rivenspire.

name: Gargoyle Statue
description: Originally found in the vampire-infested ruins of Shadowfate Cavern, it has shown no sign of animating. Yet.

name: Tu'whacca's Brazier
description: Used in the worship of Tu'whacca, who guides the fallen to the Far Shores.

name: Reconstructed Necromantic Focus
description: This has an unsettling habit of spontaneously reconstructing itself when destroyed.

name: Standing Ansei Statue
description: The triumph of the Ansei will never be forgotten.

name: Kneeling Ansei Statue
description: The sacrifice of the Ansei will never be forgotten.

name: Replica of Shattered Ansei Sword
description: The remains of one of several decoys commisioned by King Fahara'jad.

name: Glenmoril Wyrd Stone
description: The prevailing theory is that the red pigment on these stones is derived from a rare crimson flower, and is not the "blood of trespassing children," as claimed by some in Evermore.

name: Damaged Knight of St. Pelin Statue
description: Damaged in Septima Tharn's assault on Bangkorai Garrison.

name: Evermore Mourning Banner
description: In Evermore, those who have lost a loved one display their mourning banner on a spear, to represent the wound in their heart.

name: Ragged Imperial Banner
description: One of the few relatively intact banners recovered following the Imperial occupation of Southern Bangkorai.

name: Ceremonial Redguard Vessel
description: This massive bowl is traditionally used as a brazier for rites honoring the fallen.

name: Serien's Stand
description: A remembrance of the last stand of the obstreperous General Serien.

name: Lacquered Kwama Egg
description: An exquisite painted trophy memorializing heroic triumphs in Stonefalls.

name: Daedric Sconce
description: An ominous light source pillaged from Oblivion.

name: Blood Fountain
description: A grim reminder that the victories in Stonefalls were not without a price.

name: Remnant of Balreth
description: A hunk of bone and char, left over from the defeat of Balreth.

name: Mimic Hist Tree
description: A convincing replica of one of the mystically-sentient trees revered by the Argonians.

name: Argonian Egg
description: A replica of an egg of the reptilian Argonians of Shadowfen.

name: Replica Mnemic Egg
description: Following attempts by the Aldmeri Dominion to capture the Mnemic Egg, several replicas were created to foil future attempts.

name: Replica Stone Nest
description: Traditionally, the dais that holds Mnemic Egg is referred to as its nest.

name: Oblivion Stone
description: A dark chunk of raw stone, branded with the Daedric sigil Khot.

name: Lob's Challenge Horn
description: Winding this horn in Giant country could have hazardous results.

name: Standing Slab
description: This menhir of the ancient Nords stands in solemn tribute to the hero of Eastmarch.

name: Dragon Shrine Altar
description: Long ago the ancient Nords worshiped living Dragons at altars like this one.

name: Throne of the Skald-King
description: A replica of the throne of High King Jorunn granted in gratitude for services to Eastmarch.

name: Visage of the Skald
description: A traditional trophy of high-ranking bards of Skyrim.

name: Swamp Anemone
description: A living trophy and constant reminder of the lush fungal foliage of Deshaan.

name: Veloth's Reliquary
description: Relish this replica reliquary for retaining relics of the revered Veloth.

name: Tribunal Rug
description: A circular rug, emblazoned with the bronze symbol of the Tribunal.

name: Tribunal Altar
description: Each side of this pillar represents one of the three members of the Tribunal: Almalexia, Sotha Sil, and Vivec.

name: Touch of Plague
description: A sealed container, believed to hold a sample of the Llodos plague.

name: Ancient Cultist Totem
description: Legend claims that the skulls beneath Fallowstone Vault hark back to the age of the Dragon Cult.

name: Ysgramor Statue
description: A statue honoring the Nord culture hero Ysgramor, "The Harbinger of us all."

name: Statue of the Wolf
description: A recreation of the statue that has sat outside Fallowstone Hall for longer than anyone can remember.

name: Totem of the Reach
description: This totem doesn't seem to carry the usual death curse. No one's died yet, at least.

name: Torn Worm Cult Banner
description: One of many trophies taken following the defeat of the Worm Cult in The Rift.

name: Serpent Stone
description: A Craglorn-style trophy awarded to commemorate victory in the Dragonstar Arena.

name: Nirncrux Bowl
description: The rare material Nirncrux is so prized by the miners of Craglorn that it is conveyed in special bowls.

name: Snake Prayer Tile
description: A holy symbol of the ancient Nedes denoting a location of worship.

name: Totem of the Serpent
description: A memorial commemorating the defeat of the Serpent Constellation's machinations in Craglorn.

name: Craglorn Tapestry
description: A reconstruction of the famous tapestry depicting the conflict of the Constellations.

name: Craglorn Brazier
description: A brazier originally used by one of the ancient and nigh-forgotten cultures of Craglorn.

name: Craglorn Sconce
description: A light source crafted in the style of the ancient Ra Gada conquerors of Craglorn.

name: Observatory Banner
description: This long banner depicts a stylized and ordered version of the sky, as observed by the Stargazers of Craglorn.

name: Poisoned Blood
description: This is a small house item.

name: Gold Coast Estate Keg
description: A keg of Anvil malmsey to mark the expert infiltration skills of a Dark Brotherhood initiate.

name: Light and Shadow
description: This is a small house item.

name: Hourglass Rug
description: A rug stolen from those officious knights of the Order of the Hour.

name: Sanctuary Sconce
description: This light source is a reminder of the tasteful and restrained décor of the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary.

name: Brotherhood Poison Vial
description: An ornamental copy of one of the Dark Brotherhood's bottled toxins.

name: Order of the Hour Banner
description: A banner "borrowed" from the Akatosh-worshiping knights of the Order of the Hour.

name: Dark Brotherhood Banner
description: This hanging banner announces one's membership in the Dark Brotherhood. Display it with caution.

name: Banner of the Kvatch Guard
description: The noble wolf's-head banner of the respected Kvatch Guard.

name: Statue of the Mother
description: No one would be so bold as to assert without contradiction that this is a statue representing the Night Mother.

name: Preserved Sweetrolls
description: A cluster of sweetrolls—a delicious trophy that commemorates thwarting the Sweetroll Killer of the Gold Coast.

name: Sacrificial Heart
description: This is a small house item.

name: Dark Ledger
description: Every Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary has a book that balances the costs of living against the wages of death.

name: Reliquary Skull
description: A replica of the Giovessen Skull, a relic whose history extends back nearly 600 years.

name: Pale Garden Flowers
description: These flowers are a reminder of how short and ephemeral a thief's life can be.

name: Jar of Green Dye
description: Enough concentrated green dye to make Hammerfell look like Valenwood.

name: An Adoring Fan
description: A souvenir of your visit to an exclusive Hew's Bane soiree.

name: Yokudan Puzzle Column
description: Puzzle locks based on rotating stone pillars have been used in vaults and labyrinths since time immemorial. This version hails from ancient Yokuda.

name: Abah's Landing Banner
description: The flag of the Free and Open Trading Port of Abah's Landing.

name: Iron Wheel Banner
description: The banner of those over-achieving law enforcers known as the Iron Wheel.

name: Vibrant Garden Flowers
description: The life of a desert flower is brief but bright, so the Redguards treasure them for their gardens.

name: Distracting Harpy Egg
description: "The hideous harpy, half-avian abomination, is shunned by all the faithful of Tava." —The Revered Mubdaraz

name: Banner of Taneth
description: The esteemed banner of the Kingdom of Taneth in Hammerfell.

name: Redguard Round Table
description: This is a standard house item.

name: Statue of Shadows
description: Though all are impressed by the grave solemnity of this statue, none can agree on whom it represents.

name: Hiding Place
description: A typical nondescript Abah's Landing basket. No one would ever think of looking in there!

name: Orsinium Cart
description: An Orcish wheeled cart: they build 'em sturdy in Wrothgar.

name: Orc Adventuring Backpack
description: This rugged and capacious backpack is a reminder not to venture unequipped into the wilds of Wrothgar.

name: Orcish War Totem
description: Orcs like to announce great events by erecting symbolic totems: this one heralds war.

name: Orcish Battle Totem
description: Orcs like to announce great events by erecting symbolic totems: this one foretells battle.

name: Fur Throne
description: If you were an Orc chieftain in frozen Wrothgar, you'd want furs on your throne, too.

name: Orcish Totem
description: Orcs like to announce events by erecting symbolic totems: this one marks territory.

name: Throne of the Orc King
description: A replica of the throne entitled by tradition to the Orc chief who unites the clans into a kingdom.

name: Molag Bal Brazier
description: This Coldharbour brazier commemorates the thwarting of Molag Bal's last-ditch attack on Nirn.

name: Imperial Banner
description: A banner earned for plumbing the labyrinth of sewers beneath the Imperical City.

name: Pirate Banner
description: Proudly fly the flag of Abecean piracy after recruiting freebooters for a daring venture.

name: Maormer Totem
description: A symbol of the perfidious Sea Elves of Pyandonea.

name: Coldharbour Urn
description: Replica of an urn as found in the Wailing Prison in Coldharbour. Because you always remember your first iron dagger.

name: Replica Soul Gem
description: A copy of one of the mysterious and mystical crystals used to capture the souls of dying entities.

name: Replica Black Soul Gem
description: An imitation of one of those sinister crystals used to entrap the souls of dying sentient beings.

name: Soul Gem Case
description: The sort of case sorcerers and necromancers use to keep their soul gems safe, clean, and shiny.

name: Spare Flesh Atronach Parts
description: Unlike most summoned Daedra, the Flesh Atronach requires some pre-assembly.

name: Soul Gem Crate
description: The sort of crate sorcerers and necromancers use to keep their soul gems safe, clean, and shiny.

name: Lantern of Anguish
description: The crimson light from this lantern complements either torture or seduction equally well.

name: Depleted Sigil Stone
description: A mystic runestone, now drained, once used to hold open an Oblivion gate.

name: Silent Sentinel
description: A solemn reminder of the heroic effort to challenge the schemes of Molag Bal.

name: Soul Gem Stand
description: Just the thing for displaying your cruel magical implement used to enslave creatures' souls.

name: The Final Threat
description: Molag Bal has had countless such statues erected in his name, and woe unto he who mocks their craftsmanship or artistry.

name: Daedric Chest
description: The heroism of dauntless slayers of Daedra is marked by presentation of a chest stolen from Oblivion.

name: Broken Chain
description: Links from the fallen chain of a shattered Dark Anchor.

name: Decorative Treasure Chest
description: Someone so relentlessly dedicated to the pursuit of treasure deserves such an ornamental coffer.

name: Dueling Banner
description: A banner representing a challenge to the death. Only a supremely confident duelist would decorate their home with such a thing.

name: Cheese Cutter
description: When the Mages Guild won away Eveyea from Sheogorath, the Madgod presented them with a supply of cheese cutters to award as guild prizes.

name: Common Soul Gem, Empty
description: This is a small house item.

name: Lesser Soul Gem, Empty
description: This is a small house item.

name: Mages Guild Banner
description: A banner presented to one who has more than earned the right to display Mages Guild affiliation.

name: Fighters Guild Banner
description: A banner presented to one who has more than earned the right to display Fighters Guild affiliation.

name: Outlaw Banner
description: A banner proudly displaying the covert three-bladed symbol of Tamriel's outlaws. (Wait, that's supposed to be secret!)

name: Pile of Coins
description: This replica treasure looks just like a real pile of coins, doesn't it?

name: Mountain of Loot
description: Never lack for a packed stack of black market fake drakes.

name: Mass Tombstone
description: A grim memorial to the staggering number of creatures you've massacred in cold blood.

name: Death Marker
description: Yeah, well, they probably had it coming.

name: Noble Pocket Lint
description: You've picked so many pockets, the ends of your fingers are chapped.

name: Pocket Change
description: So now you're a creeping, furtive sneak thief. Wouldn't your parents be so proud?

name: Replica Key Blank
description: Copy of an item perfect for creating illicit copies of a "borrowed" key, or for fashioning into a bump key.

name: Decorative Thieves Trove
description: Every time you looted one of these, you thought, "I wish I had one." And now you do.

name: Decorative Safebox
description: In the vicinity of such a master cracksman, it's possible that "safebox" is a bit of a misnomer.

name: Undaunted Mug
description: A ceremonial mug presented in the name of true Undaunted camaraderie!

name: Undaunted Chest
description: An handsome chest for all the loot collected on missions performed for the Undaunted.

name: Undaunted Banner
description: A banner presented to one who has more than earned the right to display affiliation with the Undaunted.

name: Decorative Skyshard
description: This mystic crystal commemorates the colossal achievement of finding skyshards all across Tamriel.

name: Throne of Cyrodiil
description: Even in the tumult of the Three Banners War, sitting atop the Ruby Throne is a rare and coveted privilege.

name: Primal Altar To Hircine
description: Display your feral devotion to the Father of Manbeasts with this rustic altar.

name: Crimson-Stained Bowl
description: Baron Montclair preferred to drink from a shallow bowl, claiming that it enhanced bouquet, while allowing just enough coagulation to give a pleasing texture on the tongue.

name: Fishing Vessel
description: Though a master fisher needs only bait and line, most own a small and steady sailboat for lazy Sundas excursions.

name: Alchemist's Sign
description: A sign with the symbol used by all those who can tell an alembic from a calcinator.

name: Poison Satchel
description: Poison-making is a skill abhorrent to most citizens of Tamriel, so keep this distinctive satchel a secret.

name: Blacksmith's Sign
description: A sign earned by one who's become a master of the forge and hammer.

name: Clothier's Sign
description: A sign earned by one who's become a master of the needle and scissors.

name: Enchanter's Sign
description: A sign earned by one who's become a master of Aspect, Essence, and Potency.

name: Enchanting Gem
description: A handsome gem awarded to all those who become Potentates of Potency!

name: Provisioner's Sign
description: A sign earned by one who's become a master of the cooking fire and spoons.

name: Chef's Cleaver
description: This is bound to be a useful utensil to one who knows such a quantity of recipes.

name: Woodworker's Sign
description: A sign earned by one who's become a master of the chisel and saw.

name: Hanging Map of Tamriel
description: A well-worn map, clearly used on many a Tamrielic journey.

name: Harvester's Woodpile
description: A symbolic pile of precious woods awarded to a master harvester of timber.

name: Harvester's Herbs
description: A symbolic bunch of precious plants awarded to a master harvester of herbs.

name: Harvester's Ore
description: A symbolic outcropping of precious raw metal awarded to a master harvester of ore.

name: Harvester's Critter Trap
description: A symbolic critter trap awarded to a master harvester of lesser creatures.

name: Harvester's Garden Shrub
description: A symbolic flowering shrub awarded to a master harvester of floral materials.

name: Smith's Bellows
description: A smith who's forged as much as you could probably work a smith's hammer with closed eyes. (But don't try it.)

name: Dominion Hero Shield
description: This crest is awarded only to the greatest heroes of the Aldmeri Dominion.

name: Covenant Hero Shield
description: This crest is awarded only to the greatest heroes of the Daggerfall Covenant.

name: Pact Hero Shield
description: This crest is awarded only to the greatest heroes of the Ebonheart Pact.

name: Display Craft Bag
description: Unlike a real Craft Bag, this display version can't hold impossible amounts of crafting materials.

name: Decoy Elder Scroll
description: At exceptional cost, a small number of decoy Elder Scroll cases were commisioned early in the Three Banners War. The enchantments can be adjusted to mimic either an offensive or defensive scroll.

name: Diminished Aetherial Dust
description: -	Though Aetherial Dust can be used to open a person's eyes to untold experiences, its powers weaken over time. However, this Diminished Aetherial Dust still can be employed to craft standard Aetherial Ambrosia.

name: Disconnected Transitus Shrine
description: Though no longer connected to the Transitus Shrine Network, this shrine still emanates power.

name: Sealed Letter
description: This letter was sealed by magical means, but the ward vanished at my touch. It must be intended for my eyes only.

name: Fabricant's Burnished Coffer
description: This weekly reward was given to you by the Undaunted for performing daring feats in the Halls of Fabrication. The items inside scale to your level at the moment you open the box.

name: Fabricant's Shining Coffer
description: This weekly reward was given to you by the Undaunted for performing daring feats in the Halls of Fabrication. The items inside scale to your level at the moment you open the box.

name: Resplendent Sweetroll
description: This is a small house item. This item can be converted to a large number of Crown Gems.

name: Dwarven Pipeline, Column
description: This is a large house item.

name: Dwarven Lamppost, Powered
description: This is a standard house item.

name: Dwarven Sconce, Powered
description: This is a small house item.
