name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 1
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Name."

name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 2
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Coming."

name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 3
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Enemy."

name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 4
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Deeds."

name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 5
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Love of Morihaus."

name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 6
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Madness."

name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 7
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Battle with Umaril and His Dismemberment."

name: The Song of Pelinal, Volume 8
description: Reprint, Second Edition: "On His Revelation at the Death of the Al-Esh."

name: Segment of Dumac Royal Tapestry
description: One of ten thousand pieces of the cloth mosaic that adorned the halls of the Dwemer king. Supposedly awe inspiring when whole.

name: Kwama Chitin Carved Nude
description: An opalescent statue of a Dunmer at rest. It glistens in the light, giving it a slightly sweaty appearance.

name: Miniature Ordinator Mask
description: A recreation of an Ordinator's face mask in brass. The patina of tarnish and corrosion adds a splash of whimsy to the piece.

name: Cast Ebony Statue
description: A small mantel adornment from a run of works dubbed 'Anticipation' by an artist later executed for blasphemy by the Ordinators.

name: Embossed Leather Picturebook
description: The Conquests of Vivec' depicted on supple leather pages inviting to the touch, the proportions appear highly exaggerated.

name: Dreugh Shell Idol
description: This brownish-red likeness of Vivec has been shaped entirely out of dreugh carapace. It has a faint fishy scent.

name: Ancestor Ash
description: This scrib husk's carapace has been inscribed with markings signifying the identity and renown of the Dunmer interred within.

name: Morag Tong Oath
description: A chapbook of the ritual pledge aspirants make on acceptance into the guild. A disclaimer states it is not proof of affiliation.

name: Cliff Racer Fetish
description: An elaborate knot of cord and cliff racer plumes worn as a ward against the pests according to Ashlander superstition.

name: Desiccated Kogoruhn Beetle
description: Some believe the profane whispers of long dead heretics can be heard when these Ashland carrion bugs are tucked into one's ears.

name: Dunmeri Wraithshroud
description: This ectoplasmic shroud has retained the appearance of its original manifestation, a sign of favor according to the Ashlanders.

name: Silvered Crescent Mirror
description: This small thin sliver of silver has been polished to a mirror sheen. Daedra worshipers claim they speak to Azura through it.

name: Inflated Netch Bladder
description: Renowned for its rubbery properties. The bounciness of this preserved organ is a source of endless joy for people of all ages.

name: Greef Or Teef Scorecard
description: Used to tally the number of cheap shots the bearer has endured during a match of a popular tavern game pioneered by the Nords.

name: Three-Stab Crony
description: Condemned by the Tribunal Temple as heretical. This card game's rules and terminology paint the living gods as betrayers.

name: Kagouti Sled
description: This kagouti crest has been fixed with rope handles and padding to facilitate an exhilarating plummet down tall ash piles.

name: Pugilist Puppet
description: This taxidermized cliff racer is traditionally stuffed with scrib jelly and suspended from a rope for children to bludgeon.

name: Champion Battle-Crab
description: This weathered mudcrab is painted for war and bears notches in its shell for each of its victories in local crab dueling rings.

name: Crock of Packing Mud
description: Damp mineral rich clay sometimes used for skin care, but mostly employed in keeping mudcrabs fresh in transport.

name: Basalt Balm
description: This gritty mixture of pulverized volcanic rock and kwama ichor is believed to soothe burns and soften scars.

name: Strider Musk
description: Bottled juices from select Silt Strider glands worn for the purposes of seduction. Use in wilderness settings is not advised.

name: Hunger Tongue Comb
description: This spongy hunk of muscle affixed to a wooden handle is considered ideal for the even application of Dunmeri hair gelatins.

name: Bobbin Lace Hairnet
description: Bearing an elaborate pattern accented with beads, this netch lace has an elasticity prized among daring coiffure enthusiasts.

name: Chitinous Collapsible Razor
description: This small shalk mandible is fitted with a hinge, allowing it to be stored compactly. Good for shaving and as a shell cracker.

name: Morag Tong Contract Stamp
description: A red-stained seal stamp used on official contracts approved for execution. They are changed regularly to hamper forgery.

name: Racer Plume Quill
description: This sharp-nibbed feather is colorful and flexible, though prone to drawing blood. Much like the creatures they originate from.

name: Kagouti Paperweight
description: This polished skull of a kagouti hatchling has spines that align perfectly as a three-hole punch.

name: Telvanni Ebon Quill
description: This finely-pointed writing utensil can apply terminal punctuation to a sentence or a life with a flick of the wrist.

name: Spillproof Scroll Paper
description: Mildly enchanted with a ward against moisture that makes them incredibly impractical for most conventional forms of note taking.

name: Kwama Shears
description: Pearlescent mandibles perfect for trimming parchment or shredding unwanted manuscripts in only a few snips.

name: Kwama Egg Spoon
description: An odd spoon designed to neatly slice the top off an egg, scoop the contents out, and deliver it safely into the owner's mouth.

name: Ashwood Spice Grinder
description: This wooden container can be filled with an assortment of spices and twisted to shred the contents over a meal.

name: Wax Ladle
description: While utterly useless for most culinary applications, this dreugh wax ladle is one of the few things scrib jelly won't stick to.

name: Dreugh Corer
description: A horrific coil of barbed metal wire employed to fish out every last morsel from the narrow segments of a cooked dreugh.

name: Troubling Tines
description: A plane fork. Its twisted shape supposedly traps Daedric essence for consumption, but it looks like an Ogrim did the chewing.

name: Numbing Needles
description: These insect proboscis are commonly used to apply paralytic venom to overworked muscles or ease the pangs of Skooma withdrawal.

name: Shredded Finery
description: It's impossible to tell what kind of clothing this article once was, but the cloth may be salvaged into a fetching kerchief.

name: Prized Antlers
description: These horns look like they were torn off of the animal's skull, but are otherwise in excellent condition.

name: Loyal Hound's Charm
description: This carved bone fetish is invoked by werewolves after a fresh kill to offer the spoils of their hunt to Hircine.

name: Gnarled Paw
description: The paw of a wolf, mummified, and capped at the ankle with silver. Skaal believe it can ward away werewolves.

name: Bloodmoon Pendant
description: A necklace of rounded bone, pitted as if chewed, and stained deeply with blood. Carried by those hoping to join the Great Hunt.

name: Clockwork Dervish
description: A key-operated device featuring a tiny puppet Mer in flowing silks. The figure bobs and twirls along to a jingling tune.

name: Scrib-Powered Fan
description: A racer-wing spoked hub driven by a small wheel and axle. Propels a cooling breeze and the aroma of rancid meat.

name: Pedal Billows Mechanism
description: This pedal and jumble of gears are core components to a larger forge stoking system that operates like a textile spinning wheel.

name: Dwemeri Breathing Drill
description: An ancient, but functional miniature crank drill believed to be used to clear stuffy sinuses.

name: Spring-Loaded Scrib Trap
description: Much like a bear trap, but smaller and relying on narrow needle-like teeth to puncture a pesky scrib's shell.

name: Combination Sextant-Scope
description: Can be used to chart, scout, and magnify small details on a map. Mind what portions are intended to be put to the eye.

name: False Drum
description: This muted guar-skin drum contains a large hidden compartment useful for smuggling in bulk.

name: Camonna Tong Vice Chits
description: These wooden tokens are a form of currency issued by the syndicate to its most observant snitches. Valuable to the right people.

name: Gold Resin Scraper
description: This scoop-like implement can harvest residue from most skooma pipes without damaging the delicate surfaces.

name: Sugar Shaping Kit
description: An assortment of silver scoops, presses, and other tools for compressing ground moon-sugar into assorted shapes and volumes.

name: Silt Strider Marionette
description: This wood-carved Silt Strider dangles from a collection of silk strands. With a little practice it can be made to 'walk' around.

name: Kwama Hand Puppet
description: The hollowed-out head of a kwama worker drone, lined with canvas and stuffed for comfort. The mandibles are still quite sharp.

name: Sotha Sil Playset
description: This brass figurine of the living god tinkers with a squirming mechanical animal via simple hand-operated mechanisms.

name: Bonemold Training Sword
description: This blunt practice blade was formed as a single solid piece of bonemold. It's flexible, sturdy, and leaves a mean welt.

name: Articulated Ordinator Figurine
description: The joints on this dark hardwood statue may be posed in a number of dramatic positions for optimal condemnation of heretics.

name: Compressed Ash Plates
description: An unused stack of disposable dining ware made from pressed Ashland dust and kwama ichor. Perfect for casual entertaining.

name: Repurposed Dwarven Pan
description: The shiny concave vessel appears to have served some other function before being fitted with an iron handle to hold over a fire.

name: Bug Rendering Pot and Skimmer
description: This hefty pot is made to withstand the high temperatures required to separate liquefied kwama guts from the outer chitin.

name: Ornate Glassware
description: This gorgeous glass is nearly shatterproof and beautifully etched with patterns popular among House Hlaalu.

name: Hardened Fungus Decanter
description: A whimsical vessel for liquids made by hollowing out and hardening an oversized toadstool through an alchemical process.

name: Neen Clay Vase
description: Seyda Neen's marshes hold earthy clay that turns a rich ruddy red when fired. Limited supply has this pottery in high demand.

name: Shalk Manacles
description: The barbed mandibles of a giant beetle, shaped into a pair of painful bindings. Pulling free would leave deep wounds.

name: Ear Bridle
description: A curved iron rod pierced through a Mer's ears and screwed into place. Commonly lashed together to drive groups of prisoners.

name: Confiscated Sweetroll
description: This stale confection has a steel file baked inside. Its seizure must have been doubly disappointing to someone.

name: Excruciator
description: This small stone is enchanted to continually discharge weak Destruction spells when swallowed. Bears the seal of the Ordinators.

name: Brand of Excommunication
description: An iron brand bearing the mark seared into the flesh of Temple functionaries who have failed the Tribunal. Applied to the cheek.

name: Vigilance Snuff
description: A single ration of cheap alchemical powder to combat sleepiness. Bloodshot eyes are a common side effect in non-Dunmeri users.

name: Kwama Stick
description: This oddly-shaped shaft of wood is used by egg miners to herd kwama. There is residue coating the tip that smells sickly-sweet.

name: Vvardvark Tongue Laces
description: Long, stretchy strips of preserved tongue used for a variety of fastenings. Far more useful than leather, but less fashionable.

name: Deshedding Brush
description: A tangle of metal wires used to accelerate the molting of guar. Requires a careful technique to avoid injury for both parties.

name: Nix-Ox Brainspike
description: A hefty Glass chisel tapered to a razor edge. Meant to slip through the carapace of a nix-ox's skull with a single hammer blow.

name: Rough Sharpening Belt
description: This high-grit strap of alit hide works best for bulk sharpening of large blades, such as axes. Should last for years.

name: Dental Axe
description: Part saw, part axe. This jagged piece of metal prunes nix and kwama mandibles quickly, precisely, and with less loss of fingers.

name: Fetcher Fly Pin Cushion
description: The desiccated husk of a fetcher fly stuffed with sea sponge. This one is skewered with many needles and fetcher fly stingers.

name: Pearlescent Hand Mirror
description: A painstakingly polished piece of scrib shell framed in copper. It produces an accurate, if colorful, reflection.

name: Steel Nit Comb
description: This comb has long closely-spaced teeth to catch the numerous kinds of small bugs that will nest on the scalp or in wigs.

name: Ruddy Lip Paint
description: A rich, dark red pigment derived from dreugh shell mixed with a guar-fat formula to stick to the lips. It smells greasy.

name: Dunmeri Hair Gelatin
description: A popular formula of scrib-based hair product. This gel gives treated hair a wobbling bounciness. Technically edible.

name: Molar Massager
description: The rear portions of an alit's jaw bound to a carved ivory handle. The smooth bumpy texture is a relief to tender muscles.

name: Hide Parasol
description: The guar-hide stretched over this collapsible wooden frame is a reliable source of shade on the rare clear Ashland day.

name: Blood Jerky
description: Dry, coagulated blood in the form of a puck. May be chewed or boiled down, but its nutritional value is questionable at best.

name: Periapt of Bal
description: A string of teeth taken from bloodfiends and worn as a necklace. Vampires are said to consider them a symbol of their dominance.

name: Subterranean Travel Map
description: This hand drawn map points to a number of underground tunnel networks, though its age and accuracy aren't easily determined.

name: Vampire Clan Lineage
description: A scroll case containing the cryptic familial ties of a native vampire clan. A hunter's dream discovery.

name: Fang Rippers
description: This cruel looking pair of silver pliers was designed to tear through the gums and pull a vampire's fangs out from the root.

name: Ash Foundation
description: This particular mixture of volcano ash and binding agents is traditionally used for theatrical productions.

name: Red Mountain Kohl
description: Finely pulverized volcanic glass typically worn around the eyes to give them a dramatic outline and scintillating aura.

name: Nix Bristle Eyelashes
description: Extremely fine yet firm 'hairs' from a nix-ox exoskeleton bound to a thin silk strip. Botched application may cause blindness.

name: Six Mushroom Scent
description: This fragrance is a mixture of oils from Vvardenfell's most pungent fungi. The bottle advises shaking before application.

name: Fetcherfly Lotion
description: This smooth thick cream is made from straining a puree of crushed fetcherflies. The hazards of harvesting keep it in low supply.

name: Bone Blush
description: This ivory powder pigment that was popular during the height of Argonian-horn fashion trend. Rarely found after the Pact formed.

name: Tribunal Icon
description: A dark iron symbol of the Tribunal Temple highlighted with gold. A choice said to symbolize the Chimer origins of the Dunmer.

name: Tribunal Conversion Tract
description: This small booklet warns against the misguided worship of the 'Eight Divines' in favor of the true divinity of the living gods.

name: Blank Book of Verse
description: Devotees of Vivec are given these tomes to capture their divine inspirations for prayer readings. Buoyant Armigers often attend.

name: Seht Time Orb
description: This votive glass sphere clocks worship hours by channeling sand through unseen tunnels that form elaborate geometric patterns.

name: Token of Divine Adoration
description: Dunmer regularly buy these specially minted coins from Tribunal priests to offer at shrines of Almalexia while on Pilgrimage.

name: Pocket Triptych of Saint Veloth
description: Three detailed paintings of the Pilgrim's journey to Resdayn on a small silk folding screen. The colors are vivid when backlit.

name: Netch-Leather Canteen
description: A netch calf's rubbery dome, put through a vigorous tanning process and fitted with a chitin neck and stopper.

name: Bonemold Stein
description: A sturdy and lightweight drinking vessel made from a multitude of cadaverous sources best not dwelled upon.

name: Mushroom Cap Topper
description: This preserved hunk of fungus can firmly stop most mugs, deterring any attempts to surreptitiously poison the owner.

name: Waterstones
description: Calcified deposits found in dreugh organs that absorb fresh water and may be swallowed to stave off dehydration for a time.

name: Hlaalu Batch 42 Mazte Bottle
description: This vintage shot up in value after a Temple canon's body was discovered stashed in the cask. Even the bottles retain value.

name: Red Mountain Wine Glass
description: This gleaming black volcanic glass swirls with smoky ash impurities deliberately added during the firing process.

name: Fetcherfly Fly Lure
description: The bristly husk of a dead fetcherfly with a metal hook in place of its stinger. Popular among Ashlander anglers.

name: Dreugh Repellant
description: Concentrated dreugh excrement alchemically mixed with local mushrooms. Effective on dreugh or most anything that can smell.

name: Silt Strider Calf Rod
description: Juvenile silt striders legs are ideal for fishing rods, though adult limbs are sometimes ship-mounted for deep sea fishing.

name: Shroom-Wood Tackle Box
description: The dried mushroom stem planks of this tackle box are remarkably light and buoyant. Edible too, if the fish aren't biting.

name: Netch Tendril Drag-Net
description: An incredibly pincer resistant mudcrab hauling net made from tightly woven netch tendrils.

name: Hunger Claw Filleting Knife
description: The long, razor-thin claw of a Hunger mounted to an Ebony handle. Viscera tends to cling stubbornly to the blade.

name: Concert Kwama Flute
description: Hand-carved kwama limbs are the most common instruments in Vvardenfell, but few are capable of hitting a broad range of notes.

name: Scrib Chimes
description: Popular among parents with children, these segments of scrib are dangled from stings and struck to produce soft, hollow notes.

name: Scrib Mouth-Harp
description: A segment of scrib antenna mounted to a wood frame that produces a whimsical sound when placed between the teeth and plucked.

name: Glass Strand Golg'leef
description: This single string instrument is played by dragging a wide variety of bows across the wire. Most virtuosos are skilled jugglers.

name: Armiger Dralayn's Endless Concerto
description: The eccentric author of this sheet music has expanded on the piece by a movement every month for the last forty years.

name: Alit Molar Drum
description: The back-teeth of bull alits make acoustically impressive drum bases, but the beasts rarely reach a viable size to harvest them.

name: Bone Bender Oil
description: A shaping aid that temporarily softens bones and even teeth. In case of accidental ingestion, do not chew for thirty-six hours.

name: Bug Hammer
description: This four faced mallet is used to warp and stretch chitin into shapes suitable for armoring. Sometimes used for pest control.

name: Bag of Nix Rivets
description: A popular alternative to metal fasteners, both for their ready availability and resistance to most forms of corrosion.

name: Wraith Apron
description: Lightweight and frigid, this ectoplasmic garment helps keep a hardworking smith from suffering heat exhaustion.

name: Netch Bellows
description: This taxidermized bull netch has been fitted with a ceramic nozzle and sandwiched between two planks. Creates quite a breeze.

name: Indoril Commission Placard
description: The brass plate on this placard announces that its owner has the blessing of House Indoril to fashion their holy vestments.

name: Silent Auction Announcement Flyer
description: An advertisement instructing the reader how to surreptitiously participate in an illegal slave auction.

name: Inseams of Outlanders
description: A pocket guide for tailors and armorers outlining all manner of typical measurements for the assorted races of Tamriel.

name: Ash-Caked Sign
description: A well-used sign meant to be hung outdoors. In need of a good scrubbing and new coat of paint, but otherwise in good condition.

name: Plump Protrusions, A Spying and Selection Guide
description: The most comprehensive edition of Vvardenfell's most popular mushroom almanac.

name: Burnt Heresies
description: Fire-damaged texts salvaged from an Ordinator pyre. Valuable to the bravest collectors and iconoclasts.

name: Words of the Divine Poster
description: A vintage print announcing one of Lord Vivec's poetry performances for the public. His likeness emits a feint glow.

name: Indoril Death Mask
description: The golden face mask purportedly buried with Indoril Nerevar, though there were many replicas fashioned for failed Nerevarines.

name: Grooming Tools of Dumac Dwarf-King
description: A half-dozen highly specialized Dwarven implements for precision beard sculpting. There is, however, no razor.

name: Naggie the Nix-Ox
description: Disappointed eyebrows are thickly embroidered on this stitched together nix-ox.

name: Nasty the Netch
description: Angry eyebrows are embroidered on this fabric netch, a strange addition given it has no eyes.

name: Nappy the Nix-Hound
description: Closed eyes have been embroidered on this felt nix-hound, giving it the appearance of peaceful slumber.

name: Stuffed Cliff-Strider
description: This replica almost exactly resembles an infant cliff-strider. Perhaps it's best not to bring it out when an adult is nearby.

name: Felt Vvardvark
description: The button eyes of this twisted creature stare back at you. What force of nature allowed this thing to exist?

name: Kwama Warrior Plush
description: This hefty doll might protect a little one while they went to bed, but its fearsome face is likely to cause nightmares for some.

name: Azura's Hand-Napkin
description: At first this cloth appears to be a small tapestry depicting the symbols of Azura, but the food stains show its true purpose.

name: Ashen Pillow
description: The pillow is filled with ash, feeling more like a sack of sand than anything to sleep on.

name: Handkerchief Quilt
description: Families will often use old clothing to create a quilt. This one appears to be created from used handkerchiefs. Crafty.

name: Handkerchief of Devotion
description: This handkerchief is half-blue and half-yellow to honor the living god Vivec, though many frown on its use.

name: Vvardenfell Blanket
description: An intricately woven blanket depicting a map of Vvardenfell, including the names of major towns embroidered into it.

name: Guar Blanket
description: A patchwork blanket with an unpleasant odor. Useful for a traveling guar, or perhaps a desperate traveler.

name: 1001 Guar Enchantments
description: A spellbook with instructions for guar specific enchantments. Very popular with mage-farmers, a niche audience.

name: Stilted Dice
description: Used in practical jokes, these dice always cause the player to lose. Outlawed from most cities after many resulting deaths.

name: Future Telling Crystal
description: Though an initial success, these crystals were ultimately found to be enchanted to give randomized answers to any question.

name: Never Freezing Snowball
description: This never melting snow is perfect for keeping drinks chilled, though this is not recommended due to its embedded enchantment.

name: Color Changing Ink
description: This ink is enchanted to constantly change color, making it ever popular with young students and ever hated by their teachers.

name: Runic Ruby
description: These gems are etched with a single, mysterious rune, thought to be discovered under Red Mountain.

name: Netch Softening Balm
description: This lotion is used to soften a Netch's hide, helping it produce finer quality leather.

name: Thrice Used Bandages
description: All manner of bodily fluids stain these bandages, so threadbare that they may come apart with a fourth use.

name: Various Colored Pills
description: There seems to be little to no consistency with the color, size, or purpose of each of these pills.

name: Skull of A Slave
description: An Argonian skull used in the study of slave behavior and health.

name: Ashen Salve
description: Healers all throughout Vvardenfell rave of the healing properties of fresh Red Mountain ash. Not working? Not fresh enough!

name: Necklace of Fingers
description: The fingers that hang along the string are a variety of sizes and colors, making for a well-balanced but morbid collection.

name: Jar of Tentacles
description: It's not apparent what manner of liquid keeps these Netch tentacles afloat, but it's thick and slightly yellow in color.

name: Decaying Dark Elf Scalp
description: This would make for the most convincing toupee, if not for the stench of the rotting flesh still clinging to the hairs.

name: Guar Tooth
description: A large guar tooth, very popular with young children looking to add a bit of ferocity to their look.

name: Pouch of Golden Teeth
description: Anyone can collect the teeth of their fallen enemies, but it's an artistic soul that takes the time to coat each one in gold.

name: Phial of Dark Ooze
description: It this daedra blood? Ash tar? Perhaps ectoplasm? Most owners are too afraid to unscrew the cork to find out.

name: Vile Coin
description: This black coin is used as a symbol for those devoted to the Prince of Bargains, for everything has a price.

name: Raven's Feather
description: Many devotees of Nocturnal will keep this with them for luck in their secretive endeavors.

name: Rose Carved Idol
description: The wooden figurine is the basic shape of a woman, with no distinct features besides roses carved along her dress.

name: Almalexia Figurine
description: One can't help but note that the figurine seems far more modestly dressed than the living goddess herself.

name: Sotha Sil Figurine
description: Made of polished copper, the figurine holds a piece of clockwork within its tiny grasp, which it studies intently.

name: Vivec Figurine
description: This vibrantly painted Vivec figurine seems to glow softly in darkness. Perhaps it's best not to touch it too often.

name: Replica Blessing Stone
description: For the devoted Dark Elf who wants the feeling of Lord Vivec's protection in their home.

name: Red Mountain Hand Fan
description: Displaying Red Mountain mid-eruption, this fan is usually bought by travelers, as most Vvardenfell natives deem it unlucky.

name: Questionable Locket
description: The portrait displayed within this locket shows a vaguely feline face, perhaps the depiction of someone's pet or lover.

name: Marble Kwama Egg
description: This marble kwama egg is often used to decorate homes, though it may be off-putting to those not familiar with the delicacy.

name: Ruby Fetcherfly Pendant
description: The allure of this pendant is a mystery to many, but an avid group of collectors keep these odd pendants in pristine condition.

name: Pearl Kwama Figure
description: A kwama intricately created from various sizes of pearls, this is often used to decorate shelves or dining tables.

name: Clockwork City Gear
description: This gear is covered in various complex runes and shines a bright gold. Some light scratches show the copper underneath.

name: Vine, Bloodroot Mangler
description: The Reachmen love their great bloodroot vines, but have learned the hard way to keep their pets far from the manglers!

name: Vine, Bloodroot Grasper
description: When the Reachmen reopened the Bloodroot Forge, they realized it was a perfect habitat for their great, twisting vines.

name: Vine, Bloodroot Stems
description: Even the barbaric Reachmen have a sense of esthetics, and like to pose this thorny stems near entranceways.

name: Witch's Festival, Cursed Totem

name: MONSTER: Domihaus
description: A Monster Mask set found in Veteran Falkreath Hold.

name: MONSTER: Earthgore
description: A Monster Mask set found in Veteran Bloodroot Forge.

name: Horns of the Reach Sets
description: Contains Falkreath Hold and Bloodroot Forge item sets.

name: The Precursor
description: Back in order and ready to serve! Though it might not be the toughest target around, this eager to please factotum should at least hold up for another few thousand years.

name: Die Cut Icon of Sotha Sil
description: This sheet of polished brass depicts the masked face of the Clockwork God in a highly stylized design.

name: Freehand Schematic Sketches
description: The early designs of an inventor who fancies interesting concepts over precise technical specifications.

name: Fabricant Bug Collection
description: This small shadowbox frame has several varieties of small clockwork insects nailed to the backboard. Many still operate.

name: Micro Etched Theories of Seht
description: Within the illuminated borders of this record plate lies an entire volume of Seht's wisdom too small to read with the naked eye.

name: Flattened Skeevaton
description: This once three dimensional skeevaton has been pneumatically pressed paper thin and fitted with a hook for wall mounting.

name: Erotic Found Object Mosaic
description: Assorted junk and scrap arranged to resemble provocative figures in repose, strategically oiled to give a glistening sheen.

name: Crow Feather Pinwheel
description: These dark bird feathers have been bound together in the shape of a spoked wheel.

name: Pitch Grease Paint
description: Unnaturally black, this thick machine grease is believed to swallow the light when applied to the skin during Daedric rituals.

name: Crusty Oil Spout
description: The base of this steel barrel spout resembles a snake's fang and is clogged with dried blood.

name: Crescent and Sun Combination Wrench
description: This lovingly crafted tool integrates the imagery of Azura into each spanner, honoring her as the anticipation of Sotha Sil.

name: Desecrated Insect Fabricant
description: Symbols of Namira have been carved into this grimy, metal bug. Whether they are the cause of its sorry state is anyone's guess.

name: Clockwork Jyggalag
description: This heretical effigy of the dethroned Daedric Prince of Order seems uncomfortably at home in Seht's realm.

name: Nut Cracker
description: This simple game involves scattering a pile of polished machine nuts outside a chalk circle by slamming a larger nut into them.

name: Angles and Arcs
description: Played on a blackboard with a mathematical compass: players take turns calculating the most complex shapes in the shortest time.

name: Manual of Factotum Tipping
description: A favorite pastime of bored initiates. These instructions outline how to override some old model factotum gyroscopes.

name: Captive Bearing Puzzle
description: These brass-framed glass boxes contain intricate three dimensional labyrinths to be navigated by a steel bearing sealed inside.

name: SPROING!
description: A platter mounted to an industrial strength spring. Used for launching whatever's on hand for the most amusing results.

name: Die-Cast Dice
description: Every die in this bag is a solid brass polyhedron with a multitude of faces, for games that are a secret between Apostles.

name: Tooth Lacquer
description: This sepia tone sealant is brushed over one's teeth to protect from the corrosives found in most of Clockwork City's fluids.

name: Homebrew Emulsifier Puck
description: These pot-rendered fats and chemicals are molded and dried for storage. Foams in contact with body oils for effective cleansing.

name: Sinus Flush
description: A vial of artificial-lavender scented degreaser and syringe used to clear accumulated grime out of airways.

name: Harmonic Recycomb
description: The teeth of this improvised comb once served to produce notes in a music box and still produce crisp tones when freed of hair.

name: Skin Blaster
description: This handheld machine blows exfoliating grit through a pressurized nozzle to smooth skin. Careful calibration is advised.

name: Coif Stapler
description: It's hard to manage oil saturated hair, but this spring loaded device will fasten locks securely to scalps and headgear alike.

name: Narrow Steel Graver
description: While thin, this rigid engraving tool has no trouble carving into the metal plates Clockwork Apostles use for record keeping.

name: Record Binder
description: This book-like object has pages and pages of leather sleeves for storing record plates. Monstrously heavy when full.

name: Corrective Grease
description: The pitch-black grease in this tin dries quickly and is used to blot out undesired engravings on record plates.

name: Wax Facsimile Kit
description: Materials to take a wax impression from a record plate. Such copies have a short shelf life, but spare a lot of back pain.

name: Blank Mongrel Sheaf
description: A stack of coveted paper medium made from pulverizing and reconstituting older records into mottled, ink-stained pages.

name: Apostle Auto-Stamper
description: When pressed firmly onto a surface, a spring-loaded embossed stamp slams down with enough force to leave an impression.

name: Dainty Dining Saw
description: A table saw for those determined to serve fabricant cuts 'on the bone.'

name: Nutriment Paste Whisk
description: Sotha Sil's nutriment paste is intended for immediate consumption, but this whisk can reconstitute it should separation occur.

name: Portable Ingestion Tube
description: Holds nutriment paste for travel when securely capped. Squeeze and roll for best results.

name: Dwarven Nutcracker
description: This weighty hunk of Dwarven metal earned its name for its effectiveness in knocking exposed fastenings off shelled fabricants.

name: Meat Extruder
description: Rotating screws pulverize and squeeze meat through a sieve, preventing shrapnel from polluting the organic portions.

name: Palatizer
description: A popular invention that prepares the user's tongue for a meal by rendering it completely taste-numb.

name: Gnawed Fabricant Leg
description: Strips of pale meat still cling to this heavily distressed metal limb. Chew at your own risk.

name: Moondial
description: A pocket-sized, clockwork device that displays the phases of the moons.

name: Hair-Choked Mechanism
description: Whatever this was appears to have been torn from a machine after a large animal got its fur caught in the workings.

name: Nose Numbing Salts
description: The aroma given off by this alchemical concoction helps alleviate the overwhelming smells of industry for a sensitive nose.

name: Overclocked Skeevaton
description: Heavily modified, this skeevaton can move at tremendous speed over most surfaces. Shows teeth marks.

name: Silver Quickener
description: This highly specialized solvent will dissolve silver objects and even leach silver out of composite materials within minutes.

name: Crank Buffer
description: A hand-powered device meant to rapidly polish broad metal surfaces, a task mostly left to factotums when it can be helped.

name: Factotum Anatomy Miniature
description: This doll-sized replica factotum opens to reveal many of the inner workings for study.

name: Clockwork Clock
description: This complex nest of gears is precisely timed to rotate a series of numbers in synchronicity with a typical Nirn day.

name: Muting Muffs
description: When cupped over the ears, these insulated metal bowls drown out all the abundant outside noise of Clockwork City.

name: Defunct Perpetual Motion Machine
description: Many Clockwork Initiates attempt to craft mechanisms sustained under their own power. Most wind up as amusing collectables.

name: Study Buddy
description: A combination record holder, chin rest, and eyelid speculum for apostles whose studies can't afford to be interrupted by sleep.

name: Hollow Gear
description: The secret compartment in this gear is used for smuggling skooma across the Brass Fortress.

name: Counterfeit Moon-Sugar
description: The mysterious grains in this sack have been altered to highly resemble and smell like pure moon-sugar.

name: Metal Smoking Pipe
description: This pipe seems to be melded from assorted metals, giving the skooma smoked from it a metallic flavor.

name: Copper Hookah
description: This once gleaming smoking device is now blackened with smoke after years of use.

name: Steel Cleaning Brush
description: This thin scouring brush is made of steel wires and used to clean the nooks and crannies of hookahs.

name: Moon-Sugar Distillation Set
description: This alchemical equipment has been tweaked to help distill moon-sugar into skooma.

name: Tin Row Boat
description: This little, silver boat is light enough to float atop the oily waters of Clockwork City.

name: Verminous Fabricant Figurine
description: Molded mid-snarl, this metal figure was made with an almost frightening attention to detail.

name: Connectable Pipe Set
description: This assortment of different shaped pipes can be interconnected to make new pipeline systems.

name: Wind-Up Skeevaton
description: This popular toy looks just like the real thing, and can even roll across the floor after being wound up.

name: Factotum Figure
description: This model has many available poses, and even plays recorded messages at the press of a button.

name: Apostle's First Alchemy Set
description: A number of small vials, bottles, and mostly harmless ingredients meant to incite curiosity and learning.

name: Gear Fanatic Frying Pan
description: The bottom of this frying pan was made in the shape of a gear, making it nearly useless for cooking.

name: Rusty Bowl
description: This metal bowl has seen years of use and has begun to show rust within it.

name: Lumpy Metal Plates
description: These malformed plates are used by the Tarnished in Brass Fortress, and known to quickly rust.

name: Molded Medals Vase
description: Copper and gold have been intricately layered to create a beautiful pattern on this vase.

name: Off-Balance Decanter
description: This glass decanter was designed to lie slightly crooked on its side, making it difficult to keep balanced.

name: Non-Sitck Pot
description: The bottom of this pot is coated in a slippery substance that creates a protective barrier against sticky foods.

name: Brass Nightstick Brooch
description: This is a symbol of moderate rank among the Brass Fortress guards.

name: Brass Fortress Badge
description: This badge is worn by all Brass Fortress guards, a subgroup of the Clockwork Apostles.

name: Brass Fortress Patrol Schedule
description: A timetable schedule of guards' shifts and duties, now outdated by a few weeks.

name: Adjustable Handcuffs
description: These useful handcuffs are magically enhanced to shrink or grow to the size of a captive's wrist.

name: Depleted Tracker Device
description: This now-powerless metal device was designed to track the whereabouts of known criminals.

name: Outdated Factotum Override
description: This device was used to override aggressive factotums, though it is now obsolete due to new factotum enhancements.

name: Robust Plant Clippings
description: These clippings come from the healthiest plants growing in the Everwound Wellspring.

name: Sturdy Leaf Shears
description: These clippers are sharp enough to cut through the thick stems of Clockwork City's metallic trees.

name: Nutrient Pellets
description: Made from leftover gruel provided to Brass Fortress citizens, these bland pellets are used to feed livestock.

name: Metallic Saddle
description: This saddle has been painted over with a variety of metallic paints, making it too gaudy for daily use.

name: Airtight Containers
description: Created for the Everwound Wellspring, these containers allow fresh food to travel across Clockwork City.

name: Alchemical Nutrients
description: This alchemical solution is used to help plants within the Everwound Wellspring grow.

name: Rusted Wavy Hairband
description: This zig-zag hairband of thick wire, though now rusted to an unusable state, once helped keep hair pulled back.

name: Fine Wire Brushes
description: The brushes of these various makeup brushes are created with extremely thin wire.

name: Oil-Be-Gone
description: This solution was created to help quickly clean tough oil stains. Just apply and watch its magic work!

name: Illuminated Hand Mirror
description: The brass frame of this mirror contains small lights which brighten the user's face.

name: Broken Magnifying Goggles
description: Popular with Clockwork Apostles, these goggles once allowed the wearer to see the smallest detail.

name: Augmentation Polisher
description: This small device has been enchanted to vibrate as it buffs the brass appendages of the Clockwork Apostles.

name: Bent Shaded Spectacles
description: The invention of a sun-hating apostle who often wore a pair, these spectacles have been bent to an unusable state.

name: Blood Capsules
description: The creation of an apostle of eccentric appetites, these inedible and unbreachable capsules contain a vial's worth of blood.

name: Blood Research Notes
description: Notes of the effects of drinking blood from various races and ages. These are a popular guide among vampires.

name: Sun-Blocking Lotion
description: Created by an unusually sun-averse apostle, this lotion helps avoid sunburns, but was otherwise deemed a failure by its creator.

name: Fabricated Blood
description: This alchemical concoction was created by a passionate young apostle. Nauseating to consume, it smells and tastes of blood.

name: Vampiric Experiment Log
description: The dates and times of rather grisly-sounding vampire-related experiments performed by the Clockwork Apostles.

name: The Imperfect's Core Functions
description: The code on this sequence plaque is believed to be the core functions of the Imperfects, though it has yet to be understood.

name: Oily Kohl
description: This greasy eyeshadow gives off a strong scent and is known to cause irritation if worn too long.

name: Concocted Lotion
description: No one quite knows what the Tarnished use to create this odd-smelling lotion, but it's popular for dry skin and mild rashes.

name: Waterproof Rouge
description: This vibrant red lipstick is known for its popular motto, 'Water-tight and everlasting!'

name: Essence of Alloy
description: This perfume gives off a heady metallic scent. Popular with apostles who have yet to undergo body modification.

name: Brass Lip Gloss
description: Lip gloss that has a shiny, brass finish, a current fashion trend among apostle students.

name: Metallic Blush
description: Flecks of gold and silver cause this blush to shine in the light.

name: Scrap-Metal Idol of Seht
description: Multiple pieces of metal have been melted down to create this miniature likeness of Sotha Sil.

name: Brass Cufflinks of Vivec
description: These small, brass cufflinks depict the icon of a harp and spear, the symbols of Vivec.

name: Ivory Pendant of Almalexia
description: A large, round cameo pendant made of ivory displaying a side profile of Almalexia's face.

name: Gear of Sotha Sil
description: A large gear, imprinted with the symbol of Sotha Sil. Said to bring good luck during examinations.

name: Clockwork City Globe
description: This globe represents a miniature Clockwork City, as viewed from the outside.

name: Sublime Piston Model
description: This golden piston is a constant reminder for all to walk towards the path of Nirn-Ensuing.

name: Satchel Canteen
description: This leather canteen is made from herbalist's satchels. Any drink remains fresh, though ultimately turns extremely bitter.

name: Tin Wine Bottle
description: This unusual bottle quickly gives any wine poured into it a heady metallic tang.

name: Purification Bottle
description: This metal bottle was created to purify Clockwork's oily water, though the liquid still maintains its foul taste.

name: Gearhead Stein
description: The handle is comprised of welded together gears, making handling this stein extremely difficult.

name: Rare Wooden Mug
description: Wooden mugs are uncommon due to the lack of natural wood within Clockwork City.

name: Gleaming Seht Goblet
description: This bright, brass goblet has gears and torches engraved upon it, representing the crest of Sotha Sil.

name: Steel Landing Net
description: This fishing net is created entirely from wire, making it very durable but quick to rust.

name: Fabricant Bait
description: Chunks of fabricant flesh used as fish bait. Some metallic bits still cling to the flesh.

name: Factotum-Finger Sinkers
description: These broken-apart bits of rusted factotum fingers are used to sink fishing lines.

name: Automatic Fishing Rod
description: This fishing rod automatically pulls in your line. Useful for catching heavy fish, or for very lazy fishers.

name: Glowing Lure
description: This fishing lure is used to attract the strange creatures living within the dark waters of Clockwork City.

name: Fishing Line Wire
description: This extremely thin and durable wire is perfect for reeling in a big catch.

name: Rubbish Chimes
description: These chimes are cluttered with a collection of metallic objects, found in the scrap piles of Brass Fortress.

name: Brass Triangle
description: Popular among young mages, the single chime of this triangle helps bring thoughts back into focus.

name: Unidentifiable Instrument
description: This multi-piece instrument brings to mind a flute, though it's unclear where one would put their mouth.

name: Waltz of the Gears
description: The musical notation on this sequence plaque is extremely complicated, though quite imaginative.

name: Prized Wooden Lute
description: A common lute by any standards, this instrument is cherished in Clockwork City where wood is in short supply.

name: Musical Sphere
description: This small, brass ball chimes in reaction to magical impulses. Thought to help with arcane projects.

name: Broken Firepot Disruptor
description: This tonal dampener was originally created to stun firepot spiders, allowing blacksmiths to siphon their oil.

name: Brass Pliers
description: Found to be ultimately useless because of their low melting point, these pliers are instead used for decorative purposes.

name: Fabricant Leather Apron
description: This patchwork rawhide apron comes from the various fabricants which live in Clockwork City.

name: Piston Hammer
description: The piston attached to this hammer's head improves its power and precision.

name: Automatic Bellows
description: The automatic pump action of these bellows isn't long lasting, but help cut back physical labor in the long run.

name: Self-Turning Vise
description: This blacksmithing vise grips and loosens objects at the press of a pedal.

name: Forged Artificer Badge
description: This badge is a replica of those given by artificers legally recognized by the Clockwork Apostles.

name: Melted Sequence Plaque
description: This metal plate has undergone intense heat, making the engravings written upon it indecipherable.

name: Maintenance Work Request
description: A long and detailed form, filled with neat handwriting, asking for a various repairs in the Brass Fortress

name: Journal of Innovation
description: This blank, brass journal is given to apostles to write down their ideas and experiments.

name: Seht's Sermons Pocket Guide
description: This small booklet contains shortened and simplified versions of Sotha Sil's Sermons.

name: Inspirational Poster
description: Often found in the rooms of young apostles, this poster is inscribed with inspirational quotes and messages.

name: Sotha Sil's Notes
description: With its nearly indecipherable writing, this is thought to be one of the hundreds of notes Sotha Sil creates on any given day.

name: Vigilance Tonic
description: Generally used to combat drowsiness, this tonic is often used by young apostles to help with their concentration during studies.

name: Cruddy Man
description: A popular type of crude dreugh doll stitched from an assembly of smudged rags and, not coincidently, the color of dried blood.

name: Stuffed Seht Effigy
description: This adorable and slightly blasphemous depiction of Sotha Sil was once a pillow that now has mechanical bits stitched into it.

name: Oil-Filled Netch Doll
description: A synthetic bladder adorned with rubbery tubing and filled with thick fluid. Satisfying to squeeze, but always slightly greasy.

name: Painted Cog
description: The mounting hollows of this gear resemble a smiling face, an effect pronounced by the clever application of enamel paints.

name: Pristine Wax Lady
description: This dignified depiction of a Dunmer is clothed in fine, hand-crafted miniature garb. Posable with careful application of heat.

name: Fabricant Leather Chimera
description: A fantastical, or horrifyingly inaccurate, stuffed animal patched together from assorted fabricant skins.

name: Preservation Bag
description: Air tight for vacuum sealing, this thin rubber pouch is large enough to store a perishable research sample or small meal.

name: Hand-Woven Bindle Cloth
description: Fibers of assorted exodromal rags were respun into a course yarn to make up this study carrying cloth. All it needs is a stick.

name: Sponge Towel
description: Native synthetic sponge modeled upon natural sea sponge to wick moisture out of machinery. Occasionally borrowed for bathing.

name: Thermal Conductive Mesh
description: A flexible weave of wire and rubber now encased in cloth and repurposed as a blanket.

name: Industrial Strength Doily
description: What was most likely once a precision steam gasket, now spends its time protecting surfaces from hot pots.

name: Ornamental Mail Table
description: Polished nuts and wire arranged like beadwork into a patterned table covering that could probably stop an axe blow.

name: Apostle's Lubricant Oils
description: A pouch of tiny vials filled with alchemical oils meant to be applied to their bodily enhancements for regular maintenance.

name: Odorless Waste Vessel
description: This brass pot can contain all manner of filth without the associated fumes escaping. May cause suffocation.

name: Carving Quill
description: This angular metal quill effortlessly scratches grooves into metal surfaces. Popular among scribes and Tarnished vandals.

name: Magic Metronome
description: When placed upon a machine, this device automatically adjusts the timing of the mechanisms according to the user's settings.

name: Light Recycler
description: An array of lens, mirrors, cogs, and spokes that focuses light into a crystal providing a warm yellow glow into the late hours.

name: Dovah-Fly Swatter
description: This comically long tuning fork can shatter the tiny fluttering automatons into a thousand pieces with the slightest touch.

name: Fabricant Flenser
description: An adjustable aperture stop with razor-sharp edges. Highly effective in stripping flesh from endoskeletons of all kinds.

name: Soothing Intestinal Balm
description: This chalky fluid coats the mouth, throat, stomach, and anything else with a mild corrosive protectant. May inhibit digestion.

name: Artificial Skin Patches
description: For reasons unknown, fabricant flesh preserved in the right oils make effective temporary grafts over serious injuries.

name: Anesthetizer Coil
description: Renders living tissue numb through several minutes of excruciating, highly focused shocks.

name: Blood Billows
description: Rubber bladders manually compressed to circulate a patient's blood, preferably by a factotum, or someone with excellent rhythm.

name: Servo-Splint
description: This mechanized brace not only supports an injured or infirm limb, but also lends the strength of a slightly less frail person.

name: Love Sprocket
description: Superstitious Tarnished carry these salvaged wheels, believing meeting someone with a matching assembly will mean true love.

name: Impractical Nasal Kerchief
description: This remarkably soft rubber square is folded haphazardly and presently stuck that way.

name: Ectoplasmic Grease
description: Some claim this ghostly residue implies fabricated beings have souls, but superstitions don't outweigh its lubricant value.

name: Mummified Factotum Face
description: Left over from an attempt to make factotums relatable, it's impossible to tell if this desiccated mask was created or harvested.

name: Bronzed Apostle Hand
description: An infrequently observed tradition among the Clockwork Apostles is to enshrine their amputated body parts after replacement.

name: Self-Chewing Teeth
description: These grotesquely exaggerated metal jaws may be wound to chew according to prescribed mastication settings for several minutes.

name: Votive Statue of Seht
description: This figurine depicts Seht offering a guiding hand. They are presented to new Clockwork Initiates after induction to the order.

name: Drinking Fabricant
description: This simple likeness of a verminous fabricant bobs its head down and then rights itself periodically by some unseen force.

name: Lazy Ratter
description: The cat-like shape of these small lead statues are supposedly the reason why they're effective at keeping skeevatons at bay.

name: Mantle Minder
description: These automatons repeat a simple action for display, though some have limited utility, such as dusting themselves.

name: Whittled Wire Worker
description: Once the branch of a fabricated tree, this golden statue of a factotum has all the grain and texture of a wood carving.

name: Screecher
description: Part decoration, part security measure, this bird-like automaton emits a grating metal squeal when approached.

name: Fabricant Brands
description: Those who presume to lay claim to a tamed fabricant sometimes affix a metal badge to its chassis as a mark of ownership.

name: Knot Bauble
description: The Tarnished often decorate their hovels with small charms and figures made from twisted wire and loose scrap.

name: Scrapourri
description: The trend of leaving vessels filled with polished scrap and scented oils about a dwelling is catching on in the Brass Fortress.

name: Prized Maplewood Stick
description: Even the simplest reminders of the living world are a rare comfort to those stranded in Clockwork City.

name: Sculpting Stone
description: The thick crust of small metal bits cling to this powerful lodestone are easily shaped into simple designs for amusement.

name: Coil Chimes
description: A small set of particularly melodic machine coils repurposed to be hung by ventilation shafts and provide soft background noise.

name: Vintage Factotum Fabrication Orders
description: This machine cogitation plate contains a design template for early generation factotums. It's in near mint condition.

name: Quicksilver Visualizer
description: The liquid metal between these glass plates can display detailed monochromatic images when connected to the proper equipment.

name: Flavorless Paste
description: A thick yet rheumy substance produced within the Clockwork City. Though quite filling, and rather healthy, it is food devoid of pleasure.

name: Hlaalu Planter, Tall
description: This is a standard house item.

name: Crown Crafting Motif : Tsaesci Style
description: Use to learn the Tsaesci crafting style.

description: Use to learn the Bloodforge crafting style.

name: Crown Crafting Motif 57: Ebonshadow Style
description: Use to learn the Ebonshadow crafting style.

name: Soot-Stained Clockwork Coffer
description: This coffer contains goods from the Clockwork City.

name: Living Shadow Skin
description: Divayth Fyr's mind worked quickly to infuse part of his lost shadow essence into this cast-off brigandine.

name: Registrar's Legwrap
description: Apostle garb is stiff and inflexible, much like the Apostles themselves.

name: Grips of the Impostor
description: The Shadow of Sotha Sil slipped through your fingers. It won't next time.

name: Traitor's Cuirass
description: Even the act of betrayal has its place in Apostle philosophy.

name: Tenebrous Girdle
description: The Whispering Shadows cult that serves Nocturnal crafts its armor with threads of living shadow pulled from the streams of Evergloam.

name: Evergloam Leggings
description: "You know," Dalomar mused, "the Shrikes don't wear clothes. I wonder why the cultists bother."

name: Raiment of the Initiate
description: You served Sotha Sil well, and in exchange he presented you with this garment common to initiates of the Clockwork Apostles.

name: The Astronomer's Orbit
description: Even something as simple as a belt is a metaphor in Clockwork theology. In this case, the movement of celestial spheres and planes.

name: Gardening Gloves
description: The rich loam of the Everwound Wellspring is a rare and precious resource, and should be handled with gentle care.

name: Cleft Striders
description: Tightly sealed boots are important when moving through Evergloam, lest small Daedric creatures wriggle their way into the spaces between.

name: Welder's Greaves
description: With all of the sparking, burning, and bladed objects in the Clockwork City, having good protection at knee level is considered essential.

name: Spare Serpentine Belt
description: This tough belt is made from a rubbery strap leftover from Terari's exchange machine.

name: Oracular Sandals
description: It doesn't take a prognosticating factotum to know that a good pair of shoes can save you a lot of grief.

name: Explorer's Boots
description: Raynor cobbled these boots together from spare parts found during your exploration of the Clockwork City.

name: Proctor's Bronze Fists
description: The Clockwork Apostles furnish their proctors with the most finely-crafted armor in the Clockwork City.

name: Sotha Sil's Codex of Infinite Possibility
description: This voluminous metal tome contains the boundless wisdom of the Clockwork God. Those with the strength to read it enjoy a temporary expansion of the mind's ability to adapt and overcome.

name: Luciana's Codex of Mastery
description: Proctor Luciana has served Sotha Sil for many long centuries. Her writings on battle and philosophy contain lifetimes of hard-earned knowledge that can temporarily expand the reader's mind.

name: Radiance Resonator
description: This component taken from the chassis of a Clockwork Saint played some role in channeling divine energy, but it's workings are known only to the living god, Sotha Sil.

name: Runebox: Clockwork Reliquary
description: Contains a Clockwork Reliquary Polymorph. This container can be traded, mailed, and posted to Guild Banks and Guild Stores - however, once opened, the Runebox (and its contents) are bound to your account.

name: Deregulated Mushroom Stew
description: A piping hot stew of savoury truffles and fabricant flesh. Perfectly edible.

name: Spring-Loaded Infusion
description: Brewed from potable liquids in the Clockwork City. Probably volatile, and quite eye-opening.

name: Clockwork Citrus Filet
description: Fabricant flesh, perfectly seared and braised in local fruits. What passes for fruit, at least.

name: Crow-Touched Clockwork Coffer
description: This clockwork box is scratched and pecked by the vassals of the Blackfeather Court.

name: Slag Town Coffer
description: Razgurug put together this coffer as a reward for your efforts.

name: Typical Barb
description: An oily water fish. Use to filet for provisioning.

name: Clockerfish
description: A fabricant fish. Use to harvest its curious meats for provisioning.

name: Barilzar's Grenadier
description: A fabricant fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City.

name: Ancestor Wrasse
description: A rare fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City. Presumed extinct.

name: Enmegalabzu
description: A rare fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City. Presumed extinct.

name: Orod
description: A rare fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City. Presumed extinct.

name: Whisper Knifefish
description: A rare fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City. Presumed extinct.

name: Coppery Cucumber
description: A fabricant fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City.

name: Verminous Catfish
description: A rare fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City. Presumed extinct.

name: Clicking Travally
description: A fabricant fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City.

name: Oil-Eater Whalefish
description: A rare fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City. Presumed extinct.

name: Imperfect Blobfin
description: A rare fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City. Presumed extinct.

name: Operant Eel
description: A fabricant fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City.

name: Copperclaw Crayfish
description: A fabricant fish found only in the oily waters of the Clockwork City.

name: Transmute Station
description: When placed in your home, allows you to transmute the traits on your items.

name: MONSTER: Bogdan the Nightflame
description: A Monster Mask set found in Veteran Elden Hollow II.

name: MONSTER: Malubeth the Scourger
description: A Monster Mask set found in Veteran Wayrest Sewers II.

name: Robes / Withered Hand
description: A Light Armor set found in Alik'r.

name: Veiled Heritance
description: A Medium Armor set found in Auridon.

name: Queen's Elegance
description: A Heavy Armor set found in Auridon.

name: Twin Sisters
description: A Light Armor set found in Auridon.

name: Mysterious Clockwork Sphere
description: The nature of these massive spheres remains a mystery to even the wisest apostles. Could they be brass reproductions of celestial bodies? Waypoints for factotum navigation? The eggs of an as-yet-unnamed clockwork monstrosity? Only Seht knows.

name: Active Fabrication Tank
description: Disclaimer: Razoufa and her associates cannot be held liable for any property damage, laceration, dismemberment, or mortal injuries inflicted by released Verminous Fabricants.

name: Clockwork Stylus
description: Like most of the Clockwork Apostles' tools, this stylus has dozens of applications: engraving sequence plates, soldering the joints of a clockwork prototype, or even heating up a bowl of delicious nutriment paste!

name: Projector TBD
description: TEMP DESCRIPTION TBD: Depends on functionality and relationship to the Fortune and Fate achievement.

name: Skeleton Key Replica

name: Energetic Animo Core
description: A powerful variant of the standard animo core, this brass vessel contains a single overcharged soul gem. Just be careful not to crack it! The effects could be … explosive.

name: New Life Celebrant's Standard
